text:
Excellent sushi here. All chef at the bar are Japanese too.  They have traditional Sushi and also creative menus upon request.  I recommend you to sit at counter. Very nice chefs can explain you about where the fish comes from, etc.  
The atmosphere at other tables are more like upscale bar lounge and totally different feeling from the counter.  It is pricy but it worth to try in this town.

I can't go to Vegas without hitting up Sushi Roku...I love everything about it, from the service to the drinks (my favorite is the Tokyo Cooler, although the Pineapple Upside Down Cake martini is a close second) and the view and the food (hanabi, I dream about you!).  

On my most recent visit, my husband and I went for happy hour on a Monday afternoon.  Happy hour is only available at the bar, but it is an amazing deal!  We had a spicy tuna roll and the rock shrimp and jalapeno roll.  Roku has the best spicy tuna of any sushi place I have ever visited.  We also had the popcorn shrimp - ask for a side of spicy mayo to make this even more delicious - and the miso eggplantt.  They even have dessert on their HH menu and how can you go wrong with a mini chocolate volcano cake?

Made reservations on Opentable but like others have pointed out, it wasn't necessary but still, it was better to be safe than sorry esp on a Thursday night in Las Vegas. 
We were seated by the windows which had a gorgeous view of the strip overlooking the neon lights of Harrah's, Imperial Palace Hotel and Paris in the close distant. 
We started with edamame, closely followed by a tuna tataki salad which had a hinge of too much vinegar but the tuna was good. Then we tried the toro with scallion roll - excellent, melted in the mouth, Roku and roll roll which had combination of 3 fishes, unagi sushi and toro sushi. Then we finished with the Chocolate Volcano which was a warm chocolate cake oozing with chocolate sauce in the center with vanilla bean ice-cream, it was delicious! 3.5 stars. I thought the sushi at Nobu was a tad better. But service was impeccable considering other prime restaurants with very poor and s-l-o-w services in the last few nights!

It's a treat to go back to Sushi Roku in Scottsdale. My favorite sushi place other than Morimoto's in Napa. However, Sushi Roku's service is leagues ahead. I was on a short trip, this time, and made it a point to go twice for dinner this trip. Logan was our server on my first trip and the first dinner of this trip. He is exceptional in his service, manners, and brilliant recommendations. My second dinner was lovely and interactive thanks to Sarah's service. She made dinner a treat by her wonderful tasting suggestions, and her attentiveness to our experience. Great work Dan, GM for making this establishment so amazing! Service is exceptional. Can't wait to return.
Good quality sushi a little heavy on the wasabi. But for me very overpriced but I guess that's Vegas.

I really like this place.  Staff is super friendly, the atmosphere is fun, but not loud, and they have some great fusionesk appies.  I know sush in the middle of the desert sounds wierd, but it's tasty.

If you come here, look for Victoria.  She awesome!  Great recommendations, perfect delivery, and she's cute, which is always nice!
Friendly great staff. Some of the sushi is good, and some average. It's pretty expensive. You can get a table with the view of the Strip. I had the Salmon which was good but just expensive. Lol.

in arizona for business and came to sushi roku to celebrate a birthday with some of my employees - ALL of us were so wow'd by our experience!  one of us had a severe gluten allergy but our server Jennah had such amazing recommendations.  she was so patient and attentive!  i didnt expect sushi roku to have such an extensive "cooked" portion of their menu too!  the sushi was super fresh and the cocktail list was awesome.  once a server myself, it was nice to see the bus staff, food runners and both managers Mike and Dan, check on us multiple times during the course of our meal on what seemed to be a busy thursday night.  both food and service was spot on!  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Our waiter sucked. Never told us his name never once smiled. Continually pressured us to order our full meal right away. The restaurant wasn't even busy. He also disappeared for long periods, yet other tables had attentive staff waiting on them. Once he found out we weren't ordering cocktails he stopped trying altogether. The food itself was nothing in particular either. Same as Roka Akor sushi wise. The food wasn't as good as Sumo maya though. Overall massively disappointed in the whole evening (especially considering a vey basic roll was $18.50, we had two appetizers and two rolls coming to $80) and won't be going back.

The best restaurant experience I've had in Las Vegas, regardless of price point. Ask for Joy, she was our server and made the experience personal and memorable to the point that our group of 4 talked about her service and the great food all night and even the next morning. The scallop roll is amazing, but all the rolls we had were great.

Excellent all around. In Scottsdale for the weekend and went here on a Friday night. I'm a tough critic since I'm from Miami and used to great places. This restaurant definitely met my expectations. Great trendy vibe, great food and service. Went to upstairs pool bar afterwards and that was nice too. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
Had an amazing dinner the other evening the food is spectacular and service outstanding! I am gluten free and they were very accommodating to that! If I could give 5 more stars I would !

Crystal is the best bartender in Scottsdale! We will be back to Sushi Roku just because of her!

HH is great and a good value. Nice place with a personal ambiance, dimly lit at night. Food is outstanding. HH Kobe Skewers FTW!

We had a fabulous experience here.   The food was amazing, along with the service by Tim.  We went with his recommendations and they did not disappoint.  
Brussel sprout chips and the Japanese Wagyu beef (melt in your mouth) were 2 dishes that really impressed us.   
If you get Tim as your waiter, tell him what you like and go with his recommendations - so worth it!!
best sushi around; try their loc@ Sunset Blvd (LA).

My husband and I had dinner here on a lark while on vacation in Vegas. We were both craving sushi and staying on the strip and we just picked this place because it was close and had good reviews. I am so glad we did! Every single thing we ate was absolutely superb! Even the miso soup was amazing! We had shrimp dumplings, makoto rolls, a roll with tuna, shrimp and asparagus and a spicy salmon roll special. All of them were so light and fresh it was unreal. They were also very accommodating to substitutions, as I have an avocado allergy. Service was on point and the atmosphere was dim, but very pleasant. The lava cake was unlike any we had ever had before, and I have had a few! Some people have expressed displeasure with the prices, but we found them to be fair given the area. We live in Miami and most dinners are on par, if not slightly more expensive than the one we had at Sushi Roku. Definitely one of the best sushi restaurants I've ever been to. Highly recommended.

Excellent sushi considering you are in the desert. Simple menu, NOT pages and pages of similar tasting rolls. Yellow tale was very good. Order the yellow tale sashimi with green chilies, you will not be disappointed.

So I have been hearing all about Sushi Roku for months. Everyone was saying how amazing the food was and how they loved the décor but they also said it was pretty pricey. So I thought I would check it out myself. What I didn't know until I got there was they have a few different menus. We ended up sitting in the Lounge and everything on the menu was $5. We had the popcorn shrimp tempura, edamame hummus (it was incredible), tuna tataki, spicy tuna roll, and several drinks. It was totally affordable!

They also told us about this Stimulus Menu. It's like $30 a person and you get your choice of appetizer, entrée and dessert. Which I think is a great deal. You would spend wayyyy more than that on a regular dinner. So next time we go I'm trying that for sure!

It's on the 3rd floor of the Forum shops, a little stuffy and haughty, but what can you expect?  We popped in for lunch, around 1:30pm.  If you like attentive service, that would be the perfect time to go.  There were exactly 4 other customers in the restaurant...despite the few customers, there was a hostess, a waiter, a water guy, an appetizer/plate clearing guy, 2 sushi chefs, and a manager.  No wonder a vegetarian roll is $14!  Great view of the strip from the booths, and the decor was modern, comfortable and elegant  (think low backed leather couches and natural materials).  My sweetie and I had the Chef's sushi combo, a Harvest roll (skip it), and the spicy tuna roll.  All of the fish was like butter (yellowtail, salmon, tuna, shrimp).  Really fresh, better than some I've had here at home on the the west coast.  I had a cocktail called the Tokyo Cooler--a very delicious, refreshing, dangerous cocktail.  I could have gotten prom-night drunk on those, no prob.  Rolls were $13-26  (approx 4 pieces)each, sashimi $13-24 for 4 pieces.  Handrolls $6.  All in all we spent $55 on lunch.  We were satiated--not overly so--I wanted to save room for gelatto.
Nice atmosphere but slow service.  I was not impressed enough to return based on the other sushi restaurants in the area.

My wife and I had a date night last night so we decided to check this place out. As first timers we came away impressed with the overall experience. The food was very good, the service was excellent. Our server CJ was fantastic. He was super friendly and informed. He made some excellent recommendations, including the oysters with a lime wasabi type dressing, so good! The blue fin belly was very good and fresh as well.  There wasn't anything we ordered that wasn't good. I'm not sure sushi snobs would be blown away by this place, but we will definitely be back. I would say this place makes our top 5 for sushi in the valley. I would give Sushi Roku 4.5 stars if I could.

This place is phenomenal! We went around 9:30 on a Friday night b/c that was all they had available, but I didn't mind since I had been dying to try it. My favorites:
- Yellowtail Sashami with Chilis - light and so good.
- Organic Garden Salad - almost too pretty to eat with all the vegetable curls, but of course I did and it was delicious.
- Filet Mignon wrapped Asparagus - SO YUMMY!!! Had a delicious glaze/sauce to go with it.
- Hanabi Spicy Tuna on Rice Cakes - MY FAVORITE!!! Recommended by our server and I was hesitant but the spicy tuna and the crispy rice cake go so perfect together.
- Chilean Sea Bass - YUM!!! I had gotten this to-go a few times after seeing it featured in Phoenix magazine, but was even better straight from the kitchen.

I also had some sort of specialty margarita that was so good and went perfectly with the food. Our server was AWESOME and the decor was beautiful (we sat in a booth near the sushi bar). Prices were in line with what we spent at Geisha House, which I thought was quite reasonable for a high-end sushi restaurant. Definitely the night out we were hoping for and we will be back.

Went into Roku knowing nothing about sushi, and now I feel like I know everything thanks to our server. The food was all such great quality. Also I didn't even have to order our server picked everything for us! Also had a bottle of sake I've never had before which I am now in love with. Again thanks to the server. His name was Jon and he was very professional, knowledgable, and yet still super causal with us! Thanks again Jon I'll be asking for him again.
Todd, you were right. This place is like a nightclub with sushi. Just really expensive and really tan people friendly. Meaning-fake tans, over priced, underwhelming.  Service was fine. Seriously. Meh

This place was amazing! After looking at the prices, the table decided to get the tasting menu, because as it was rather well priced in comparison. We were all SO glad we did. I now have so much more of an appreciation for the art form that sushi and all of Japanese food. Flavor combinations that I NEVER would have thought of were simply magic. I just wish there was more of it! 

Service was also wonderful. I love hot sake, but haven't had much experience with cold. She recommended first a sampler to pair with our courses. Wonderful! 

Pair that with a fabulous view of the strip and you have an unforgettable experience!

Excellent meal! We did the "family style" dining where the waiter brought out a variety of dishes. Everything was amazing. The only downside of doing it that way was the cost but it was worth it. A must try for sushi when in Vegas!
Had dinner and service was a little slow BUT justen with an "e" had jumped and saved the night by getting the service jumping and he made up for it with great service. Food is excellent too
Great food and had an incredible waitress named Nicole. She gave solid recommendations on the food and was a very down to earth person. I will definitely come back to this establishment!

Last night my wife and I went into Roku (where we haven't gone in quite some time) and had a great experience. We travel a lot during the summer so we do not get a lot of time to go to our favorite spots. Roku is one of them and it was unreal. Jon served us a complex order and gave us some great recommendations that my wife loved! Happy wife is happy life! Thank you to Roku and the staff

Made the long trip to Scottsdale from Goodyear to check out Sushi Roku and to celebrate our friend's birthday. Beautiful atmosphere and tasty sushi made this a nice experience. I wouldn't say it's the best sushi I've had, but well worth the visit. Our only complaint would be the 45+ minutes we waited for our check after completing our meal. Granted, it was Saturday night and the place was fairly busy, but come on...

After we FINALLY got our bill...gulp....the prices are very high...we ventured upstairs to the open air lounge which is nestled near the W hotel's pool, which I've heard is an experience all in it's self. Lounge was small and a little noisy for us 30+ yr olds...LOL! 

Nice experience...would return again.

One of the Killers', and especially singer Brandon Flowers', favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. If you want to spot celebrities anywhere, this is the place. Oh right, and the sushi is insanely good too...

From LV's Daily Fiaso blog: "Even family man Brandon Flowers has to eat. Thus we have him being spotted enjoying lunch at Sushi Roku inside the Forum Shops at Caesars today with family in tow. Reportedly, the singer is a frequent visitor of the acclaimed restaurant."
http://thesponge-dani.blogspot.com/2011/10/victims-pilgrimage-killers-fans-guide.html

A perennial guest at the W Hotel this is the only dining option... Consistently disappointed in the lack of attentive service / food and beverage wait times. The focus on the "scene/crowd" overshadows all else and is definitely not accommodating to the solo female business exec based on my experience at the bar/high top section.  Recipe for satisfaction = (- expectations + patience + sugar daddy)

WE LOVE SUSHI ROKU IN SCOTTSDALE!!! We moved to Phoenix 2 years ago and frequented the other locations in CA.....sushi ROKU in Scottsdale is THE BEST! Chef Miles omakase....which we've had numerous times....is not only a culinary adventure but creative, unique and beyond delicious. We crave it. The staff is great and the management always says hello and greets customers. This is a place you will want to come to again and again. We've had sushi from Japan to New York and in between....sushi roku in Scottsdale stands out. Thanks to Miles, the staff and management who do a fantastic job.....each and every single time!.......
......from C and F

Great, especially better at the happy hour. Been here several times before, and we love it each time. Pricey, but good. Ambiance was great, and great location, you can shop after too work off the calories. Spicy tuna as usual was the bomb, juts enough flavor not too greasy. Volcano dessert was awesome.

What a bad time! We had reservations for 930 and didn't get seated until 10...well we got seated at a temporary table until the table we were supposed to have was ready...then we moved again! They didn't get ANY of the food right! Some of us didn't eat at all. We all left hungry. My ribs were good but fatty..not worth $20. I will not be returning. One star for decor.

Came here for lunch today. Was a little disappointed in the service and food. The restaurant is connected to the W Hotel in Scottsdale, great location. The interior of the restaurant is really nice and modern. As for the service, the waitress took about 15 minutes to come by the table to get our drink order. Once she did, it took another 10 minutes for us to get our drinks. We then ordered the food. She brought out the first order of suchi and had forgotten to bring our edamame for our appetizer. We then asked her for it. Then she brought out another dish and forgot half of it. We then sat for another 15 minutes before any other food came out. I asked the waitress what was taking so long (since there was only 2 others tables in the entire restaurant), she said that everyone was ordering sushi and they were busy. That wasn't the brightest response because 1 we are at a sushi restaurant, so of course people will be ordering sushi, 2 she only had 3 tables to wait on. Once we did get our sushi, the rolls fell a apart. So it just seemed as though everything was just not up to par, especially for the amount of money you pay. 

As for the food itself, we had the following:

Spicy Tuna hand roll
Softshell Crab Roll
Rock Shrimp Jalapeno Roll
Cucumber Roll
Kobe Skewer

The food itself wasn't bad, it was more of the experience that wasn't great.

Right when you walk in, this place was pretty nice.  We made reservations at 8pm and everything looked amazing.  They had these booths on the right hand side which looked pretty comfortable, but we had a large group so we took a table.  The decor is really relaxing and the view is awesome.  
I had the salmon and scallop dish here and it was really good.  Everything in the dish went with each other, but I didn't order much because we were going out later that night...drinking...so yeah.  I guess I'd say that this place met my expectations and didn't disappoint.  Service was on par with the status of the restaurant so no complaints there.  But for some reason I couldn't give this place 5 stars.  The food was good but not excellent...if it was excellent I would have ordered more after my first dish.  
Overall, I'm satisfied with my experience here.

A gem in Vegas! The staff was very knowledgable on the fish and where it came from. We had the chef make a roll of his choice and it was spectacular!!! The king crab sashimi was incredible!! Will be back to this place again! Cocktails were A+!!

This is a wonderful restaurant!  Atmosphere, service, and cuisine are top notch! The views of the Strip always contribute to a great dining experience. I recommend the asparagus wrapped in filet mignon as an appetizer. The tofu steak entree is also a fine compliment to any main course. My ginger lychee mojito was fabulous and I suggest you order one or several with your meal. Sushi Roku strives for excellence and always delivers it!  Enjoy, enjoy, enjoy!!!!!!!
Dana F.
12/26/12

The service was decent however the food was horrible. I took my boyfriend here for his birthday the sushi was so fishy he couldn't even eat it. I got a California roll it was soggy and poorly prepared. We have had better sushi from Fry's supermarket I am giving one star for the birthday ice cream dessert.

Unreasonably pricey. Crazy service fee. We weren't been clearly explained about the 20% fee in the bill. We had sashimi, wagyu beef, tempura, sushi and ended up paying $1500+ for a party of 9, plus a hard $300 service fee, which is crazy because we only ordered platters to share. The waitress was busy and we had to call on her a few times to order things. Not the best service around town but charging too high. Don't go there!

Sushi R does it again. A buddy of mine hooked me up with this place 7 yrs ago and it's ever bit as good today as 7 yrs ago - do yourself a favor and eat at Sushi Roku 
Katana Roll is a std and try the Sea Bass Roboto as a starter kit!

This was our second Thanksgiving dinner here (weird, I know).  We came back because the food is good and the decor is nice for a dress-up family dinner.  I'm from Hawaii, so my standards for raw fish are high (which explains the lower rating for some of the sushi items). 

Spicy tuna roll w/ avocado: 3 (boring)
Hottate (scallop sashimi): 4
Ikura (salmon roe): 4
Oysters: 4
Tofu 3 Ways: 5 (served with truffles, caviar, and ginger with delicious sauces and red dipping salt)
Miso eggplant: 5 (so good!)
Shishito peppers: 5
Tuna tartare: 4.5

Service was a-ok, no problems.

This was for my girlfriend's 30th birthday and she loves sushi so I wanted to treat her to a place that is nice. As we approached the front entrance of Sushi Roku, we were greeted by two skinny cold looking hosts. As one of them escorted us to the table, she nonchalantly asked how I was doing but it wasn't very sincere. She seated us right in front where we can see ... the outside to the mall. I caught a quick glimpse of the darker area of the restaurant that supposedly have a great view of the strip lit up.

Needless to say, at least our server was nice. I told him we had a show to catch (Peep Show) and the order came out very quickly. We ordered:

- Foie Gras wrapped in Yellow tail sashimi (foie gras was over powering and salty)
- Toro (don't remember what it even tastes like, not impressed)
- Japanese Yellow Tail Sashimi with Diced Chiles (too salty)
- Chilean Seabass w/Yuzu butter (this was a flavorful dish. The bass was very well cooked)
- Kobe Beef Skewers w/ Black Pepper Sauce (flavorful and tender; thumbs up)
- Spicy Tuna and Rainbow Roll (rolls were pretty good size and tasted fresh)

Total for 2 people: $216 including 1 mojito and 1 cocktail

Would I go back? Only if I get a chance to have a nice view of the strip at night but besides that, not really.
Great atmosphere and great sushi! Fun part of downtown Scottsdale, very lively place. The sushi chefs were awesome and the reviews were right.... freshest sushi around!

Decoration: Very unique and love the wall decoration. if you are interested in presentation, Should check out thsi place

Food: Wide vareity, fresh fish in the middle of desert .

Service: Excellent. 

Why only 3 stars?? very expensive when you order one meat dish ( grill beef on the stone) and rest sushi
Went for happy hour, weekdays 4-7pm. Great good, great service, great prices. Highly recommend !

Went to the LV location instead of the one in Santa Monica.  This is next to the BOA steakhouse in the ceasar's forum shops.  We ate here to celebrate my sister's birthday.  We didn't make any reservations ahead of time, but they were able to accomodate eight girls and were given a good table with a view of the strip  We ordered different kinds of sushi, salmon terriyaki, to soba noodles.  We each thought our dishes were pretty good.  They even provided my sister with a bday dessert.

Very impressed, 
hands down one of the best restaurants in the area.  The menu was unbelievable and the service was even better.  The food was diverse and amazing, it was some sort of experience that combined the art of the culinary past mixed with the present. The freshness of everything is where I was most surprised being that this particular location is in AZ. I can confidently say it's one of the top sushi restaurants I have ever visited and will be going back for more.

Sat at the sushi bar with Kyle and ordered omikase. He did a phenomenal job selecting cuts of traditional and exotic sashimi tailored specifically to the taste preferences of my girlfriend and I.  Very thorough explanation of each plate. Extremely attentive and friendly. Had a wonderful experience.

Went here during a visit to Vegas. Debated the oh-toro (fatty tuna) out loud and even our server commented that it was great and "just melts in your mouth". Ended up ordering 2 orders (4 pieces) of it along with our entrees.

The tuna we had looked like they were less than ideal cuts. Not only did they taste bad, they were likely the worst tuna I've ever had. A complaint to our server simply resulted in her shaking her head and saying "not so good?" with no offer of a remedy.

Two stars because the fried rice was pretty good.

The hubby and I went here for our anniversary and everything was spectacular! Everything we had was amazingly fresh but the highlights of the meal were the tuna carpaccio, the yellowtail with diced chilies and the ribeye wrapped asparagus. We could have licked the plates. Such attentive staff and great atmosphere. We will definitely be back!

Sushi is so great at this resturant I love they roll so fresh and it's so good 
Great service and everyone friendly there.

Amazing service and food! The sushi tastes very soft and fresh. Plus we had the king crab fried rice which was pretty fantastic! Our server was very attentive and polite. The best service we received while in Vegas for the weekend.
Tuna Carpaccio and tuna tataki sushi was fresh and delicious! Celebrated a birthday here! Friendly wait staff and sushi chef! Highly recommended!!!

As a purveyor of all food fine, my wife and I ate here this past Friday night.  The serviec was friendly and not stuffy.  Our server Louis was great, very knowledgeable on the menu and a fellow foodie.  

The decor was very hip and the Strip view from the main dining room were amazing.  We sat at the large couch-like tables and seating area, which are the best seats in the house.  

We ordered the spicy tuna on cripsy rice, which was very good.  The jalepenos were diced and mixed into the tuna which was much better than most places that just place a sliver of the jalepeno on the rice.  Very tasty.  We also ordered the peppered kobi beef skewers which were tender and flavorful. Perfectly grilled.  

We also ordered the baked crab handroll...which were the best we've ever eaten and we've had the ones at Katsuya and Koi. These by far were the best as the crab was flavorful and was stuffed in there...unlike Katsuya where they have the tendency to skimp on the ingredients.

The best part of the night was the chilean sea bass with miso glaze. That fish was cooked to perfection, it was light, flaky and ever so sweet.

This place rocks!

It was a nice surprise when we found out that they have lunch special! Bento box with teriyaki salmon and 4 pieces of sashimi priced at $19, super delicious! My friend ordered unagi donburi and it was to die for, sweet and melt in your mouth eel! Service was excellent! I recommend to go during lunch time if you come to town with kids, it was nice, quite and still great food and service!

I have an iron stomach and the sushi I had here put some chinks in it.  Obviously something wasn't fresh.

The service was good.
The Toro Sashimi wasn't good due to the stringiness of the fish.  It's supposed to melt in your mouth and be the best.  So disappointing.
The tempura and edamame was really good.
The rolls were good but I can't remember which one.

Next time I'll be going to BOA instead.

Came here and got the seafood udon noodle dish. It's not in the menu but recommended because I asked if I could add meat to the udon noodle. The server was great - the Brussels sprouts chip were great. Next time I go to Vegas I would definitely go back
I love this place. Very friendly inviting staff, the ambiance is great and u have a view of the strip. The sushi is fresh and always good as well as the choice of sake.

We are regulars whenever we visit Las Vegas. The service here is excellent, and the food quality is second to none ! The Manager, Johnny, is very accommodating, and makes sure everything is perfect. The yellowtail with diced chillies is one of our favorites, all seafood is the freshest you can get. The hot appetizers are consistently excellent as well. Tempura is great, too. The atmosphere is very friendly and upbeat. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone that is looking for a great japanese meal, with a great view of the strip. Don't miss out on this rare treat !!

I rate this place 2 stars because the calamari was dressed with this sauce that they did not even ask if you want it and the sushi was alright the rainbow roll the salmon and all the fish were not fresh that's all I gotta say very dissatisfied and disappointed

My wife and I just had dinner at Sushi Roku, and we really enjoyed it. The service was terrific, especially our server, Deborah. The ingredients were fresh, the warm dishes were straight from the kitchen, and the portions were adequate. Highlights included the Lobster Tempura with a Miso Glaze and the Kobe Beef Pot Stickers. The sushi was terrific, too. We had plenty to eat, and two cocktails each, for about $150, plus tip.would dine here again, for sure.
My favorite sushi place hands down. The tuna role is great along with the crab roll as well. Beautiful view of the strip if u sit by the window. Excellent staff.

We came for happy hour... Planned to stay for dinner but after we realized it would take 20 minutes for someone to greet us and to get the appetizer we decided to head to another sushi place for the main course. There are far better sushi restaurants in Scottsdale.

The staff was not very friendly, we kept having to ask for our stuff we ordered a couple of times to wait staff. The green tea was burnt so it was very bitter. The Sashimi pieces still had skin on them so eating them was not a great texture. I had one piece It was so fishy I almost threw up in my mouth. The brussel sprouts where not very tasty and greasy. The Korean bbq short ribs were so salty we couldn't eat it. They wouldn't split the bill so it made it a long difficult process for us to figure things out. The price is very expensive for service and quality. I get better service and sushi from hole in the walls. The only good thing we had was the oysters so that's why they get 1 star.
Ordered $35 executive Bento box, food is well prepared  with quality ingredients, I won't say it is a bargain as lunch special but I am not disappointed either.

OK, Sushi Roku has, in my opinon the best sushi in the Valley. It was ridiculous. Loved it. I went for happy hour and it was pretty quiet but I wasn't expecting it to be bumpin'. As a matter of fact I was hoping to avoid the snobs and I guess I did. (I hear they show up after 9 pm, FYI). I sat at the bar, enjoyed the edamame hummus and the spicy tuna rolls. The spicy tuna rolls were seriously the best. The service rocked too. Our bartender took great care of us. I'll be back.
Delicious fresh sushi! Got the spicy tuna roll and absolutely loving it! The sashimi is a bit pricey, but everything is very well done. Highly recommend!

The best restaurant for sushi in Vegas!!!!!!! Love this place and the View of the strip is fabulous. They have great filet also that has a great garlic butter soy sauce and saki mixed drinks. The staff is wonderful and that has a lot to do with the  management there since (Johnny) is by far the best manager making sure that everything is perfect:)

Not what you would expect from being inside a shopping center - Nice!
Sushi and Sashimi were good, sides and extras were fresh. Service was very friendly and attentive, pricing was - well, typical for the Strip.
All in all, good restaurant, great ambiance and quality service.

WOW! 

That's the only way that I can describe my experience at Sushi Roku last week.

My parents were in town and I wanted to show them an amazing night and I can honestly say that they left blown away by our experience here. Neither of them are major sushi fans so to win them over is no easy task, they are already talking about making it a tradition to eat here.

From the minute we walked in the door we were treated as royalty, being greeted by the manager (Mike Kirsch) from the get go is a refreshing change of pace, he assured us that if we needed anything we would be taken care of. Mike checked in multiple times throughout the night to make sure everything we needed was being addressed and of course, it was! 

From the second I exited my uber to the minute I walked out the door we felt special, which is not typically a feeling I have when exiting a restaurant but this place is truly amazing.

I'll be back soon! Mike Kirsch and our server were off the charts, I need to get that mans work schedule because anytime he's there you are sure to have a world class experience.

Thanks to everyone at Sushi Roku in Scottsdale for an incredible night!

Im not one to write reviews. However, the staff, the service & food at Sushi Roku was excellent. And far exceeded my expectation. First off, Stephen Dean coordinated a party of 14 for my daughters prom. He was professional, super accommodating and very nice. His turn around time for responding to emails was extremely prompt.  He created a perfect menu that all the kids would like. And made sure everyone had plenty to eat. Lastly, the service was impeccable and funny. As parents, we all know kids eating at restaurants don't usually get great service unless their parents are at the table. My daughter (who frequently dines out) said it was the best service her and her friends have ever had. The service was quick and they were well attended to. Not to mention the food was excellent. A big thank you goes out to everyone involved in making my daughters prom memorable!

Sushi Roku is kind of inside of the W hotel ... so you can imagine that the place is certainly is very nice in term of atmosphere or deco ... love the style of this place. 

Went there for a Saturday lunch with only few people around and enjoyed the seating outside with such great weather, so the overall ambient was totally 5 stars.   I will check it out again at night and see how the scene likes ... 

As for the food, me and my friend shared two of the lunch bento boxes with a variety of food from miso soup, salad, tempura, teriyaki, sushi to roll and dessert (green tea and red bean ice-cream)... Food was ok, not a whole lot to rave about. But again, this type of restaurant, you go there more for the atmosphere than food.  So in that sense, it met my expectation. 

Will recommend this place for a night-out, or date place

This place has been reviewed enough that I really can't add anything more.  Good food although the hot stuff especially the beef wrapped asparagus things were better than anything raw.  I don't think I'm going to be invited back.  I started doing saki bombs...I know weird when's it's just two people and I kept getting the shot glass stuck somehow in the beer glass.  The waitress was going nuts I could see the sushi chef giving me a stink eye...big mess.  In fairness to them I don't think it was the glasses but somehow I was dropping them wrong in my drunken state.  My apologies so I'm giving them an extra star.  I am sure they know who I am from this review.  I apologize deeply.

The sushi bar here just rock.  Second and third visit to  Sushi Roku, P made a bee line for the sushi bar.  That made all the difference.  

First time here we sat at a booth and while the food was good, there wasn't anything to make me want to go out of my way to come back.

But the sushi bar just transform the experience.  The sushi chefs are friendly and willing to engage you and what's fresh and good.   I put my trust and their recommendation and left happy and satisfied.

First of all we missed our reservation time due to Hennessey. Worried that we may not be able to move to a later time, I was pleasantly surprised to receive a later reservation. So of course our party still showed up late to the restaurant still in thanks to said Hennessey. The staff still managed to be very friendly despite our lack of grace and composure (aka Bachelor Party).  In fact they locked us in the private room with an equally crazy Bachelor Party also from our hometown (Go Niners).

The food itself was good. I had the Crab Dynamite Roll, the Spicy Scallop roll and the Crispy Salmon dinner. None of the above stuck out specifically but the quality and presentation are enjoyable. Drinks blurred into Sake Bombs and shots of Patron. The check was a bit rough but I felt it matched my expectations well.  My overall star rating is 3.5

For our last night in Vegas, we were looking to do a show and a fancier dinner. And a show and a fancier dinner we did! Our first choice for dinner was booked out a month, so we fell back on our trusty old friend, sushi. This restaurant did not disappoint. My boyfriend made a reservation (just to be safe). We get there and we are promptly seated in the back room; the windows behind our table looked out over the strip. Everything was prompt - the service and the time frame in between ordering our drinks and food and those getting to the table. Not to mention the service was so friendly - for some reason, they speak in rather quiet tones, which normally would frustrate me (I'm mostly deaf) but for some reason, it contributed more to the already soothing atmosphere. It was very intimate and peaceful. My boyfriend got some sashimi, soup, and rolls (forget what, exactly) while I got a little bowl of rice and rolls. The food was great! Normally, I'd go into much more detail, but I'll just leave it at that and let you find out how good it is. Dessert (mochi) was also good, three flavors of your choosing and one piece (which is then halved) of each flavor. I appreciated this, so I could indulge my sweet tooth but not feel overwhelmed/too full from it. Overall, this is a romantic and peaceful restaurant, equally good for couples as well as groups. We went early (6 PM) so this probably helped out with the peacefulness a lot, but nonetheless, I highly recommend it.

If you like authentic sushi (i.e. not crazy rolls where you can't taste the freshness of the fish), sit at the sushi bar and let the chef know. He'll hook you up with some out of the world food that you won't forget. They have the best selection of fish in town and amazing variety of condiments from Japan, including fresh wasabi root that's grated to order.

i made reservations for vday here they took my CC down to hold the reservation. then afterwards i realized they were a chain so i was hesitant to go through with it but seeing as how they were gonna charge me $25/pp i kept the booking. and IT WAS WORTH IT! the service was good but the meal was better!! had AMAZING yellowtail sashimi appetizer with scallion and ponzu sauce, then we did a Katana roll and added cream cheese to it (i know, how fraudulent) and then my bf and i shared the RibEye cooked to the most perfect medium i've ever had. everything was delicious! i admit a bit pricey but it was vegas and valentine's day so we let it go. a great view of the strip and really nice place. the only thing was the seat cushions we sat on had little room to spare between us and the table so if youre a bigger person or have big thighs then..id steer clear of those booths.

If I were to rate Roku on the quality of the food, it would be much higher. However, they not only have a very limited sushi menu, but it is also OUTRAGEOUSLY overpriced while at the same time offering tiny portions. 

I won't be back.

I love sushi, it is my favorite food so I am always hoping to find a good sushi restaurant when I go to Vegas. This place was okay. I think I am just too spoilt going to Sushi Deli in San Diego which is hands down the best sushi place on earth. The sushi here was just okay to me. I got the black truffle roll because it sounded awesome and someone else suggested it on here. It tasted like absolutely nothing to me. It wasn't bad, it just tasted like crunchy cardboard. We also accidentally ordered cold sake which is quite possibly one of the grossest tasting things you could ever drink. Overall the sushi was fine, but I wouldn't come here again to be completely honest.
I had some sushi. I had some sake. I had something with black truffle. Oh yeah, I had some seaweed salad too. Let me tell you, everything was delicious. That's all.

Love the atmosphere of this place. Fun, exciting, and beautiful. Great for a romantic dinner, nice dinner meeting for business, or getting some food before a night on the town. Our server Sarah was wonderful. Helped us order things we would not have ordered ourselves but knocked our socks off. Her food and beverage knowledge left us wanting for naught. Come in, ask for Sarah, let her take you on a magical culinary adventure as she says. You will not regret it in the least.

I recently took my wife to Sushi Roku for a long overdue night out. Several friends highly recommended this restaurant not only for great food, but for its outstanding customer service as well. Although the bar was set high from the outset, both my wife and I could not have had a better experience.

We were not that familiar with Sushi, or many other items on the menu. Fortunately, our server Nicole, did an unbelievable job in clearly explaining everything to us and even made perfect recommendations that made our dining experience top notch. It was almost like she knew exactly what our taste buds would prefer. 

No more long delays in taking my wife for a romantic night out.    Sushi Roku is now a scheduled weekly destination.  I'll be sure to ask for Nicole as our server.  So nice when your server is as helpful and pleasant as her. 

I'd recommend Sushi Roku in a heart beat!

If I am in the Old Town area of Scottsdale mid-day, this is my go-to lunch spot. It's never loud at lunch and the atmosphere is totally different from a dinner service there, far more tranquil. It is a place I meet clients for lunch frequently because it is never louder than a dull roar.  

For lunch, get one of their Custom Bento Boxes. In the bento box you get to pick two options I get mine with Chicken Kara-age (which I think tastes somewhat like KFC, minus their extra grease) and sashimi which is six pieces consisting of two of each of the following fish, yellowtail, salmon and tuna. One day they were out of regular tuna sashimi and they had to give me fatty tuna (Toro), what a fantastic mistake that was for me and my happy tummy.

I think I read someones review that called the place a "hipster hangout" I've never heard a more inaccurate statement made about this particular establishment. Hipsters like PBR and indie music, all they will get at Sushi Roku is a Sapporo and some fantastic yellowtail. I would call this place "hip" though, the decor is very intimate and interesting, especially at night and they do a very good job of being trendy which of course attracts the people that want to be "seen". What I mean is Hipster, no. Beautiful people and wanabees, yes. Having said that, I do not think there is a restaurant I have ever seen more actual celebrities at in Scottsdale than this one, recent spottings include Kristen Schaal and Rainn Wilson.  

For dinner appetizers you can't go wrong with the yellowtail with diced chiles or the hanabi. For mains you can do the "omakase" at the sushi bar if you've got the deep pockets and adventurous appetite or just stick with the ribeye with Japonais sauce which is an umami overload!
I always hit up my favorite sushi joint when I'm in Vegas.  The fish is so fresh and yummy
Food was of the chain good. Couldn't give it 5 stars cause of the price and water tasted like hose water when I was a kid.

This place is amazing I was out here in Vegas in June for my 27th birthday. My aunt and uncle brought me here, considering my aunt is not a sushi eater, so my uncle had a sushi partner lol. Omg.....delicious. amazing. Even the saki was really good except I requested it be chilled. And it was on the sweeter more milder side. People the host there was as fabulous as they get. He was such a diva lol! Ok! Now back to the food. My aunt from what I recall ordered a filet that she loved and my uncle and I chowed down on all kinds of sushi. It was amazing. Wish I lived closer lol! Xoxo

Sitting at the sushi bar here is the best. The two times I've been here, they've had a good variety of fresh fish here, more than what I've found at other sushi places around town. Finally I've found my amberjack sashimi!!!
If you're looking for some great selection of fresh sashimi, come here!

Pleasant atmosphere, stunning view, the staff is ultra friendly and helpful, and they'll do a huge portion of their menu gluten free!! This the first time ever that I have been able to order gluten free spicy tuna.  Also their sashimi is melt in your mouth good!

Sushi Roku was a great experience. We were seated and served so quickly. We had an 8 o clock friday night dinner reservation and although they were quite busy, many members of the staff made sure to take care of us. Highly recommend the cocktails and the makoto roll, so yummy. They also brought out a huge sparkler and decorated plate of desert for my boyfriend, as we were celebrating hid birthday.
The view was nice! Food was okay. Spicy tuna hand roll had too much rice. Overall awesome atmosphere and great service!

Excel price, food, services during happy hour.
I ordered miso eggplant, stuffed chicken in mushroom, rock shrimp tempura hand roll, albacore sashimi with fried onion, spicy yellowtail cut roll. The bartender made lychee martini and charge only  $5. The bill came $30, I paid $36total. You can't beat the service, food and price elsewhere.

Good food, very overpriced because of location and the view. Servers were knowledgeable but had an air of pretentiousness. I had the 6 piece chef choice, 2 pc bluefin, uni and spicy tuna rolls. All good, but much better AYCE places for $60 for two exist in the valley. But if you are in the Ceasar's shopping this is a good sushi spot. 4/5

I made reservations on Opentable a month or more in advance and we still got a table basically in the mall.  We watched other people that had put their name on the list and waited get seated by the window and the view.
Strike 1.

Service SUCKED.  The waitress actually didnt talk.  She would walk up to the table and look at us and wait for us to talk.. She would walk by and we would say excuse me and she would clearly hear us and keep walking.  She never checked on us once during the meal and believe me her tip showed how unhappy we were.
Strike 2.

We ordered a sampling of items.. we had The shrimp dim sum, which was the best item we ordered.  Does anyone else think thats funny?  The best item was a chinese dish.. haha

We ordered chicken yakitori which was pretty good but kind of overly yuzu'd up.   Way too overpowering on some bites.

We ordered a scallop dynamite which was ok, again overpowered by a flavor, which this time was the bonita flakes on top.  And halfway through eating it you could see oil puddling at the bottom of the dish, signaling we should be done and we were.

Last and least we ordered the Spicy Tuna crunchy roll (or something to that effect)  It was undercooked on the tempura outside, yet somehow overcooked on the Tuna inside.  Once this got a little cold it was disgusting...
Strike 3.

Price is outrageous really for the quality of food and quality of service.  It showed us that they really dont care if or when we come back and we wont.
Strike OUT.
Im rarely disappointed.. But this placed sucks! Took forever for my food to arrive even though its about 25% full. And the rolls are tiny!! Im leaving and im still hungry! :(
Had great service, food was amazing, and Jon was more than informative for an inexperienced first timer. We will definitely be back!

This place never disappoints. I've eaten at  both the Los Angeles and Pasadena, CA location. The Scottsdale location did not disappoint!  The decor here was nicer than the other locations, still rocking that chic and hip vibe that the W hotel and roku restaurants always have. We came with a large group of people, so we ordered a ton of dishes. Here are some highlights and must haves:
1) yellow tail with diced green chile: paper thin slices of hamachi bathed in a yuzu sauce topped with tiny pieces of diced green and red chile. It was delicious as always!
2) spicy tuna on crispy rice: i always order this at every establishment that offers it on the menu and I find that roku does it the best. The rice it's served on is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside and comes out warm. It's piled on high with spicy tuna that's bursting with flavor and heat. 
3) miso marinated cod: this is another dish I always order when it's available. It's not as good as Nobu Matsuhisa's, but still delicious. The fish is so delicate, it flakes apart easily with a fork and melts in your mouth releasing the flavors and sweetness of both the fish and miso marinade. Absolutely delicious!
4) Chilean sea bass: this is another really delicate fish that had great flavor and served nicely seasoned sautéd spinach. 
5) crunchy spicy tuna and avocado roll: tuna and avocado with tempura flake crust
6) spicy tuna and shrimp in rice paper roll (I forget the actual name of it): the rice paper gives this roll a unique and delicious flavor. 
7) rock shrimp: tempura style mixed with a sweet sauce.  
8) mixed seafood tempura: the batter was light and flaky. The scallop and asparagus were my favorites. 
9) edamame (soybeans): made al dente and came out steaming hot to our table lightly salted. Delicious! 

Everything here from the service to the food to the ambience is great. This place rocks!!

This is the sushi restaurant to come to if you want to overpay and feel like an unwelcomed guest.

My girlfriend and I were in a hurry so we stopped by here without a reservation on a Saturday night. Three (!) hostesses (no idea why they needed that many since none of them were doing anything) at the stand rudely told us all we could sit at would be the sushi bar even though we saw many open tables. I did not complain and happily accepted that. Big mistake.

We were jammed into two spots at the tight sushi bar and given a drink list. After waiting about 10 minutes for someone to take our drink bar, the sushi chef impatiently asked if we were ready. Um, no menus yet. He yelled at a server who came by and apologized and gave us menus and took our drink orders. Ok, honest mistake we thought...

Drinks came back and we ordered edamame and our sushi. Edamame never came and we couldn't get our server back until after we ate our rolls, which did come out quick. 

I complimented our sushi chef on the rainbow roll and he barely grunted back at me. Meanwhile, the chef to our left was having a very long conversation with the couple next to us. Maybe we got a grumpy chef? Either way, the rolls were good but I felt as if I had done something to piss off the staff which I felt to be pretty impossible since we had barely even got anyone to talk to us and I had been nothing but polite and complimentary.

When asked about the edamame, server just smacked his head and said sorry. He was nice enough but apparently overworked or not prepared to handle weekend volume. Either way, pretty poor from what I expected to be some of the best sushi on the strip.

Bill came to $70 for 3 rolls, salmon sashimi and a soft drink or two. Couldn't wait to get out of here. Food was good but I'd rather have my money back. This is the worst side of Vegas: overpriced, rude service, and no one pushing the staff to do better.

Great view of the strip. The sushi here is good. You will end up spending around $80 (inc. tip) for 2 for an appetizer and 3 different types of sushi/sashimi (average priced ones). The service was great/quick however they were not busy at the time we ate.

This place is awesome. I don't eat a bunch of crazy stuff lol but my boyfriend does. We went for a birthday dinner their. They ordered sea urchin with quail egg, beautiful blue fin tuna, pig ear with cartilage lol, raw beef liver with garlic. Everyone loved the food. I didn't. Try any of that but I did get the tofu and that was really good! It's definitely something to check out!

warning! biased opinion here. 
get to know the chefs. once they get to know you, you're experience will be stellar! first, i dont eat rolls! second i've been to japan numerous times and have had sushi there. third. i know where sushi roku is located (arizona) for those who forget. fourth i make a reservation any time im having dinner there. that said, have the grace and faith to let the chef make you what he would eat or what he thinks would best suit your tastes. (be honest! if you dont like uni say so!!!, if you normally eat rolls try omakese at your local sushi spot befor trying it here!! ) the chefs here have a strong head chef that teaches not just cutting techniques for the numerous fish that other sushi bars nearby dont carry, but also about how to best "service' the guest. 
if your expecting super fast rolls and unrealistic low cost, you made the wrong decision.

Good food. Make sure you are early for your reservation there is no grace period if you are late.

If you want water and the waiter offers you flat or sparkling water, it's bottled water and you will be charged it's not complimentary. 

Good atmosphere

Back at Roku and YES!!! Amazing once again.  Must have is the Grilled Octopus!  And the smoked Albacore is a treat....  not to mention how amazing the service is ... say hello to Dustin behind the bar, he's the best, or ask for Bre... she will make your dining experience one you will want to yelp. 5 stars.  Fantastic food, fantastic service, fantastic staff.....  well done Dan.

I rarely give places a five star. A five star place is the perfect model which all other places aspire to be. Sushi Roku is that place.

Obviously the top criterion for any sushi place is the quality of the fish. It tasted fresh--and I mean out of the ocean fresh! I still am having a hard time trying to get my head wrapped around the fact that Las Vegas is nowhere near an ocean and yet it was the freshest sushi I ever had.

With that out of the way, the service was impeccable. More than one person had their eye on me to see if I wanted anything else. What I was impressed by was that they balanced the way to be immediately responsive without being too imposing. All I had to do was make eye contact with one of the restaurant staff anywhere and they seemed to master communication by gesture among the staff so the right person could address whatever it is i was looking for.

Finally, what is a sushi place without a master sushi chef? This guy was good. I even asked if they had things that were not on the menu and he still produced them in less than three minutes.

Granted I did drop 80 dollars by myself here, but with this kind of service and this kind of food, I find it is worth the money.

If you are in Vegas, and you really like sushi, there is no excuse not to go here.
Incredibly fresh sushi and very friendly staff. Sit at the sushi bar for the full experience. AREGATO!!!
We loved sushi roku in the W! Rio was an amazing server, Dan and Steve were so fun....thanks to that trio we enjoyed delicious sushi and blanc de blue and will be back!

This place was recommended to us by a local at our hotel. Ambiance was great. Service was great. Food not so much. A coworker and I were there Saturday evening. We took suggestions from the chefs menu that day, an appetizer recommended by the waitress, sashimi, and then some rolls. Maybe we didn't order the right items but nothing seemed fresh. Really disappointed because I had high expectations going in.

My friends were in the mood for rolls, so we ended up here after wandering around the Forum shops trying to beat the heat.  I opted for the 3 course prix fixe for $45.  Appetizers were very good - glazed chicken, salmon with truffles, and kobe beef skewers.  Sushi plate was ok but nothing special, and dessert was a simple sorbet and fruit platter.   

I think the non-sushi menu is the way to go - on the whole, a pretty decent place with a great view of the Strip, especially at sunset.

I've now eaten twice at Sushi Roku in Vegas. First time was the one that earned four stars. I placed one order at a time trying a lot of different fish and had the best o-toro sushi I've ever. What was great was that the sushi chef recognized right away that I was basically creating my own omakase and so he tried out a couple things on me like searing one of the o-toro sushi pieces, brushing it with some sort of a sauce and placing a truffle on top for what was an amazing one bite food experience. Unlike at Okada a couple of days earlier, Mirugai was very different tasting it was very fresh and much better. All of the sushi was very good, best sushi I've had in Vegas. The one kitchen dish consisting scallops and foie gras wasn't good. Each scallop was huge and lightly seared on the outside raw on the inside but just didn't do it for me.  

On my second trip to Sushi Roku I sat at the sushi bar once again, this time with a different chef. I didn't go all out like the last time but the sushi that I did eat this time was once again very good.
Incredible food, amazing service!  Braised short ribs are to die for, king crab special with champagne butter is delicious!!

Sushi Roku was an awesome experience during my brief weekend vacay in Vegas.  My girlfriends and I enjoyed quite a few appetizers, including perfectly cooked edamame and scrumptiously fresh pieces of nigiri sushi.  For entrees, we ordered various rolls, more nigiri sushi, and a salmon/scallop entree that was absolutely delicious.

Service was also excellent.  We had a very attentive server who recommended some fabulous drinks and also dinner choices.  I've got nothing bad to say about the Roku--except that the prices aren't exactly cheap.  But you get what you pay for, I suppose.  And the last thing I wanted in Vegas was for bad sushi to ruin my luck!

Excellent food in every category....FRESH and delicious, presentation and exotic selection. I love the yellowtail sashimi style YUM and the grilled asparagus & steak....yes you can have steak there too. I took clients to dinner and our server CJ was brilliant guiding us through the menu and making recommendations. Also, Cody the manager made sure we had everything we wanted. The head chef even payed a visit to our table asking if we enjoyed the food, and yes we did!! The restaurant is a winner for impressing your clients or casual night out with friends. You'll love the ambiance too.

The Sushi was average. I found that the Eel/Avocado roll had muddy taste, like you sometimes get in catfish and talapia. Not the most appealing. 

The Truffeled Sea Bass was the highlight of the meal, pefectly cooked and delicious. 

The chicken fried rice and Soba noodles were average as well. Not my favorite sushi place, but a decent option if you are staying at Caesar's.

I love this restaurant.  The sushi was fresh and creatively prepared, decor is very contemporary and sets the mood and the view was awesome. I don't know why, I just have this thing for views in big cities. Went here with hubby and it was very romantical. If anything else, come check out the bathroom doors. lol... you'll know what i'm talking about. I've been to the Pasadena location and nothing but good things to say 'bout that location too.

I come here at least a couple times a month. Everything you get here is amazing! Asparagus wrapped in steak, tempura shrimp, lobster shrimp, sea bass with miso sauce, katana roll. I can keep going. Everyone there is so awesome and so nice! I love our waitress Mikoh and ask for her every time. You won't be disappointed. Johnny, the manager, is also wonderful and nice. I will keep going here forever!

I am giving 2 stars only because the service was good. The food is terrible; greasy and too salty! I sent my yellowfin sashimi with chiles back because it was drowning in oil. The seaweed salad was also drowning in oil. The food is over-praised and absolutely the worst sushi I've ever had. I also think all the oil on my seaweed salad made me sick.
We enjoy eating here whenever we are on the strip. The sushi is always great, and I am extremely difficult to please in that department.  I think we have our best meals at the sushi bar.

The atmosphere is awesome. We had gotten a seat by the window, and had an awesome view of the strip. We came here for my friend's 21st birthday. I ordered the peach passion drink, it was good but not too strong. For an appetizer, we ordered the filet mignon wrapped asparagus, they were decent. we ordered a couple of sushi rolls, the rice is a bit dry... some of the rice was even hard. i've definitely had better sushi rolls other places. The bill was pretty high for just the two of us. But, the place gets an a-ok to me because as we were leaving, our server surprised us with free shots for my friend's birthday.

Some of the best sushi rolls I ever had! The service was great our servers were very attentive to us like some sushi restaurants this belongs up there! We were welcomed by the host I wish I could recall both the server and host name too bad I forgot it..oh shucks...but I would just like to say they were great, but when compared to the sushi restaurant I went to in Dallas the service is just down 1 level which is still good. Although it's a casual place it's a great place to eat if your traveling around all the states like me! The fish was fresh and was prepared very well, and the crab tasted awesome! The drinks came out in a timely matter as well. If your looking for a great place for a date or just a quick dinner this the place. Also don't forget to make reservations this place is packed! Overall I would recommend this place to anyone.
Great sushi here probably the best I've had. Now they just started happy hour Sunday to Thursday from 5-close. The happy hour menu has a good variety of rolls, appetizers and drinks for 5 each.

I wanted to give the review about a 4 star because there was a wait so the night started off not so good. We waited about 30 minutes before being sat down. After that it only went up from there. Jon served us and did a great job explanation the different dishes and recommended terrific dishes (even though I am not a big sushi fan). In all, bill was not too expensive and dinner was great.

I LOOOOOOVE sushi. I've had some truly amazing sushi in Los Angeles, San Francisco, even DC. 

This place is... ok. Not bad, but not astounding. But, good enough. Definitely below par what I've had before and what I was expecting for the venue and price, but it's Vegas, so it's quite doable. According to my boyfriend, it's the best sushi place in Vegas/the Strip. 

Also, I'm pretty sure their mocha green tea ice cream was from Trader Joe's! D:

Loved the ambiance and the decor though.

Food- mediocre 
Service- terrible, so SLOW
It's hard to enjoy your dinner when you're constantly looking to flag your server!

I came here for Happy Hour last week. Got an $18 raspberry cocktail and two of the happy hour special sushi rolls for $4 each. Both of the ladies working at the bar were very nice and friendly, and my cocktail, while pricey, was also very good. The sushi was great. The salmon was perfectly fresh, and the tempura shrimp nicely cooked. Good rice, too. The lady next to me ONLY got happy hour food-- no alcohol at all-- and they were just as nice to her-- no grudging the lack of drink-buying. It's an attractive space and a pleasant Happy Hour environment. This place gets a thumbs-up by me.

One of the best sushi restaurants in Vegas.

Rolls are a bit pricey but are very creative and have much more fish than most of the other "fine dining" sushi restaurants on the strip. 

We had the Katana rolls which consisted of Tuna and Yellowtail on top of a roll with spicy tuna and shrimp tempura, these were fantastic, the shrimp was perfectly tender and the flavors worked well together.

Also had the crunchy spicy tuna with avocado which was perfect. And the spicy scallop roll which we really enjoyed.

I was quite hungry and wanted something hot so we tried the Chicken Yakitori  skewers, awesome, and the Kobe Beef skewers, alright but not as good as I would have hoped.

Service was excellent and the bar makes some very innovative cocktails, I am not much of a cocktail drinker myself but my better half ordered the Tokyo Cooler which I tried as well and agree with her opinion that it was fantastic.

Tab was just over $160 with three rolls, the chicken and kobe skewers, a shared dessert, two cocktails, and a couple beers. Not bad for Vegas.
I came back to Sushi Roku 3 times in 2 weeks.  The staff, food, and ambiance were wonderful!

I was lucky enough to be with a group who all got the Omakase (chef's menu). That said, we had most delicious, freshest things that could be prepared that evening. Service was great, and presentation was lovely. Lots of high-end ingredients. I won't pretend this was cheap... its pricey, but the food was worth it. The wine menu is unfortunate... small selection, and crazy-over-priced. 

If you really appreciate sushi, and are looking for tasty bites in the desert, swing through for sure. If you have the time, order the Omakase... it was so yummy!!!

oh! and the view from the booths was GREAT!

Just not a great Sushi Roku location.  The service was okay and the ambience was too - but the food wasn't fabulous and the sushi chef knew very little of the food he was serving.  When sitting at the sushi bar in a 'fine dining' japanese restaurant you kind of expect the chefs to be spot on and knowlegable about the food.  Not the case here.  If you want to spend this kind of money, go to Roka Akur - it's fantastic and worth every penny.

My husband and I went to visit friends in Scottsdale arizona. We always like to try new and different restaurants. We decided to go to Sushi  Roku and meet up with friends. The fish was of high quality and everything was fresh! The atmosphere was very unique, loved it. We had the Toban Yaki which was very expensive but it was worth the money. The premium tofu is a must-have and the spicy tuna was great. We had Nicole as our server. Nicole was very knowledgeable and her personality was lovely. When we asked for suggestions she listened to what each one of liked and she went from there. Everything Nicole brought out to us left us with big grins. Very tasty! Great job Nicole, we will be asking for you and learn more about the menu.
This is my favorite restaurant in Vegas. The food and staff were amazing. I highly recommend to order the foie gras wrapped in yellowtail in truffle, everything from the menu you can't go strong.

The restaurant is beautiful and it was a great hangout location. The food was good but by no means spectacular. I expected to be blown away by the food for the price. Small portions and not a lot of creativity for the price. Service was great

Absolutely amazing sushi! They seem to have a small menu but they can make anything you want. I recommend trying the baked carb hand roll with cream cheese!!! Just may be the best sushi I've ever had!
We went there since it was suppose to be the "happening" sushi place on the strip. While sushi was good, I didn't find this place that much fun. The view of the strip is quite spectacular though.
This was a perfect spot to get delicious sushi.  The atmosphere was quiet and romantic and the food was amazing.  No doubt about it, we will be back.

Great spot inside the W hotel. Convenient location in addition to amazing food! Staff was very friendly & helpful. 

On the more formal & expensive side but worth it if you're looking for high quality sushi etc.

I love sushi roku, I go to the one in Newport Beach a lot and the taste here in Vegas was just as good as it is at home. The waitress was very nice and the service was great. 4 stars because the hostess wasn't too friendly but we also came without a reservation so not sure if that had anything to do with it, OH WELL. good alternative to other restaurants like nobu if you aren't into spending nobu money.

We made reservations, and our table was not available when we arrived.  Sat at the bar and ordered a few drinks.  When our table was finally ready, we had to walk our own drinks to the table.  I would have expected better service from a place like this.  The food was no better than the service.  On the bright side, our server did inform us that a particular dish we wanted to order was not up to par on its freshness that day.  I really appreciated his honesty.  

We expected some good sushi out of this place, but was not impressed at all.  The sushi was mediocre, and so was the rest of the food.  Nothing we ordered stood out.  Only worth going because it was in Vegas.  If this place was anywhere else, they would definitely not get the business they get.  I don't intend to come here again.  Spent enough money here to receive two desserts compliments of the manager, but the food just was not good. There are plenty of other places in Vegas worth the money.

I ate at Sushi Roku along with two other people last Sunday at around 5:30pm.  It wasn't crowded so we got a booth overlooking the window.  The waitress was attentive and the Asian-influenced ambiance was nice.


We ordered just enough food to feed the three of us.  The cost was around $120 dollars for three people, including two small sakes.  The dishes we ordered included:

APPETIZER
Hanaki Spicy Tuna on crispy rice cakes - This was quite good with a nice amount of spicy tuna on top of individual rice cakes.    The tuna had just a touch of spiciness.  There were about 5-6 pieces.

Sweet potato tempura (two pieces) - We had to send it back the first time because the sweet potato wasn't cooked enough.  It came out better the second time.  I probably won't order the tempura again.


SUSHI
Unagi Hand Roll - It was a standard unagi hand roll, which is my favorite sushi.  The sauce wasn't overpowering like some unagi hand rolls.
California Hand Roll - It was tasty since they included generous portions of real crab meat.

MAIN ENTREES
Chilean Sea Bass with Sauteed Spinach entree (Added Miso Soup and Rice for $6 which was a bit pricey) - I felt the fish was moist but had a fishy aftertaste but one of my guests thought it was perfectly cooked.  

Pan-fried  spicy jumbo shrimp with homemade potato chips - The shrimps were good-sized and were perfectly cooked. The sauce was not overly spicy.  The homemade chips were an interesting addition and tasted good with the sauce.

This is by far my new favorite spot for sushi! The atmosphere, service and especially food was the best I've ever had. I will be coming back and becoming a regular to this place! If you ever want sushi in Scottsdale this is the place to go and request Jon! He his knowledge for sushi and the whole menu led us to try new things we may never have tried and everything was amazing!

Moving from Santa Monica to Scottsdale had its drawbacks, one concern being my access to high quality, fresh sushi. It goes without saying that the food is exquisite from the menu staple items, to the daily specials, and the sake selection! All of the employees are knowledgeable and friendly as they guide you through the menu to ensure a perfect meal. The team is lead by a great manager, Mike Kirsch. I booked a New Years Eve dinner at Roku for my girlfriend and I. Needless to say, it was extremely busy. Mike took the time to swing by my table several times to check on us and step in with refills and food drop offs when the wait staff was tied up. He helped make New Years a perfect evening! I've been back several times since, and have had the pleasure to meet the other manager Dan who hosted a business meal for me. Dan held the same high standards as Mike and guided us through a fantastic evening. This is by far my favorite sushi spot in town for any occasion. Don't miss out!

The service was horrible!!! Have never had service like this anywhere, especially a higher end sushi restaurant!!! Food took an hour and twenty, the wrong order was given, our appetizer never showed up, no water until I requested it. It was 3pm. Empty in there. No excuse. Our waitress was terrible. Two other couples arrived after us were in and out in 45 minutes. The sushi was good but not for the service or price. Go to Koi, Sushi Samba or somewhere else.

I heard they were very good at catering to food allergens, but we had a pretty poor experience.  Their gluten free menu was really limited compared to their normal menu.  I have a soy intolerance, and they brought me crab in a soy wrapper.  We didn't figure this out until I was a couple of bites in.  Then they didn't discount my meal.  The waiter took forever even though the place was pretty empty.  Lame all around.

The ambiance of the restaurant was nice. There was an excellent choice of different foods in the menu. The chef's specials were delicious. The waiter was wonderful, we never had to look for him, he was very attentive to our needs. Overall, the dining experience was excellent and we would visit again. However, I would like to point out that when I made reservations through Opentable.com I had stated that this was a special occasion we were celebrating (my parents 40th wedding anniversary) and no-one had bothered to bring a special dessert (as others were receiving) with candles. This was disappointing that the note in my Open Table reservation to the matradee was not read. (We had spent well over $300 that evening.)

Had a great meal with my mom. The staff was very attentive and courteous. Although they couldn't make an expresso to save their live, the food and service made up for it. If you can sit next to the windows. The "booths" suck for comfort if you're a sloucher like me.

So, the first word that comes to my mind is LOUD.  The food was good, and the drinks were good, but it was hard to hear the people at my table.   I can't think of anything that stands out on the menu as being great, but we had a few rolls, the shrimp cups (those were the best), and some tempura.  All in all, it was a scene, pricey, and decent food.  Will I go back?  Not sure.

Excellent food & service Friday evening.  Giovanni our server was tip top.  A couple of menu items were 86'd - so he simply recommended other menu options.  Dan - the wine/sake somm - offered excellent sake pairings.  Steve GM - checked in on us a few times as if we were regulars.  Will definitely be back.....

Sort of hard to find, on third level in the Caesar's shops, just find an information booth and ask for directions.

Can park for free at Caesar's self parking, parking garage is close to the shops.  Come out of elevators, take first right, take left one you get to Fizz, take another left after  you enter the shops, good all the way down until  you hit a fountain, walk around it and go to the right, walk straight until you get to the escalators, go up, you'll see it in the back to the right after that.  

Only did rolls, tried: 
- Crab Dynamite (favorite)
- California
- Popcorn Shrimp Tempura w/ Jalapeno (really good!)
- Shrimp Tempura w/ Asparagus
- Spicy Tuna (tuna melts in your mouth, one of best i've had)

Does take reservations, used OpenTable

Nice ambiance, service kind of slow but nice people

3 people, 3 drinks, 5 rolls, $100 bill.

I ate here with a large group of girlfriends during my bachelorette weekend and was impressed with both the food and the atmosphere.  The view of the strip is excellent, and it is very chic inside.  We ordered a multitude of rolls and they were both aesthetically pleasing and delicious.  I recommend the sparkling blueberry sake (if you like sweet wine) and the scallop appetizer.  As with most sushi restaurants, it was quite pricey, but well worth it overall.  I would definitely return here in a group or on a date.

Fantastic late dinner! Our server, Jess, was very attentive, and recognized my wife's chocolatini (special request, not on menu) wasn't as requested. Very inventive menu. I recommend the beef tataki app! We had sushi rolls and a couple cocktails. Perfect! Thee Wagyu roll was ridiculously good. I remembered a "free white choc brownie" offer somewhere, and Jess was quick to ask if I was on Yelp!.....and yes, it was amazing.

I was here 3 weeks ago with friends. I went back the next night alone. The staff was friendly and welcoming, the bartenders Sam and Regis both remembered my name from the night before. The service was prompt, the food great and the atmosphere awesome. I will be back in AZ next week and will def visit this venue.

It is THE place to start out also,  with your friday and saturday night shenanigans ( :

Loved the decor. The "strawberry fizz" drink was delicious and had quite the kick without tasting alcoholic. Also had a taste of the "pear martini" which was a bit sweet for me but my dining partner loved it. The yellowtail carpaccio with peppers was yummy. Had to send back the rock shrimp because it was soggy and weird... ick! Tried some new things for sushi... liked my first taste of kanpachi, the ikura (one of my usual  favorites) was good, nothing special. Also tried uni--- really good! Had tried it once before but it wasn't fresh enough. Basically, you'll pay ridiculous prices but the fish quality is actually good. Mom had the chilean seabass which was pretty good except not cooked all the way through, ick! Service was great and our server was a sweetheart. Wouldn't rush back due to price, but it was still a fun, satisfying dinner with a few hiccups!

I really wanted to like this place more but, after our recent (and only) experience, I'm barely able to give 2 stars. First: it took us close to 20/25 minutes to find this place after entering Caesar's and asking several hotel employees. *No, we weren't drunk or stoned; it's that hidden. Second: When we did finally arrive to the hostess stand and nobody else was around, they both just stared at us. We said hello and that we had a reservation. One of them lead us to a table right next to a table of ladies and all their bags. We looked around the empty restaurant and asked if we could possibly be sat a bit farther away. Done with hesitation. Third: I eat fish/seafood but, my husband doesn't but, can usually find something on any menu. I asked our waitress what she recommended for both of us given the no fish deal. She suggested a shrimp dish. ??? My food came first while we waited for my husband's. This is the fault of our waitress by misfiring the order to the kitchen;  any good waitperson knows all food for the table should come relatively around the same time. The sushi was good; they have ankimo!! The best? No way! For $200 (no booze) I expect much better than good. I think the most insulting was being charged $3 for extra "pita" pieces when we wanted more than the 4 slices the hummus originally came with. On a completely personal bitchy note: our waitress' grill was all over the place (possibly missing teeth, jagged, crowded) and very distracting when looking at her. Her appearance didn't match the chic/trendy look this place is going for. As a local, we probably won't go back anytime soon.

The best sushi in Las Vegas and probably the U.S.

The sashimi is flown in daily form Japan.

We came with a large group, gave him our price point per-person, and he brought out outstanding dishes. 

If you like sushi, this is the place to eat it in Vegas.

I would give this place negative starts if I could.
