Food poisoning aside (this could happen anywhere), it was truly the worst dining experience in Vegas.

The wait staff were rude, unattentive and just gave off a general bad vibe.  And since we were a party of 8, they slapped on an 18% service charge.  Again, that would've been acceptable if we received ANY SERVICE at all.

Views were great but how can you enjoy it when you spent the evening trying to flag down your waiter?  I ended up having to get up to get someone to get me more tea.  I felt sorry for the booth next to ours because the waiter served my tea climbing OVER their seat.  Maybe he was too tired to walk the extra 3 feet around to fill my tea cup?

Given the level of competition on the Strip, one would think service would be stellar but I've had better service at any strip mall sushi diner.  

Truly awful, stay away.

Have been here twice and love their selection of sushi and sushimi. On this trip we tried Octupus and a sushimi combination. Fantastic. The curry sushi we ordered exploded with flavor with each bite. And the crab fried rice may have been among the top 3 fried rice dishes we've ever had. Delicious.

Just had an amazing dinner can't tell you what was more enjoyable the service or the quality of the food. Soraya was our server, we told her it was her first time there, and she basically highlighted the entire menu for us. The presentation & the quality of the seafood was outstanding. Our favorites were the hamachi appetizer & the white lotus roll. (Which I was told us not on the menu). I've gotten to the point now where I just ask the server " order dinner for us something that will make us want to come back here again".

Came here for a late dinner after watching Phantom of the Opera.  Ordered the Sushi combination and Tuna Carpacciowhich I thought was ok.  The Seabass truffle was actually really good.  The best part of the meal.  

We had dessert and I thought the banana flambe was really good but the volcano was ok.  Overall it wasn't too bad. If I come back again, it would probably be for the Seabass Truffle and Banana Flambe.

Amazing Sushi and we eat it often at different restaurants. 
Also, Great Happy Hour 4-7pm!
Cheap but professional, food was literally delivered to our table within 2 mins of ordering each course.
Had multiple items, but the Spicy Tuna on Crispy Rice was exceptional, ordered a second one after the first!
Visit!
Great summer menu going on right now with fun drinks. So convenient if you're staying at the W.

My friend and I decided to grab an early bite while shopping in the Forum Shops at Caesars and chanced upon their happy hour. Happens every day (as stated by other reviewers) between 4 to 7 pm. Talk about a great deal on sushi in Las Vegas nonetheless. 

Well drinks cost $3 each and a large beer will set you back $5. Great way to begin any rock star adventure slinging a few drinks before hitting the tables and clubs. Hint: $$$-saver!!!

We had popcorn shrimp tempura, tuna tataki, shrimp and chips, spicy scallop roll, and fried calamari which cost $4/each. They don't skimp on the portions so order up.

Food is really good tastes  amazing too. Also the server was very professional.  BUT literally every dish was like nothing there. If u really wanna try here just let u guys know. U will cost 31 $ for like 5pics of shrimp and tons of chips on the top n it's called pan fried shrimp with chips lol.

Service was awesome. My husband and I ate there on 10/17/2010 for dinner and it wasn't too busy.

We were seated right away, and our server was extremely attentive. She even suggested some sushi that wasn't on the menu and she had good suggestions.

The sushi was decent but extremely pricey. You're on the Vegas strip. You have to expect it.

Seaweed Salad = yum
Crab Dynamite = yum
Shima Roll = yum
Red Sun Roll = yum
premium sashimi special = alright

If you get the Crab Dynamite, order it first. It takes some time to prepare.

Oh what a night of culinary delights with my colleagues in Las Vegas at Sushi Roku.   In the famous Forum Shops at Caesars on the 3rd floor, this dark and sensual place is a great intimate place to gather with friends or on a romantic date.
I had one of the most outstanding dishes I had ever had  - it was the tempura lobster with a miso glaze.  It was sweet and amazing because of the sticky miso and crunchy because of the panko tempura and juicy bits of lobster.  Our table couldn't get enough and was like heaven.  This item was a special on the menu and is a must have.
Delicious decor and stylish food!  Great Bento box for late lunch.  Nice service and professional management.

I went to Sushi Roku with my colleagues. This restaurant is located in Caesars Palace Hotel. The food itself is OK. I liked some kind of sushi rolls.From this restaurant, we could see nice strip view(south direction).

I was shocked to stumble upon Roku having been at their other location in Phoenix.

My BF and I had lunch there last week. The food is amazing as always and the service was excellent!! The view is something hard to come by in Vegas and we enjoyed watching all the tourist walk down the strip.

The only issue I had is with the bartender and the man who appeared to be the Manager/GM. You can clearly hear him yelling at her in front of guest. Its so sad that people cant be pulled to the side to discuss employee related issues.
Folks here are way cool. I asked the head chef Haruhiko 'Haru' Takeshita to freestyle our dinner and he said no problem!! Needless to say, this our second time eating here on this Vegas run!

The sushi was over priced and not that good. We ordered a shrimp tempura/jalapeño roll. It was literally just that. A small piece of tempura shrimp with jalapeño slices rapped in rice. No sauce, no other filling. What a waste. The waitress was very good as was the rest of the service. But when you spend over 100.00 on sushi, you'd like it to be memorable. It turns out it was because I woke up at 2:30 in the AM running to the bathroom...

This restaurant is beautiful!! It is very modern and comfortable at the same time.  The service was amazing... almost better than the food.  

The appetizers were very good.  The miso soup was hearty and filling - the best I have ever had. The popcorn rock shrimp was amazing - one of the best foods I have ever eaten!  The sushi rolls were good, but certainly not the best I have had (Crystal Fish in Monterey, CA is still # 1 for me).  Also, the pricing was quite high - about what I would expect for a tourist city like Vegas.

Overall, I really enjoyed my experience at Sushi Roku.  It was a great addition to our Vegas trip.

I gave an extra star, or a second star for the decor. Very nice place and view. Otherwise, the food is so bad and skimpy that one star is too much.
I don't mind small and tasty portions, but these were embarrassingly skimpy and notg so good. Udon soup came with tempura on a side, as we requested. Tempura consisted of one shrimp split in quarters and you only get two skimpy quarters of that one shrimp. Nada mas. 
My sushi box should have had four slices of sashimi, but what they did, they took one piece of tuna and split it in four pieces. So the four slices are paper thin and see through! It also came with beef, which was overcooked and not good. 
I was still hungry and went ahead and ordered a sushi roll. It was decent size but not great tasting. 
They should be ashamed of serving such food for such price. But even if it was cheap, which it wasn't, they should be ashamed, you don't serve two quarters of a shrimp as your tempura.

Nice ambiance and decor. The food is just okay, to put it mildly: my friend and I ended up with food poisoning after visiting this place. Service was slow. Overall: good for drinks, not for food. An overpriced and pretentious place.

I ordered unfiltered sake, seaweed salad, toro, albacore tuna, japanese snapper, yellowtail, salmon. Huge pieces of sashimi. I should've ordered the specialty rolls but I stuck with simple stuff. I wasn't that impressed BUT the service  was phenomenal. The waiters soooo attentive. They even packed my leftover sushi on top of ice and gave a to go cup for my left over sake. They were knowledgeable and let me taste two different sakes. I sat at the sushi bar and the chefs were friendly. The main dining area looks over the strip. It's also on the top floor of where the stores are.

My girlfriends and I had dinner there on a Friday night. Our table was not ready when we got there but we sat in the bar area and enjoyed one of their delicious specialty cocktails. 

We had excellent customer service both from the waitress and even the GM stopped by our table more than once to check on us. Both had excellent recommendations and everything we tried was delicious. Stick with the classic plates and you won't be disappointed.

I thought the pricing was on par with every good sushi place that I have been too. I even thought it was reasonable.

Great place!  It's in Ceasar's forum shops on the 3rd floor.  I sat at the sushi bar and they treated me so nicely.  Very good service and the food was good!  Fresh sushi, great rolls and interesting appetizers.  I had the spicy yellowtail rolls and the toro jalapeno which rocked!  Really good food, cool place, good service.

Moved to Vegas two years ago from LA and have really struggled to find good sushi. So far, sushi Roku sets the standard. The chefs are extremely good at what they do. They bring their own flair to standard items. They also have managed to create some very tasty and interesting dishes of their own. The hanabi is very tasty as is the tuna tartare. The salmon skin hand roll ordered a little extra crispy is the best I've ever had - the taste of the salmon skin though delicate, is not oily or overwhelmed by the other ingredients in the roll. Suggestion for all diners - try the sushi before you bathe it in soy and wasabi. You don't want to mask any of the flavors. Only real downsides - 1 it's on the strip so getting to and from can be difficult, and 2 it's expensive (but sometimes, you do get what you pay for).

Service and ambiance are top notch. Sit at the sushi bar if possible for a great time interacting with the chefs. 

Sushi was fresh and prompt. The sushi chefs steered us to the freshest selections.

As others have said it's a little on the pricy side but hey, it's Vegas!.

As good as it gets, We had a party of five and were treated like royalty, Combo of servers kept the food and drinks coming. We shared sushi rolls and they even worked in the timing for our person that ordered a steak. Rolls were excellent and the servers helped suggest a few new ones for round two, a bit of a shock when the bill came because it was lower than expected.

Based on my own experience, I'm pretty surprised that anyone would have rated this below 5 stars.  Our experience was amazing.  The head sushi chef, Jason, took great care of us.  The fish was delicious, the rice was perfect, the ambience was very chic and overall I would rank this as one of my top 5 dining experiences.  

Probably the best item I had was Foie Gras, wrapped with Hamachi and Chiso leaf, topped-off with a white truffle and gold flakes.

Guys, super nice place and the food is outstanding, high quality with great service.

The manager Justen is trenedous and makes every dining experience very memorable!

*A must visit if in Scottsdale!

we got 3 rolls and they were some of the best we've had. the prices aren't too bad for sushi in las vegas. if you can get seated in the front, there is a nice view of the strip

when we went, there were 2 huge birthday parties that were extremely loud and disturbing. I am hoping that isn't an every day occurrence or i wouldn't want to return

Came in town for a long weekend & was recommended to try this place for the best sushi. It did not disappoint! From the great service by our waitress Kylie to the awesome ambience of the restaurant we definitely enjoyed ourselves and hope to be back soon.

I love giant clam, this place always has it fresh and crunchy,
Don't let them seat you in the front area where you walk in, sit in the back by the windows , the view is great !. 
I, minus 1 star for the price here . Even with my local discount.

Rob our sever took great care of us.  His service was amazing.  Great place to have breakfast, lunch and dinner!  The food was delicious and sushi/sashimi were fresh.  Drinks were great as well.  All the people working were very friendly and hospitable.  Thank you Rob & Sushi Roku for taking good care of us on my birthday!

I went there for lunch during my last trip to LV.  The environment is pretty nice, and the decoration is modern, but the service is kind of slow even though there weren't too many customers when we were there.  We ordered the lunch combo from their lunch menu.  The food is just ok.  Everything is just on the average level, but I was expecting it would be better given the price they charge.  So overall, this is not really a place you must try in Vegas.

Excellent service despite the very busy night we were there.  The bar area was alive and had very attentive bartenders.  Upstairs in the VIP area...  bartenders were not attentive it took over 10 minutes before leaving because we were never asked or offered to order a drink.  

My order was correct and delicious for dinner!

We had a great experience at Sushi Roku.  The Hanabi was phenomenal as was the shrimp appetizer.  The Chilean seabass was extremely tasty as well.   The service was great on a night that was busy to say the least.  Definitely will visit here again.

Having been to Sushi Roku in Santa Monica this was truly a let down.  Although the fish was fresh, the preparation, menu and overall experience lacked what compelled us to go there after having had many good experiences in LA.

Visited on a Monday evening. Easy reservations via Open Table at the time requested. Seated immediate at a dark intimate half circle booth with a view of the chefs preparing sushi. The wait staff was friendly, prompt, and put up with our sake bomb messes all night. 

Food was well presented and tasty. Ordered seaweed and cucumber salads which were not the expected traditional versions but still good. Excellent Yellow tail small dish followed by various rolls. It's a fun swanky place for date night. A bit pricy and non-traditional but that's what you'd expect for a W Hotel restaurant. Enjoy!

It always helps out a place when not only is the food great but the service also.  Been coming here ever since the grand opening and even though it's in an obscure area of the Forum Shops at Caesar's, it's definitley worth the trek.  Always have consistently good food here with great decor (and if you sit at the right spot on a nice summer night, they open the sliding windows open so you can "feel" the strip view).  Have come with small groups as well as large and this place never fails me.  Some recommended dishes:  Seared yellowtail with diced chile (extra chile for me please!!), popcorn rock shrimp, chilean seabass, chicken nuggets with that cilantro-like dipping sauce, and pretty much any of their sushi.  I've been to all the Roku's (except the newly opened one at the W in AZ) and this one is as good if not better than any of the other ones.  It's always bigger, badder, and better in Vegas.

While in Vegas, we were looking for a Nobu alternate.  The reviews led me to S. Roku.  The decor was expected of a Vegas restaurant - sleek, dark and trendy.  The food was comparable to any other sushi joint.  We didn't have anything that was memorable, so I guess that makes this place forgettable considering all the other options on the Strip. Also, there was a rather long wait for some items to be delivered to our table considering the place was pretty empty.
Delicious. Although the prices are high, it's kinda standard pricing for good sushi on the strip. Shishito peppers were amazing. Fresh featured sushi and sashimi were amazing. Loved it.

My whole night at Sushi Roku was full of "I should have known better...."

I should have known better to not trust the front desk folks at my hotel to make a restaurant recommendation..... should have  trusted YELP

I should have known better that trendy and hip don't always equal quality dinning .... should have consulted YELP 

I should have known better ... when the hostess tells you 30 minutes for the next table and you don't get seated after waiting for a good 45 minutes, its time to get the hell out ..... YELP would have saved me 

I should have known better .... when you're waiting for a table and you see a sea full of empty tables that the restaurant could care less if you are waiting or not ..... god YELP me 

I should have known better when the restaurant never seats you at a table, keeps making up excuses as to why you can't sit down, you find a bug in your drink and they only comp you for part of your bill .... its time to give that place a big YELPIN review

Ok so bottom line ... 
Sushi Roku is a trendy place in Scottsdale, its kind of hip.. but again you're in Scottsdale 

I should have known better and left restaurant after being told it would take 30 minutes to get a table.  But instead I decided to take my chances and that was my bad. 

The saving graces of the night was my dinner party, and the very helpful and wonderful waiter STAN.  Stan allowed me to give Roku an extra star.  

Sum it up:
Roku ain't worth it... move on

Came for lunch and got the Spicy Tuna Don Buri.  They did it with the brown rice risotto for me, instead of the usual white.  It was great, I've never had spicy tuna this way.  It was mushy-style and spread over the rice and topped with some vegetables.  They forgot my miso soup though.
Great place, reasonable prices, and great quality. We enjoyed grilled chicken, eel rolls and salads
This place is a little difficult to find but the food was great. Everything was fresh and taste great. I will definitely go back when I'm in town.

Went here for dinner last night, and I have to say, each time we've visited, we have had nothing but exceptional service. Jon was our server; his knowledge of the menu is outstanding. We even let him order for us! His recommendations exceeded our expectations! You truly have an asset on your hands! We will definitely be back and will request him again! Great job to him and all of the staff!

My review is based mostly on the excellent service I received from Jenn the bartender...she was absolutely delightful! I came here with my friend (both new to the area) and we had a lot of fun joking around with her. She was both professional and fun...I've been working in the service industry for 5 years...I know great service and I'll definitely be back! We ordered 4 specialty rolls, all of them were delicious...this place was not disappointing in any way. Overall wonderful dining experience, can't go wrong here.

Went solo for some miso soup and sushi. The sushi was good, but the blue tuna sushi I had actually smelled a little fishy. Good spot to view the strip, but I wouldn't go back as there are other sushi places worth checking our.

I went here a few months ago with some friends while visiting Vegas for a friends birthday, our server was amazing and helpful when trying to figure out what to order. The food was amazing and the atmosphere was great for a few lunchtime drinks with friends.

Arrived a little late and needed to rush the order so we could make a show.  The waiter was extremely helpful and ended up being an interesting guy who chatted with us a little.  The decor and view were pretty good, and I'm a sucker for their Filet Mignon wrapped Asparagus.  Everything arrived quickly and we managed to get in and out in time for the show.

Food and service excellent, but young and inexperienced Restaurant Manager in way over his head for such a nice restaurant. Rude and unpolished treatment of customers. Won't be returning anytime soon.

We love sushi and loved the unique spin to many of the items on the menu. The food was outstanding. However, the restaurant is noisy and filled with young, "beautiful people", so do not come here if you are looking for a quiet romantic night. The overall vibe of the W in Scottsdale is one of snobbery and elitism, very disappointing for a W, and we have travelled to many across the country and usually enjoy attentive and upscale service. The good news is that although the hotel is lacking, the wait staff at this restaurant is exceptional and really made our evening. CJ deserves special recognition for making it a great night. It was easy to see that he loves his job- he knows the menu, helped us pick great plates to share and was friendly and engaging. Because of the food and CJ, we will be back to eat, but will stay at another hotel.

Wasn't a huge fan of any of the rolls, and the gyoza was different from what I'm used to I guess. A lot of beef taste...
Service was good. Dirty martinis were great. Felt like the food took a little more time than usual to come out. Great looking place with a great view though!

Quality sushi that uses top of the line nori for their rolls and it makes a big difference.

The spicy tuna roll has a nice kick to it and the katana roll is tasty as well.

A few points:

1) Service can be better -- the way the seater spreads out the customers gives each one privacy, but with how the restaurant organizes, it makes it difficult to get back to guests in time when they are ready to order. I noticed that another waitress had to step in when I started getting impatient.

2) Good ingredients on the sushi -- the fish is on point. There was fish with sesame oil on top of my chirashi donburi that was fantastic. I didn't expect sesame oil to pair so well.

3) The rice for the sushi sucks. It's bland, it lacks proper levels of acidity. It takes away from the deliciousness of the other ingredients.

Been going Sushi Roku for five years only one of its the best , freshest sushi in town also great service and friendly staff !! You won't be disappointed plus General manager and other managers are amazing to get along so please go there and see for your self! Cheers Roku!!

I'd give it 5 stars if it wasn't in a mall. Granted, a very very nice mall, but it takes away some of the allure for me.

That said.....the food is VERY good and I love the atmosphere inside. Tuna tartare spring rolls -- why didn't I think of that? The sushi was also very fresh and well-prepared....

Pricey? Yeah, but not outragous. We splurged on $125 bottle of champagne and got dessert and I think it came to $260 for two people.

I'm not sure if I loved it enough to go back on my next trip to Vegas, but it was definitely worth it for the first trip.

Fantastic sushi experience.  Ask for John, probably the best waiter on the Strip.  He recommended the perfect mix of sushi and sake to cure our hard fought Vegas hangovers.  Great atmosphere and a fantastic view.
This place is great. Definitely order the spicy hamachi appetizer. Sushi is some of the best I've had in a long time. Highly recommend.
Happy hour is the time to come here. Cheap drinks and dishes. Sushi is fresh and delicious! Appetizers are always on point.

Stared out with a lychee mojito. Sweet and strong...  If I wasn't tipsy I would have had a second!  The hot sake came out hot (not warm) and was nice and smooth...

Baked crab roll was like nothing I've ever tasted before. I was expecting a volcano/dynamite typical topping but the topping had a curry flavor.  Pleasant and refreshing surprise. 

Also had a fried spicy tuna roll-don't remember what the restaurant called it. It was really good. I LOVE fried rolls!!!!!  Delicious and came out warm.  Yummmmmm!

Uni nigiri was sweet and left me wanting more...

Banana flambe was ok. I was expecting something more like banana fosters...  It was more like a fruit medley...  

Restaurant is modern and decorated beautifully.  The view of the strip is gorgeous!  Really nice place to take your gf after you've spent all your winnings on her at the forum shops!!!  Hehehe!  =)

Overall, I was pleased with dinner minus the flambe. On my way out I read that they have happy hour from 4-6...

Went here when this place had their anniversary week and all food for dinner was 50% off. I walked by this place several times. Scoped out the menu but was too afraid to commit due to the price and my lack of success with Asian food let alone sushi in Scottsdale.  I'm from Seattle where grade A sushi is sold from grocery stores.

This place did not disappoint. Their wide selection of fresh fish is impressive along with their A5 wagyu beef. The New Zealand King salmon melted in your mouth as well as their thick slices of sashimi (yellow tail, tuna toro, snapper) gave you the perfect amount of balance of flavor on your tongue.  If you're not into raw fish, their japanese fried chicken is crispy and juicy-you really don't even need the aioli that comes with it.

I did also have their BBQ short ribs that were supposed to be Korean style. It wasn't bad but it was doused in a lot of sauce and a bit too salty for my liking. I typically like short ribs dried and grilled without being sauced.


Service was impeccable. Rene was very knowledgeable of the menu and did a great job describing the seafood items and the chefs preparation of each item. Having worked at upscale restaurants before, I'm truly impressed by this individual. 

Overall good place but probably a bit outside my price range for how much I normally eat on any given day. Great value during promotions such as their anniversary week.

Sushi Roku is the only place I will go to for sushi in AZ. Their food is excellent, service is consistently great from their wait staff, and their manager Dan always goes above and beyond for his customers. You won't be disappointed when you visit Sushi Roku at The W hotel!

This place was amazing!!!! I am getting married in August and was in Vegas for a Bachelorette party! We came here for dinner and were all blown away.  Sat at the bar in order to get the happy hour menu, and had Donald (donnie?) as our server.  He was amazing, attentive, and gave some great suggestions.  We ordered a ton of appetizers (the brussell  sprouts and shrimp with miso sauce were a few favorites) and each ordered some rolls (the Jalapeno shrimp roll was great).  All the food was great, someone at the bar bought us a drink (some kind of infused vodka with champagne) and Donnie arranged to have a desert brought out for me to congratulate me on my upcoming wedding, complete with a gorgeous firework sparkler thing in a champagne glass! Will be recommending this place to everyone and will be coming back every time I come back to Vegas! Thanks for the great food, ambiance, and of course, the customer service.  Amazing!

Food is really soso.  I came with a hope that the precious 'low stars' were just occasional.  The fish is fresh.  Chef is nice (I sat at bar).  But that is about it.  Service is soso.  Waiter never came back after taking initial order.  Splash the $18 (5oz) sake on his trade, and did not say any.

Ordered the assorted sushi.  Rice too dry, no moist.  Not enough vinegar tan in my humble opinion.    

Do not come with high hope.  Random sushi place in Japan would probably exceed this place.

PS.  Choose Nobu, similar price, much higher quality.  They're only open after 5pm.  Hence me being here sharing a friendly warning.

Excellent quality and selection of sushi, all fresh and prepared in a unique way.  I would recommend the the Omakase sashimi appetizer, as well as the grilled octopus.  The soft shell crab roll and the individual sushi that we ordered were also excellent.  The only reason I wouldn't give Sushi Roku 5 stars is I was charged for wine that I didn't order and sent back (and unfortunately didn't notice that night that it was on the bill) and the parking is $12 - albeit you get a $6 credit from the restaurant.

I was in Scottsdale on business and was able to stay thru the weekend.  On this past Saturday, already staying at the W Hotel, I decided to try out Sushi Roku located in the lobby.  My business partner and I were warmly greeted and chose to nestle in to a corner spot at the sushi bar.  We ended up in front of the Sous Chef Tony.  He recommended doing "omakase" and basically started flooding our plates with beautiful pieces of elegantly dressed fish from all over the world like golden eye snapper, live octopus and wagyu beef.  Our server Jonathan was attentive and recommended an awesome bottle of sake; the Gensai.  Even the manager, Dan stopped by to check on us and explain how sake was brewed and the grading processes.  We not only learned a ton but we enjoyed the experience as a whole from service to food to drink and even the ambiance.  Highly recommended and I hope to be in Scottsdale for business again soon simply for this establishment!!!
Will make this short and sweet. Been there twice and both times the food and service was fantastic. I can't say enough on how great the food is. A little pricey but in my opinion well worth it!!
One of the best dining experiences in a long time. The food was excellent but our server Sarah stole the show. She is extremely knowledgeable and very personable. Highly recommend!!!!

We decided on this sushi restaurant based upon other Yelper's reviews.  We were not disappointed.  There were many wonderful choices on the menu but my husband's love for Salmon, avocado and jalapenos was satisfied when the restaurant made him a "special" hand roll with soy wrapper and included these 3 items.  I have posted the picture.  Also try the albacore tuna tacos and the Spicy Rock Shrimp with asparagus cut roll.  Our waiter Khang, originally from Hawaii, was exceptional.  We had a wonderful view of the strip from our table and we couldn't have had a better time.

As a sushi lover, I had high expectation for sushi roku, but after my dinner experience here I really think this restaurant is totally overrated. We had blue fin o toro and makuro, the fish was pretty fresh, however not surprisingly good. Despite the size of sushi being too small, the major problem this restaurant had was that the sushi rice was not good. The portion of rice and sticky rice was off, so the sushi rice was not tiny sour-ish nor sticky enough. The decoration of the restaurant was really nice but I don't think I will visit again.

I really enjoyed our meal at Sushi Roku.  We were fortunate enough to make it for the 5 year anniversary and everything on the menu was 50% off, except for drinks!  It was an awesome deal and we took advantage of it.  During this Vegas weekend, I went to Sushi Roku, Okada, and Sushisamba....Sushi Roku was my favorite. The sushi rolls were awesome...I ordered all of the rolls my waiter recommended and the most expensive ones too.....heck it was 50% off!  They were all good, however, I wasn't a big fan of the lobster roll.  

We did encounter some problems with service, however.  It seemed our waiter disappeared on us.  We ordered another round of drinks and it never showed up.  We asked another waiter to check on our drinks and she said it was coming soon...but still no drinks appeared.  We asked yet another waiter to find out about our drinks...finally the manager came and apologized and offered our round of drinks for free.  Since our round of drinks was offered for free,  we still enjoyed our time at Sushi Roku.

The food was awesome, drinks were great, ambiance was cool, but service is a little lacking. Okada had better service but I didn't think food was as good and I would prefer to go back to Sushi Roku next time I'm in Vegas.

Awesome happy hour menu!! This is definitely my go-to Japanese restaurant in Vegas. My sisters and I enjoyed delicious authentic Japanese food -  chicken stuffed shishito, mushroom tempura, salmon and avocado sushi roll etc... The staff were all friendly and professional and the manager was very hospitable and accommodating. I can't wait to come back next month - this time, dinner with friends. I highly recommend Sushi Roku.

I don't eat seafood. I have no business reviewing this place, right? Well, my boyfriend had a craving for sushi while we were passing through on a cross country road trip. So we stopped in Phoenix for the evening and this spot came with highest recommendations. Panko encrusted salmon for him and veggie rolls for me. I barely saw the plate set down before the salmon was devoured. The veggie roll however...man, did they put some spin on a pretty basic dish. I'm never wowed by sushi restaurants simply because I never order anything wow-able. They sure proved me wrong. Totally filling, deliciously flavorful and made exactly to my particular orders (not too big, rice paper, no seaweed, etc. etc.). We had the pesto tomato mozzarella salad and chicken satay (both specials) as well and while they were devoured pretty quickly they just don't stick out in my mind like those veggie rolls. A pretty innocuous dish that most would likely never seek out but if you have a finicky friend on the fence about joining you for a night at Sushi Roku, they cannot go wrong with this order.
This place never disappoints - food is always amazing, service rocks, and the view of the strip kills! Make sure you yell at the sushi chefs when you enter.

It is the terrible Japanese Restaurant I have had been in my life.
I was order one fry rice, but the fry rice about triple salty could not eat at all.
I asked them to give me a bow of rice to mix with it, but they charged me extra fee for the rice.
I could pay for it, but they were not even try to make another fry rice for me, but charged me the extra fee to make me feel very bad service.
I will never go there any more in the future....

First time at Sushi Roku was for a Valentine's Day dinner. Had reservations for 8:30pm arrived 15 minutes early. As I walked in, the atmosphere seemed alright but man the hostess did not know how to greet or check people in. Waited about 10 minutes and not a single effort was taken to greet us nor did she ask if we had reservations. Took a little longer to be seated and the lighting inside was too dark which didn't do well with the tiny little print on the menu. Only highlight of the night was the sushi. The sushi was absolutely delicious. The appetizer did come out after our sushi but still overall the food was delicious and well displayed. Long story story food was delicious but service could have been better.

I went here even though I can't eat ra fish. I was very happy that my server, Jon, guided me through the menu and suggested dishes that I could eat. His knowledge and service were both memorable and made my experience amazing. Will definitely be coming back as long as Jon is there.

I thought this place was overpriced and the service was definitely lacking.  I have a food allergy to avocado and they treated me like a leper.  One of the items on the lunch sushi special was a california roll, which without avocado is a simulated crab roll since they apparently don't have cucumber on them here?  Anyway, it was my birthday and we paid more than $40 for lunch here...I felt like I wasted my money though they did give me a cool sparkler and sing happy birthday with a cool dessert...that was the only thing that got them up to two stars.

Perfect location, great atmosphere, outstanding selection, stellar service. Each of the zillion items we ordered, was so good; and given all of the above, we did not at all feel it was overpriced. Will recommend and will return.

Yellowtail, Atmosphere, and Dan the manager from NYC is the reason for the 5-star review. Heard we were in town from New York and he came over and introduced himself.  Thank you for personalizing our visit.

WOW! I have heard about this place for a really long time and my wife and I finally decided to try it. All of the food we had was amazing, the best part about our meal was the impeccable service. Our server John was super helpful with walking us through the menu and even recommended a great bottle of wine to go with our meal. The only complaint I have about Johns service is my wife thought he was really cute! We will be back!

Ah, Vegas.  It's hard to find a good meal that isn't thousands of dollars.  Sushi Roku was probably our best meal on my latest trip.  The sushi selection is relatively small compared to other cities, but I guess you'd expect that in the middle of a desert?  I don't know...  But I went with the japanese short ribs appetizer for my meal because we didn't expect to eat a full meal.  It was so good I asked for a side of rice to soak up every bit of the juice/sauce that it was with.  The rolls my dining parter had were good, too.

The service was OK - not incredibly attentive but not bad either.  I imagine on a busy night (there were only a few people at the time) it could get slow.

I love sushi!  I am also picky about my sushi.  Sushi Roku does it beautifully.  The fish was melt in your mouth delicious and the service attentive and helpful.  We had the katana roll - great mix of fish and you could add/remove as much of the spicy mixture as you like, a salmon sashimi special with yuzu foam - nice balance of flavor although slivered radish was a little strong for the delicate fish, a couple of hand rolls - the California had sweet mild Alaskan crab and the eel sauce on the unagi  was top notch. I love uni, and this met my expectations of fresh sea goodness.  The dessert of banana flambé was a huge wonderful surprise.  I am not a dessert person, but my nephew was there and he ordered this dish.  I had two bites before he finished it and OMG!  No flames at the table, but his spoon was on fire as he dug in!  Go here instead of Nobu when in Vegas if interested in creative sushi.

This place is located in the Forum Shops at Caesar's Palace.  The closest entry point from outside the hotel is via the valet parking (actually free, but tip req'd) at the forum shops.  We got there earlier than our reservation (a Sunday) and they were able to accomodate us.  We got a table w/ a great view of the strip looking southbound.  Very sleek, modern interior, dark, loud modern music.  We ordered: eggplant app (yummy), pork korubata (good but fatty and not for sharing), seaweed salad, kobe beef and scallop app (beef was too chewy), california roll, unagi avocado roll, and the chicken entree (a bit dry).  The rolls were alright, nothing elaborate for their pricepoint, perhaps the nigiri/sashimi would have been better?  They had a nice assortment of small plates that we should have stuck with.

Wow. Where do I begin? For a place so chic and modern, you'd think you'd be getting a pretty good meal. 

Restaurants should NOT be comping you or sending you food because they can't deliver what you actually ordered in time. Plus, I don't want your shitty stir fry shrimp that tastes like it's from Panda Express because you're service is so slow. The lunch special sashimi with chicken and salad is a joke. The chicken was overcooked, and the salad was pathetic. I really wanted to be a bitch and send it back, but I always thought I'd just suck it up and never come back. I really worry that they think they food they're putting out is acceptable. The sashimi salad was alright, but the portion was ridiculously small. I tasted the rest of the sushi that the rest of the party had, and it was mediocre at best. 

Come here if you're a "gringo" and don't care and just want some California rolls and a good view. Don't come here if you're expecting quality sushi and service for the price you're paying. Seriously disappointed!

Food was decent but pricy. Expected bento boxes to come with miso soup but it was extra. Sushi was very fresh but very small portions. Based on previous reviews expected a higher quality product. Would give another chance based on the great location, but there is better sushi in Vegas.

If you want to splurge, you certainly can here. The sushi was very good, but honestly not better than I've had in MUCH less expensive sushi joints. Our waiter was totally put out that we shared an appetizer and two rolls, instead of going with his suggestions. We just wanted something light! 
The rolls were good, the fish superb and fresh, but nothing to blow you away. We won't go back, not because of the price, it just wasn't at all memorable.

Short version: The food is good, but it is overpriced.  The profile should have 4 dollar signs.

I expected to be blown away by $25 rolls, but they didn't taste any better than rolls you can find at any local sushi joint in SoCal.  I didn't have anything that was worth more than $15.  If you don't each much sushi or sashimi then perhaps you will have your expectations exceeded.  I will not go there again.

Green Tea ice cream for $10, Sake sampler was $20.  Neither of them were any different than you will find anywhere else.

My friends and I had all purchased tickets for the W's New Year's Eve party and were really excited to have some sushi at the swanky sushi roku beforehand. Our server was amazing and we had a great night but sure enough two days after we have all be vomiting consistently. Although we cannot be positive our illnesses came from the restaurant we do know that we have not all shared a common meal at anywhere other than this restaurant. Will definitely not be returning. Very disappointed in what I had expected to be a top of the line sushi restaurant.
I was underwhelmed by very average sushi. The rolls were smaller than the norm and overpriced for being such. You are paying for the lounge ambiance with an uncharismatic wait staff.

Loved this place! I went alone and was seated immediately. The waiter was super friendly and attentive. Not a good selection of veggie rolls but they were willing to accommodate! I opted for the Garden Roll and Miso Soup. It arrived almost immediately! The Garden Roll was $12 and came with six huge pieces. My only gripes are that they're too big to fit in your mouth AND the end pieces have huge pieces of Asian sprouts that there's no way you can eat them without taking them apart. (Which I did. Because they were delicious.) Overall very attentive staff and good food.

One of my fave stops whenever I'm in Vegas! Happy hour is the best! Yummy appetizers, and good drink prices & of course Saki! Nick our bartender was fun and friendly, he made our dining experience a cool one! Can't wait to come back!
Vegas pricing.  To be expected.  I can't get over a certain expectation of quality when sushi reaches a certain cost per roll.  The ambiance is fantastic and the service was outstanding.

I love coming here. Not only do they have great ambiance and yummy food, but the service is great and that's what brings me back. Staff is always courteous and accommodating. The first time I decided to check this place out, I called in and talked to a woman named Julianna. She was so sweet and very inviting, offering to give me directions to the spot. When I came in, she greeted me and remembered me from our conversation on the phone. She also gave me DELICIOUS recommendations from the menu such as the rib-eye wrapped asparagus. I had a lot of questions about the menu and she had an answer for every one of them which impressed me. Julianna alone made my visit so great that I decided to keep coming back. She's my go-to gal at Sushi Roku and has even helped me coordinate a dinner for my friends and family. I love Sushi Roku!

I have found you, best miso soup of my life (Country Miso Soup). If only we had more time to enjoy Sushi Roku! We ate here for a birthday dinner before a show but were unfortunately rushed to get to the show on time. The interior design is very zen and chic. We had a table with a view of the strip from Caesar's forum shops which was top notch. Our waitress Shaina was awesome, enthusiastic and helped us with back road directions to get to our show on time! I was under the weather so only had the soup and veggie tempura but as previously mentioned, this soup rocked. I didn't sample the sushi choices at the table but only heard good things. Our food was bit delayed coming out considering it was sushi, but upon investigation, Shaina found out the chefs were making the miso from scratch! The country miso had filet mignon to make the broth a bit heartier, hence the extra time apparently. Well worth the wait and they comped us a salmon carpaccio starter. Drinks were also tasty! I'd love to go back!
The Uni was delicious! The service  supper and the experience I can't explain. I will recommend this play to any one. My last time there was many years ago and still the quality isA+ outstanding!

first spot me and my gf decided to go when we arrived in vegas.  i was really dressed down, as a matter of fact the only person in the place dressed down.  But still, did the hostess have to look at me like i was a scrub?  cmon, you're a hostess in vegas, probably hoping some rich guy knocks you up.  anyways, the place was crackin, like most spots in vegas.  very nice, upscale place.  the food was great, the best salmon sashimi ive ever had.  i couldnt stop thinking about it 2 days later.  they set a new standard for myself when it comes to salmon.  id also reccomend the baked lobster.  prices are really steep, so if your taking someone here, i hope you get some action afterwards.  minus the snobby hostess, and i would have gave this place 5 stars.

First, I'll start out by saying I'm a big sushi fan and have made it that I have to try a new sushi spot each trip.  This time around my friend and I picked Sushi Roku for lunch on Christmas day.  Sushi Roku is located in the Forum Shops at Caesars Palace third level right next to BOA Steakhouse.  We had reservations and once we got there was seated right away and the place is beautiful.  The decor was very nice which gave this place a great atmosphere.  The view was looking right down the strip which was very nice.  They get an A+ for the design and setup for this place.  The staff there was very friendly and helpful.  By no means the best service I've had but water and drinks were always filled.  Answered any questions we had when we asked.  First thing to know we had the Yellowtail at Social house at TI and have been looking for anything anywhere as good as there.  Nothing has lived up to it yet.  We started off with the Mixed Seafood & Vegetable Tempura and it was pretty good.  I've never had Tempura before so I can't compare to anything else.   Got the Yellowtail and I was very disappointed it just lacked much flavor and was not impressed.  I also ordered the Spicy tuna cut and this was some of the best Spicy tuna I've had.  Little Buddha was the best before I went to Sushi Roku.  The Spicy tuna was so fresh and just melted in your mouth.  Overall I would go back if I run out of sushi spots but still have Koi, Yellowtail, and Wazuzu to try in the near future.  The prices at Sushi Roku are on the high side and in my opinion not worth it per say.  For just the 2 pieces of Yellowtail and Spicy tuna it was 18.32 plus another 13.00 to split the tempura with my friend.  Overall a good spot to go but not the best sushi in Vegas.
Pricey but it's Vegas! The sushi was awesome, the waiter was very knowledge and had a wonderful experience.

Had dinner with five friends here a few days ago.  We're from Boston and trust me when I say we have good sushi.

This restaurant's strength is the ambiance.  The view of The Strip from the main window is great, and the decor is competitive with the best of them.  Music is new agey/lounge, but I know a lot about this genre and it could be a lot better.

The food was fairly good taste-wise when compared to other sushi restaurants in its price range.  However, it is more than a little overpriced considering the portion size.  You are literally getting mere morsels for $35-40.  When the waiter brought me my "main dish" it was something that looked size-wise like leftovers from someone else's meal.

Our total bill was in the $350 range and absolutely nobody had enough food.  In terms of taste, two out of six dishes failed to impress, one was mediocre, and three were good (including mine).

Overall, probably would not recommend.

This place is the Best I have been too In a while. The seaweed salad was a hearty size and tasty. The Octopus special was to die for and I like the sashimi large slices. I might go back tonight so good and the sushi chefs very attentive.
Never before have I had such amazing sushi and incredible service! We will be back! I would say the only thing we didn't like was the music.

Fresh, fresh, fresh seafood!!!!!!!! My hubby and I are huge raw food eaters and every time we come to LV we always go to Roku! Service sometimes could be better, especially during the day when there are not too many people are dining but overall delish food is what we love! Sashimi is a must to try when you go there and I would skip the soy sauce all together to taste the true flavors! They have a great choice of saki too - skip the usual warm cheap stuff and go for exotic cold real deal saki.

Alex provided an exceptional service. he accommodated our group and made us feel welcome. I will highly recommend my friends and family to come see Alex specifically in the bar. I will be coming back specifically to see Alex W every time I'm in the area #liveyourbestlife

Bug infested 

Sat at the sushi bar and all of the sudden 4 or 5 small bugs appeared all over the bar.  

Manager politely offer an apology but I was surprised to know that this is a known problem to them.   He explained that they been spraying 2 times a week but still have the problem.   They should shut the place down until problem is taken care of.

Several people from my conference raved about the food so I squeezed in a quick lunch this afternoon. Sat at sushi bar... Restaurant is really nice looking. Sushi chefs were very friendly. I got tuna and salmon sashimi and they were happy to explain the different types. The fish had very nice texture. The tuna was a little small, the salmon was perfectly sized and absolutely delicious. I also had a custom-made role since none of their specialty rolls included tuna. I think there were probably 10 pieces so a good size. All in all excellent but I walked out with a $70 bill eating by myself. Not complaining. Just sayin.

For what it cost, Sushi Roku was just okay.  Lunch for three of us ran nearly $250 (with no alcohol).  We ordered the mixed tempura, three of the signature rolls and three of the sashimi choices.  With just one sashimi selection costing nearly $40 and signature rolls hovering at $30 each, it didn't take long to run up the tab.

The sushi rolls fell apart way too easily.  The rice didn't have the right texture and there's no excuse for that at these prices.  The service was also spotty.  Again, not cool at these prices.

The decor is fine, but I am sure this place benefits from candlelight.  It was a bit dark and spare in the afternoon for lunch.  It also smelled like fish.  A sushi place that is this spendy shouldn't smell like fish.

Frankly, I think you can get better sushi for the money in Vegas.

I wish i could remember the bartender's name because he was awesome! Had great drink and dessert recommendations! Happy hour is a great deal - smaller portions, but still plenty of food! The chocolate filled mini donuts were great! Also the filet wrapped asparagus and garlic ponzu albacore were both amazing apps!

This is hands down my favorite sushi place in Vegas.  The quality of the seafood is top notch.  The tuna is melt in your mouth amazing.  Great place to try out a lot of different dishes.

Lots of gluten free options to choose from as well.  

The service is fantastic, and restaurant is located in Ceasar Forum and its relatively easy to get to.

Sushi Roku served an amazing lunch. The sushi chefs take great pride in what they serve. One of the preferred specialty rolls is the Baked Lobster. I also love roku because they offer Japanese A5 Wagyu in gyozas. A must try appetizer. The filet mignon skewers are also delicious.

A great place to make you feel like you're NOT in Vegas, and what a view from the dining room!  Although dinner can get expensive, it's worth it every once in a while; what's even better is the Happy Hour at the bar- delicious rolls and small appetizers for cheap; it's calm and the bartenders and waitstaff are friendly but not too talky, which is great.  Went there almost every day for two weeks straight on a business trip- totally worth it.
Loved this place! Such a neat location, overlooking the strip, and very kind servers/hostesses. The sushi was delicious and I would love to come back!
If there is one place to eat in Las Vegas, it's Sushi Roku. It has great sushi and other items are available if you are not a Sushi person...

We ate here for lunch our first day in Vegas. We both ordered sushi rolls (can't remember which ones). No draft beer and the sushi was just okay!  View of the strip and decent decor but not a great atmosphere. Probably won't go back!

Environment slightly dark, very high class feel. The food was extremely expensive, so I was expecting some high quality food. Ordered some sushi, sashimi, maki rolls, and the salmon with scallops entree. I have to say, I was very dissapointed. The food was good, but no more than average, absolutely not worth te ridiculous prices. I've had WAY better, cheaper, elsewhere. But it's Vegas, so what do you expect? =p I would not go back here for the food because I could get the same quality other places, for AT LEAST half te price.  Total came to around $150+. only reason to go is environment, or if you want to spend a lot of money.

We consistently have great service, food and quality every time we visit. We have dinner here at the very least twice a year during our Vegas trips and recommend our sushi loving friends to head over there too when they are in Vegas. I am sure there are other places to go for sushi in Vegas but the location (in Caesar's Forum Shops and there is valet, right off of Las Vegas Blvd., so no mixing with all the other LVB traffic, cabs and hoypoloy!) Our latest visit was much of the same, great service, sushi and quality. They had a private event that took up most of the dining room, but opened up more seating and were able to seat our party of 4, maybe 15 minutes later but it was prime time dinner hour 7:30 pm and there is a Peter Lik gallery across the way so the wait was nominal. 

We ordered our staple crab miso, rolls and sushi. The wait staff was attentive and quick to fill waters, change plates and check on us. 

We had a great meal!
Best Service and Sushi on the strip. And a great view from there dinging room!

sorry but worst japanese food ever. 
I've eaten Japanese food so much
I could not even taste the food was delicious Japanese nor Chinese food.

Fortunately, the service good to give a star

Location, Location, Location... the view from this Caesar's Forum Shop's Eatery is amazing.  I'm sure the sushi is fabulous (didn't personally order any) but the Ingen Chinese Style Green Beans and Garlic Sauce and their Chicken Kara-age served with a Cilantro Mayo Dipping Sauce was the sh%#!!!  Pair that with a Cucumber Infused Martini on the rocks... you will be on Cloud 9.

Perfect ambiance, ultra delicious portions, great service, on the expensive side, but totally worth it to whom who can afford and is interested in a higher end experience. (specially on the Vegas Strip!)

Ambiance is great, but food and service is terrible. 

This restaurant is in the W, which is befitting since both are extremely trendy, modern, and classy. However, the service was extremely slow even though the restaurant was not crowded; instead, the waiters were busy flirting with the girls at the hostess stand. I was going to order more food, but got put off at having to wait over 10 minutes to get the waiter's attention.

This place is also extremely over priced. The fish inside the rolls were mushy - this just means that they take the leftover fish cuttings from the sashimi and mash it up to fill the rolls (you can see it in many of the pictures other reviewers have posted). At ~$10 a roll, I would expect much more. The Brussels sprout chips were very tasty and flavorful with the truffle oil addition, however they are deep fried and DRENCHED in oil (not truffle oil). The chef ought to let the oil drain off before serving as the sprouts were sitting in a pool of oil.

I'm IMPRESSED!  The view from this Sushi Roku is definitely amazing!  We squeezed our sushi run between a rough gambling sesh and a Boys II Men concert, giving us literally 45 minutes to get in and out of Sushi Roku.  Went with some heavy hitters so they were definitely 100% accommodating for us.  I dont think what we did would have flown well with the staff there... if it wasnt for the heavy hitters!

The service was impeccable and the meal was outstanding.  I cant get over the shiseido peppers.  I dont think I'll ever get tired of this dish!

Here's the one thing that throws me off -- this place is a million times better than nobu.  Why does nobu have its own... tower at Cesar's palace?  I dont get it!  We need a Roku Tower at the Bellagio!

I'd come back here in a heart beat.

Let me just cut to the chase... I wasn't impressed...

The restaurant is beautiful, but oh so noisy!  It's like trying to eat on the center divider of the 405 during rush hour.

The food was very hit or miss.. The Lychee martini was nasty, but the Lychee mojito was very good.

The shrimp dim sum appetizer was very good, but the sushi was very mediocre.  It made Todai seem delicious.

Service was VERY substandard.  Everything we ordered came out in the first 15-20 minutes instead of being properly paced throughout the evening.. and then we waited forever to find someone to bring the check.

And for the prices (almost $100 per person with tip), I'd expect everything to be perfect.

I don't see any reason to ever go here again.  Next time I'm in vegas I'll be trying one of the many other sushi restaurants in town and I suggest you do the same.

The sushi was good (not great), so the fourth star is due to the ambiance and service.  It has a trendy feel while still being somewhat casual.  The elevated booth seating is fantastic and affords you a view of the strip.  

I recommend the Far East Mule if you're in the mood for a cocktail. I'm not normally a gin drinker and am definitely not a fan of sweet drinks, but this cocktail is smooth and delicious.  One or three will help make the night.

I've been dining here frequently for the last year and every experience has been great!!  If you're lucky enough to have Brian or CJ wait on you you're in for a treat!!  All of their recommendations were outstanding.  It is a perfect destination to take that special someone!!

Our second time here was good, not great, not special. We won't go back for a full meal, just late night snack. 
Love the decor and the upscale modern feel. It's a great place for a date. We like to walk through the W Hotel entrance to enjoy the lounge scene. Another plus is going to the W pool deck to hang out and schmooze post sake
The food was expensive and good. To drop a couple of big bills and not be wowed is criminal. We had some winner dishes and the only real loser was some kind of steak skewer. 
Our server kept pointing us to the specials. We like to sit at the bar and watch the artistry of the food being prepared. We tried a number of times to encourage the chef to be creative with a particular item ie, sea eel to no avail. It was right off the "special" menu and very tasty but not an eye roller. Guess these specials are tried and true throughout the entire chain of sushi restaurants this group owns. Perhaps therein lies the problem, the CHAIN effect... cookie cutter sushi; good and satisfying, but not memorable.

Our new favorite sushi place in Vegas. Food is absolutely delicious. Not many sushi rolls to choose from but a lot of unique items and uniquely tasty combinations. Dimly lit, not overly loud suits for a client dinner or a date night. Fantastic views straight down the strip. 
Highly recommend.

I can't believe I saw so many good reviews about this place.  The sushi was not fresh, the chef's special was downright disgusting and the prices were shockingly high.   Cost $47 for 5 pieces of sushi and miso soup - couldn't eat the rest on my plate - it was simply gross.

First night in Vegas and we were looking for something light to eat before hitting up the club.  Nobu was booked, so we decided to try Sushi Roku.  Reservations weren't hard to get and I had heard good things so it was a go.

We decided to order a bunch of appetizers and small plates to share for four guys.  One could't eat meat due to lent and I couldn't have carbs. Even with those restrictions we were successful in getting some tasty dishes.  

The Truffle Edamame was really tasteful, but you can't really go wrong when its sprinkled with truffle oil, yum!  Shishito peppers were okay, I've had better (at Nobu, haha).  

Yellowtail Diced Chilies were really fresh and tasty.  I good balance of flavors with a not too tangy sauce to compliment the delicate yellowtail flavore.

The highlight of the show was teh Chilean Seabass Truffle Miso Glaze!  Delicious.  I have never met a Miso Glaze I did not like, but add truffle to it, and I was in heaven.  Went perfect with the smooth like butter seabass (i kinda wish the black cod had the truffle miso glaze, but it was only described as Sweet Miso, so I passed).  

Other items we got were the Uni Tartlette (couldn't eat the pastry so just at the inside. Small, and flavor no so Uni-ish.  The sweet shrimp (Amaebi) was really fresh and the fried shrimp heads with it were the perfect compliment, Fresh and Fried.  

We also got rolls, but i didn't partake because of the rice.

All in all, Sushi Roku is pretty good.  Flavors really stood and were well balanced.  Service was excellent as to be expected.  Price was a bit on the high end for what it was but that's normal for Vegas.

I would come back (unless I have a reservation for Nobu).

Not what one would expect for a Scottsdale restaurant. We had a large party (15) and made reservations far in advance. The staff was ill prepared to wait on a group of this size. Although we all arrived together, our entrees were all brought out at different times and two people never got their main entree. A few of us had the fried rice and it was very greasy and made one person sick to her stomach. We complained to the manager who comped us a bottle of champagne upstairs at Shade Lounge and also brought out some special desserts. Overall very disappointing and not worth the expense.
Delicious, delectable but pricey sushi with a great view of the strip.   Highlight: hand rolls - Eel Avocado and popcorn shrimp washed down with an Asahi draft

The wait was a little long, but that's because I put in a special request for a booth. Since it was going to be longer, we request the first available. They created an adhoc table out in the front to accommodate which was unusual but great for last minute.  The food was excellent. Very tasty and even though the waitress said that kitchen was behind, came out in perfect tempo. The miso cod was exquisite, not new but cooked excellent. Loved the brussell sprouts and the sashimi was very fresh. Great evening spent.

Not happy. Staying at The Sanctuary and  called for delivery. Ordered $85 worth of food and received enough for 1 person. Called and was told "we have the best sushi in town". VERY overpriced and poor customer service.

Rob is the BEST!! 
Makes you feel at home. I never wanted to leave!
Was my first birthday meal here in Scottsdale....  UNBELIEVABLE fresh fish!! 
SO fucking delicious!!!!
This is my place now!!!!

I love it !!!
The spicy tuna on crispy rice is yami yami
The service is fast and welcome

Great sushi, but expensive!! Then again unless you're buying a hot dog for dinner, EVERYTHING in Vegas is expensive!! We loved our meal. We had salad, one cocktail, 1 spicy tuna roll and a bento box...are you ready? $100!! Yes. But worth every penny. Every dish was flavorful!! Worth it!!

There are many things words to describe perfection.  In this case hands down amazing service from front door to the the AGM and GM.  This place will always treat you like a king and Queen. 5 out of 5  and everything above.  Thank you Gary and Sushi Roku for making our night even better than the last time..

Wow, is all I can say, the priced are phenomenal cheap for happy hour, the well drinks,  only $5, for drinks that usually cost $15, the portions are small but to taste all the food it's delicious, we ordered the fried calamari,   delicious and lightly fried,  we ordered the popcorn shrimp,  first time they were not lightly fried as well...really yummy, but the best food was the mini doughnuts to die for, for only$3, tasted like Mochi, balls...will definitely be back here.
Awesome i an extremely picky on sushi ant Roku is top notch. Service was great and manager made sure we were taken care of.

I don't often give 5 stars, but Sushi Roku earned it tonight.  Delicious sushi in a very upscale setting. 

The Katana roll was very tasty,  expertly prepared and quick to my sushi bar seat. Perhaps marginally overpriced at $19.50, but includes three W hotel premium.  

Kimchee cucumber sunomono also very good,  although came out well after sushi.  But,  I'd rather have sushi out quickly so not too concerned.  

Pleasant desert choices from chocolate volcano cake to michi, to s'mores.  The frozen lemon souffle was delicious.  

 Esteban's service was attentive and engaging.  He definitely looks out for the customers and to provide a nice dining experience.  

Well done tonight.

My friend and I are visitors from California. I simply wanted sushi so I searched for sushi restaurants near our hotel and decided to check out this place cause the star rating wasn't bad and reviews were decent compared to other sushi places.

This place is fancyyy. It's connected to the W hotel and has a lounge as well. We went on a Friday night and the wait was 40 mins or so for an actual table. We went for the bar.

The staff at the bar were very helpful and knew they were behind due to the amount of customers, but were trying their best to get all the orders out as fast as possible. Their edamame had salt sprinked on it; I didn't mind cause it was something new. I tried some rolls here and they were good. Nothing exceptional.

I did try some fresh sushi for the first time (I usually just get rolls) and those were exceptional. My first time trying Toro and it was a great experience. It was so fresh and soft. Yellowtail was good as well. The Popcorn Shrimp Tempura was delicious. Warm, flavorful, and the gaze on it was just right.

Those who had a birthday received a special treat. There's a SURPRISE on that dessert! :)
Elegant restaurant within the Caesar's Palace complex. The yellowtail diced chili appetizer was recommended by our waiter and was excellent. I also recommend the makoto roll - delicious!

We had the tasting menu with a party of six. Paid about 250$ each person. Food was as good as what you can expect for the price segment so no complaint even though I've eaten much better for half the price.

However the service was terrible to the point where I complained and got pretty annoyed. 1. They switched the waiter for our table during our stay. Pretty much a no-go. 2. And that's much worse is they started bringing the next course to the table when some of us haven't even started the previous course so food stacked up on our table and we felt rushed.
Rushed service. Poor quality sushi and really mediocre food. One of the worst restaurant experiences that I ever had in Las Vegas and I go there at least three times a year..

I went back to Sushi Roku for another bachelorette party and it was a complete 180 from my last review. They're having a great summer Happy Hour (even on weekends!) and we decided to be decadent and order one of everything. The sushi tasted fresh, the vegetable dishes - green beans, roasted eggplant - were flavorful and well cooked, and all of the meat dishes were great too. The cocktails were much better this time around, and cheaper, thanks to Happy Hour :) 

Our server was very friendly and fun, and even brought a complimentary round of champagne at the end of our meal to celebrate the bachelorette party. Sushi Roku totally won me over this time, I'm glad I gave it another shot.

J was dizzy from low blood sugar when we walked in. I was still stuffed from breakfast but I figured I'd have a nosh. She ordered a cornucopia of sushi (salmon, toro, one handroll with tempura shrimp and asparagus) that she devoured and was highly pleased with. I had the 'new' chicken salad and some mixed tempura (veg and seafood). Both were good but I really liked the chicken salad. The dressing is that sweet miso-y dressing you can some times get at some Japanese restaurants. 
   The service was really wonderful. Our waiter was highly attentive to our needs and my water glass wasn't allowed to be less than half full. We appreciated it.
   The price was pretty high for a couple of women on limited budgets. My salad was $16 and the tempura was $12. I have no idea how much J's platter o'sushi was but it wasn't for the faint of heart. But you are paying for quality, not quantity.

Great service!  Super clean and neat. Fast service! 
Delicious bar. The bartender was amazing. I got tipsy off one cocktail lol I'm not even a lightweight. 
Went here for my 21st bday and wedding reception. So amazing. Wonderful service. Wonderful people. Beautifully designed Asian fusion theme and soft music. Very relaxing time.  I will definitely be coming back another night. 
Excellent food! Everything was fresh and delicious. I expected to pay At least 1000. Bill was half that, plus tip. Got a hookup on champagne for my wedding :) 
So great! 
I guess the only thing people should know is portions are very tiny. Good for me cuz im teeny but not the hubby lol
For men you might end up hitting up a burger joint after but for the ladies it's perfect! I would definitely go again and again!

Came in to the restaurant, seated, and given a wine list. No one came after that to take care of my order or even asked for my drink order. I was there for a bussiness trip but I was alone since my colleague left the day before. 15 minutes went by, NO ONE served me water or even asked me my order, not even gave me a dinner menu (I had to ask myself, even so, no one took care of my order, even after I tried to catch their attention).  A group of 4 people came in. A waiter IMMEDIATELY asked for their drink order!!! Is one person bussiness not as important as 4 people? Is this how you treat your customer? My night was ruined and I was disappointed! I told the ladies at the front desk about it and they said "really?" as if they did not believe me. I left the restaurant because I felt that I was treated unfair and that my business was not important. Who wants to eat their food after that? I work for a large coorporate company and I don't recommend your restaurant at all to my colleagues, an yes, we do a lot of of business in Vegas!

Have been to Sushi Roku a couple times.. Both times the Food was GREAT the Staff Was Great... For years I have just driven by, now that I know this is an awesome establishment, I will absolutely be stopping by more often.  If you have never been, you need to check this one out.  For Real!

Came here with my fellow Yelper Miss Lisa E, and very much enjoyed this upscale, fun, trendy restaurant.  Located within the W Hotel, makes a great spot for happy hour with friends, or a date night. The way the food is prepared, makes typically "scary" sushi a lot less intimidating for sushi rookies like me who don't typically eat things like octopus, eel, etc.  Everything I tried was quite delicious. I would suggest the fillet wrapped asparagus, and pretty much any of the rolls. The service was impeccable, its almost as if they knew we Yelpers, but seems like they are just that good! Looking forward to coming back.

We stopped here for lunch while shopping in the Forum Shops at Caesar's Palace.  

We ordered sushi: salmon, tuna, albacore, unagi, spanish mackerel, kanpachi, yellowtail and special rolls: rock shrimp tempura with jalapeno, spicy scallop roll and a Katana roll.  Honestly, there was really nothing that blew me away.  The menu items all sounded awesome but when it arrived to the table I was quite disappointed.  The portions and cuts of sushi were smaller than I'm used to and the quality of the fish was fair.  

Don't get me wrong, the restaurant is beautiful and the service is impeccable.  But it you are dropping $150+ for lunch, you should expect the food to be way better.  

I should offer up another star for our waiter.  I burned my hand on my flat iron that morning and he let me use their burn spray from the kitchen.  That was nice of him to do.  Thanks!
My new favorite Sushi spot both in LA and in Vegas... Apparently you can get awesome Sushi ,reasonably priced in Las Vegas ,oh and great service !!

Great place for sushi and ramen on the strip. You can shop at the Forum and then do dinner. The food is excellent and the atmosphere is hip and clean.

Now considering it is on the Strip, there are tourists who can act like tourists. We saw a group yelling "saki bomb" and then made a mess, which the servers had to clean. I was embarrassed for them. I understand it is the Strip and would not hold it against this place. 

For us, the servers were friendly and helpful. One friend who does not do sushi, enjoyed other their tempura. This place has something for everyone.

Delicious!  There's one in LA that we used to go to, and the AZ one is just as good even though we're landlocked here!  Must gets are the:
  -Spicy tuna on crispy rice
  -Marinated Cod
  -Baked crab hand roll in soy paper

We arrived a little before they opened at noon and sat outside the restaurant, inside the mall, for a bit. We were signaled when it was officially open. The waiter took our drink order and asked if we wanted to order edamame while we looked at the menu- loved that! I always forget.
We got salmon and tuna sashimi and two tolls. The shrimp roll with salmon and the eel. Despite dining in a dessert, the sushi was fresh and delicious. 
Tables along the wall gave one person a view outside of the strip. 
It was conveniently located in the Forum shops. I would come here again.

Stopped here for happy hour - I was a bit disappointed that we weren't allowed to sit near the windows with the views, but I get it. We sat at the bar, and the bartender was very nice and helpful! Drinks and sushi were really good! You gotta love those happy hour prices, too! It was a very relaxed atmosphere, and I'd love to come here again for actual dinner sometime!
This place are boom I just love everything here the sushi are amazing will come back sure
Great Food with Great Price point especially during Happy Hours. But all their food are delicious, fresh and nicely presented. A must try when in the neighborhood.

It was busy here, but there were plenty of tables and only two of us. They sat us at the worst table for two located by the kitchen. Luckily, my husband spoke up and asked to sit near a window so we could enjoy the view. There were several vacant tables for two. Yes, we moved. We kept an eye on that original table; no one sat there while we were here. Hmmm...

I ordered the Katana ramen. I enjoyed it. The broth was smooth and milky. It had enough goodies inside although a little bit more pork would have made it better. To tell the truth I wanted ramen and this place was the closest. Another note, I'm a light eater, I think my husband could have eaten more ramen than what they served. I didn't finish mine, he finished the rest of my noodles. 

I also had the Makoto roll; it was nice, but not something I'd order again. 

I wanted to give this place three stars for wanting to sit us in the worst place especially because it wasn't busy. We were dressed casual, but nice. Others were dressed even more casual and had better seats. I want to be fair and not knock them down for first impressions. 

The hostess sitting us was very friendly and so was the waitress. This restaurant is expensive just like every other Vegas restaurant on the strip establishment. I'd be willing to come back if I want ramen and I don't want to move my car and drive someplace.

Awesome sushi/atmosphere in the forum shops at Caesars. The sushi was fresh and the very good. It's your standard high end sushi restaurant in Vegas. The prices are a little steep but what do you expect from a restaurant in the forum shops. A good place to take a date for a nice sushi dinner.
very good sushi cut fresh right in front of you.  had the yellow tai tuna roll which was awesome.  will go back there very soon

Beautiful view of the strip.  Service was fast, but a little off putting in the haughty way.  We got the shimi roll, a rainbow roll (not on menu), wagyu beef potstickers and soft shell lobster roll.  Food was delish but not out of this world.  I regret not getting the tasting menu at $120.  Would have given 4 stars, but they messed up the bill and charged me several drinks that I did not order.

Dined here for Christmas dinner. In summary, good food but service was something to be desired. 

We made reservations via open table for 7:15. We checked in at 7:10 and were told it would be a few minutes before our table was ready. Within those few minutes, we were asked 3 different times if we had checked in. I'm unsure if this was a one-off because it was busy due to the holiday. In any case, we were seated closer to 7:30 and ordered right away as we knew exactly what we wanted. It was 7:45 before we got water for the table and 10 minutes later, we finally got the bottle of sake we had ordered. 

We ordered 2 ramens and only one came out so we had to wait another 15 minutes for the 2nd bowl. The sushi and sashimi were pretty good. In short, the kitchen and wait staff seemed overwhelmed and service was definitely lacking. 

3 stars for the food and the effort!

Absolutely one of my favorite sushi places in all of the state...the filet wrapped asparagus is amazing, spicy tuna on crispy rice cakes are great, all the sashimi rules, the baked crab roll...unlike anything I've ever had, delicious. They have awesome happy hour specials but beware its a very small inside bar, so get there early.  They have amazing mixologists and always have a nice seasonal drink menu.
Atmosphere to spare and a menu that will speak to everyone. If you can please both my wife (atmosphere) and me (food) you gone magical.

One of my first experiences going to an actual sushi restaurant. I was skeptical to go but it was a great time. The rolls we ordered were delicious. The Atmosphere was very satisfying and our server, Jon, was incredibly humble and nice. I will definitely be going back!

Unfortunately our experience here didn't go well. I'll start off by saying the ambiance and food is great and there is so much potential. The staff however very rude and degrading. First off in case your not used to it make sure you know they serve free tap water. Hostess makes it seem like regular water but charges saying it's bottled. Water had no ice and was not chilled if there wasn't a need for ice. 6$ water. The waitress made us feel like we were too poor after I asked for tap water and was not friendly. Staff stared at us after that repeatedly. Left feeling in a bad mood. Food is great. Go for sushi. Not the service.
