This was my first time eating at this sushi place. I am usually weary of overly expensive sushi places, because i'm in love with the AYCE options everywhere else in town....oink oink. We had gone for happy hour (Sunday4-7). It was so frakkin good. I think I literally might have tried every single appetizer on the menu and some even twice haha They had asparagus and crispy rice and popcorn rock shrimp! Everyone in the restaurant was also very nice and attentive to our needs. I swear I would only drink out of my water cup maybe once or twice, and they were already refilling my water haha

The waitress we had was named Ellen. Very cute and bubbly girl. She was very patient and kind in explaining all of the items for happy hour and in suggesting what she really likes. It was our friend's birthday, so she even had a little birthday dessert prepared - even though it was only happy hour! So cute and nice.

I would definitely come back here again.
Hands down best sushi meal I have ever had. Food was amazing, service was amazing, and the view of the strip can't be beat.

When I think of Sushi Roku, I am indifferent. 
You know... that feeling... the absence of any emotional reactions.

For me, the dining experience involves so many things. And usually that precedent is set from the moment you walk up to the hostess stand. WHY is this an undervalued position at most restaurants? PLEASE, Sushi Roku, do not put someone at the front desk that cannot seat people properly. After two strolls through the dining room while walking back to tables that weren't open...not once, but twice... I finally asked to just stand where I was until they could find me a seat. 

Maybe it was a bad night for them, who knows. But, if you read my reviews you'll see I'm an overly friendly yelper. The fact that I actually got irritated and let the hostess know I was frustrated speaks high volume.

Moving along, the food was great and the server was great. This wasn't my first time here. I've eaten here several times, including breakfast a few times. The

Dishes we had: 
Organic Garden Salad - Delicious!
Mixed Vegetable Tempura - Broccoli was the best
American Kobe Potsticker "Gyoza" - Loved
Baked Lobster Roll - MUST TRY!
Salmon Sashimi - Maybe wasn't feeling the sushi, just OK

And if you like pear, don't skip the Pear Martini! Garnished with Parmesan Cheese! Amazing flavor and plus a little antipasti bonus.

I've yet to have a full experience at Sushi Roku, but that doesn't mean I'll stop going. It might be one of those ongoing hit and miss situations - I just keep hitting the miss. Looking forward to the hit!

Day 2 of my four day getaway in Vegas.  I try to eat at a good sushi restaurant wherever I visit and Sushi Roku was well rated everywhere.  I was not disappointed in my expectations.  I asked for a seat with a view of the strip and was obliged with a great view looking south down Las Vegas Blvd.  

I ordered the chef's tasting menu, a sake sampler, and a cocktail suggested by the waiter (muddled tangerine and cucumber with gin - Yummy!).  Each course in the tasting menu was brought out by one of the chef's and I was given an explanation of the food and its preparation.  

The appetizer course was amazing.  After two weeks it is hard to remember which each item was but I think the first item was a squid sashimi with olive oil and lemon.  The second item was a tuna tartar and the third item was a salmon sashimi.  Every item was sublime.

Course two was the hot appetizer.  This was a shrimp skewer with a mango salsa and a skewer with bacon wrapped cherry tomatoes.  Course three was a sashimi sampler with three types of tuna.  Beautiful presentation here.  Course four was perfectly seared scallop.  Course five was a sushi sampler with three pieces of tuna poke hand roll and 4 nigiri.  The salmon nigiri was the best salmon sushi I have ever tasted.  Course six was desert, a tiramisu with green tea infused lady fingers.  Heavenly.

Top rating in my book for service, view, ambiance, and most of all, the amazing food.

Made a reservation here on my most recent Vegas stay.  Place was highly recommended by a frequent Vegas visitor friend so made it a priority to come here.  We were seated at a table that had great view of the strip; more amazing when lists lit up at night.  

Started with some miso soup and seaweed salad along with sake; all were perfect.  Ordered the yellowtail diced chilies - unique dish with a great kick that complimented the yellowtail.   Next we moved onto the Katana and Tuna Japaleno; two dishes that went down so well.  To finish off, we went off the menu and ordered the gold truffle yellowtail.  This may be the best kept secret in Vegas - inside the yellowtail is some foie gras tucked in.  The sushi was heaven on earth; one of the best I've ever had.  Overall this is one of best sushi restaurants, period.

Roku sushi : 
Quality of the Fish:  3 *stars points
Service: 4 *
Interior: 3*
Organizations: 2*
Hygiene behind the sushi bar : 2*  (too unorganized should not be behind the bar)

For that price not worth .

We came here for my birthday dinner last year. 
Restaurant had good decor but a bit too dark for me.
They DIDNT read on our reservation that it was my BIRTHDAY dinner so did not get anything for the occasion.
The food was good and the service was okay too. 
Was a good experience overall but wouldn't come again for that price.

This place is not as good as it gets, but it was sure as good as I wanted it at the moment. Late night, money lost downstairs at the casino, too tired to think where to eat and I stumble into this restaurant by accident. The host is the waiter and his name was a fabulous Paul. Paul sits me down at the sushi bar and the chef just stares at me. I was so hungry I didn't even think to ask for the OMAKASE ! What an idiot! The Omakase is $90 per person, but they serve so much that I saw people fall of the chair from being full. I don't even remember what I ordered, but I lost my balance after the first bite. Then I turned around to face the windows and THE VIEW!!! THE VIEW of my beloved las VEgas Blvd from the 3rd floor of Cesar's Palace with an orgasmic sushi in my mouth made my night.  Cesar's Palace curves at this point on the Blvd. and you end being sort of in the middle of it with bay view windows. I am flying there in two weeks to order the Omakase and I will update the review with details.

My favorite upscale sushi in scottsdale. The W hotel is beautiful and Roku is no different. The vibe is upbeat with trendy music playing in the background. Everyone in the restaurant is sexy and dressed to impress. Great date place or pre-party place in walking distance of many clubs nearby.

Once again - Sushi Roku does not disappoint. My favourite need a snack while shopping at The Forum shops. Located on the top floor it takes a little patience to find this quiet spot. Enjoyed their signature rolls - make sure to try the Katana and Sima rolls.  Our server was friendly and made sure everything was perfect for us.

Fantastic sushi...amazing rolls. Their specialty rolls are where it's at. Get the one with the sriracha!!! (Sorry running a blank now on name of role). 
Yellow fin tuna sushi is perfection. Quite pricey, being at $50-ish for four pieces, but honestly so worth it. 
Took us a while to find this gem, but we're satisfied that we found it. Top floor of the ceaser's palace forum, take the escalator to top floor and you won't miss it. :)

was here on labour day.  had my money stolen.  staff unhelpful; manager inexperienced and unprofessional; used to frequent often for the mediocre but reasonably priced happy hour menu.  will never return.  advise patrons to hold on to keep their bags close.  horrible experience.  try ra sushi instead for a decent happy hour menu.

Luckily we noticed that las vegas was having some type of restaurant week.  Kind of craving some japanese food and the choices for this place sounded great.  We had the dinner which included appetizers, main course and dessert.  Theme was hot and cold so since there was two of us we decided to try each one.

For cold appetizers we had a trio of salmon, albacore and tuna carpaccio.  Delicious especially the salmon.  Hot included sea bass, rib eye wrapped asparagus and tatsuta age chicken.  Also really good especially the sea bass.

Main course included a variety of sushi nigiri and a BAKED CRAB handroll which was amazing!! We ended up ordering more.  The other dish was filet mignon with mushrooms and garlic truffle oil.  It was good but that baked crab took the prize.

Dessert was a Yuzu creme brule with green tea ice cream along with a trio of flavors of mochi ice cream.   All in all the meal was great and Ill definitely have to come back again for the baked crab hand roll.
Amazingggggggg sushi!!!! By far the best I've ever had!!! The fish was sooo fresh ad melted like butter in my mouth!! View was amazing and ambience was great! Suchhh a clean and tasteful place!!

I love Sushi Roku.  I have never had something that I didn't enjoy here.

My favorite: Yellowtail Sashimi w/ Diced Chilies $17 5/5

Popcorn Shrimp Tempura with Spicy Creamy Sauce. $17 5/5

The edamame is always a great way to get started

Local Secret...they offer a 20% locals discount with a valid Nevada Id.

I've been to Sushi Roku a handful of times and I LOVE IT! The restaurant is stunning, the staff is extremely friendly, and the food is absolutely delicious. The manager is AWESOME as well. I recommend this place to all of my friends and family.
Excellent. Staff, food, service, quality, freshness delish. Excellent prices.

Great ambiance. I had the Matsu 8 piece chef sushi custom and the grilled octopus. The sushi was fantastic. Each were custom made from the chef. The grilled octopus were too grilled for my liking and the price I expected a bigger portion.

Ok, I was wandering around Caesars Palace for snips and giggles and found myself on the top floor at Sushi Roku (which they have one out here in LA) and this place, though pricy, was what I expect from a great sushi restaurant. Friendly and quick service, happy customers (even sat next to some guests from Toyko, they were very nice) and the chef was top notch, he even gave me something on the house. I think business was slow so he was just warming up his knives. 

I shared a meal with myself and was very happy I did. When you're here for a month you try a little bit of every cuisine so expect more from me the whole month of April. 

But if you happen to come across this place it may be fancy, it may be pricey, but it's worth the extra 2 bucks on the rolls for the service and quality. 

Enjoy!

Solid "meh." 

I think this place definitely gets a lot more hype than it deserves. 

Ambience = trendy and inviting 

Mixed drinks = delicious

Sushi = bland, nothing special, & pretty limited selection of specialty rolls compared to your average sushi restaurant

I had the crunchy spicy tuna roll and it was just ok. It tasted fresh, but overall pretty flavorless and the temperature was weirdly lukewarm. 

A friend ordered the Katana roll which was significantly better than the crunchy spicy tuna, so maybe it was that roll....

Overall, I wouldn't go out of my way to return here.

the sushi here is good. the rolls are good but they are smaller than usual for rolls. the service here is kinda slow too. the prices here are really expensive. the rolls are over twenty bucks each and they are small. its super easy to rack up a bill of a few hundred dollars. although i liked the sushi, i dont think i will be back bc i thought it was really expensive for what i got.

OK, this place deserved 2.5 stars.

Sushi quality was very good:  4-5 stars.  Prices were obscene, though, even with that quality of fish.  Minus 1 star for that.

Service was lacking.  The place was nearly empty yet I had to wait a long time for everything.  Don't feed me piecemeal when there is NO ONE at the restaurant.  I sat at the sushi bar and had to wait for every pair of sushi to be served to me.  I'd like to pick what order I eat my fish.

Please know what fish you do have and don't have.  This is a sushi restaurant.  It's like a bell captain who has to stop and ask the blackjack dealer where the elevators are (...which happened at the Venetian, btw.  But I digress.)  Minus 2 stars. 

Yeah, overall, the experience was lacking.  Aka... sucked.
Get the lychee sake martini, blackened cod and sashimi.  Fresh and flavorful.  Good for groups.  The view was unexpected and a nice bonus.

I celebrated my 40th birthday here and everything was wonderful. From the event planning prior to the dinner (from a distance), the food, the service and the atmosphere it was five star. Thank you Johnny Seo (Executive GM/Regional Director) and the whole staff at Sushi Roku for making this a night to remember.

Omg this place has amazing food!!!! Can't wait to go back. Our friends were raving about how the tuna tartare is the best they ever had! I don't eat raw, but all the cooked food is sooo delish! Dinner with a view! Service was greaaaat. We ordered a total of 12 dishes. I'll try to update w/ more pics later

The sashimi and skewers were incredible.  Also a big fan of yellowtail with jalapenos and ponzu.   Had several bottles of the most expensive nigori sake, which costs almost as much as our entire meal!
The fish was great. The service was also recommendable. However, considering the size and other factors such as location, third floor of a mall, it was not a 5 stars.
I can honestly say, I have had sushi in a few Continents and I've never had anything as good as the Matsu at Las Vegas Sushi Roku. Simply the most delicious I've ever tasted.

Three stars for the great service and chicken fried rice. The sushi had a horrible texture. The pieces were falling apart. 4/5 roles we ordered had no flavor. To say the least it was monochromatic and anticlimactic.

Really good food, and a cool atmosphere! Fast service, though the workers seemed a bit frantic. The bar also doesn't have normal options, only their specialty drinks. Luckily the bartender was really nice, and even though it was busy, when we told her what was in a Mai Thai, she was willing to make it. She also made a fantastic mojito!!!

Hands Down a great fun place.
Great food on and fusion options for sushi.
Very posh, good service, but can be a tad slow on getting a drink ordered but overall great atmosphere.

This is probably the best sushi I've eaten in quite some time. The fish was very fresh and reasonably priced. I had the chef's sushi lunch special, the seaweed salad and the Pinot Grigio. The decor was really nice too. 

The service was a little slow, but overall it was a great meal.

Hungry for Sushi we searched yelp n the net for a good sushi spot, when came upon this place.

will definitely not make it to my top sushi hit list. service was very slow and it took forever n a half to get out menu n the check. we sat at the sushi bar and we only got a few sushi rolls, though it was fresh i have to say it certainly was not memorable. we ordered the chefs sushi special where the sushi chefs choose the sushi. the place is very expensive so be prepared to empty your wallets for this one.

overall will probably not come back. definitely not for the sushi alone. but i heard the hot plates are good.... i guess.

Happy hour was a great deal. The sushi was really delicious and tasted fresh! They have great prices like $4 rolls and $5 cocktails during happy hour everyday if you sit at the bar. The bartender was very friendly and personable. This was one of our favorite meals during our stay in Las Vegas!

Excellent service and ambiance but overpriced. Then again, it's Vegas and everything is overpriced. 

Everyone in the group enjoyed their food. My fried rice and miso eggplant were delicious. We shared the creme brulee and mochi samplers for dessert, which were both decadent. 

I don't know what was in the food, but less than 15 minutes after the meal we were all hightailing it to the bathrooms. :P

I've been here 3 times and it's a lot of hype. FIrst of all the steak restaurant or fine dining atmosphere does not work with a sushi theme. They are trying to be the Nobu of Scottsdale and it comes off as a sushi version of Mortons. No the atmosphere is not sexy; the W hotel is sexy, Sushi Roku is not! The service is definitely rushed and I certainly enjoyed my time more at Stingray than Sushi Roku. I like the variety of the menu but the execution is amateur. The food is good but incredibly overpiced. I certainly have no problem paying 200-300 for a meal but it better be good and honestly the sushi at Stingray, Ra and Kyoto is better than this place. The only nice thing about this restaurant is that it is located in the W. However, don't expect to receive any perks at the W for dining here. It may be connected to it but it doesn't get you upstairs or past the W hotel bouncers in the lounge adjacent to the restaurant.

This place is one of my fave sushi restos eva!  The highlights are the Japanese bier selection and a place that serves ankimo (monkfish liver)  We had at least 4 servings of the sashimi version.  The rolls were amazing.  Don't worry about price as it's worth every penny.  Next time, i'm going to try the omakase menu as i'm sure it will be off the chain!

While visiting Las Vegas, we popped in here for a quick lunch.  As typical for Vegas, everything was overpriced, but we'll let that slide.  We had a really tasty rock shrimp tempura roll with jalapeños.  It had a nice crunch and spice; we would definitely order that again.  The noodle dish we ordered was entirely forgettable though (so forgettable that I honestly don't even remember what it was!).  The service was courteous, but not engaging in any way.  Definitely okay for a quick bite, but not a place that is on my list to return to.

One of the best sushi bars in the Phoenix area! The fish is amazing, staff is extremely professional and friendly, and the atmosphere is upbeat yet comfortable. I highly recommend this spot, and will keep coming back!

first time here, was recommended by a friend! a lot of unique sushi choices... we order the Brussel sprouts chips for an appetizer which was perfect cause it was a good snack and not so fulling so you can enjoy your meal. I ordered the toro-jalepeno roll which was about 8 pieces.. I also ordered the spicy scallop hand roll.. I did expect the scallops to be fresh but it was cooked but still delicious! We also ordered the crispy shrimp appetizer which was sooooo good! my friend ordered the chicken fried rice and the rice was perfectly cooked and nice and soft! my friends got other rolls as well but I don't remember exactly what rolls but they said it was amazing! After words, we ordered cheesecake and mochi for dessert which was delicious as well! I would definitely come back when in town!

After incurring sufficient gambling losses, getting the lunch combo seemed like the smart choice. Too bad it wasn't. I had the beef teriyaki and sashimi combo. While you get a good amount of food for the price, the quality was lacking. The meat was too chewy and gristley. The sashimi was OK and nothing spectacular to rave about. 

However, the a-la-carte items were phenomenal. My friend ordered the premium homemade tofu three ways, one with black truffle, one with caviar and lemon oil, and the last with scallion and sesame oil. Tofu was silky and smooth and almost hard to grab with your chopsticks as it would break into pieces when you grabbed a hold of it.

I ordered the chicken karaage with cilantro mayo. I enjoyed the light crispy coating surrounding the meaty pieces of chicken. The cilantro mayo was a nice condiment but I didn't notice the flavor of the cilantro too much despite the light green color of the mayo.

Service was good, except for the server for getting my order of Sprite so I had to ask for it again. At least she came by later and gave me a refill when I didn't ask for one.

Lesson learned this time, Sushi Roku. I'll be back to try more of your delicious a-la-carte items. Hopefully with more money to spend.

This place is a typical example of Vegas extravagance on the Strip. I opted for the Kobe "American" New York steak cut which is priced at over $50. Not sure how many ounces it ended up being but for not being the Japanese version, it was a very tender New York cut. Full of flavor, well seasoned, and a healthy side of varied mushrooms and green beans. You'll have to get your carbs from their various specialty sushi rolls or nigiri options.

Basic dessert menu, actually decided to skip it since it didn't stand out and the pricey entrée already made the dinner worthwhile.

Great ambiance and if you have the option, opt for the lounge seating instead of the normal tables.

5 stars for the awesomely flavored food and comfortable interior. Of course I could nit pick about the lackluster dessert options or opine about the lack of real Japanese Kobe beef, but the sushi, entrée, and appetizer menu is varied enough to include something for everyone.

Great sushi in Vegas..not a prime location, but if you go for happy hour (until 7 M-TH), the prices are super reasonable. I recommend the tuna tataki app, fried mushroom app, filet wrapped asparagus and spicy tuna roll. Note, you have to sit at the bar to get happy hour prices. Def give this place a try!
Loved it.  Donald at the bar was awesome!!  Food was great.  Went for happy hour.  Great deal!  Great ambiance.

I love love love Sushi Roku!!!

Sushi Roku is the epitamy of first class sushi dining experience!  Our birthday party was seated immediately even though half of our party was five minutes behind us.  Our table had an AMAZING view of the Strip.  Our birthday party was greeted personally by the GM - Kenji.  Our server was attentive and our food came timingly.  Everything was good, not a complaint from our entire table.  

We LOVED our dinner and would go back anyday!  Tuna Carpaccio, Chilean Sea Bass, Ramen, Shima and Katana rolls were good.  I'd definitely recommend the molten chocolate cake for dessert... OMG it's to die for!  Overall a little pricy but definitely worth it for the ambiance, impeccable service and tasty food.

Loved this place!

Firstly, service and atmosphere make this restaurant very welcoming and comfortable. Great views of the strip, or cozy interior table with a modern decor. When you walk in, all the sushi chefs greet you ! 

Secondly, the food was ever so good. The best agedashi tofu I've had to date and somehow, they made simple avocado rolls just full of flavor. So good! Almost ordered seconds!..

My husband and I ordered a bunch of small plates to share - vegetable tempura, agedashi tofu, avocado rolls, and avocado & fried rice tartine. Considering that this is a sushi place, they had many good options for vegans! 

Everything was just amazing!!

I thought Suski Roku was great.  It is way better than any hotel restaurant I've been to (except David Burke's Primehouse, of course).  

I had edamame, a california roll and a shima roll -- shrimp wrapped spicy tuna w/ cilantro and avocado.  They were both fresh and excellent.  The nice part was that I could see the sushi man actually making them about 25 feet away.  Nice!  I did think they needed more creative sushi rolls but was definitely happy with the two that I had.  

The place looks great.  Nice tables, booths, everything.  A little dark with the lack of lighting but I'm fine with that--I know my dad would have complained about how hard it is to read the menu.  

For hotel guests, I guess they serve non-Asian food here for breakfast and lunch.

Were they out of their minds when they gave this place more than two stars?  Have they never had sushi before?  Have they nothing to compare it to?  Is this what desert dwellers consider good sushi?  Gag me!

Whose brilliant idea was it to place the sushi bar in the middle of the restaurant, and to seat every sushi bar patron with a loud greeting in Japanese as they were led to the bar as if they were royalty?  It was cute once or twice, but all of us sitting at our table by the entrance did not appreciate the fake sentiment by the end of our evening.  It was downright annoying.

While ordering, our server asked if we had ever been to Sushi Roku before in such a manner as to suggest that it was going to be a once-in-a-lifetime dining experience.  When he indicated that their food is served "family style" we initially thought that it meant that we would share dishes, which wouldn't work too well when five out of seven of us were vegetarians.  When he explained that it simply meant that the food is brought out as it is completed by the kitchen, I pointed out the fact that what he really meant is that the kitchen is not organized enough to assure that we will all eat at the same time.  This is unacceptable at a so-called high end restaurant.

I had to laugh at my vegetarian dinnermates.  They all ordered a tofu dish with what they called brown rice risotto.  After tasting the dish, which tasted like fried water, I understood why they thought the edamame was so good.  It's the only thing, other than the overpriced wine, that they actually tasted that night.

As for myself, I went for the sushi assortment, or should I say, the rice cakes with slivers of raw fish placed atop them.  I guess not enough raw fish survived the trek across the desert.  The fish was carefully rationed. I actually took one of the rice cakes and put all of my sushi on it to make a rainbow roll.

In the end, the server was right.  It was a once-in-a-lifetime dining experience for me.  Meaning, I'll never go back there.

The baked lobster rolls was amazing! We really liked everything we tried. Great food, great view. Service was a bit slow. They took a while to come by when we wanted to order more food. The view to the Strip was awesome.

Best crab sushi I've had. We enjoyed albacore sushi, a spicy yellowtail toll and a Philadelphia roll as well. It was all second to none. 
However, the edamame disappointed; it was undercooked. Ambiance is five stars. Server was super nice, although service was a little slow, but we were in no hurry. Would definitely go back.
Service and food was very good.  We had three rolls and all were very tasty.  We recommend this restaurant.
The food is so good! Yum! Service here was wonderful and the quality of the food was great! Husband and I had a great time here for lunch. I will definitely be back here anytime I'm in Vegas!!

This is a pretty solid sushi restaurant. A bit pricey, but the ambience is awesome. My boyfriend and I went last month, and our table wasn't ready until 20 min after our reservation. The bf wasn't exactly pleased as he had spent a lot of time planning the evening. The GM Steve was very gracious though, and brought us some amazing appetizers! Definitely helped to smooth things over. Everything we had was amazing. My favorite was probably the yellowtail appetizer!

Awesome food and very friendly stuff. Happy hour menu is spectacular. Try miso eggplants and popcorn shrimp. Also tried the chef menu which was exceptional. Many years we were dining there and never were we disappointed.

Ok let me start by saying we eat alot of fresh sushi, we salt water fish, we have been to 4 countries eating sushi so this is an educated sushi review. We have noticed alot of sushi restaurants are Phillipino owned and operated however if the fish is DNA real and the knife is sharp we eat. 

A few years back we searched best sushi in vegas just to test the area. We figured VEGAS being VEGAS the who's who would eat sushi. I don't recall the name my wife found but it was behind an escalator down a hall across from a sports bar, it was a true hole. This place was unbelievable great. 6 years later we did same search as our daughter (9) loves sushi everyone and there mother has a sushi restaurant. 

My wife picked Roku. We sat down and it was a typical restaurant  other to flashy but sushi bar was awesome long and chef's were very visible. I scanned the menu and wow the prices were outrageously high like Toro was 26$, Halibut was 18$, saki by the glass Nigori super $$$ and it was a small glass. We decided to stay and try it is got Albacore, Halibut, Toro, seaweed salad, saki. The Toro was old and mushy, Halibut was tail ends and chewy if you know Halibut you would know this was awful and a cheap cut, the Albacore was very thin and almost white. My son got typical spicy tuna rolls and 1 lobster hand they were TINY. My wife well same. Daughter well same. Our bill usually runs 100 to 125 locally and we're treated like royalty I'm talking everything from desert being free to chef compliments in sushi. Roku was 345$. 

We were thinking wow like we didn't get the special water or anything. We watched another family gorge and fancy water for the kids and this roasted marshmallow desert. Another family looked to be locals sat. Started ordering and we thought man we must be cheap or over our heads nope. The waitress brought all kinds of fancy things and the mom said he'll no we drink tap water, get drunk before you come in, and order cheap. I asked her why just go to a different place she said they work near by. By the way we came here at 630 and the place was empty. When we left we talked to a guy that ate at the bar and he too said the most expensive fish he has ever ate.

So if your in the mood to look important and spend but get average fish this is the place.

What can i say but the truth a definite stop when we are in vegas right next to tommy bahama at the Cesar palace forums. Food is delicious and fresh try the katana rool and the shashimi all of them wont be disaapointed also shrimp fried rice is off the hook.

Went for lunch recently and the place was empty! So we ordered the chef's special, a combo of sashimi and rolls and it was alright. The spicy tuna had a strange, mushy texture-I was not a fan. We also ordered the shrimp tempura roll which was great. I may have been expecting too much; I was not impressed with this lunch. With two cocktails and tip it was over $80!! Ouch! I do not think I will return-there is better sushi out there for less money. Only go here if you want to over spend on sub-par sushi. The view was nice!!

Excellent food and service!  They have awesome Oregon Four Graces Pinot Noir wine  and the cod is awesome.  For a real treat try the steak with a little charcoal grill at your table.  Great birthday celebration place as they provide fireworks and free deserts.

Wildly popular Sushi Roku is now in Scottsdale at the W Hotel.  It's atmosphere is ornate and blends organic textures setting the stage for 
freshly-prepared sushi and sashimi fare. 

The food goes beyond the expected and blends ingredients such as jalapeño peppers into more traditional Asian fare giving a unique touch to every dish. The bar serves up some wild concoctions that will surely cure what ails you, and there's a good selection of sakés and a creative wine list. 


Since I went to Sushi Roku last night without a reservation, my friend and I ponied up to the bar. We were greeted by a team of very knowledgeable and service oriented bartenders. Dylon offered some fantastic food recommendations. Oh, and ladies...he's total eye candy! He was very attentive and took care of us even as the bar got busier. 

Stephani cured my ailments with one of the most unique and delish martini's I've had in a long time! It was the Passion & Spice martini. It's made w/ Skyy Passion vodka, muddled jalapeno, orange juice and some other secret "sauces"!  Its sweet (but not overly sweet) w/ a slightly spicy finish. If I had a tail it would be wagging over this drink!  My friend had the Strawberry Fizz martini created with muddled fresh strawberries. Very summertime!! Caution: these drinks go down easy!  

The edamame hummus appetizer is refreshingly unique. It's made with black edamame and the beans are only vaguely darker, yet sweeter than the familiar green.  Their creamy, buttery texture easily adopts the flavor and spices of traditional chickpea hummus. It's served with 3 dipping chip varieties: fried won ton, lotus and sweet potato. Yum-O! 

I also indulged in the Filet Mignon wrapped jumbo asparagus w/ Soy Mirin Sauce (served tapas style) and the mixed veggie tempura.  The flavors were perfect and the drinks compliment these creative dishes. 

With it's critically acclaimed Modern Japanese fare and Zen-like atmosphere, Sushi Roku will be a favorite among both locals and visitors.

Lewis is an amazing server.  This was my fourth or fifth time here and this was my best experience. Lewis created a tasting menu for us that was bar none over the top delicious. We had the starter of yellowtail and ahi tuna tar tar followed by waygu steak wrapped asparagus and tempura shrimp (this was my least favorite). Then the lamb chop and sea bass skewers finished with a sushi combo of three of the top selling pieces. In conclusion, if you want an amazing experience with a server who knows the menu, see Lewis and enjoy!!

This has been my favorite sushi place for a while now. At least the one in Vegas and Katana in LA. The menu at this location is different and the fish didn't taste as fresh. But the service was great and the atmosphere was very hip and fun. I'd go again.

Maybe the worst sushi experience I have had minus the good company. First of all our meals did not arrive at the same time or even close. It took more than an hour to get sashimi. Two of our dishes did not arrive at all. When we asked our server to just cancel them, he remarked "they didn't arrive?" When we asked for our check we noted that we were charged for one of said dishes. I'm not one to ever complain about a meal but this was something I couldn't just let be. In all the service was better than the mediocre sushi we received. If you want great ambience, go for a drink just forget about eating.

Sushi Roku is tucked way out of sight at The Forum Shops at Caesar's. It is romantic and dark. Our server was very professional. We ordered a bunch of apps to start. 

The tuna carpaccio was fresh but lacked in flavor so I had to add soy sauce. The Kobe beef skewers were tender and juicy but I am not sure if they really were from Kobe. The chicken skewers were ok - afterall it is chicken. I recommend the Seaweed salad and Miso Eggplant Dengaku.

We were ready to order dinner and then a friend of mine got sick and left and her bf went after her. So my gf and I finished the apps and were full. We explained to the waiter that we had a problem with out friend and he understood but I felt bad for him since the place was almost empty.

One thing I noticed in a lot of Vegas restaurants is that they are so dark inside. It's draining. Liven up and be more fun, it'll increase business.

WOW! Have you ever tried Popcorn Shrimp?? one of the tastiest things I've ever eaten!! EVER!!! The beef teriaki was succulent, rich, juicy,rare...sublime basically! Eat the sushi here and you'll never be able to get cheap rubbish sushi ever again!
Absolutely the best sushi I've ever had!  Super fresh and creative rolls. My favorite is the jalapeño tuma roll! Fabulous view of the Strip too. Highly recommend!

Sushi was good, decor was great, service was solid..BUT the price was silly! I expect to pay more in Vegas, but double...Other than that it would warrant four stars, but all things considered its a solid three.

Ok so I'll begin with the bad, cause baby- they ain't much good..... the drinks were not as strong as they should be for $14,(I had 3 of them and was not even buzzing- usually 2 and I ready to rumble) the sushi is great, but again you end up with $20 of it perperson just to have a decent sized dinner and the waitress totally but things on our bill that we didn't order AND the "5 piece" tempura order originally came w 3 pieces. All of this and the 5 oz of  so-so sake was $15. They should be ad they are new to the valley b/c in this  market they'll be a one-off place to go for people who can vacation. Plus this was all on my birthday, so they needed to do better. Plus you pay $8 for valet and they didn,t even pull the car around all the way. Eahhhhhh "at the the sushi was good?" Is not how I wanted to feel when the bill is over $120.
Exceptional service and even better food!! From the filets to the sushi. Highly recommend this restaurant!

I was en route to Japan, when I flew over the W hotel in Scottsdale. I looked down and noticed a bunch of cool tables and booths located next to the sidewalk. I couldn't make out what the sign in front said because I was already at 2500 ft. and ascending. I asked the guy next to me if he knew, and he said " I'm in the middle seat, I can only see wingtips you moron".  So I made a mental note to myself  to find out which restaurant was located there. 2 weeks later, I had returned. I found out that it was Sushi Roku. I thought to myself, there's no way it could it be as good as the sushi I just had in Japan for the last 2 weeks. Well, Ive only been wrong 3 times in my life before the day I ate at Sushi Roku. Now I can honestly say Ive been wrong 4 times. I had no idea how fantastic everything is here. The decor blew me away from the get go. It's an interior designers heaven. Very modern and clean. I was floored by the warm greetings and smiles my wife and I received right as I walked in the door. Now then, there's sushi and then there's Sushi. The Toro sashimi I had was so fresh, I thought it was gonna swim right out of my mouth!! I mean Harrow!!!  Everything from the Filet Wrapped Asparagus to the Shima roll was fantastic. Ironically, our servers name was Ross too. Classic.  He was able to answer any questions we had, and he also suggested several menu items that we ended up ordering, which lead me to write this review. God he was impressive. Fantastic experience overall.  
I cant wait to go back!!

Wonderful, friendly service! Nice atmosphere and sushi was fabulous. Spicy tuna roll and katana roll were both very good. We also had one of the chefs, Jason, make us something special and fresh and he nailed it! It was delicious!

This restaurant truly deserves 5 stars. Let me start off by saying they have a GLUTEN FREE MENU, which is amazing for any sushi lover who can't have regular soy sauce and tempura. They have gluten free soy sauce and they have gluten free rolls which makes it really easy to order. The fish was so fresh and delicious. The ambience of the restaurant was very nice with the dimmed lighting, strip view, and great decor. I definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone that is looking for great sushi in Vegas for a reasonable price.

Awful. Some of the worst sushi I have ever had. Maybe the happy hour menu is full of leftover sushi from the night before, but I'd rather eat grocery store sushi. Mushy and unappetizing. Thank goodness I didn't pay for the same items at $20 each. $50 I wasted at happy hour here. Never again. Worst sushi experience by far. Save your money and go somewhere else. Yuck!

Come in here during CES w/ friend.  We were able to book it thru opentable the day before & got seated about 15 min after we got there with the busy crowd there, I say their time managment is very good! ^^

Seated at the Sushi bar, the chief was very friendly & so is the server.
We ask him the promotion I got from my AX card-$30 gift after $100 spend that expired just two days ago, they were still able to honor which was pretty cool, except we stuff it about $100 worth of sushi & Sappro to make to $100 bill. & it was so GOOD, & so Fresh for this sushi.

If you not much a sushi eatter, you can always try their other chain right next to it, BOA steakhouse, that is right next to it in the Ceaser Palace Form Shops.

This is by far one of the best Sushi restaurants that I've visited in Las Vegas.  This service was absolutely phenomenal from the wait staff, bartenders and the chef going around and meeting everyone.  The atmosphere was cozy and intimate and although on a busy work dinner, we were still relaxed in this environment.  Also, you must try the dessert!!!

Like many restaurants in Scottsdale, this is all style and no substance.  The food is good, but subpar for the prices paid.  I even returned a glass of wine because it simply was not worth the $10.00 cost.  And we did not think the menu was anything special or unique.

7/25: Located in Forum Shops at Caesars Palace casino. I looked up a site that lists sushi restaurants with Happy Hour available. This place was one of them and had a good rating as well, so I decided to give it a try. The food was pretty good, and most of the service was great. 

It was pretty quiet a little before 6PM on a Thursday, and I walked up to the front without a reservation. My friendly hostess promptly and politely sat me down in the bar dining area, although I requested to sit at the bar. Not sure if she misunderstood me or not. (FYI: it was pretty hot in that area; I'm not sure if the A/C was on...the bar was just right). A Happy Hour menu requested, which wasn't available in that area, so one of the waitstaff courteously moved my beverages to the bar. 

My bartender/waitress Lauren was awesome! She works pretty fast; there was an instance or two when I felt rushed, but that's better than slow service. She was very friendly and social, and we introduced each other as well. The rest of the staff was meh. Food was served in a reasonable amount of time, and the presentation was pretty cool. 

TIP: I was told that locals get 20% off regular menu prices! (double check on that before you go)

-Kobe Meatballs ($6)
-Fried Calamari ($4) 
-Spicy Yellowtail Roll ($5 cut)
-A2 Fusion Roll (albacore, onion, avocado & jalapeno...$5) 
-Eel & Avocado Roll ($5)...I'm a fan of unagi and this was fresh and delicious! 
-Mini Tropical Fruit Cheesecake ($3)...one of the best, if not the best, desserts I've ever had! They don't give you a huge slice, which can be a good thing. It's pretty sweet and rich, tastes like coconut with oreo crust. SO good! 
-Iced Tea was "only" $3.50 as well (I think it's usually $4+ on the Strip). Lauren even offered a full cup to go, which I accepted of course.

All of the food was great, although I wasn't expecting a couple of items to come in such small proportions (meatballs and calamari). Happy Hour might actually be more profitable in terms of cost/profit margin and bringing in customers; not just here, but at most places. 

Overall a pretty good experience. I have no doubt that I would be satisfied with the quality of the other appetizers. I'd come back again for "Red Sun" Happy Hour!

Recently visited the Forum Shops location for Happy Hour and what an awesome experience it was! They have their Red Sun Happy hour (Sun - Thur 4 - 7 and Fri & Sat 4 - 6). Happy Hour is served in their lounge area with bar seating and a long 'communal' table. There are some may great hot & cold items, drinks and even deserts! Gosh we had so much food! Some of the items included: Miso Glazed Shrimp Tempura, Spicy Scallop sushi roll (it's got a lil kick!), Shrimp Tempura with Asparagus roll, Shishito peppers, Crispy Chicken and Vegetable tempura. Most of the HH cocktails drinks I think were $6 each and the hot green tea was served nice and hot! Carmelo was our server - did a great job and to show how committed they are to great experience - Johnny the GM and Guillermo - Asst. GM stopped by several times to check on how things were going. As other reviewers have noted - beautiful floor to ceiling glass window that overlooks the Strip - amazing views to go along with the amazing cuisine and service. I think this is one of the best deals for Happy Hour on the Strip with all of the great choices and the fact it's offered 7 days a week. Of course their regular lunch & dinner offerings are just as great! Next time you're at the Forum Shops or looking for a great experience - check it out! A MUST! ENJOY! ;-)

If you want to have true traditional Japanese sushi/sashimi, this place is not a right place for you.  I felt food was overpriced and food was average.  If your boyfriend take you there and enjoy upscale/romantic atmosphere, it's a right place.  Service was good and their restroom is very unique. When I walked into the restroom, I thought I was drunk after a glass of sake. But the washing hands sinks are located between men/women's restroom.  A very kind gentleman indicated to me the women's restroom. Thanks to him.

GO. HERE. NOW. I fancy myself a bit of a sushi aficionado, and I am SO glad we tried Sushi Roku at Caesar's.  They have some REALLY rare cuts of fish that I want in my life everyday.  We ordered Nigiri (Sake, Tuna, Hamachi, and Trout). The trout was the recommendation of the server and GOOD GOD, best nigiri I've ever had. Imagine Salmon, which is so fresh and buttery and smooth, but MORE buttery and smooth. It was like what salmon WANTS to be.  We also tried a few rolls which were incredible, but the nigiri is really where they shined.  I can't wait to come back next time in LV! ENJOY!

I went there for happy hour today at 5:58 and the hostesses say that it ended. How is that possible when it says that happy hour is until 7. It's a good thing I asked but that's a little sketchy when their website and yelp says that happy hour is 4-7 Sunday thru Thursday.

I spent my 21st birthday with my family in Las Vegas and this is where we chose to eat on our first night. Due to a freak snow storm, the restaurant as well as the city was mostly empty. It is a beautiful restaurant, providing an escape from the mall it is in. The best Japanese cuisine I have ever had and the price isn't ridiculous as many restaurants in the area. I highly suggest trying the sake sampler. Being more of a wine snob, I never considered sake with a meal mostly because I knew nothing about it, but each glass came with an explanation. The service was right on point as well. I will definitely be returning.
5 stars for me. Went for my birthday and was impressed with the service and quality of the food. Great atmosphere.

It's sad when chain places lose that sense of service. No one was rude, but by no means was anyone welcoming.
The spicy scallop roll I ordered was on the fishy side (usually an indicator of bad seafood) and I told them I didn't care for it. So awesome - I still had to pay for it! (Please hear the sarcasm.)
Hummus was great, presentation of everything was beautiful, but I think they should work a bit on customer service. 
Try smiling while you're at work, not telling me your back hurts and you can't wait to get off.

Also, quick tip - don't order the red wine that's on happy hour. Thinner than a Pinot noir, but supposedly it's a Cabernet Sauvignon. Tasted like wine tinted water.

If you are looking for a taste of the rich life without actually being rich, then consider hitting Sushi Roku at The W hotel between 5pm and 6:30pm Monday through Saturday.

This place is great for a date or a place to kick it with friends. You are at The W, so you have the upscale feeling of being posh, and because the prices are so good during happy hour, you can actually have the satisfaction of saying "I'll have one of everything on the menu" which is exactly what I did!

Atmosphere: Sushi Roku is a quintessential modern Asian establishment. While it is chic, it is oddly authentically Asian. It feels open yet intimate at the same time.

My favorites from the menu:

Sushi Roku Fusion ($4 a glass, $18 a pitcher). As you walk past the bar you will notice a gigantic glass jug filled with fruit and vodka. This is the Fusion, and it is deliciously addicting, yet sneakily strong.

My favorite sake, nigori sake (cold, unfiltered sake which in in my opinion has a lot more flavor and is smoother) and also hot sake for just $4.

Miso Eggplant ($5). I have never EVER desired eggplant or ordered it at a restaurant, but after trying this dish, at least once a week I find myself salivating over the thought of the Miso Eggplant. This appetizer is a big reason I keep coming back.

Sautéed Chinese Green Beans ($3). Crunchy and flavorful, these beans are the beans knees! I don't fancy myself a vegetarian, but I have never been so delighted eating a plate of straight veggies.

Tuna Tartar ($6). If you like raw tuna and avocado, this dish will melt your taste buds. Don't let the ugly name fool you. This is a beautiful dish with a beautiful taste.

Oysters ($2.5 each). These oysters have more flavor that most any other oyster I've swallowed. They have a garnish of Asian citrus flavors which subtly mask the true oceanic taste of the oyster, so if you are looking for the traditional unadulterated oysters, these may not be the ones for you.

On a side note, kudos to the staff. The servers, bartenders, and managers, are extremely accommodating, helpful, and very friendly. They all genuinely wanted us to have a great experience, which we did.

After your meal, take the time to meander upstairs and see the outside dining area which edges the famous W pool, the social epicenter of the who's who's and hooha's of Scottsdale.

Excellent customer service and amazing view of strip. The my really value their customers and want to please them. Definitely consider going here if you are wanting sushi in vegas. The desserts are great too.
We both ordered the Chef's choice, wow, it was delicious & included some hot surprises!! Great view of the strip!!!!

Came in on Saturday evening around 830 and sat in the front of the resturant by the bar. The food was so so, however  our waiter was amazing(wish I would have gotten his name). He was so kind and compassionate and very knowledgeable of the menu.  Las  Vegas restaurants need to take notes on this type of service; as we will be back to try the menu again and hopefully get the same gentleman who service us last night!!!!!!

We came in Saturday evening December 26th  around 845.
Amazing customer service and great food. They truly went above and beyond.. the yellowtail appetizer is amazing, we ordered two..

I absolutely loved the food here! We had a party of 5 and ordered a number of dishes for the table to share. Whether it was a fusion dish or traditional sushi, every single dish was VERY VERY good. I'm not a big fan of truffle oil but I definitely thoroughly appreciated the Yellowtail/Foie Gras/Truffle Oil creation. The kobe was super marbleized. The sampler was a lot of fun. I could go on and on about each dish. As an afterthought, the decor is beautiful and the service is great too. =P

The only thing i didn't like was the hostess. The place was clearly not full but she made it sound like it was the end of the world that we didn't have a reservation and would have to wait. Arrogant much?

I rarely give one star; however, this dining experience was one of four bad ones. Having given this a chance over and over, I'm throwing Sushi Roku under the bus.

Three of the four times I've dined here, the drinks came after the food.  The front staff are friendly but some of the staff was down-right rude. I've worked in the service industry for years and cannot believe the attitudes of the servers.

One of the servers lied to us and told us they were out of pitchers because she didn't want to sell $15.00 pitchers.  The manager actually admitted that she lied and there were plenty of pitchers.  She also lied on our tab and took advantage of a large table who would have tipped more than 30% had she been honest and courteous.

The food I would rate, okay.  I find that they don't use the best ingredients and inexpensive soy sauces, etc.  

I would definitely not recommend this place to anyone.  If you want bad service in a convenient W Hotel location, go for it, but Roka Akor far surpasses Sushi Roku.

We had miso soup, crab dynamite roll and the sushi mix with spicy tuna roll.  The spicy tuna roll tasted very fresh.  Miso soup was also excellent!  In comparison, the food prices seemed very reasonable.

Unfortunately the sushi we received was subpar.  The crispy tempura and the crispy shallots were cold and soggy.  The rice was not fresh and the short ribs were extremely tough and rubbery.  This had such high reviews but the food did not live up to expectations.  
On the up side our server was amazing and did everything she could to make our night enjoyable. 
If you are coming here for food, I would urge you to rethink.
Good music great service. Been a fan and a frequent customer of the Hollywood Roku. The sashimi was marginal but other specialties were as expected. Also the drinks were better than the Hotel bar!

Alright I am not lying when I say Sushi Roku has the and I will say it again the best filet mignon I have ever tasted!!!!....!!!!! (medium rare). I could take it apart with my fork and sight pressure from my knife.   We had popcorn shrimp too (big portion). I was so full when I left.  The atmosphere of the restaurant is dark  but sexy and has a great view of the strip (so ask for a window seat).  My girlfriend had the spicy tuna roll which was good. 

 The app menu is long so don't get confused like I did, but I was impressed with  popcorn shrimp, so no telling how large the other apps unless I hear it from you yelpers. But there was some stuff that sounded good.

Amazing restaurant. We tried almost everything on the menu and it was delicious. Great atmosphere and it's not super loud so we can talk comfortably. 

Highly recommended! Drinks were great too.

I have nothing negative to say about Sushi Roku. I had the seaweed salad and lobster tempura. The salad was very generous as was the lobster. The service was superb! My husband got the tasting menu and it did not disappoint. A lot of variety and they happy switched out the scallops to which he's allergic to. I can't recommend Sushi Roku highly enough.

People should seriously stop whining about prices in good restaurants.
The sushi here isn't "mediocre" as others claim. it's GOOD, quality sushi.
it melts in your mouth and your taste buds will thank you for every bite.
We were hungry, we wanted a good restaurant and that's what we got.
lots of food + sake + tax n tip cost us 80 bucks a person, but I can confidently say it was worth every penny, especially considering the gorgeous interior and the view of the strip while you're indulging.
Keep up the good work Roku!

Great sushi place, probably the best in Scottsdale.


Great ambiance and design, good service and great manager.

The W is pretty much always on point with its restaurant partners. 

Try the diced Chilies and hamachi. Amazing.
Amazing view and service by Juliana and a lovely girl Janet who dropped off every plate with excellent descriptions.

Best happy hour in Vegas!  Bartender was great and steered us to the best items on the menu.  Don't miss the miso eggplant or the rib eye wrapped asparagus - both are amazing and the portions are a decent size.  You can definitely make a great meal out of the happy hour utms and try many different dishes - they have over 30 on the list!

Had dinner here with a party of 25 people and it was an absolute disaster! Customer service was horrible and would they would not split the bill. Horrible experience for a friend's birthday party. We will not be back.

yes yes yes!  amazing happy hour sushi.  the bartenders are friendly, the expensive far east mule cocktail was to die for, and the sushi rolls were phenomenal.  

Rock Shrimp Tempura Jalapeno and spicy tuna rolls were amazing, as were other I tried.  small seating area for happy hour, but force yourself in because it's well worth it.  

I was able to get the free wifi from the close coffee place while eating.

I wanted to like this place more than I did. 

Let's start with the good... Our waiter was excellent, truly top notch. He was attentive without going overboard. The restaurant is lovely. Nice layout, comfortable tables. We were shown to a table immediately without a wait. The restaurant was relatively quiet, which I appreciate.

Now for the not as good... We ordered the tower of fish. They had two versions on the menu. Their standard one for $99 and the premium one for $172. We initially ordered the standard one thinking that ought to be enough to feed three of us (2 adults, 1 child).  We figured this would give us some variety. Our waiter suggested that the premium one would be more satisfactory since it was all we were ordering.They had several special fish on the menu that sounded delicious so we agreed. However, it turned out there was nothing special about the selection we received. 6 oysters, 6 crab legs, 4 pieces each of albacore, tuna, salmon, and yellowtail sashimi, 1 scallop and 6 shrimp. The tuna was so-so.  The rest was well prepared but there was nothing special or exotic about it. We also ordered the sake sampler which again stuck with fairly standard sakes. Nothing particularly interesting that you wouldn't have had if you enjoy sakes.

For the price, I was let down by the dullness of their selections. That issue aside what they did serve was fine though not spectacular.

This place has a beautiful view of the strip! I have been here before a couple of times. I started with some Okunomat Sake for $35 for me and my husband to share. That was my first time trying it and I loved it. I then ordered the "Avocado Hanabi" for $15. It is a cube of greasy fried white rice topped with Avocado, it needed some kind of sauce and crunchy topping. I also tried the "Katana Roll" for $23. Again it was good, but just wasn't amazing. Overall, 5 stars for view, 4 stars for service, 3 stars for food.

We were staying at the W and decided to grab dinner here one night. Very friendly wait staff.

Ordered truffle edamame, crunch spicy tuna roll, makato roll, and popcorn shrimp tempura.

Truffle edamame - loved it, great flavor
The sushi rolls were good, nothing amazing.
Shrimp tempura was also ok.

Overall food was ok/ good- nothing exceptional.

We had the wild mushroom carpaccio which was exquisitly delicate.  Just the right amount of sweet and vinegar.  The sushi was quite fresh and the decor was wonderful with a nice view of the strip.  Service was also excellent.  Plus the people watching in the mall was an added bonus.

Much better than some other outlets in this chain. The trick here is to order appetizers, such as the tuna sashimi with crispy garlic chips, or yellowtail and spicy tuna on crispy rice, not conventional sushi and rolls, which are just so-so.

If you're in the mood for overpriced, subpar sushi then this is probably the place for you. But if you want decently priced, good quality sushi - I recommend you take your money elsewhere. The boyfriend and I made reservations during our recent trip to Vegas to celebrate his birthday and we felt like we ordered a good amount of food - but the portions are pretty small, more like tapas and not main courses. We got the baked lobster roll, the tuna jalepeno roll, the eel avocado roll as well as free range chicken dish. The sushi wasn't quite as "fresh" as we expected and the chicken was... dry. The check came up to a little over $100 and we although we are pretty small eaters we had to go and get a round of burgers at shake shack later that night so we didn't have to go to sleep hungry.
Love sitting at the sushi bar, the chef's are always super friendly and really fun to watch. The urchin with the quail egg is a MUST for all you sushi lovers.

First time here. Delicious sushi and chefs sashimi. Excellent service. Specialty cocktails are great and don't forget dessert!! Donuts are best finish!!  Pricey but great views and great food! What do you expect on the Strip?!?!

Sushi roku was one of the best restaurant choices we made while in Vegas. Although it was hard to find in the hotel/casino, the Ambiance and view were worth the walk. I had the tuna appetizer and popcorn shrimp along with a few rolls. Everything was awesome. One of our friends didn't like raw fish and still enjoyed the other menu items. From the sake to the salad, I would rave about this place. Next time I'm in Vegas, I will be sure to come back!!!!!

We showed up out of the blue on Valentine's night looking for food. We got a seat at the sushi bar right away, but the place was otherwise packed. I guess we were lucky. We passed on the V-day prix-fixe menu and decided to order as we ate.

Our waitress was visibly perturbed by my wife's order of tap water to drink and vegetable tempura to start. Judging by her expression, she took us for deadbeats; it wasn't offensive but hilarious, we're old enough to be confident in our own opinions of ourselves. Anyway, the vibe at the W was definitely people trying hard to be cool and of-the-moment.

In any event, we struck up a conversation with the chef behind the bar where we were sitting. We initially ordered some basic sashimi dishes, but when I asked the chef for suggestions, he started rattling off a series of custom creations he could make. So we let him do his best, and he turned out a great collection of sashimi dishes, none, at least as far as I could tell, on the menu. 

We had a great meal, and we would definitely return, at least if we didn't live in San Diego.

(The waitress eventually warmed up, probably thawing as she watched us eat through plate after plate of sashimi....)
We had a wonderful meal here on our recent trip to Las Vegas.  We tried some items from the menu as well as some specials - all were delicious - flavorful, fresh & creative.  Excellent service too.

Really excellent sushi. We tried a variety of rolls, sashimi, as well as the baked cod. Everything was great, although we ordered a few too many of the "eccentric" rolls that are either partially or entirely fried, or have a combination of multiple types of fish. I prefer the simpler items, and we had plenty of those, and they were just incredibly. The baked cod is also a great item to mix in with cold sushi.

For sake, we had cold unfiltered sake and it was delicious. A great alternative to the steak and shellfish restaurants in this area!

I've hit the Happy Hour here each of the three past years. Consistently good (great?) HH menu and great prices. My favorites were the hand rolled jalapeno shrimp & the sashimi. Best dessert value in town just might be their $3 chocolate lava cake with ice cream. Save room for 1 or 2 of their house specialty drinks. The Crush & Ginger Lychee Mojito were both great.

Sushi Roku is a cute chic restaurant inside the W, but I was unimpressed with the semi slow service and small variety of sushi variety on the menu.  All in all, I think it's a good place to hang out in groups because of the decor and the drink selection.

We came in few weeks ago for an early dinner.  It was pretty empty since Vegas wakes up later on.  We were seated right away.  

Our waitress Debra M was polite and helpful.  Actually,  everyone was very welcoming.

We ordered...
Brussels sprouts 
Spicy miso soup 
Yellowtail diced
Hamachi Belly
Jalapeno Toro cut
Seabass with Truffle oil

Everything was fresh and tasty.  Portions were very small.  This coming from a person who prefers small portions.  So if I am saying small portions,  it's something.  Was it the best ever food?  No.  But it was pretty good.   

Since it's Vegas and there are so many other options, I doubt that I'll be back.
Absolutely one of the best sushi restaurants that I've experienced in Las Vegas. Great location, amazing sushi, and great prices.

Do you LOVE great food, a fun atmosphere for any kind of celebration, and spending about $60 per person for a cocktails and bites? If so, Sushi Roku is the place for you.

I made a reservation at SR via opentable.com, and our group of 7 were promptly seated. They have a fun offering of cocktails, and a decent wine list too.

Our table indulged in several sushi rolls, edamame, and other mains. Go for the panko crusted salmon (2 of us split the entrée, and it was plenty), and pass up the beef skewers (they tasted *off*, and were ultimately sent back and taken off the bill). 

After dinner, we were escorted by the restaurant manager to the velvet roped hotel lounge area where there was *LIVE* music. 

SO FUN.

Trendy place with great service and atmosphere. But like any tapas place, it is "starving in style" :-)

Will definitely visit again ... And even though I am not a tapas aficionado, I do appreciate the attention to detail in presentation and taste. This place meets or beats anything I have experienced in DC.

This review is tough, because I had a pretty good experience the first time and I really don't like giving poor reviews but I felt I had to share.  I've spent my time working in the restaurant world and I try to be very easy/understanding because I know it can be stressful. 

First experience a couple months ago was great, I'd give it 4 stars. Atmosphere is upbeat and fun, food is creative, it was good but high priced for what you get.  I went back because I had a good time, my second visit was terrible.  Our server Michelle was very rude (we're very easy/kind/not demanding), she snapped at us, messed up the order multiple times, and wouldn't even divide a check between two couples.  Every time we asked for something she'd snap right away "NO" and acted as if we were an inconvenience.  It was really disappointing because I brought friends and bragged about the place to come celebrate a special occasion, and it turned out terrible. I rarely leave a poor review but my overall opinion is good is decent, little too high priced, but worst service I've had in the last 2 years .

Our group came for Happy Hour on a Friday. We ordered right before HH ended at 6pm, the waitress was super friendly and patient as a few of us who arrived late ran in just in time to place our orders.  

The table had the hummus with pita bread ($6) to share after hearing good reviews on it.  I found this dish was just OK though I'm not normally a fan of hummus anyways. We ran out of Pita bread and had to order more as we still had plenty of hummus left. I personally had a Hot Sake ($3), the Brussel Sprouts ($5), the RibEye wrapped Asparagus ($7), and the A2 Fusion sushi roll ($6).  The veggie dishes all tasted great! The crispy pork that came with the brussel sprouts added nice contrast in texture and taste to complement the already well flavored brussel sprouts. The asparagus dish was also done well - loved the soy-mirin sauce - and easy to cut through and eat (meaning the rib-eye was done just right and wasn't too overcooked or tough). The A2 Fusion sushi roll was disappointing though, I don't even remember how it tastes now... 

The prices are great for being in Caesars Palace, the quality was there, and the food had great flavors for the most part. Service was also excellent; we were checked on frequently but not intrusively, and all with friendly smiles. Would definitely come here again to try more of their dishes.

Sushi Roku is inside Caesar's Palace on the third floor of the Forum Shops. The inside is a mix of modern and Asian design. It looks sleek and posh. 

The food is a little pricey, but it is understandable since it's on the Strip. The view from the dining area is really nice. I ordered the spicy tuna roll because I am a huge fan of spicy tuna. It did not disappoint. The tuna was very fresh and it was obviously much better quality than other sushi places. 

This is a good place to go for dinner before a night out. Nice and classy.

Beautiful restaurant and beautiful people in a beautiful hotel.  It's rather dark and loud, but I'm assuming that's the entire trendy feel they're going for.  Cocktails were good, I had the Pear Martini but I tried the Lychee which was even better.

We were a group of 10 for a bachelorette party, so we opted to share a ton of appetizers and sushi rolls:  

Edamame:  extremely oversalted
Yellowtail Sashimi:  9 extremely thin slices, delicious
Mixed Vegetable Tempura:  anything fried is good
Shishito Japanese Peppers: Awesome, except some of the peppers were unexpectedly too spicy
Crunchy Spicy Tuna: one of my favorites
Caterpillar:  My favorite (I love eel)
Baked Lobster:  Too much mayo (I'm not a big mayo fan)

We had some girls that were vegetarian, and there was a ton of selection for them, as well.  Great restaurant option if you're staying in the hotel.

We had a lovely sushi dinner tonight at Sushi Roku! I enjoyed the delicious calamari and ramen. We are celebrating a bachelorette party and they brought out a complimentary dessert with a sparkler. So unexpected and so nice! Great view of the whole strip.

Our service was terrible. We waited at least 30 minutes for our waiter, and then another hour and a half for our meals, and this was when the restaurant was NEAR EMPTY. The food was average for being overpriced and the overall experience was basically moot.

Our server Romi, specifically, was not communicative and responsive to our needs until after we complained. They tried to reconcile with dessert but it didn't outweigh the poor service.

In short, you're better off buying fast food. At least then it's affordable and the service is timely.
This place is great, service & atmosphere are amazing. Makoto roll is amazing and the scallop cut roll is great. Waitress was great with recommendations.  Will be back for sure on our next Vegas trip

I made reservations for 7 at Sushi Roku for a bachelorette party dinner and everything went perfectly. We were seated right away upon arrival and received great service throughout. Our server was so attentive and knowledgeable and really made us all feel like he cared about our table. Everyone ordered alcoholic beverages, which were strong and tasty, and miso soup to start. We then ordered individual meals and the server happily split up our tab accordingly.

I ordered the Katana Roll: Spicy Tuna and Shrimp Tempura topped with Tuna and Yellowtail for $23 and it was delicious. It was spicy, but the roll was large (8 pieces) and plenty to fill me up. The Signature Rolls all came with 6-8 pieces depending on their contents and the other Rolls came with 4-6 depending on their content. 

I would highly recommend Sushi Roku for a romantic dinner, night out with friends, etc. it has everything you need. The ambiance was slightly dark, but worked perfectly with the Las Vegas Strip right outside the window lighting everything up. Best meal we had during our stay.

MY FIRST REVIEW IN OVER A MONTH, sorry I've been away for so long Yelp!! Now onto the review.

Cute place BUT looks can be deceiving, as we all know. 

AWESOME VIEW
Located on the second floor inside Caesars Palace, Sushi Roku looked promising because of the attractive decor and beautiful seating, the place practically looked like a lounge. Oh and I forgot to mention that the view is pretty awesome. 

Our reservations were made for 10pm on a Thursday night, which I kind of thought was weird because they close at 10 BUT hey whatever. 

KEEP ON ROLLING WITH THE DISAPPOINTMENTS
We ordered at least 10 rolls, might have even been 12. But each roll that came out was just as disappointing as the next!!! I'm not use to eating crappy sushi, can't expect too much from a Japanese restaurant on The Strip. The last roll that came out had my friends wanting to spit it out, they described the taste as rosemary soap (WE SENT THE DISH BACK BECAUSE IT WAS THAT BAD). Needless to say I did NOT try it because knowing me and my gag reflexes, I would have thrown up on the person sitting across from me after eating that. 

One star for the laid back ambiance and awesome view.

Less than Average sushi, wannabe Vegas vibe, trashy clientele. Highly disappointing. Upon ordering our server told us we couldn't order one of the items we wanted because it was no good. Another item was not acceptable to her either because it was the "cheap version" of a souped up roll on the menu (that was double the price). Our server was extremely pushy, rude and inattentive. We ordered 4 sushi rolls and water (7 dollars a BOTTLE!) and our total came to $100. We are local and never coming back!

We had dinner here and the Chilean sea bass was amazing. So was the filet mignon and the poke. The only thing I didn't like was the lobster sushi roll. Everything else was amazing right down to the asparagus.

So it's my birthday night and made reservations ahead. I showed up and didn't have enough chairs and tables for my party. After asking for manager and complaining they added an extra table with chairs. After that they kept telling us they had reservations after which was total bull because nobody was after other than new people. So yes after a while they pretty much kicked us out the table and threw out some drinks that friends didn't drink because they went to the bathroom and still got charged. And to top it off I was not impressed with the food. So although they tried to accommodate me and my party they still sucked. Only good thing was that the place was pretty.

Great food and fantastic ambiance!  What a pleasure it is to see the General Manager walking around greeting every table and ensuring the guests were happy.  He made great suggestions to our dishes and even made us laugh.  I haven't seen this type of service from the top down in decades from an establishment especially in Vegas! Definitely a place to visit!!!

Tonight we made the mistake of not making reservations, for their 50% off sushi night. I will own up to that. But myself and two others showed up at 4:55 not thinking this would be a problem. Three cold hostesses informed us that they don't open until 5:30, and that they are fully booked. Having worked in the restaurant industry myself I completely understood the fact that they were fully booked on this night, again, my bad. They told us the bar top (5 seats) was open though, and to return at 5:30 when they open. We went to the bar at the W to order a drink. At 5:25 we walked over to the hostess stand. The first thing they said to us was that we couldn't take our drinks in. Fine, understood. But the tone again was not appreciated. Then we look and the 5 seats at the bar are FULL. I'm sorry, at 4:55 you told us we couldn't be seated until 5:30. And at 5:25 those seats are taken? I'm giving roku 2 stars because I know their sushi is good. Which is why we wanted to dine there. And again, I get that we should have made a reservation. But the ice queens at the front door coupled with the early seating when we were told we couldn't sit down, made us feel like we weren't worthy of sushi roku scottsdale.

Do not come here with a large group. I give three stars only because our wait person was working really hard.

However, she was our ONLY wait person. She waited, she ran out food, she ran our drinks and she bussed our table. Not cool when you're rolling 20 deep.

The food was ok. Many items, like the chicken dish, were under cooked. I know it's a sushi place but chicken is chicken and is usually cooked, even in Japan.

The rolls were good but very slow to come out.

Basically they treated a large group of high rolling business people as a group of 20 somethings.

I don't recommend this place. Just go somewhere else especially with a large group.

FYI, we made reservations a week in advance so they knew we were coming.

Abolsutely wonderful! Great central location and view from Ceasar's Palace! I had sushi while my daughter had the ramen bowl. Now, we have been to Japan before and this ramen bowl was better than the ramen that we had in Japan itself. The food also came out varily quickly which surprised both my daughter and I. Wonderful place and I would very much recommend if you want sushi on the strip.

Great restaurant with great views of the strip. Great service and atmosphere. I had their filet mignon, which was pretty decent for a sushi/Jap restaurant. Their sushi was good too. I think this restaurant is more for the atmosphere than for the food. Don't get me wrong though. It's not like their food is subpar or anything. It is decent.

Not much of a hang out in Scottsdale person, but we happened to stumble on a Groupon for this place one day.  (And it was an awesome Groupon)  The place had a very nice atmosphere and decor, and we went a little earlier so it wasn't super busy.  I always feel bad for the servers that get those groupons because I know some assholes dont tip very well when bills are discounted, but our server Zach, was upbeat and very helpful in helping us pick out menu items.  The quality of the fish was excellent.  The spicy tuna on the rice cake thing was soooooooo good.  This place is definitely pricey, but if you can afford it, its definitely worth it.

EXCELLENT! You must come to Sushi Roku while in vegas. The food is perfection, the GM is first class all the way, and service is spot on. This restaurant is in The Forum Shops at cesars. It has great views of the strip. I was there this Friday and everything was beyond amazing. Great for late night dinning. Thanks Sushi Roku Vegas team.

Went for a romantic date nite and it was amazing!! If you are going to splurge on a night out for sushi- this is the place I would recommend. The sushi is the best I've had in Arizona, and the service was terrific and efficient. The waitress gave recommendations, and made sure to accommodate to my allergy.. (Being Celiac makes me a bit worried to eat out but the waitress and manager reassured everything was not cross contaminated.)
I recommend the Taro and basically all the sashimi and rolls.

Went to Sushi Roku to celebrate my girlfriends birthday. Met Johnny the GM and Chef Alan. We had an amazing and wonderful dinner here. Everything we tried was really delicious. Really love the Spicy Tuna on Fried Sticky Rice and the Japonais Ribeye Steak. All of my girls had a blast here.

Living down the street we stop by for happy hour a few times a year.  The spicy tuna and salmon rolls both cut and hand are superb.  Other appetizers such as pork belly, Kobe beef, hummus, and fried chicken are also good.  It is not a cheap happy hour but good food is not cheap.  The Japanese beer is a great change of pace.

I'm a fan of the Sushi Roku chain and this is my first venture to the Vegas one... we were staying at Caesars and wanted a close place for dinner our first night there.

Great decor and amazing view of the strip from our table by the window.  Considering it was a Tues night, the place was packed but service was top notch.

Prices are in line with the other Sushi Roku's, which means pricey.  I live in one of the cities with the best sushi, so in terms of quality, Sushi Roku is a not the best or freshest I've had, but it's damn good considering it's in the middle of the Vegas desert!

We had a nice mix of tempura, beef, popcorn rock shrimp, and sushi - we had toro, salmon, unagi and spanish mackerel which are my go-to's.  Everything was a solid 4* and a nice variety of good fishes on the menu.

Liked it!  It's in the W hotel and my first trial of this chain.  The decor is great and I loved the large tables.

Sushi quality was very good.  I still prefer Nobu, but this chain is very comparable.  I had the usual mix of what I like: edamame beans, unagi sushi, a sashimi mix, rolls and their rock shrimp.  I first fell in love with rock shrimp at Nobu, and I think Sushi Roku does a very good version of it!  Tasty and good sized potions.  The fish has a nice flavor and texture.  The rolls were good quality - we had a spicy salmon roll (not on the menu but they allowed the subsitution), tuna toro with jalapeno, and a dynamite.

This place is pricey but I was happy with the meal and service and would return.

Love this place and if you get great seating, you have the view to the whole strip. The food here is great!
