I've asked for certain rolls that I have eaten at their SoCal location, and they were happy to make for me. Servers are attentive and the sushi chefs are all entertaining and friendly. Quality is always above and beyond, no complaints!

Ok, ok, I'll give you 5 stars Sushi Roku.  I'm not a sushi fan at all but I was invited to attend a private birthday dinner here with one of my closest friends, how could I say no?

All aspects of the evening were planned in advance and I'm quite impressed with the level of professionalism each memeber of the staff here at Sushi Roku possessed. On point from start to finish!

I experienced some new eats on this night including sashimi (sp?)!  Much to my surprise the sashimi (tuna and yellowtale) was one of my favorite items tasted this evening. Still not a fan of actual sushi rolls, we're still making progress people.

Should the taste buds have a calling for sushi (or sashimi), Sush Roku would be at the top of the list.
We only came for the happy hour, and overall, it's a good deal.  For 6 bucks, you can get simple, yet decent rolls.  Beers were also  nicely priced.  For it being the strip, it was pretty affordable.

OK so where do I start first off the place looks cool and has a really truly awesome assortment of food on the menu. Plenty to choose from including carpoccios which are my fav. 

I ordered the 

tuna carpaccio = the fish was sliced too thick and had what tasted like a salty bottle bought ponzu. Dont order this if you want carpaccio 

Yellowtail carpaccio = delicious sliced thin and had the oils and herbs perfect. A good size too. 

Miso soup = the same as everywhere else 

The Katana roll = dude this thing is freaking amazing but for 16 bucks I dont know soo good though. 

some beef wrapped in asparagus= soo bad I took it back 

Spicy Tuna was over minced like mush 

All in all the meal was good but for 70 bucks I left hungry and pissed 

The waiter was soo weird and creepy. I was there with my gf and a friend and he asked my friend if she was having a rough night, WTF!!! Dont ask a girl if she was having a rough night. Might as well said you look like shit. So weird. 
Oh and the fact he only talked to my gf when he was addressing any of us. Talking to him was like pulling teeth soo damn weird. 


I did go back a second time and had good food and a waitress with a name with like all syllables. I wish I could remember it because she really is the best

Walked the entire strip to have dinner here. Showed up during happy hour. The food was excellent and came out quickly. The spicy tuna on crispy rice, calamari and crispy shrimp are all to die for. We also got a few rolls including California, Crispy Shrimp w/ Jalapeño and Spicy Tuna on top of Crispy Shrimp. We enjoyed them all. Annie, our bartender/server, was very easy going, sweet and friendly. All in all, it was a great experience.

This place is awesome. I experienced fantastic service, delicious sushi, and great omakase from Mike.  He was very knowledgeable on sake wine and liquor.  Every time I'm in Phoenix this is my go to spot. They take great care of me when I stay at the W. Also check out their happy hour!

I experienced the BEST service I have ever received at Sushi Roku this past weekend, if I could rate this place 10 stars I would. We had a large group in for a friend's birthday, and had to wait about 15 minutes for our table due to a conflict. Although we were hardly bothered by the wait, the manager came by to apologize for the inconvenience, and even sent us a few free appetizers. He stopped by several times to see how we were doing, and our waitress made sure to make the night as special as she could for our group. I highly recommend this restaurant for a nice and affordable night out--the staff is so friendly and the food is phenomenal!

We went there to dine after the Rock n roll marathon. The place was highly rated on Yelp and we were very excited to try it out. The sushi/fish was fresh and delicious. However, the miso soup was salty and they forgot to add in seaweed. Our waitress service was subpar especially for this upscale restaurant. She didn't refill any of our drinks. She didn't check back on us to see if we needed anything else until it was time for dessert. She came to the table in front of us more than 5 times during our visit but no more than 2 times to our table. Also,  the 2 hostesses at the front were not welcoming compared to other restaurants in Vegas. This was a total disappointment.  Sad to say but we will not be coming back to this establishment.

Good.....not great. The food was tasty but I don't recommend doing a "trust me" menu with the waiter alone.....our waiter told us he would prepare one we could share and it was very lackluster (i'm taking about beyond basic...spice tuna roll, tuna sushi, pot-stickers) so that was disappointing. Nice ambiance, but for the prices, I would go somewhere more upscale and that takes more risks, like Nobu. Also it was a birthday and I told 4 people but they still forgot to bring my husband the desert and sparkler to the table.....I ended up having to remind them and they served it to him in the bar on the way out...pretty lame but better than nothing. Don't do a special dinner here is what I would recommend.

I can always expect good quality sashimi at sushi roku.
and the black cod is really good too!

Never been here before, but they were having a "half-off" promotion to celebrate their birthday.  Basically half off your entire bill.  Great deal.  However if I was to judge this place based on their normal prices, I'm not sure I would've considered this place worth the money.

The place is set on the bottom floor of W Hotel in Scottsdale and it meshes very well with the reputation and the vibe of the hotel.  Hip, sheik, trendy, while at times bordering on over the top.  The hostesses are screaming at the sushi bar everytime they walk their guests to their tables (sounded like they were yelling fishaaaay or something).  Got really annoying after awhile.  But I digress.

For the appetizer we got the crispy rice asparagus.  Basically an asparagus skewer covered in a fried batter of rice and peanuts.  The saltiness took me by surprise.  Not bad, but not what I anticipated.  For the main dish, we got the twelve piece assortment to share.  In reality it was more of a 20 piece dish as they served a mixture of california rolls, crab tempura, and a mix of different sashimis.  Basically reads like a greatest hits menu.  The albacore and octopus weren't really my thing, but the crab, tuna, and salmon were all pretty good.  It was more than enough sushi for two.  We washed it down with some saki of course.  For dessert we had a chocolate lava cake.  They got this one right, as the chocolate was moist on the outside and liquid hot on in the inside.

All totaled, one appetizer plus the sushi assortment, saki for two, dessert for two, with the 50% discount and tip was $55.  Great deal with the discount.  Normal prices are somewhat in line with some of the popular sushi venues I've been to (though you pay a little more for the venue I'd imagine).  Personally I like going to the small local mom and pop Japanese establishments like Hana, Tokyo Lobby, and Cherryblossom.  The prices are right, the quality is just as good (if not better), and its feels like a more authentic experience.  But thats just me.  If you're not picky about atmosphere or price and just want a sushi fix, this trendy Scottsdale spot will suffice.

I love sushi and Japanese food, I tried this place for delivery because I was craving ramen but I was disappointed. Their $15 pork ramen came with 2 tiny slices of pork, the spinach salad was 1/2 a cup for $7 it was salty n tasted like strong vinegar... couldn't eat it. The California roll was good but standard and you get 6 pieces for $10+. This place is overpriced.
Best sushi we have had to date. Staff was attentive, and very knowledgable. Very impressed with every aspect of Roku!

I really like the ambience of this place.  It has a great view of the strip, great location in Caesars palace beside the fountains & statues.  I like the sushi selection and the way they presented the food made it more appealing.  Besides aesthetics,  the food was great.  I've been to plenty of sushi places & this is one of my favorites.  The desserts were great as well!  I forget exactly what it was I had but someone posted a picture of it (it was a decadent chocolate cake with ice-cream). . . it was delicious.  Must try this place.
I cant believe people think this is good sushi. The 8 piece chef special was sour and soggy. Very over priced and terrible. Save your money. I was ripped off.

This is no 4 star sushi restaurant!  Anyone that reviews this place 3 stars or more is used to eating sushi in Alabama gas station. I do not remember the last time I had worse sushi. The fish was flavorless and chewy and the tuna smelled. This is by far the worst sushi experience I've ever had and what's worse is I spent 60 bucks for 3 ITEMS and I'm leaving the restaurant still hungry.

This was my first visit to Sushi Roku. It was a nice setting and the decor is very pleasant. The service was just okay, nothing special. The food was good. We had a premium priced edamame beans that were pretty much the same as I have had everywhere including the frozen food section of my local store. The Ikura, Uni were both good, but again not over the top. The soft-shelled crab was very nice. We also had a couple of rolls that again were good, but not memorable. All in all it was a good dinner. Had a chance to catch-up with friends. The noise level was good so having a conversation was easy.
Met my brother here for a quick bite... The food was good, but not AMAZING. Prices are high since it is located inside the Caesars Palace Forum Shops- but the service was great.

Hands down the best Chilean sea bass I've ever had. Listed as an appetizer, can be a meal with a sushi roll on the side. Great sake and wine selection. Amazing sashimi as well. Excellent service. Great ambiance , perfect for a date or business dinner. Some seats have a view of the strip. I would definitely go back.

Place is really nice and servers are really. Ordered some sushi and sashimi and fired rice. Rolls don't tastes good, sashimi and sushi are really good for this price. I would expect much tasty than other sushi restaurant.

We stopped by for lunch as it was the closest Sushi place nearby. I'm definitely glad we checked it out, the food and service was excellent. 

We had the Specialty Roll: Shima Roll and the flavors were superb.
I recommend the Banana Flambe for the dessert!

Will definitely come back again on our next trip!

Came here for a late dinner and the food was super good!! We met Johnny, one of the partners of the restaurant as he was going around the tables. This is a really nice touch! Quality service and we enjoyed talking to him. Our server was quite busy with another table, but we understood and he ended up making up for it. What a nice guy!  

Must Try:

Baked Lobster Roll
Beef wrapped Asparagus 
Beef skewers (Waygu?)

Pretty good sushi - expensive for sure. Small pieces of nigiri..our waitress was really nice, service I thought was excellent. The daily special tako roll was excellent. Soft shell crab plate was like ..really..really small. And it was over $20. A+ for service. B for size portions. A for taste. I'd recommend you trying it.

Ate here for lunch. Everything was delicious. Love the U-shaped booth seating. Super comfy..Our waiter was very friendly and put up with us changing our order a bunch of times. We randomly mentioned us celebrating our friend's birthday and to our surprise our waiter brought out a yummy banana flambe with a champagne glass filled with white sugar and a giant sparkler. 

Although we enjoyed our meal, service, etc. there are so many great sushi places in town to try, so it might be awhile before we come back.

Review is for takeout only:
-called at 615 on a Sunday to place a takeout order and was put on hold for 10 minutes before the hostess took my order
-was told my food would be ready in 35-40 minutes
-I arrived at the restaurant 45 minutes later and waited another 20 minutes for my food (which was just edamame, brussel sprout chips and two sushi rolls)
-stupidly did not check the food handed to me as I was in such a hurry to leave, but they gave me a shrimp instead of eel roll
-will never order takeout here again

New favorite!  The spicy tuna and jalapeño roll. Spicy and amazing!  

The Katana roll was also delicious. It had shrimp tempura with tuna and yellowtail on top.

Tried it for the first time. Overall, good experience, but would recommend stick with raw fish as that was certainly the highlight.

-salmon sashimi - delicious
-toro sushi - heavenly and worth the market price
-eel avocado hand roll - like any sushi joint so skip it if you are looking for special items
-baked crab hand roll - its much better at katsuya  so this is a definite pass
-hanabi - how can you mess up spicy tuna on crispy rice- order it

Look forward to trying more sashimi on my next visit...

Great sushi restaurant in the Forum Shops at Caesars Palace. The atmosphere is very open, with a modern Japanese vibe. We ordered a bunch of dishes to share. Among them, the roasted cauliflower, miso eggplant, tofu 3 ways, and a vegetable roll that they let us choose the ingredients for. The only item we didn't like was the slabs of cold tofu. I love tofu, but we couldn't even eat this. Everything else was great!

Las Vegas has tons of high-end sushi restaurants battling it out to be known as the best (Nobu, anyone?). We try a new one each time we are in town (eventually we will be able to name our favorite... maybe). This trip we tried Sushi Roku in the Forum Shops.
We are sushi lovers, but for some reason other dishes called out to us more at this restaurant.  We decided to try a few of the premium (read high quality ingredients and therefore expensive) appetizers.

We started with Kobe beef tataki - a method involving a brief sear, slicing thinly, and marinating in vinegar or, in this case, garlic and ponzu. This was one of my husband's favorite dishes from the whole trip - he was very tempted to order a second round.
Next we had a salmon carpaccio with truffle soy vinaigrette which was very tasty.
Lastly we had panko crusted salmon with wasabi and tonkatsu sauces. This was one of my favorite dishes of the whole trip. The salmon was warm and flaky and moist on the inside with a crispy crust of panko on the outside. The wasabi cream and the tangy, savory tonkatsu sauce (typically served with breaded, fried pork) worked perfectly together. I could eat this every day and I would be very happy.
We both love unfiltered sake, and Roku had a very good one that we had not seen anywhere else before.

2 out of three dishes being overall trip favorites gives this place 5 stars!

The only thing better than the food is the service !

Easy location, Attentive waitstaff, plentiful menu. The only struggle is deciding what to order.

Food was so amazing. What made the meal special was our waitress Danielle. She knew the menu inside and out and made wonderful recommendations. My only complaint are the prices. Average $22/roll but the fish was very fresh. Ask for the White Lotus roll - it's not on the menu.

The restaurant is kind of tucked away from the stores inside Caesar's but it's a hidden gem. The inside is presented very nicely. They have happy hour between 4-7pm and has a decent number of options for a good price considering the price of the original menu. They have a whole variety of liquor at their bar. It's perfect for a late lunch between touring all around Vegas. The sushi was really good and fresh. They aren't that much though but I did not complain because the side dishes/apps were pretty filling m.

Call me ... not impressed?

Okay, I get it, this is again supposed to be one of these hip, nobu type of places that you don't really get sushi, or American food, you just kind of pay for the atmosphere. Well there isn't really much of that here so I'm not entirely sure what you're paying for.

It's definitely another to be seen place, but it's not even very good at that. It's in the forum shops for one ... and they just can't seem to decide what kind of restaurant they truly are. 

The sushi rice is terrible, and the sashimi is hit or miss. Their hot food takes eons, literally ... and the drinks are overpriced. Basically, skip.

The sushi was pretty good for happy hour! I don't like it nearly as much as ZEN32 but the waiters were cute and its a little fancier than some other local sushi joints. A good choice if your tired of other sushi places in the valley.
Great place...excellent sushi, and they encouraged pounding on the table for our Saki Bombs! love it.

Great ambience, exceptional service and over the top food.  I have been to this location many times and it has been consistently top notch.  Usually get the "Omakase" (chefs choice).  I have tasted many different offerings and everything is fresh and tasty.  Not a sushi person...they do have beef as well and I wouldn't pass that up either.  I am told all their chefs are master sushi chefs from Japan...and it shows.  If you're looking for a $10-15 meal...this is not the place for you.
Very nice! The atmosphere is a bit mall restaurant and there were kids galore, but the fish was super fresh. We tried several inventive dishes, including blue fin tuna with truffles.

the restaurant is trendy and has a great view. even though the place was not too crowded, the noise level is a bit intense - so on a busy night, it would probably be really noisy. 

we came for the sushi and overall, it was okay. it was fresh enough, but not the best i've had. we had the 'special' which was foie gras wrapped in hamachi and topped with black truffles. that was yummy - and you paid for it! ($50 for 3 pieces). dessert was actually very good - we had the tempura green tea and it was pretty awesome.

service was a bit uneven. you really expect great service for the price you pay, but they were just 'okay'. for a part of two - we ordered several sushi rolls; sake; and dessert and spent about $150.

overall, a good experience but wouldn't frequent this place.

We were a little scared from the front since it was a Thursday night and it seemed empty, but after walking to the back of the restaurant, we realized everyone wanted to sit by the view over looking the strip-ROMANTIC.

Honestly, I could live off the spicy tuna here. It's perfectly spicy, perfectly textured, and perfectly great. Try the spicy scallop hand roll and yellowtail sushi too; all their fish is extremely high quality, and it obviously reflects the steep prices.

We ordered a bottle of Saki (can't remember the name, probably because I couldn't  pronounce it at the time), and it went down extremely smooth and had a great, light flavor.. Our waitress would run over everytime she saw our shot glasses empty and pour us another round; ROYAL TREATMENT.

I come here a lot to eat with friends.  The sushi is always amazing but...  The service is terrible.  It will be dead and the service is still terrible.  Takes 30 mins to have someone come to your table after being seated.  Then 30 mins to get water.  30 mins to bring your drink.  Dishes left all over the table.  They bring a dish all the old dishes I have to hold them while they place them and give them to someone.  I'm always dressed up.  I risk getting my outfit dirty being their buss boy.  We started to order 2 drinks at a time when we go now.  To be paying $800 and more every time we come to get sushi service should be amazing.  This has been going on for years here.  Hire a top of the line restaurant manager and servers and more help.  Such a great location and food service is ruining your restaurant.  Get it together and fast.
Since I live in Florida I'm a little spoiled with good sushi quality. I didn't feel this restaurant had great sushi and it was extremely overpriced.

One of the most fun nights I've ever had was spent at Sushi Roku.  Ambiance excellent, service excellent, food excellent, experience excellent!  The 50 minute wait even with 7:00pm reservations -1 star.  

We were a group of 8.  Cold and hot/ filtered and unfiltered sakes came out very fast.  On to the apps.  Everything ranging from edamae to homemade tofu to traditional house salad with ginger dressing was ordered and everything was delicious.  For dinner everyone was there for sushi except for one couple.   The meat eater chose the Japanese Kobe Wagyu dish which almost made me wish I got that instead of sushi and his wife chose the Chilean Sea Bass dish..... beautiful presentation on both.  

As for the sushi goers:  Blue Fin Tuna, I've never had it before, fresh and amazing!  All of the basics... Toro, Yellowtail, Salmon, Snapper, Halibut, Eel, etc.  (Don't hate my review because I'm using the American names... I don't want to screw up the spelling......) and then the rolls.....Spicy Tuna, Spicy California, Rainbow Roll, Caterpillar Roll.....mmmmmm.mmmmmm Good!

This was an excellent dinner......the server was really upbeat and even did a sake bomb with us!  Next time I'm in Sin City I'm definitely coming back to Roku.

There are a few times in life when a meal is so expertly crafted and planned that it is nothing short of genius. Tonight I had one of these! Dan is a great manager and makes the experience so much more fun!

We went with our kids and it was good.  The kids thought their rolls (California roll and tuna roll) were just ok.   We loved the roll we had and the sushi sampler.   The location is good, the view is great and the wait staff was very good.   

The prices are definitely on the high end but overall it was a good night out.

For two people, we ordered a glass of wine, an iced tea, one appetizer and two sushi rolls.  The bill came up to over $80.  And after putting in a tip, roughly $100 for lunch for two.

The food here is good, but it's not great for the price that you pay.  I probably wouldn't eat here again, unless I got a solid discount or maybe happy hour (if the prices are a lot cheaper for the food and drinks).  I'm pretty sure that there are other sushi restaurants in Vegas that could provide a similar tasting meal for much less than what you pay here.

Lots of great sushi places in Vegas and this is one of them! We tried the special A2 roll, baked lobster roll, and tuna jalapeño roll. All were excellent and super fresh fish! We had a nice table with a view of the strip. Service was alright but could have been better since we never got water.

Consistent, fresh quality fish.. I like that they don't drown their sushi in sauces .. Very clean and all about the fish ... On the downside it's extremely pricey.. dinner was $150 for me and my hubby.

Best california roll I've ever had made with fresh alaskan king crab and not the imitation crab roll.  I also got some yellowfin sushi that was delicious. Service was excellent and I really enjoyed sitting at the sushi bar.  The chefs cut up fresh whole fish right there.

I've been here twice and liked both times I was here.  It's located in Caesar's towards the back so might be somewhat hard to find. 

We ordered the omakase menu, which came with multiple courses along with some sushi.  It was savory and had no regrets for springing for the extra dough on the chef's choice.  Yes, it's pricey for the dinner entrees.  American Kobe and Japanese Kobe steak not the same - Kobe beef much better!  The sushi / sashimi prices are on par on what you would find in Japan - so the sushi prices weren't pricey in my opinion just the end bill.  

We liked the cool, retro interior albeit somewhat dark but it had a good view of the strip.  We had good service both times eating here.  I usually only get omakase (chef's choice) at a sushi restaurant but I would come back.
Very good sushi and excellent service.  A bit on the pricey side, but to be expected as it is collocated with the W hotel.
Food not bad.  Wine list decent. Service and presentation and follow through - horrid. Non-educated staff as well. Disappointing. Will continue to go to Tao or elsewhere for Asian cuisine.

We are back at our favorite japanese restaurant! Master chef Haru made special creations for us and its absolutely great! I highly recommend chef Haru if you want to try off the menu special sashimi creations! The seafood here is always top notch and service is always impeccable! The rib eye is also very tender and tasty. We will definitely be back next time we are here in vegas!

Ok, I understand. It's Vegas and the primary object of the town is to separate me from my cash as quickly and painlessly as possible.  But to be charged 120.00 for 2nd rate sushi is a little much. Understand, it wasn't bad, the Uni was not #1 grade. The Saba had a strange spoiled note, but overall everything was ok. But the price was absurd, the quality overall was second string and I walked away feeling a little used. I was a volunteer and made the decision to eat here. If the bill had been 40-50, no problem. But it wasn't. Eat somewhere else.

Just mention this place and my mouth starts watering with the memory of the fantastic toro they served on the night I visited.  Soooo good....

I sort of don't remember the rest of my meal b/c the toro was THAT good.  I believe I had a roku roll...yes, that was good too.  They have a nice cocktail list.  I'm pretty sure I had a saketini, and I'm pretty sure I liked it.  Oh, and we had edamame, which was also good.  Even the non-sushi eaters at our table enjoyed their food!  They serve a variety of cooked items, for your friends who don't dig raw fish.

Which is fine, because that means more toro for me!

This place is a must if you're in Vegas, whether if you eat sushi or not!!! They have tons of options for non sushi/fish eaters. Service and atmosphere is just excellent and very welcoming! 
I do visit the one in LA, but let me tell you the service here was much much much better than my experience in LA. 

Highly recommended, this is my go to place when going to Vegas!

Staff: Our server was nice, efficiently attentive.  No wow factor, but I'm not the type to go looking for one.  It did take a while for us to get our check, but I'm assuming it's because most people will loiter there after their meal.

The goods:  I had a steak teriyaki something or other.  It was good.  I guess I'm a little indifferent because people rave about this place, but I don't remember experiencing anything ethereal about it.  Still though, it wasn't bad.  I'm really picky and bias about my sushi, so again, not really wow'd.  As far as sushi goes, I could stand to eat it again.  My dessert was fantastic, but you can't go wrong with a molten chocolate cake and vanilla ice cream.  And my friend got the fruit mix with different dipping sauce.  Never heard of a kiwi dipping sauce, very unique.  It was sweet and delicate, very tasty. 

The atmosphere: This is where it got good.  I loved the decor.  I did manage to trip on the round stones, but that's more my fault than the restaurants.  I liked the dark tones and wood and modern yet aged feel.  It was very pretty.

I gave it 4 stars because it wasn't bad.  I wouldn't mind going back, we had a nice view and a nice meal, but I don't think I'd plan my next get-together there.
Really, 6 bucks for a cup of hot tea? Ell with avocado was pretty plain and tasteless. Server also forgot out green peas (never got them) very pricy. Not recommended.

OMG hands down BEST sushi EVER!!!! We go on average 2 times a month and OMG it is so so fantastic!!! We try other sushi restaurants and always come back to Roku! Does not get any better than this.....There is no better sushi in all of Vegas and Henderson! trust me we have tried MANY!!! 
MUST GET the baked crab roll :)
Always come here when I'm on town for work. Outstanding food and service is consistently good. Half price apps and rolls at bar during happy hour can't be beat.

Best sushi of my life... FOR REALS.
Better than any place I've tried in SF...and there's no ocean nearby Nevada!! 

Everything I had was amazing. Def try any type of tuna. The toro was deliciously-incredibly-mouth-wateringly tender. It was like butter. Or yogurt, or something just a smidge stiffer then yogurt...umm... basically it was super soft.  mmmm!!

I don't want to go back to Vegas anytime soon...but when the time comes, I'll be looking forward to 2 things- Qua Spa & an amazing meal at Sushi Roku!!!

One of the best sushi spots in Vegas hands down!! And don't worry, if you don't like sushi, there are so many other options for you. 
I was very impressed with this place. My sister and I dined here for a girls night and they took such great care of us. We got a seat with a view, when it was packed. The manager comped our dessert, just cause. Literally, I would give them 10 stars if I could.
It seemed like the type of place to take care of their regulars, and locals. 
A couple of the dishes that stood out to me were the Jumbo Shrimp, and King Crab fried rice. 
The shrimp was served with potato style chips, and a creamy sauce. I am still wondering what was in that sauce. It had a savory, yet sweet honey butter flavor. So delicious. 
The crab fried rice just hit the spot. There were huge chunks of crab, and the dish was packed with flavor. No need to add soy or hot sauce to this one. 
There were a dozen or so sushi options, and a variety of small sharable plates, or full size entrees. 
Park valet at the Forum Shops to avoid the tourist traffic. From food, to service, and even price, I was highly impressed all around. I can't wait to return.
Expensive but worth it. The brussel sprouts appetizer is so delicious that I've tried to recreate it at home. The sushi was fresh and delicious!

From the moment we were sat, we waited for almost 10 minutes to be greeted by our server.  The restaurant was empty by the way...we were the only poeple in there.  When we asked about the menu, we got the vaguest descriptions of the sushi rolls.  Being the only table In the restaurant, we were surprised that our order took extra long.  The server never came back and out drinks were not refilled.  Part of our order was finally delivered but our appetizer was not to be seen.  We were finally told that there was a problem in the kitchen and a few minutes later the appetizer and second roll arrived. You would think. Being the only table in the restaurant, everything would be perfect.  Not the case.  Maybe that is why they are so super slow for lunch?  We'll go back to RA next time. :(

This place is so great I don't know where to start. Here I go! The entrance from the parking structure to the restaurant reminds me of Beverly Hills CA. When you walk in you very welcomed with the staff. The art work and lighting is amazing. I sat in the bar had old fashions cocktails with new makers mark whisky I've never had before. Ordered different sushi that was delicious.

Ryan and Alex were very helpful in helping me choose the perfect drinks and food.

I strongly recommend this to anyone that pretty much wants to enjoy some good food and a high class experience.

:) enjoy

Came in for a quick lunch while I was in town and I was lucky to get the Executive Chef at the sushi bar. I started with the spicy miso which was excellent. Perfectly prepared miso with a touch of spiciness made it an innovative take on a staple.

I then had the toro carpaccio which was rich and unctuous. The toro was ultra-fresh and minimally topped so the flavor of the fish stood out.

For my entrée I went with the Matsu special which was 8 pieces of nigiri each with it's own special toppings and/or sauces. I particularly liked the toro and salmon offerings which were dressed with ingredients that completely enhanced the flavor of the sushi. 

Service was great and while it is indeed pricey you are having your meal prepared by a classically trained sushi chef who puts care into each preparation.

Fish is fresh and they use real wasabi. They toast their nori in sesame oil for their handrolls and it males a difference in texture, fragrance, and taste. Highly recommend of their happy hour from 4-7 for amazing deals on sushi and apps and $3 sake carafes.

Beautiful restaurant? Check.
Amazing service? Check.
Mouth-watering food? Check, check, check!

To end our mini vacation in Vegas, my family and I selected Sushi Roku as our last lunch spot before heading home and we couldn't have chosen any better. Located in Caeser's, Sushi Roku is on the second floor and offers a marvelous view of the strip for your dining pleasure. Inside, there are plenty of tables and since we were grabbing a later lunch, we didn't have to wait long to be seated.

One of my BIGGEST regrets was not getting our waitress's name because she was absolutely amazing. Not only did she surprise us by busting out in Vietnamese, impressing my entire family with her clarity, but she also came by frequently to check on us and gave great explanations of each dish as they arrived to our table. Her service alone deserves five stars.

Portion sizes at Sushi Roku aren't too large so for a party like ours, nine people in total, it definitely meant ordering multiples. We chose a variety of dishes such as: yellowtail diced chiles, fluke kumquat sashimi, baked cod "saikyo-yaki," beef rib eye wrapped asparagus, spicy pork belly "kakuni" fried rice, the spider roll, and the Katana roll. 

The yellowtail sashimi was mighty spicy, but mighty delicious while the fluke sashimi had a more refreshing flavor profile, thanks to the sweet kumquat. The beef rib eye was cooked on an iron hot stone, creating a sizzle that would make anyone's mouth water in anticipation. The meat was tender and the asparagus had a good crunch as well. The baked cod, however, was melt-in-your-mouth buttery and literally fell apart with the slightest touch. The miso sauce was sweet, but never once overpowered that delectable fish.

One of my favorite dishes was the kakuni fried rice with pieces of fatty pork belly. It is definitely not a waistline-friendly dish, but your taste buds will thank you profusely. The Katana roll was dressed in a creamy, spicy mayo sauce that added a buttery flavor to the yellowtail and spicy tuna while the spider roll was a bit more simplistic. 

Because portions aren't too great, we all still had room for dessert so we ordered the yuzu creme brulee with green teen ice cream as well as the green tea tiramisu. My pick for the best dessert had to be the green tea tiramisu. It was an incredibly light and airy dessert that had you inhaling the whole piece without all the guilt. The matcha flavor was prominent and paired well the espresso layers. The yuzu creme brulee had a refreshing orange-like taste and the green tea ice cream was deliciously smooth.

With food of this quality, it's no surprise that breaking the bank is a must. But even though you won't feel stuffed silly, I'm certain you'll still remember every dish with fondness. 

Sushi Roku is outstanding!

Not bad not bad at all. If you're looking for "asian fusion" cuisine: sushi with spicy sauce and fried stuff, teriyaki steak and expensive sake - you'll like this spot. Cool, dark, trendy decor overlooking the strip - perfect for a dinner date or group dinner. Feels like you stepped into a different world from the shopping mall exterior - well, cause you technically did.

Expect to spend $50 min for some food (enough to make you full but ready for late night pizza later) and A drink. My sushi combo - spicy tuna roll and about 7 basic nigiri was about $28, glass of Rombauer chard was $18. Yes, a little pricey on the wine, but oh well, it's Vegas.

A fair comparison to this place is Sushi Samba in the Venetian...Would I go back? Sure, if it were suggested. No, if I had my choice. Too many other places to check out in Vegas!

We had a family dinner here prior to me and my fiance getting married. This place has totally ruined sushi for me anywhere else. It was absolutely amazing. We did a tasting type deal where they brought out many different dishes of sashimi, rolls and such, everything was fresh and nothing like I had ever had before. And I am one who did not eat much raw sushi before this trip. It is going to be very hard for me to eat sushi just from anywhere from now on and previously I was ok with eating Kroger sushi :) This will be a definite stop for me when I return to Vegas and a definate recommendation for those who are in the vicinity. I love this place!

came her for lunch after a crazy huge dinner experience, sushi sounded perfect! this place did us just right. The fish was fresh, the service was cool, but then again...there weren't very many people there eating lunch=) Toro was and has always been delicious to me, but one thing you should get is their japanese snapper? not too sure what it's called, but it's a fish that's hard to find...sashimi wise....almost as good as toro!=) but worth every penny!=) and their spicy tuna mixed with something (a recommendation by our waiter) was really good too!!.. so do your homework before dining at vegas, so you won't regret not losing it on a crap table=)

Came here with my wife on Sunday evening. Didn't need a reservation we were seated right away. We ordered 2 sushi rolls and the sliders. Portions were small but the food was deeeeelish!!! We will definitely be coming back.

Food was great
Terrible drink service, waited 30 mins for a drink.
Asked multiple servers where our drinks were and no one seemed to know. Wish we had chosen a different restaurant on our vacation

Amazing sushi! We were sent by the Doubletree - Very fast service and the waiter we had was very nice - sorry can't remember his name. We went all out and got edamame and a roll of some sort, several different sushi plates, fish, and shared desserts. Everything was great!

Nothing thrilled us. Either we are terribly unlucky, or we really didn't order anything right that night. Here are the issues I have with this place: 

1. The ambiance is dark and when I say dark, I mean I can't see my date's face let alone see anything on my table
2. The menu is short, not too much creativity here
3. I don't care if we have to pay a Vegas tourist premium, just give us quality food and a memorable experience - yet they failed at that here. Although the nigiri was of great quality, we really don't feel the overall value is here whatsoever

Here's what we settled with: 

Miso soup $6 - two tablespoons served lukewarm with a miniature bit of tofu and nonexistent seaweed. Yep, I am pretty much sipping on warm, salty water. Skip it. Flavor rating: 2/5

Makoto roll $22 (spicy yellowtail & shrimp tempura wrapped with seared tuna spicy creamy sauce) - Sloppily rolled with lots of rice, minimal fish, and no wow-worthy sauce or flavor attributes. The roll ingredients and sauce were all too dry and bland. I was missing any trace of spicy yellowtail or even seared tuna, that's for sure. Flavor rating: 2/5

Soft shell Crab roll $15 - The soft shell crab had excellent flavor,yet a tad too soggy for my preference. Again, why was the roll so shoddily put together? We did not dine on a busy evening (Tuesday night, close to closing), so there is no real excuse. Flavor rating: 3/5

Salmon Nigiri $8.50 - The salmon was sweet and fresh, yet, they were not generous with the cuts. What felt like a paper-thin, cheap cut was a tease in the end. Flavor rating: 3/5

Uni Nigiri $14 - The uni was vibrant and fresh, but again tiny portion, why would you ever need to pay $14 for uni nigiri, I will never know. It's not like you can't get it anywhere else as fresh, since you totally can for MUCH cheaper. Flavor rating: 3/5

We made the wrong step when we decided to be seated in the dining room floor with an awkward angle of the strip view. We might have ended up on a thrilling note if we dined along the sushi bar. For the same price point, I would have had more bang for my buck and a completely satisfied palate at Nobu. Eh, well you live and you learn.
The sushi here was so amazing and fresh, so very happy we popped in... after a long day of shopping this sashimi hit the spot!

Let me just say straight off the bat; yes, the prices are expensive for what it is. But keep in mind, all restaurants and foods are usually overly priced on The Strip. 

Besides that, food was delicious! Boyfriend and I wanted to try the brussel sprouts chips but they were out for the day. -__- what!? awwwwww......man! So we got gyoza dumplings and the seabass sliders (one order came with two) as appetizers. The sliders were my boyfriend's favorite item of the night. The tartar-type sauce had a kick to it. The seabass was crispy. We would definitely order that again.

We decided to order three kinds of sushi. As a staple, we always get an order of spicy tuna roll at any sushi/Japanese restaurant we go to. This one here, ehhhhh....it was only alright. We could definitely do without. Average and I've had spicier, better ones at other places. 
We also order the Shima roll: shrimp on top of spicy tuna, cilantro and avocado. It looked like it was wrapped in soy paper. And we got the Baked Lobster roll in a creamy miso sauce. Both those rolls will definitely be a repeat.

Only reason why I gave it 4 stars (really a 4 1/2 star review) was because we really wanted to try the brussel sprout chips. If they had it available that night, this might have been a perfect 5 star rating. Plus I know the prices here might turn some people off. We got two drinks, two appetitzers, 3 sushi rolls and our total was a little over $100.00. Overall, I have no hesitation to come back here (if I want to splurge on sushi).

The crunchy tuna was mushy so I decided to go with an even easier dish, chicken fried rice. It was over seasoned with so much pepper but some how some pieces got none of the seasoning and was burnt. They even over poured on my mixed liquor causing me to miss out on all the mango and spice that my Mango and Spice Was supposed to have. I gave this 2 stars because the service was top notch but the place was pretty empty. I won't be back anytime soon.

I Love Sushi Roku :)

Ok, now that I've said that.. the review. 

Came here after not being in Vegas for a couple years.. I'd just gotten tired with Vegas. We walk in and even after not having been here for 2yrs our waitress Jessica greeted us by our names! Impressive! We'd not made a rez, so she didn't get it via that method .. she just remembered. If I had that type of memory, well I'd be lucky. 

While we'd like to check out the new Sushi Samba, and we know there are "trendier" places for sushi in Vegas, the service here is really what makes us repeat customers. There was a time when we would be in Vegas twice a month and would come here every time. The dining room/restaurant is chic, the view is amazing, and the food is fantastic but without the service we would probably spend more time exploring other places. It is as plenty of people have pointed out  "pricey", but it's Vegas and I've never thought of Vegas as a place to go when on a tight budget. In my opinion the price is justified by all the pluses of Roku.

The Food:

We started off a comped tuna carpaccio our lovely waitress brought for us. It was very flavorful and light at the same time. It was a great light starter. We nibbled it up too fast to get a picture.. sorry :x 

Tuna sashimi with garlic chips and sesame soy. We order this every time we go to a Sushi Roku.. it's so good. I love the clean taste of the tuna complimented by the sesame soy and the little bites of garlic flavor, mixed with the crunchiness of the chips.. it's such a great bite to have all of those at once!

Kobe with king crab. I don't remember much of it, but I do remember liking it. I just think that I prefer my Kobe either raw or very rare and it was too cooked for me. Kobe is fine on it's own :) If you want to try something different tho and you like your Kobe on the cooked side, this dish may make you go "mmm"

Foie gras wrapped in yellowtail and sprinkled with edible gold. This is another thing we can't pass up. Every time we have it, I think we know it's great before we order it, but we don't fully remember just how decadent and divine it is until we actually eat it. It really is fabulous! I'm seeing less and less foie gras on menus. I know the Roku in Santa Monica dropped foie gras so I'm going to enjoy this while I can and when I can.

Kobe Yakiniku. This is the thin slices of kobe that you cook yourself, usually over a hot rock. We thought it would be a fun dish for my daughter. I had a piece and it was perfect, however the cooking method needs to go. Instead of a hot rock, they bring out a mini grill and the meat kept sticking to the grill. It wasn't easy to get it off with just two hands.. I had to hold the grill part down(because it wasn't attached) with my chopsticks, while my daughter peeled the meat off. And it smoked a lot! Like up to the ceiling. 

Shrimp Tempura. It's shrimp tempura, I don't eat it my daughter does. That's that.

Sushi. We had Salmon, Tuna, Toro done two ways.. seared and not seared. Everything tasted super clean and the texture was perfection. I love the toro here and I get the feeling the sushi chefs here would never put something on your plate that they wouldn't eat. Some places have given me some nasty stuff. Never the case here. Only complaint, they forgot two or our seared toro.. apparently they didn't believe us when we ordered what we did haha. 

The waitress brought us two comped desserts, which I myself was too full for. They were eaten and they were super cute and pretty so I imagine they were yummy as well :)

Cocktails. I love the drinks here! I have two things I usually stick with.. the lychee mojito and the lychee martini.. they are both delicious. Sometimes I get the Kyoto Rose, it's different and it's grown on me.. the rose flavor threw me off a bit the first time I tried it.

Sushi Roku is the mix of everything that makes me a fan of a restaurant.. great stetting, fantastic and attentive service and food that makes me and my mouth happy :) If you go ask for Jessica and tell her I said hi!

If you are coming for the view you will be very happy, if you are coming for the sushi you will be mostly happy.  My husband and I snuck away for a dinner from our group and based on reviews ended up here.  We started with mixed vegetable tempura and kobe beef potstickers....wonderful choices for appetizers. 

The Katana roll was delish and we were very happy with our choice here.  After all that we decided to do one more roll...we shouldn't have.  The Crunchy Spicy Tuna disapointed. It was warm which we were warned about but it was just bad and not crunchy. Overall good experience but was hoping for amazing sushi which was not here.
Great food presentation, taste and sushi is fresh.  Thank you Las Vegas restaurant week  for the opportunity to try their food.  I'll come back

The service is phenomenal. The food is impeccable. The atmosphere is modern and relaxing. The food is pricey, but completely worth it. The back of the restaurant has an amazing view of the Las Vegas Strip, overlooking most of its well known hotels. I had the Albacore sashimi dish, along with a Spicy Tuna roll. Both left me feeling satisfied. I will definitely be coming back here for sushi soon!
Greatest sushi in Vegas I will always come back here , the service is amazing and I always get treated well

As a 16yr local of Las Vegas, Sushi Roku is hands down my favorite Sushi Restaurant in Vegas!  Been here several times and this last time we were a party of 7 in to celebrate a friend's birthday and from start to finish the service was excellent & attentive. Great view of the strip from where our table was located. The food & drinks though are what keep me coming back. The menu changes so even for us regulars there's always something new to be tied. I had the edamame hummus (only because I love both edamame & hummus & was curious about it) & crispy rice asparagus appetizers.  Next was the Kurobuta Pork "Kakuni" (braised pork belly) & my main was the Filet Mignon with Ginger Teriyaki sauce.  The hummus was great though they should serve it with a few more wonton chips than they do as those ran out long before the hummus did.  They did however bring out a few more chips when asked.  The crispy rice asparagus was  prepared and served as you would expect, and while it was good, it wasn't as memorable as other dishes the table ordered. The Kakuni on the other hand was my favorite dish of the night (and that's also including all the dishes of my dining companions that I also tried). All you pork belly fans, this is one of the best preparations I've ever had of this fatty delectable treat. The Filet was served sliced alongside mashed potatoes & garlic green beans...the Filet was perfectly cooked and seasoned perfectly! A phenomenal dinner was had by all! 

Also if you like cocktails that are sweet, definitely get the cookies & cream & pineapple upside down cake cocktails...phenomenal!  Already looking forward to my next return visit to Sushi Roku!
Went here for lunch and got the beef teriyaki lunch bento. The beef was very tender and good!

"Try everything you want on the menu. I mean it. Try everything, don't hesitate now." Those were the exact words that came out of my mouth as I was sitting at Sushi Roku in Ceasar's with a Roku virgin. I first found out about Sushi Roku in Los Angeles located on 3rd and Croft by the Beverly Center and I was hooked. It's no Nobu guys, it's no Matsuhisa, it blows them out of the water.

First I had kimchee (pickeled cabbage) stuffed cucmber salad. Perfectly crunchy, salty, sweet, spicy. I could pop those in my mouth all day like potato chips. You just can't have one. The tofu steak was next with grilled mushroom au jus. Just outta this world. Perfectly done tofu with three types of mushroom, light, complex, and not overly filling which was perfect because we were seated at a table for two and between her and me we had ordered for four, at least. 

The tastings started to come, and the sashimi, and the specialty rolls I requested not on the menu from the head chef at the sushi bar. Baby tako that melted in your mouth. Hamachi that glistened and we swear could have been still moving it was so fresh. The fish was like butter. Even the edamamde isn't oversaled, isn't overcooked. It's fresh, light and absolutely perfect. The tempura can be ordered separately or as a combo, which means that I can order six broccoli and sweet potato pieces, which is always what I eat last on my tempura plate because I think it's the best. 

My sake was excellent. Nigori, which is unfiltered, was exactly what I asked for, salty, sweet, and heavy. Like a creamy dream, my alcohol was a match made perfect by the suggestion of my extremely helpful and quick waitress. The service is fantastic. 

The decor is wonderful. If you're by the windows you can see the strip and all it's glory at night. But look around. Private raised booths that still create intimate feelings are against the back wall. My table was close to others around me, but we didn't care. We talked with the couple next to us about how fabulous their food was and weren't they looking forward to flying back out to Vegas from NYC just to eat here. Of course, their answer was an excited "Yes!". 

This Roku is much better than the Los Angeles one in my opinion and I've eaten frequently at both locations. This is some of the best sushi I have ever eaten on the west coast. I will always go back. My name is in the computer system permanently, I always get a great table, and my people there take care of me. 

Live the good life ya'll. Sushi Roku is a gem in a luxury "mall". Have a few beverages and order "a la Danielle". Seriously, take one of everything. You won't be disappointed.

Best sushi house I have been to in town. The noise level was quiet but not so quiet where we could hear the table across from us. Our waiter Tim was fantastic helping us choose several kinds of rolls and sashimi, Tim even brought the food out over the course of 30 minutes allowing us  to savor the different flavors and have them smoothly blend through out the meal. Aftwards we were treated to a lovely frozen lemon tart and finished with a warm hand towel.
Excellent and fresh sushi with imagination and great flavors.  Loved this place!  The baked lobster is a must.

Ok, when i heard this was the dinner venue for our guys night in LV, I was quite disappointed.  I guess anywhere you can get a reservation for 12 on 2 hours notice for friday is unlikely to be the hottest place in town.  Not only am I not a huge sushi fan (I know, kind of a dumb comment for a review of a sushi restaurant), but its in Caesar's Palace.  We were staying over at Wynn, so we had to get across town and make our way past all the people with oxygen tanks hanging out at Caesar's (yes, I think clientele at Caesar's tends to be old and stuffy).  Place had no ambience, but that could be attributable to the crowd (NCAA tourney weekend, so lots of sausagefest tables).  However, food was AWESOME (bold statement for a guy impartial to Sushi). We had 4-5 kinds of tuna, and all were fantastic.  I ordered the filet mignon as well, which was almost steak house quality (yes, i shared it).  And by doing big beers and sake rather than wine, tab only came to $100 per person, which is half what I would expect to pay for dinner in Vegas.
This restaurant is always on the top of my list. The ahi melted in my mouth, it was awesome. I also had the filet; tender with a smokey flavor...this is a "must go" for the perfect dining experience!
Decent but nothing crazy that would make me go back there. I'd actually give this place 3.5 stars. Either way, i would not make an effort to go here again.

Located in Caesar's Forum, Sushi Roku's seating view of the Vegas strip is amazing. The decor was romantic and modern. We ordered the 4 course prix for two and the entire meal was about an hour, it was long but it was satisfying. The service was excellent, you almost have to sit still and any movement they will come to ask how you are doing. 

Next time I'm in Vegas, I will definitely come back for more Sushi Roku.

I wanted so badly to hate this place. You have no idea. 

And this doesn't come from a place of hate in my heart. I don't hate "Scottsdale." The concept. The place. Or the people.

Ani Di Franco says "If I were you, you're exactly who I'd be..."

So if I was both a city and an undeniable DB (which are equally possible coexisting phenomena considering my paunch and treatment of other humans at large), I could indeed be Scottsdale. I could represent everything about it. 

But instead, some rich ladies and gentlemen, developers and career hype-hawkers no doubt, decided to build a representation on Camelback Rd so I could go on just being me, Dally G. Scottlas, Atlas' retard cousin, I am not. No, I did not just use that word.  

But, as I said, I don't hate it. I do hate hype. I do hate, kind of with all my heart, the fucking dumb asses who stand in line for video game systems, 
Starwars movies, and iPhones. So the 2000+ people who showed up at the pool at the W this weekend are the unjustifiably more socially acceptable versions of the 3 week line-standing uberdorks. I know I'm making a lot of friends here.  

So when I arrived at Sushi Roku for a "press junket," I was like, I already hate this place. Just because I'm a judgmental asshole. And I wasn't greeted by a TOTAL FUCKING TOOL. By that I mean, some fucking asshole in a horrible, horrible tie who later introduced himself as an assistant GM, would not fucking acknowledge my presence as I'm leaning on the podium. Dude, the people at the front are more important than the famous chefs and stingray skin place settings! Get a fucking clue douche-nozzle! ARG! It wasn't until the main attraction arrived and took the bull by the horns that we were able to break into his extraordinarily minuscule external sphere of recognition or comprehension. 

Ok, so I have no idea what a press junket is... But I'm calling it that because it makes me sound like a pimp. And I need more of that in my life. But it was a night for press people from around town to come and check it out and get everything comped and interact superficially because they all seem to hate/judge each other. Who can blame them, really. 

And it was fucking marvelous. I loved the place. As a vegetarian on a meaty night, they hooked my skanky ass up. I had a breath-taking eggplant dish. Some tofu variety platter that would probably be about $15 I imagine, which was good but I would have to know the price before I could recommend it. I had a mushroom tofu steak and a fairly delish dessert. It was all very good. The seaweed salad was good but loud. Yes, very loud in my head. Our waiter, while it seemed that he had never worked in the service industry before, was genuinely nice and totally helpful with my surely annoying veggieness. 

We got a pseudo sneak peek of the pool area during a party that was going on. I didn't quite understand why it was so hush hush when there was already a huge party going on but whatever. The place is fucking rad. Bring a date there. Expect him/her to put out. Not because he'll/she'll feel obligated but because everything is sexier there. It's just totally amazing. 

The people walking around the rest property were as snobby as you'd expect and yes, they are judging you. But everyone should check this place out once. 

I guess this is sort of a review of my experience at the W as well. You'll probably live. Check it out.

Come for happy hour! It's the perfect timing to eat before going to a show. 4-7pm. Good sushi and appy selection that's half price. Their HH is more about the food than drink. Limited selection of lower priced drinks and cocktails aren't part of the deal at all. Surprisingly good little deserts for $4. 

Their sushi is much better than your average place. Very fresh with tender rice makes it worth it whether you're paying half or full price. The menu is pretty traditional. No weird combo rolls here. Just great quality. The creativity on the menu is in the hot and cold appetizers. Yum.

One bummer thing is their cocktails. Don't bother. I tried 2 - a ginger lychee mojito where I couldn't taste the ginger and the lychee and mint were served as garnish and not in the drink. So this drink was a rum and lime where the lime was a tart mixer. I don't like like my cocktails deconstructed thanks. So I tried a different drink...Cant remember the name but it was supposed to be a spicy vodka lime cocktail. Again the drink came deconstructed with the chili skewered on top as a garnish so the drink itself wasn't spicy. The lime was so tart I asked for simple syrup to sweeten it up and make it drinkable. Insult to injury, both the drinks came in short glasses with one huge ice cube that took up almost the whole glass do you couldn't possibly mix in the 'deconstructed' drink components. Avoid the cocktails!  Stick with the food.

Good service.  Sushi chefs weren't very chatty.  The portions on the albacore very good. Also had a nice soft shell crab roll.  Loved that they had fresh wasabi.  The only black eye... was the crunchy spicy tuna roll was awful.

I would have given 4 stars of not for the last roll.  I'm pretty open minded when it comes to food but it really was awful in my opinion.

3.5 stars.

Location is nice, with view of the strip. A little too dark in there, but nice decor/ atmosphere.

Shared the Chilean Seabass, which was very good. Had the titan roll which was okay, but nothing spectacular or worth the $22 price. And then go the black cod, which was very good. Octopus roll was very good as well.

For the price, I've had better, but it is a solid place if you're looking for good sushi.

I am an experienced sushi eater and I have been to Sushi Roku many times.  I can honestly say this is a top 5 place for me.  The fish is usually extremely fresh (one time it was merely good), the rolls are creative, the atmosphere is terrific, and the service is good.  It's definitely pricey but you're on The Strip, it should be expected.  All in all my go-to sushi restaurant in Las Vegas.

Great sushi happy hour. Great service. I was so busy eating I didn't take enough pictures. The rolls on the happy hour menu are either hand rolls or 6 pieces. I ordered 2 rolls, sashimi and wine for $25.00. It was a great deal and it tasted amazing. My favorite dish was the sashimi. I ordered the Tuna Tataki w/Garlic Ponzu and I was in heaven. It was so fresh and just melted in my mouth. I loved it. I wish I had went back today just to get more lol. I also ordered the A2 Fusion, this role was good but it was a grayish color do ascetically it wasn't very pretty. But it wasn't bad. My second favorite roll was the Rock Shrimp Tempura w/Jalapeño...this was just delicious. Fresh, a little spicy and very filling. Writing this review, I think I know what I'm having for dinner...my mouth is watering!!! :-)
Cool place in the W Hotel!  Great atmosphere and great happy hour prices!

This restaurant is inside the shopping center attached to Caesars Palace. Great atmosphere, romantic if you are on a date, quiet, clean. Our meal is ok. We had the spicy tuna, shrimp tempura, California and the lobster rolls. 
The lobster roll was amazing. The best roll hands down that we chose. My second favorite was the spicy tuna followed by the California roll. 
The waitress didn't seem to have it together that evening. My sister ordered the soup which she said wasn't that good. It was my friends birthday and they graciously comped our bill for the cake (chocolate) that we ordered. It was really good.
Pretty good drinks, but FUCK the wait for the table and the extreme douche crowd. Yuck! Food is alright tho.
Lunch - seaweed salad, pork belly fried rice, sushi sampler lunch with miso soup, all fresh and delicious. Beautiful dining room with a view of the Strip; excellent and attentive service.

Sushi Roku - how I thought I liked you!

I first went to Sushi Roku a few months ago, with the darlings Alysha N and Joanie M. We were having a very enjoyable night and were quite starving by the time we wandered into Roku. So we had a very good time, but with that caliber of company the restaurant was the last thing I was paying attention to. Also, that meal was very early in my sushi-eating career. Since then, I've been looking to go back.

Enter: 20% discount for locals. That's all it took to get me through the door for my 2nd run at Sushi Roku. This time, accompanied by Ramze S, and Mr & Mrs Mark G - all accomplished sushi enthusiasts, with Mark being something of a gourmet. Let me give it to you breakdown-style.

FOOD: The food was pretty good. Plenty of pretty good. and not enough great, especially with the prices in mind. The sushi & sashimi was pretty good quality, but nothing outstanding about it - and that was the consensus from the table. Where they seemed to do better was with the prepared dishes, which on our table was mostly appetizers. 

SERVICE: Acceptable at best. Yes, it was early in the evening and the place was just getting rolling. But on the other hand, it was nearly empty, so why not go over the top, Mr. Waiter? They didn't really foul anything up, but it wasn't the quickest service ever, and not only was friendliness or charm out of the question, but so was knowledge! The question "Can I get fresh wasabi?" took a 5 minute trip to the back before a "No, sorry." could be returned. (And, for what it's worth, this is the first sushi restaurant Mark's ever been to that didn't have fresh wasabi)

ENVIRONMENT: It's a pretty nice place, that's for sure. And not uncomfortable. But it definitely doesn't look so hot while there's still light pouring through the giant glass windows, so come post-nightfall. 

OVERALL: "Meh" is right. We had a good enough meal, and a good enough time, but that's not enough these days, especially not at the prices that Sushi Roku charges. Even considering the 20% off, there was nothing special enough about the place to make it worth a return trip. We didn't feel taken or anything like that, but it takes more than not feeling robbed to get 3+ stars. 

Take some decent quality sushi, add all the pitfalls of a chain restaurant, mark the price up 100% and put it in the hippest room you can find. BAM! Instant Sushi Roku. If you wanna spend big bucks on sushi, even on the strip, you can find better places to do it.

Roku is one of the best places in Vegas. The omakase was unbelievable. The uni was incredible! Everyone here is the nicest person imaginable. Just an all around wonderful place to have dinner. The view isn't bad either.

A few days ago I got an itch I could not scratch.  Not in the pubic way, but in the sushi way.  (That's right,  I had a sushi craving.)  

I had traveled to Vegas for some business.  And, I had had enough.  I became gravely ill.  I was homesick.  But, before I could ride that wave.  I had to make one quick pit stop at a sushi joint.  

It was difficult finding a sushi place from Bally's casino.  But, finally I found Sushi Roku!  It was delicious!  I ordered 3 items.  The entrees and appetizers were all divine!

The hostess asked where I wanted to sit.  I shyly smiled and scanned the room.  Just as I was about to sit at a table.  To the corner of my eye I seen him.  Thats when I decided to sit at the sushi bar.  By george, the sushi chef was so handsome.  And, to top it off he made Amazing sushi.

Not to mention this place has a great ambience.  Nice music!  And, cheerful employees.  Its definitely sexy!

A+, yay.

Service was wonderful and the food matched. Really High quality fish and they made our anniversary special! The kobe meatball was also fabulous as the one thing we tried beyond sushi. We would definitely go back. The bread pudding was a nice balance with sushi too!
By far the best sushi in Las Vegas or Henderson. Always fresh, great variety and special fresh fish flown in every day.

I'll preface this by saying that this location is inside the W Scottsdale, and I ordered it up to my room. That being said, I wouldn't think it'd be too hard to get a bowl of spicy miso soup and 1 sushi roll executed, but I'm not sure of the quality and/or freshness (you are after all, in Arizona). The sushi had a very fishy smell yet no real flavor, and the soup was lukewarm and also lacked flavor. Clearly not worth the surcharge let alone regular prices, but you live and you learn. I think this sushi is best served in their dark swanky restaurant where you aren't that concerned with what it tastes like. I made the mistake of turning the lights on...

Cool decor. good sushi.. colorful bento boxes. i loved their mushed spicy tuna over rice.. apparently only they have that dish bc i havent been able to find it elsewhere. and when other places try to make it, it doesnt taste the same.

This was the BEST sushi I have ever had! The service and ambience was excellent! The food was to die for. The spicy tuna crispy rice (which is called something else here) and the white fish carpaccio special were insanely delicious. I am a sucker for spicy tuna and they have ample spicy tuna dishes to choose from. We tried many rolls and we figured out that basically anything you get is amazing!! Definitely book a reservation ahead of time and I recommend requesting a booth!

Love this Sushi Roku Location for its top notch views!
Good sushi, much better than the Sushi Roku in Los Angeles as well as Pasadena, ca.
The service was great, the manager was very very nice to us.  I think he had his eye out for our birthday girl ;)
Over all great place if you are visiting or having a birthday celebration.
But definately does not top Nobu!
My only complaint is they are pricey compared to other quality sushi restaurants ie sakana on Hayden and Indian school but the food was good service was good and the ambience is comfortable

Pretty good! I've been looking forward to trying this place out for a while and was not disappointing. We had the Kimchee cucumbers as an appetizer, nothing special just Asian pickles, but still good. I had the tuna jalepeno, which was good but really hot! I thought it was interesting that they didn't provide wasabi with out sushi, but after one bite, I realized that I didn't need it. It's pretty expensive here but the food it good and the service is very good as well. Definitely would consider going again and trying more of their menu.

Roku is to sushi as "The Golden Child" is to Eddie Murphy movies -- far closer to the bottom than the top.
Roll selection was weak, and construction was worse. Having said that, their crab dynamite was delicious.
The sushi and appetizers (miso and garlic edamame) were really good!  We got in fast, service was excellent, and the ambiance was beautiful.
Food is good. Not bad for Las Vegas Resort Restaurant. You won't be disappointed. The music is not so good. The service was okay. The decor is okay. The food was the best

There were six of us, and everybody was happy with their orders.  I had cold sake (excellent) but they did not have the monkfish liver sashimi that night which I was looking forward to.  The organic kale salad was very fresh and tasty.  I also had the filet foie and the lobster tempura which were exceptional.  My friends raved about the Chilean sea bass which one of them recommended since she goes to this restaurant often.  The chocolate dessert (so good I forgot the name) was delicious!!!  The service was attentive and knowledgeable.  And of course the view of the Strip from our table was unbeatable!

The food here was delicious but their suggested gratuity is way off! You have people drinking here and senior citizens who may not pay attention and just put what you recommend. If you go here pay attention to your bill so you don't get robbed on gratuity! This is breaking the law and deceiving their customers.

My friends and I were so excited to try this place. However we were treated with so much disrespect that we left the restaurant.  This  place is basically racist. It sucks how people are judged based on color of skin or clothes they are wearing. Why treat people like dirt?

Cool atmosphere, friendly service...unique bathrooms (with unisex sinks).

But that's about it.

Serving sizes were pathetic. (I spend $30 for THAT?) Other sushi joints give you double the portions for the same price, if not half the price you'd pay at Roku. Quality was right on par with most other sushi bars. I did feel like I was being hounded to 1) buy a drink, 2) buy edamame, or 3) order more sushi (which many people probably do, considering the portion sizes).

I'm unlikely to return to this venue, unless I begin to miss the decor and snotty valet people.

Was in Vegas this past weekend and we came here for dinner. It was a nice place and heard good things about it. Its Vegas, so its going to be expensive on the strip let alone its in the forum shops at Ceasers. Anyhow, the sushi grade was great and most of the rolls were really good. The Katana roll was amazing. I ordered a side of the sweet potato tempura and i got two slice for 6 bucks. Had i known that, i probably wouldn't had ordered it. Anyways, it was good, but i would rather had eaten somewhere else for that amount of money.
Food was excellent. Their beef dishes, fish, sushi, everything. Best Sushi Roku out of their four locations. Great atmosphere for hanging out.

Nice, friendly staff. Of course, we had met them first during our bachelorette party festivities at Ghost Bar.  What's not to love about single gals? ;p That's how they reeled us in. (Yes, we're suckers) Who cares they were fun and nice guys and I am a single woman in Sin City.

Pretty yummy food not necessarily the best Japanese food but tasty. On the pricey side though. Enjoy the Tokyo Cooler. I'm not much a drinker but I'll drink this and it was on the house. It soooo pays to a bachelorette in Viva Lost Wages. 

Great view. And they know to treat repeat customers. 

So is Kenji, the cute HAPA manager, on the menu? haha

Like many of the reviews I thought the sushi was very fresh and the spicy tuna was actually spicy which u very much enjoyed. I also ordered the ramen and it was on point in terms of the broth being rich and flavorful. This is my new go to spot for sushi in Vegas!

Amazing service, so impressed. Crystal was both gawgeous on the outside and in and had impeccable service. Such a pleasant environment, the folks at this place, Mike and Nicole thank you for being so lovely with us. Perfect example of what good food and service should be. Thank you!

This one's in Ceasar's Palace and our table had a nice view of the Strip.  We were also lucky enough to be sandwiched in between 2 big rowdy bachelor parties!  Sake bombs!!

Loved the scallops!  And the salmon.  We're roll peeps so we ordered a grip of them.  All were great, can't go wrong.
Love this place. Everytime we come to Vegas, we get our Japanese fix here. Plus we always ask for Courtney, who is a magnificent server and super awesome!

A company took me and my coworkers here for a meeting and both the food and service were exceptional! We were in the private back room and had several appetizers to start including tempora shrimp and veggies, kobe beef that we grilled ourselves, and edamame. Everything was stunningly displayed and tasted great! We even cooked our own kobe beef on little grills over hot coals, which was fun! The sushi was delicious (and i dont usually like sushi!!!) i would HIGHLY recommend this restaurant if you want to make a good impression on your group and have an amazing meal! Pricey but worth it.

This was probably some of the best sushi I have had in a while, but the prices are off the chart. Everything was easily 2X as pricey as any other place I have been. I know good fresh fish is not cheap, but there is a $42 sushi appetizer on the menu which seemed obscene. The service was exceptional and the sushi was great, but $145 for dinner of 2 is just too much money regardless of the quality or the service.

My fiance & I love this place.  They have a happy hour in the bar only, but a few good food choices & drink discounts.  We have eaten in the main restaurant a few times too and enjoyed everything we have had.  Try the Tokyo Cooler drink...very fruity & delicious.

I'm surprised that this isn't one of the highest-rated sushi places in Vegas because as an Asian foodie who often overspends on sushi, I was utterly amazed by the quality of sushi and culinary creativity at Sushi Roku. We had the sushi sampler for $65 and when it came, I saw some unusual combinations and thought to myself, "Oh no, this had better not be some kind of Americanized sushi like Californian rolls..." Well, it wasn't. The truffle addition truly worked, bravo. We also like the bartender and the friendly atmosphere. The only thing that I didn't like was the noodles; after all, this place is where you go for sushi, not ramen.
Good sushi, a bit on the expensive side compared to all the other sushi near by. Service was attentive and helpful as my cocktail took a while to make it to the table.

What a great place for sushi!!! Love the ambiance and the sushi, perfect! Our server Debra was wonderful! We told her we were open to her suggestions, just asked that she keep in mind my sesame allergy...she was spot on with everything, such great recommendations, everything was delicious! We enjoyed the Yellowtail Sashimi with Diced Chililes, Edamame (great flavor whatever they do), Katana Roll, White Lotus Roll (a bit of a kick, so good) and for dessert Uni. Everything was so tasty I would have it all again right now!!! We also enjoyed a carafe of the Sawanoi cold sake which was perfect for us! We highly recommend this place & Debra! Next time we're in Vegas we'll be back for sure!!!
Best sushi in Vegas period!! Jason our sushi chef was awesome and Rene was great to make sure we had everything we needed. Food was amazing! Fresh and unique with a fun vibe.

The place looks nice and the staff was really cool. The sushi chefs were actually Japanese. The food was just ok however. It was a steep for what I'm usually getting. The best thing about Roku is they use real grated wasabi.
Very nice place with great service. The steak was great, the only thing I would hope they fix is the sushi. It's a very romantic place and my gf enjoyed it for VDAY

Two  years ago it was the popped collared short sleeve shirt.

A year ago it was the striped button up long sleeve shirt.

This year, it's the black t-shirt with some sort of skull or crossboney eagle shape that has taken over as the "official douchebag uniform."

Come to Roku and you'll see some of these dudes but seriously, don't stay away because of it.  

Roku was de-friggin-licious.

Highly recommend you stick with whatever specials are available on the left side of the menu.  

While slightly expensive, it'll make for a memorable experience.  

Just watch out for the Jersey douchebags.

Fresh.

Loved it! Came here for lunch.  Ambiance was nice and the view of the strip was beautiful as well.  The sushi was very good, but the sashimi was what was memorable.  We had salmon and toro sashimi.  The toro sashimi was absolutely delectable.  It was like butter!  The california roll was very good considering we were in Vegas.  I loved the options for vegetable tempura (considering my sister is a vegetarian) and the fact that they don't use peanut oil to fry it (my sister is allergic to peanuts)...When they found out that it was my mom's birthday they brought out free dessert and a sparkler (an actual firework). That was nice. This was a very pleasant experience and if I am ever at Caesars again, I will come back.

The sushi here is very good, however, I don't feel like the high prices are worth it for the quality of food. One thing that upset me is that they secured the raw fish to the rice with wasabi!! I was disgusted as I hate the taste of wasabi and they didn't have that information on the menu. The appetizers were good, especially the seaweed salad. It was nothing to write home about here. I'd definitely try another sushi place before I come back here.
Always a stop for us. My son had the King Crab Fried Rice and LOVED IT. We had a couple of rolls and were very good.  Highly recommended!!!!

I have been here from day 1 to present.  The food has remained good, I feel like the specialty cocktails are missing their mark though.  Their selection of sushi is good, but there are a few favs. they are missing.  *can't remember their actual names* Some of the dishes are fabulous like the beef wrapped asparagus but, their tofu sampler (cold) was not good nor flavorful.  When I come with my foodie friend we just tell the sushi chef to prepare some great sushi (omakase style), they make a specialty roll for me & we order our fav hot dishes with some nigori sake.  It is always great this way... however, I don't see the bill and probably wouldn't want to.

I love Sushi Roku.  A friend and I decided to get lunch here one day because we didn't want to fall pit to the "we're in Vegas, let's have buffet" like we did the time before.  I had had Sushi Roku one time a couple years ago, but wanted to try it again.

We were promptly greeted and sat at the sushi bar.  The chef was great.  I threw out a couple suggestions of what I like, but wanted to have his recommendation as to what I should have.  Although they didn't have ankimo this time, he did recommend a few other dishes.
