The tako roll was really tasty, but the nigiri I had was by far better.  The katsuo was one of the best preparations I've had in a very long time, light sauce and onion, perfect!  Katsuo is my favorite fish, and actually one of the cheaper ones.  It wasn't even on the menu here, but he had it! =)  I next wanted to have a full aji (i.e. sashimi, nigiri, and then the filet is deep-fried), but the aji was already filleted, so I decided to just have a couple pieces seared.  The next was a great recommendation of saiko sake.  Saiko sake is what the Japanese consider to be the best salmon in the world; this salmon comes from New Zealand.  I normally don't care for fattier fish, but this was exquisite.

I admit the food here is a little pricey, so make sure to get the good stuff.  If you want California rolls go somewhere else.  If you want to be adventurous and have high-quality sushi, this is the spot.
Thank you!!! The restaurant promised a front row table to NYE fireworks and delivered.food and drinks were great. Fun times!!!

Amazing sushi!  Everything in Vegas is pricey, and this is no exception.  However, when the food is amazing and the sushi chef is knowledgeable, it's worth it!  Prices weren't too bad...  I usually check the prices of the spicy tuna roll (since every sushi place has them) for comparison.  The Spicy Tuna Rolls at Sushi Roku were $11.  Again, expensive, but not over the top.  And for delicious sushi, I'll take it any day!  Make sure you go here - much better than Yellowtail Sushi in the Bellagio, and less expensive too!

Sushi Roku is a very elegant and fancy sushi lounge and bar inside Caesars. It is somewhat difficult to find, it is up the escalators past the Forum (the shopping area) and is in one of the corners.

Inside you will see lots of empty space despite an okay number of other diners but the place is so big that there are bound to be many open tables. A nigiri (fish + rice underneath) averages 4-5$ a piece, with a blue fin special they had at the time of 13$ a piece. I expected this to be mind blowing but it was very very average. The salmon belly was super fatty as expected, it tasted super fresh but the texture at the end of the day was just not my thing, but not their fault as I just wanted to try it. The salmon nigiri was good, we ordered a lot of "regular" nigiri and those were all solid. The eel one could be a little less cooked but still decent. Overall I would probably not pay that much for this. A friend got some kind of roll for 20$ but it tasted very average as well, I could get the same for 12-15$ in NYC which is really saying something.

The view though is amazing, like a super awesome view of the strip. The lounge is cool as well, you have enough space away from other tables to do your own thing, and the couch chairs are super comfortable (which is also the case at the dining table). Food I would give 2.5 stars given the exorbitant price, but view and atmosphere I would give 4.5.

This was my first time with my friends.  The waiter was OK. He introduced himself and asked us if it was our first time so I said yes and that it was my friend from Chile, South America.  The waiter did not explain, offer or promote anything.  So we ordered some California rolls and other foods, there was 4 of us. The food was excellent,  we had sushi before from a scale of 1 to 10 I will give it an 8. Suddenly I saw this very nice looking lady carrying couples of plates so she stopped and came over with a radiant smile and explained the dishes and introduced her self. It was very pleasant and great she said her name is Sarah and came back to ask us if we need anything and I ask a few questions about the menu and drinks. Due to her awesome personality and warm smile we all felt like we were at home. Sarah mentioned her passion for foods and the interaction with people,  she loves to meet others and make them feel at home. I WILL BE BACK JUST BECAUSE SARAH MADE OUR NIGHT MORE MEMORABLE. The manager was an awesome person as well. Thank you Sarah for being a real person and make our night something to remember.  I will refer Sushi Roku to all my friends. 

Lewis

From 4-6 PM every single day of the week, you can go and forget that bitch, Lady Luck, totally ditched you at the baggage carousel, that you lost this month's mortgage at the Craps table, and that the "hot" slot machine you sat with for so long was nothing but a tease. Because from 4-6 every day at Sushi Roku, you can pretend that you're a high roller, order a large Kirin beer, a spicy tuna roll, a shrimp tempura and jalapeno roll, an order of spicy prawns and chips, and a mini chocolate volcano cake off the Happy Hour menu. And when you get the bill that's less than $20, you can feel like you've just hit the progressive jackpot. Except that you are still leaving with an even lighter wallet. But at least you don't have to worry about paying that pesky winnings tax.

Had a blast! Made it a girls night two evenings ago. I made reservations through their website for 9pm on a Saturday night "girls night out!" It was VERY busy so I was glad I had made reservations. We were able to get seated on time, however we waited a while to get our food. There was only one person at the table who ordered Sushi so it is not fair for me to rate the Sushi even though she said it was good. The rest of the table ordered drinks and main entrees. I am not a big meat person more of a veggie lover, though I spilt a  Teriyaki Steak which included Mash Potatoes, Rice and Sautéed Veggies. Along with Tempura Vegetables. Everything was great! The quality and quantity was reasonable for an upbeat Scottsdale restaurant. Our waiter was energetic which made it more fun. 

Overall the restaurant was very clean. The staff was well groomed. The scene was hip, young and vibrant.  The bar is small but very packed. Great variety of food selections for those with different food preferences and large selection of beverages. The restaurant is attached to the W hotel so you can mix and mingle in the lounge or upstairs in the patio bar.

Overpriced average sushi, with a staff that made us feel like we were bothering them.  I don't get the hype.  If we spend over $200 for a party of 3 I would expect stellar food and a bit of ass kissing.  Had to remind them of items we didn't receive and the sushi chefs are as rude as they get.  They pretend to greet you nicely, but they are miserable and added to the fact the place was a huge disappointment.

Great happy hour specials and attentive staff. We like sitting at the bar during happy hour because the bartenders, Joy and Ryan, are so wonderful. Gary, the manager, walks around and talks to customers to make sure they're taken care of. All in all, great service.

Very impressed with the beautiful interior, food, and service.

Coming from San Francisco, my bf and I were skeptical about Japanese food and Asian food in Arizona. However, we left feeling full and and content.

We ordered:
-Special trio of the day (it was delicious! I believe it was octopus, scallop, and tuna)
-Ramen: it was surprisingly good. The broth was so rich.
-Sashimi platter- spicy tuna rolls, California rolls, and assorted sashimi 

I had a ginger lychee mojito that hit the spot.

I'd definitely come back if I visit Arizona again.

This is one of our favorite vegas spots to grab sushi.  It has actually become a tradition!
Everyone is always so nice and the service is great.  I always make a reservation as we are usually a party of at least 4+. We've never had to wait.

Moving onto the food. I stick to what I know and like. We get salmon sushi, albacore sushi, baked crab hand roll, spicy yellowtail handroll, ikura with raw quail egg (Kinda bland). Everything has always been fresh and delicious. The sake is great as well.

The shishito peppers were AMAZING!
One of my favorite things about this place is the torch bday candle. Can't wait to be back again.

I came here on Friday night, got a nice booth close to the sushi bar.  My favorite place because not only does it have a fun sexy atmosphere, but the food and service is great.
 We had: 

The Yellowtail with diced chilis in ponzu was ordered right away, that stuff is melt in your mouth flavor.

Popcorn Shrimp: Awesome!

Filet mignonette wrapped asparagus is super fun dish that comes out on a hot rock!

Salmon, Yellowtail, Tuna, Eel and Sea Urchin Sushi.
Quality fish. Don't like sea urchin anywhere else.

The star was Toro sashimi / Caviar on top. Really decadent.

Katana and Mokoto Rolls

 Baked Crab Hand Rolls! Always need these!

They have a good wine and sake menu, and one of the girls got a cold nigori, which is a milky sweet sake. The rest of us had some same bombs! 

The best part is I was afraid to go because it was a double date and my co workers date is allergic to all types of stuff, including nuts and shellfish, but I assured him the steak was good, which I get sometimes. He ordered the Ribeye Japonais and loved it! It comes with potatoes and green beans and has this buttery garlic sauce that is so good.

Our server Jennah killed it as usual. I always ask for her, she really knows how to take care of guests. Waters never empty, no mistakes, very professional.

The employees in general are really trained well to keep the table clean, since so many small plates are coming and going.

This double date was important to me to have a bonding experience with someone from work! Thanks Sushi Roku!

While staying at the Indigo on business, I was referred to this place by my hotel bartender after I asked for a simple sushi place close by.

Simple it surely was; there were only a few people at the sushi bar and maybe two or three couples at the tables. Actually it was a bit boring, but then again, a quiet, no-frills experience was what I had asked for. Perhaps Wednesday is a slow night.

What I gleaned from my experience was:

1. High sushi quality, on par with what I have found elsewhere in Scottsdale.

2. Good service; I was asked very frequently how things tasted or if I wanted anything further. You might say this was due to the slow night, but I have certainly experienced poor service at restaurants under the same conditions.

3. Low prices, certainly relative to what you get in this neighborhood. I believe that for six nigiri pieces, a roll, and a small sake; the total including tax was $27. Not too shabby.

The high quality I had expected out of a Scottsdale joint; the high value I did not. The only reason this place did not receive 5 stars was that it had a bit of a strong smell. Not fishy, more reminiscent of fried food. Perhaps a tempura order went out of control; things happen. It was not unbearable... yet I could smell it on my clothes later that evening. Then again, I am sometimes overly sensitized to smells. Rest assured, will still go back to Sushi Roku next time.

My friends I recently went to Sushi Roku after discovering them on the Whistl app for iPhone. We got there at 6, just in time for their happy hour! We were blown away by the ambience of the restaurant, it was modern, but had a timeless sense of class.

We stuck strictly to the happy hour menu, which features 30+ small bites and drink, including sushi rolls. We started with Edamame Hummus w/ Wonton Chips ($3). It was  justt the right consistency, and very refreshing. The edamame and wonton chips were a nice addition that gave this mediterranean dish a fresh asian twist. We also had the America Kobe Meatballs ($4). They were deep fried, but not greasy at all. The dipping sauce was also an excellent paring with the meatballs. Next up was the Hanabi for $5 (Spicy yellowtail on crispy rice). This was by far our favorite. The crunchiness meeting the soft texture of the sushi was out of this world. It was one of the most unique dishes I've ever had at a sushi bar. We also got A Spicy Yellowtail roll and an Albacore Salsa Roll ($3 each). Both were excellent, exactly what'd you'd expect from a cut roll. To top it all off we got the Bana Berry Spring Rolls ($3). The crunchy exterior meeting the sweet, soft center was excellent. The drizzled caramel on top made it only more perfect. 

Overall we had a great experience with the food. We would highly recommend this place to anyone who enjoys asian cuisine. Also, if you love finding deals like we do, you should definitely check out the Whistl app on the App store. Free to download and no signup!

Enjoy Fellow Foodies!!
I've been to many restaurants, and this server named David stands out amongst the best.  Thank You

My husband and I dined at Sushi Roku for the first time this evening. Ayden was our server and he was one-of-a-kind spectacular! He was extremely  informative, professional and thoughtful. Ayden answered my many questions about the impressive menu and suggested the perfect pairing of delicacy and drink. We were honored to have the manager, Kyle introduce himself and offer his warm welcome. 
We savored each selection that was offered us. I am fortunate to have dined at all of the top restaurants in Scottsdale and without a doubt Sushi Roku is amongst the best in quality, atmosphere, presentation and by far, service. We will most definitely return to dine at Sushi Roku again. I highly recommend Sushi Roku, and of course ask to sit in Ayden's section and may I suggest the avocado appetizer and the crab roll with butter sauce.

I ate here with my husband. The prices were standard for Vegas. The restaurant is in the mall and somewhat open to the shoppers. We had lunch without reservation at 2p and were seated without issue. The service was fast. I would recommend the tuna sashimi Carpaccio.

We had reservations for New Year's Eve on our first visit to Las Vegas.  There was a $160/each omakase but we decided to order a la carte since it was way more food than we would want.

The first warning sign should have been that the restaurant is located in a mall, and the second that it is on the strip in Las Vegas.  The food was just ok but the prices astronomical.  For what we paid for the entire meal we could eat twice at the best sushi restaurant in Atlanta (which blows this place away).

Most annoying was the "Tofu 3 Ways"... It was 6 slabs of raw tofu taken directly from the package with 3 "ingredients" sprinkled on top.  I think one was caviar, one maybe scallions and I don't recall the third (it was that forgettable).  Really a 6 year old could assemble this dish with minimal adult assistance.

The shrimp tempura roll was fine but nothing special and small compared to what would be found at the average sushi restaurant.  The tuna carpaccio was good (for $26) but overpriced for what it was.  The seaweed salad was good and we also really enjoyed the king crab fried rice but beware that it does have some sort of hidden pork not disclosed on the menu.

Finally, while trying to enjoy a relaxing evening out, it's kind of difficult when the waiter is jacked up on something, and running around like a maniac.

Really, as we dined at this place, I came to realize the reality of Las Vegas, shiny and glitzy on the outside, but in reality built to draw in suckers.  However that's another review for another time.

Not recommended.

I had THE BEST experience at Sushi Roku.
When we went to the location, it was very easy to find and the restaurant was on the third floor of the Forum Shop at Ceasar's Place. The view outside the window was amazing. You can see the whole strip from the dining table if you get sitted by the widow. Perfect spot to go on a date. 

The place seem to be constantly busy but not up to the point where we had to wait a long time to get seated. Our server name Maiko was the best server I ever had from all the different restaurant that I went to. We ordered Omakase with Sake pairing and she seem to be very knowledgeable on the food that she was serving as well as the sake that we had it paired with our sushi. Every time we finished our dish, she would come discreetly to clean our table and get it prepared for the next meal. When she was clearing the table of the empty plates, we were never interupted from our conversation and sometimes I didn't even realize that she took our plates. Our waters are always filled so we never had to ask for more water. Also our sake glasses are always filled as well so that's always a thumbs up~! (We order the bottle of sake and she would always be around to fill it our shot glasses whenever we took our shots) Also every time we get a dish, we always know what we are eating and how we should eat it. Chef that did our omakase came out himself to explain the dishes as well. We also got a chance to meet the Executive Manager of Sushi Roku and got to have conversation with him. 

Finally the food, the sushi qualities are AMAZING~!! Every dish that came out was perfectly balanced and very pleasing to the eyes. We got all different kinds of dishes so our palate were never bored. There was a lot of times where I was getting full but I just had to keep eating because of the food look so appetizing and I just had to try more. 

In the end, the overall experience was AMAZING and it is the go to place if you are craving sushi and happen to be on the Strip at Las Vegas. :D

**I will upload the pictures soon**
This sushi place was okay. Expensive like everything else on the strip. I had the Crush cocktail which was actually very delicious. Good food that just costs a little too much

Sushi Roku is one of the must try for those looking to stay in Vegas on a Budget. They apparently have a great happy hour.
Unfortunately, we missed that happy hour by a slight margin, so we were forced to pay the full price. 


Located on the 3rd floor of the 'Forum shops' by Caesars. Just take those winding escalators all the way up. Take in the wow-mazement and gaudiness of it all. 

The quality was very good... no complaints there. 
The plating was typical. Nothing fancy or over the top.
Drinks--Were delicious. Go for one of the cocktails. Not only are they tasty, but make a great palate cleanser. Downside: Not very strong. 

Pricing here is on the higher end if you don't make it during happy hour. That was really only my disappointment. 

Service was good. Not pretentious, or stuffy. 

I think sushi Roku can come off as more frou-frou than it really is. We saw many of people hanging casual in here, despite the high ambiance feeling they try to portray. Then again, that's honestly the entire mall that encompasses this place. So come decked to the nines, or in your tennis shoes. 

Definitely a decent spot for Sushi while in Vegas.
Nice atmosphere.  Sushi was pretty good.  Customer service was not bad.  Overall decent place to enjoy sushi...

Probably the best sushi in town. Fresh fish - always ! (not easy in AZ)
We always enjoy the strong drinks . Not much changes in the menu and the specials repeat, so I would like to see more creativity but overall I love this place! 
The bar upstairs should be open for people who eat at the restaurant. You should not sand in line or pay the bouncer to get in after you spent $200 at the restaurant... 
I would definitely recommend trying this place! I think they have great happy hours and summer specials right now. Worth a try !

I give this place 10* for the quality of sushi. One of the freshest sampling of Uni, Toro, Mirugai, soft shell crab rolls i have every tasted. The reason for 4* is the price. $250 for a party of two is a little pricy. If you are craving sushi and have $$$ than make sure you drop by here and enjoy.

Best meal I have had in Vegas.  The wagu (American) beef skewers and wagu gyoza both excellent.  The three people at the table who got king crab fried rice all said it was excellent.

They also had Japanse wagu on menu although I did not try it.

No wait on a Monday at 6pm even with our party of 8.

Tuna tataki sashimi was fresh and not overcooked.

Wait staff attentive.  

Great choice if you like sushi and even the non sushi afficiandos said they would come back.

The food was GREAT (very fresh and yummy) but our servers - yes, we had about 4 - were about as hot as a bowl of ice cream.  They forgot our edamame.  They were slow with our food and drinks.  They kept switching servers on us.  I guess after hearing so many great things about this place I was expecting more.  

Question:  The table next to us got warm towels for their hands... Were we left out? Do they do this for everyone?

We didn't have reservations and got seated at the restaurant front facing the Forum. Not really an ideal place since there was someone sitting just outside smoking a cigar from the neighboring restaurant. 

We ordered the following:
Tuna Carpaccio
Chicken Karaage
Shima Roll
Makoto Roll

Everything tasted good except not really worth the price. All four items above totaled $75 plus tip. You are paying a premium for atmosphere. Make sure to reserve and request a table with a view of the strip if you decide to try it out.

Good sushi and sashimi.
Great service.
Excellent ambience and decor.

I had the chef's sashimi combination ($26) and a roll of spicy scallops ($9). Companion had the chef's sushi combination ($29).
I was going for mostly plain and simple, nothing outrageous or innovative. What I got was plain and simple, I felt like I was eating good quality fish. And I'd never had a spicy scallop roll before and liked it.

Our edamame was really good. More firm than most other places I've tried, and I think the firmness was a very good thing.
I also loved the doors to the restrooms, which were designated by beautiful tattooed body art on a man and a woman. 

I did think they were a little stingy on the wasabi and ginger. When we asked for more, the wasabi brought to us was really hard and crumbly, almost gritty. A bit of a mellow harsher there.

With some sake, sapporo, tea, nibbles and our sushi, the bill for two was about $100.
Overall, I thought it was a good meal, but the food itself did not impress me enough to say it was the best I've had. Nowhere near. 
It was similar to what I'd get at restaurants in my own city, but served on black pebbles in a hip atmosphere.

I went here for Restaurant Week and tried a combination of the offered menu and some of the other items on the menu.  The sushi was delicious, the specialty items were unique and tasty, and I would definitely come back again.  The service was also top notch!

Sushi Roku was a great experience for us.  My boyfriend and I stopped there on the way to a Circ show at the Wynn.  The food was delicious and the service was nice.  I will admit, there wasn't much of a crowd when we went, but that's better for us.  We sat at the sushi bar and asked the chef to create something special for us, and boy did he ever.  He delivered some very fresh sashimi, served with truffles....yummy!  It was not cheap, but so worth it.  It u want cheap, go to sushiRUS!

Our friends and us wanted to try this restaurant, I have always liked the one in Pasadena....We got seated at a window seat with great views of the strip, very beautiful. 

My gf and I ordered specialty cocktails, both were sweet and refreshing, but a little weak. 

Our food:
Filet Mignon with Ginger Teriyaki Sauce, Japanese style potatoes, sautéed garlic beans: it was cooked perfect to medium rare, hubby liked the sauce, I liked the beans. 

Miso soup: nothing special, it was OK

Premium sashimi (10 pc): they were very fresh and tasty, loved it. 

Our friends food:
3 orders of albacore, baked lobster roll, California roll: I tried a little bit of each dish, they were yummy, but nobody liked the baked lobster roll too much, a little too creamy for our taste. They couldn't even finish their food, kept asking me to eat more. No problem, I love sushi too much. 

The food was delicious, service was great, plus the amazing views, a very pleasant double dinner date, we enjoyed it so much. 

I am a big fan of sushi Roku, it never disappoints!
Outstanding meal here ...  Top shelf service. The Shishito peppers  were ON POINT! Amazing! You must order the American Wagyu potsticker Gyoza appetizer! Beef will melt in your mouth

Great Sushi. Some of the best I have had in Vegas.  Very creative in their Rolls. Love there Lunch Bento Box. Great portions and very tasty presentation.  The only thing they need to work on is getting the food out quicker.  Lunch took a little longer than it needed to be.  However the manager was excellent about fixing the situation.  Definitely a place I would go back too.

Went there for my daughters birthday. Great ambience and very comfortable round booth seating. Waitress was friendly and very knowledgable about the menu. Made great suggestions and had us excited for the food.

The Kobe beef pot stickers sounded excellent and sadly they were anything but. The wontons were very greasy and chewy. And the Kobe I think was kind of chopped and mixed with something that I would imagine dog food taste like. 

Carpaccio was excellent. King crab miso was pretty good but not a $14 bowl of miso. 

Overall the rolls were very good but I have had better in valley. 

Service and atmosphere excellent. Food just ok to good.

To me ... Definitely overpriced and would probably not return. Nothing great that would make me come back. 

Not bad ... Just not great and for the prices I expect great.

Took my girlfriend in for dinner for her birthday, the service was amazing, they wished her a happy birthday by name and service was impeccable. 

The food was delicious, we had the prime rib for dinner and bananas foster for dessert  wish we could have taken pictures of our meal but it was gone too quickly haha. 

Over all it was an amazing night, although it was a bit pricey it was definitely worth it for a night out.

Came here on a whim, Thank God!!

We were starving and my friend just finished shoping at the forums, we wanted sushi...wow, this place has it in it's name...

We arrive, no wait...we are sat at the most comfortable table that i have ever sat at, ANYWHERE to top it off, the most amazing view of vegas, it's just perfect

Our server was really cool, wasn't fake or overly nice

I only spent 50 on myself and was full

Definately coming back here again

.....5 stars, but still not as cool as the Geisha House :-)

I stopped in on my evening walk (read: I was underdressed, not gussied up for a night on the town) on an early Friday evening.  Even so, I was treated to what was - hands down - the best sushi/sashimi experience ever.  I had several dishes. Every one involved incredibly fresh fish with thoughtful use of ingredients with a beautiful presentation.  Each bite delivered often subtle but intricate play of flavors and textures.  The selection of fish was much broader than the usual good sushi restaurant.   All of the wait staff and sushi chefs I encountered were attentive and knowledgable.  And no one made me feel self-conscious that I had arrived in my jeans and walking shoes.  The atmosphere is definitely aimed at attracting the trendy upscale clientele (the W is known generally for it's bar and party scene) but serious sushi fans of all types and ages should make a point of eating here.
5 star dining experience. The sushi was unreal and so was the service. I was very impressed once I walked in to when I left. I will be back with friends!

Nice food and drink selection. Loved the ambiance. Good for a night out on the town. Located inside the W hotel. Valet parking available. Get your ticket stamped by the restaurant. It reduces the cost of parking.

When you are going to be the only male meeting nine pretty girls from New York City,  you know that your 7 o;clock reservation needs you to call at 7 and ask for it to be pushed back to 730 as you leave your hotel at the other side of the strip.  So imagine when to my surprise I still managed to be the first one there with ample time to sit at the small bar and enjoy the company of the friendly bartender and review their nice selection of wine.  Only out of California for 24 hours, I still missed it enough to settle on a crisp Russian River Sauvignon Blanc.  

By its name, you know that Sushi Roku is Japanese fare with a lot of Sushi options.  If you know me, you know Japanese food falls behind Korean BBQ and anything with "Steakhouse" in the title as my least favorite dine out experience.  Nonetheless, I persevered for my sister's birthday weekend wishes, as I did much that weekend.  I was nonplussed to see that they had a seaweed salad that I managed to combine with a few other small items for one full meal.  I did not enjoy how both my miso and salad which ended up being my largest course were both served before anyone else received an appetizer.  Perhaps the gentleman servers were overwhelmed by the prettiness of the nine ladies while I was appreciating the artistic bathroom doors.

Sushi Roku was a very fun atmosphere with pretty great food and a fun way to spend a Friday night in Vegas. We had a group of six eating here and everyone was excited about what they got. Everyone at the table had assorted rolls that they were incredibly happy with (especially the Dynamite Crab Roll). The spicy tuna was VERY spicy, which I love. We also shared the Katana Roll and the shrimp tempura roll, all very yummy. They did find out we were celebrating a birthday at the table and brought us complementary desserts to share. Really fun atmosphere -- only downgrade would be that the service was a bit slow.
Excellent sushi and supreme service!  Courteous, efficient, and delicious. Beautiful ambiance. The happy hour Menu is perfection. Thanks Raelin. Your service was impeccable. Cheers

After losing our reservations for a bachelorette party the manager allowed us to come 2 hours later.. 930pm and promised to seat us then. When we got there there was no reservation and nobody knew what we were talking about. When we finally got seated they placed us in a booth and added a chair on the end for the bride... not very special. Service was terrible, food was overpriced and seriously doused in sesame oil and the entire evening seemed like a huge inconvenience to their staff. I will never ever return... pick a place like RA or roaring fork if you like to be treated like a paying customer.

This was a tough sell considering we are from Seattle. 

The restaurant itself was beautiful  The architecture and design of the eating areas was like a work of art.  The staff was very kind and we got our tea and appetizer right away.  We waiting a long time for our sushi dishes.  When they finally did arrive, it was not worth the wait.  The sushi did not seem fresh.  The flavors were lacking.  For a restaurant of this caliber in Caesar's, we were surprised.
Food is average and service below average. Often a long wait after being seated.

An entirely mediocre and underwhelming dining experience. We made a reservation for Saturday night celebrating a family member's birthday and we had pretty high hopes. We can look past the noise, the yelling, the loud music...all of that is fine if the service and food are dynamite. Well, they weren't....with the exception of Kyle the manager who was fantastic.

Our server couldn't have cared less about our non-trendy family: our water glasses stayed empty, there was no "how is everything?" or "can I get you anything?" 

My steak was so unbelievably salty I sent it back half eaten and she kept it on the bill.

At 7:30 on a Saturday they ran out of salmon and cod. The birthday boy had to order chicken, which was mediocre at best.

The runners had their thumbs in the food when they put the plates down on the table.

A salad was brought over that we didn't order and the runner's response was "the server told me to just leave it here."

They cut a large birthday cake into 5 pieces and served it, I've never seen an individual piece of cake so big in my life.

Kyle stepped in and took excellent care of us which is why I'm adding the extra star, otherwise this was most certainly a one-star dinner.
Stopped by for happy hour on Sunday and everything was great! The bartender was very nice and accommodating. The food here is delicious. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in old town.

I gave them a try on July 4th because I actually had a holiday off for once(Whooo!) but I dislike all things barbecue related. So on this American holiday, I decided to go Japanese..and was glad i did!

The place is somewhat hard to find in the forum shops of Caesars Palace, being on the third floor of a mall that is built to confuse tourists and make them spend more money on high end items that they think they need. Anyway, once it's found, it will be easier to make your way back on the next visit. 

I heard happy hour is amazing, unfortunately I didn't make it in time. But the view of the Las Vegas strip, away from the bar helped ease the pain of missing out on cheap drinks. I still ordered a cocktail but it was a bit overpriced for the size-good nonetheless, just small. 

My group ordered the baked lobster rolls, eel avocado rolls, popcorn shrimp rolls and shrimp tempura rolls  I couldn't complain at all on any of the rolls. Very flavorful and plated beautifully.  The lobster rolls were very different..but good! Definitely worth trying. 

Service was also excellent and my waitress was very helpful with explaining things on the menu. Also, before I was seated, the manager was standing near the front and struck up a conversation with myself and the person i was with. He was surprised to find out we were Vegas locals and let me know that "locals are always treated well." We most certainly were treated well and I will always come back to a place that loves locals! Hopefully next time for happy hour!

The food was great and incredible but the staff was absolutely rude, condescending and rolled their eyes at someone in our party because she asked for vegetarian information. Made the mood extremely displeasing. 

UPDATE: After speaking with their customer service and their astounding apology. I reconsider my review based on how it was handled. I am still a bit mad to be honest how we were treated at the restaurant but management was extremely accommodating and apologetic. I will give them a higher review based on my experience with management. I would give their other restaurants a try if I am in the area.
Located in the W Hotel in Scottsdale.  Great sushi dishes and a great atmosphere.  I've only been there once but the service was great and the food was very taste and fresh.

We hit up Sushi Roku Saturday night before heading to Pure for my cousin's birthday. We wanted to have a nice meal that will be just enough to fill us without making have to unbuckle my belt and go for a siesta. Since it's inside of Caesar's it's the perfect location to eat before hopping off to the club. The ambiance was lovely, the waiters were uber friendly (and very cute) and the food was top notch. Their Usuzukuri (thinly sliced of fluke with ponzu sauce) is to die for!!! 

It's a bit pricey, but the free birthday dessert of assorted mochi ice cream and the little fireworks show they threw in added that special touch. Be sure to check out their wine list, its ace! I had a phenomenal glass of Riesling that I'm still thirsty for!!!
Setting is beautiful, service is great, food is delicious.
I recommend the Chefs Sushi plate - delicious and artistic sushi that is a pleasure to eat! The Kobe Beef is delicious as well!!! Yummmm

Very upscale flavored fish and sushi. Classy ambience great for special occasions and birthdays. Came here with a group while visiting Vegas and was very impressed. We tried assorted sushi, sliders, salmon plates, and dessert. Everything was fantastic. Will definitely be coming back one of my favorite sushi experiences.

Upon entering, we were not sure we'd made a good choice, walking further into the restaurant out reservations settled...the setting is swanky, urban elegant...dim lighting, pretty decor, knowledgeable staff and good food made this a nice experience. We've had better sushi but overall it was a nice experience .

I was recently in Scottsdale celebrating my bachelorette weekend. Our group of 14 ladies dined at Sushi Roku and all of us highly recommend the restaurant! It was the perfect place for a special night out, and my maid of honor who planned the dinner said the manager was easy to work with. He arranged a pre-fixe menu and every single dish was exquisite! Great value for what we paid. We were seated later than our dinner reservation and the managers brought out a round of drinks on the house, which went a long way in making up for the delay. Dan, the manager who took care of us, is really professional and friendly, and made sure that our group was well taken care of. 

Delicious food and drinks + great service + beautiful ambience = perfect night out with my friends. Thanks for everything!

"Jane, you ignorant slut..." - Dan Aykroyd  

(That's basically what I'm thinking as I read some of these sushi bar reviews.  I mean, who the heck rates a sushi bar based on the distance of the walk to the restaurant or the taste of the 'prime rib' they order there?)

First of all, I think this is about a 3 1/2-Star.  Let me explain why but before I do... I want you, dear reader, to think about an important question:  "What is the criteria for good sushi?"  I believe there are some very basic criteria:
-- FRESHNESS
How soft is the fish?  Does it smell?  Is there a slimy texture to it?  Does it melt in your mouth?  And doesn't this depend a lot on when fresh fish arrives?  DUH.  Ladies & gentlemen, I think we just solved the question of "why are the reviews all over the place for Sushi Roku?"  
-- CHEF SKILL (Selection, cut, preparation)
What portion of the fish is served to you? And how that portion sliced?  Is it prepared with something in addition to rice, like a plum sauce?  How is the formula for this restaurant's sushi rice?  These are all things that should be considered in looking at sushi because they can all drastically affect the overall meal.
-- PRESENTATION
Does the dish appear appetizing?  What kind of wasabi & nori is used?  Is special sashimi shoyu provided with sashimi dishes?  Sushi that looks unappetizing is just plain poorly made sushi.  A significant part of the experience of dining isn't just eating but the anticipation of eating as well.

The fact is that Sushi Roku's sushi is just "okay".  On the days they get their shipment of fish delivered, the quality is very good.  Other days, not so much.  Their chefs aren't bad but like most touristy places in Vegas, you don't form a relationship with the chef.  At best, you get to know the restaurant manager.   What compensates for some of the variation is the fact that Sushi Roku, despite its upper crust placement, is about 20% CHEAPER than the other big name sushi restaurants. (i.e. Nobu)  This difference in cost will be important later when I go over group visits.  The sushi starts them 3-Stars.

What gets them a little more over 3-Stars however are the other things.
-- FOOD/DISHES
They have a fair number of "group oriented" dishes both incorporating raw fish or those that are cooked, allowing dinners to be eaten & shared by people who both "eat sushi" & "don't eat raw fish".  (Here's the menu:  http://www.sushiroku.com/sushiroku/menus/lv.asp) Additionally, the atmosphere is a lot more "relaxed" with the pretension & arrogance turned down a few notches, compared to some other sushi joints.   
This makes Roku surprisingly "party friendly" for folks doing group get-togethers or Bachelorette Parties, etc. since with the well-balanced menu, everyone can order something cheaply that they'd be willing to eat, & then pass it around w/out getting too dressed up.  You don't comfortably get this in many restaurants in Las Vegas, even Nobu.  
-- SERVICE
The wait staff is okay but what defines Sushi Roku however is Kenji Tamida - General Manager of Sushi Roku, Las Vegas.  Most of the time, you can find the well-dressed Kenji personally greeting & escorting guests like VIPs to their tables along with the hostess, shaking hands, & making people feel welcome.  Kenji has a knack for remembering people & providing that high quality, repeatable touch that is lacking in so many turn-and-burn Vegas restaurants today.  And if you've got a group , he'll even sit & have a drink with you if you ask him to & tell you about what's hot in the city, 'cause he's a high profile partier too.  Ask him, & he just might be able to point you to the quickest way to the party, if you know what I mean.  If you stop by, be sure to say hi to him by name & tell him you read about him on Yelp.  He'll take care of you.
-- DECOR
The décor is similar to what you'd see in Nobu, Yellowtail, etc.  What's nice is that the restaurant is configurable for groups of 4 all the way to 30+.  Additionally, their view is great:  It hangs directly over the Las Vegas Strip & give you a rare up-close 3 story view of everything going on while you're dining.   Be sure to make a reservation for a window seat.  

BONUS:  For some reason, a lot of bachelorette parties come here.  I think it's because Roku's known for being a quieter, less dressy, lower profile place & thus I've seen as many as 3 parties going on at the same time, each with the signature wedding veil on the bride to be.

CONCLUSION:
I want to stress that you're not going to go back to Roku over & over for the food.  While it's decent, it's stil a notch below places like Nobu & Yellowtail.  Ultimately, however it's an all-around good place for groups, birthday parties, bachelor parties, etc., w/ a good balance of raw & cooked dishes w/ something for everyone, personal attention from the management, an unbeatable view, & consistently less lower prices than other sushi houses.

3 1/2-Star

Finally was able to ditch the kiddies & have a date night w/ the hubby (who is a sushi snob).  I was craving for some exotic stuff and was not going to waste it on some rock n rock sushi bar.  Sushi Roku didn't disappoint.  The sushi case was filled most variety of fish that I've seen since my days living in S. Cali.  Since dinner happens to land during their summer happy hour (wow...it's cheap) we did a mix between the 2 menus.  

Oysters 3 ways - all I remember is the one with hami, hami oyster with uni & caviar (5*) ...OMG, I will be dreaming about this dish for a very long time. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/DwP10iEz5LGf3fhcVQZm0Q?select=n3aVAzN_-SyGAdkuLyb4Ew

Halibut Special (5*) - thinly slice halibut on ice (tender, slightly chewy, with a light flavor) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/DwP10iEz5LGf3fhcVQZm0Q?select=Fb5juM08pTBbFGH1WKtD8g

Seared Blue Fin Tuna with white truffle oil, micro arugula & parmesan cheese (5*) - the Spanish blue fin just melted in my mouth..yum!

Zuke Hawaiian big eye tuna (5*) - the marinated tuna has the perfect balance of ginger, tamari & maui onion

From the HH menu - 
- Bacardi Moitos (5*) & Skyy Voka Fusion (5*)
-Spicy yellowtail  roll (4*) 
-California rolls (5*) - where else can you score real crab meat Calirolls for $3.50!?!??!
-Asian BBQ Short Ribs (2*) - way too salty & tasted like liver
- Calamari with ponzu (2*) - kinda of under cooked...not crispy at all

The service was awesome and ambiance was perfect (guess it's more causal during HH).  Yes, the raw stuff was kinda of pricey but worth every penny.  I hope I won't have to wait too long for another date night ....*sigh*
Incredible food. Great atmosphere. John the general manager is very professional and curtious
Sushi was decent, service excellent and best of all, love the hours of happy hour.  The spicy garlic edamame was amazing!

Came here for dinner and had the omakase which runs about 120$. Seating was by the bar but at the corner and not in front of chef. The music was loud so it was really hard to hear what was in the dishes when they were brought out. It was 6 courses which each course having 1 piece of sushi with the exception if sushi sampler and meat dish. 
1st was the tofu and some fish dish that had a spicy taste to it which was my favorite of the night
2nd was the seared scallops with butterscotch  sauce
3rd was the sashimi with tuna and another type of fish. Also tasted great.
4th was some type of steak on top of mushrooms and onions
5th and final was 6 piece sushi sampler
6th was dessert which was creme brulee

Overall it was tasty but menu wasn't huge and still was a bit hungry after and also which there was better communication about what's in the dish considering the price.

The food was really good! I'm glad we stumbled upon this place and tried it. It was everything I needed to get my sushi fix. Our server Juliana made it a delightful visit. She was very attentive and friendly. We will definitely be back!

this place, which is part of the w hotel, is officially my favorite sushi place. first, i love this restaurant's restroom; never seen such interesting, modern men's room anywhere else. excellent food, great ambiance - expectedly saw several couples on their date dinners. awesome sushi. 

edamame, various plates of sashimi, bunch of rolls. all excellent food.
never expected such good sushi in the desert (scottsdale, az)

Uni. All day long. Uni @ $5 per piece. Uni from Santa Barbara. Uni that melted in my mouth.

I preferred the nigiri over the rolls.

Fun place with what appears to be a good happy hour menu. Decently priced bottles of bubbly. Gets loud on weekends, but it's the W and to be expected.

Food: 4 Stars
Service: 3 Stars

I give it a total of 3.5 but I always round down.

Thursday night we had reservations at 8:45 PM. Did not get seated until 9:10 PM so the reservations did not have much help. The ambience is nice, dimly light, bar near the front, big open space.

Food:
Sashimi - VERY fresh, this is probably the best thing on the menu. We ordered Salmon, Tuna, Yellowtail, etc. all very good.

Filet Mignon wrapped Asparagus - this was a nice treat, beef was tender, and well marinated.

Kobe Potstickers - nothing special, save your money. Don't get it.

All of their rolls were nothing special.

Chilean Seabass - This was very very good. I highly recommend this.

Overall the FOOD is good, just the service wasn't the best. This review is based on food + service. I recommend this restaurant if it was based on Food only.

We heard great things about Sushi Roku and decided to try it.  The space is great, beautiful strip view, but it ends there.  Service was less than spectacular, and the food was nothing special.  Rolls were very uninspired, sushi/sashimi was ok but nothing great.   I've had much better experiences at Blue Ribbon and Nobu.

The sushi sucked.
The service sucked. 
Food presentation was awful. 
The cocktails rock.

The best thing about this place is that it is connected to the W Hotel. 

Visit Roku solely for the cocktails and ambiance, eat prior.

ok im giving one star because i came for my birthday and the loser waiter didnt give me free drinks. ugh so mad. the food is super expensive. but i got the katana roll and tofu appetizer. it was soo good. that is all. and they spelled happy birthday wrong.
Really awesome robata sea bass skewers. The katana roll is fantastic. Short rib was done really well. Overall great service and happening atmosphere. Would definitely come back.
Some of the best sushi I ever head coupled with excellent customer service. This is a proper restaurant

Amazing food and great atmosphere! Sarah was above and beyond accommodating.  I can't eat gluten, which makes sushi restaurants next to impossible. Tons of GF options.  If my table ordered something not GF Sarah made sure to let me know as it came in. She was so kind and made this experience truly something to enjoy! Thank you! ( five times, Mike! That girl needs a promotion) ;)

What an enjoyable dining experience! The service - Tim was my waiter - was extraordinary!! Engaging, good suggestions, and sincerely interested in how I was enjoying the food. Ok... the sushi rolls are just average. The Katana roll was puzzling in that it reminded me of a manufactured sushi roll offering at my local grocery store... it was NOT even interesting let alone compelling. The tuna/avocado roll was much better... simplicity is their strong suit. The tuna belly (Toro) was SUPERB! What's not to love? The surprise of the evening were the Brussels Sprouts. Order these 1st with a cocktail and study the menu. They are the perfect starter.

Note to self: I'll stick with the sushi in the future and forego the rolls. The guys behind the sushi counter know what they're doing... and the fish is über fresh! But most important - I'll ask to sit at one of Tim's tables!

This place is great for groups. We were a party of 12 girls for a bachlorette party and spotted 3 others that same night. Service was wonderful and I must say it is no easy task to please that many gals. 

The non sushi dishes were perfect but the plate of sashimi and rolls was just average. The server underestimated a few of my friends' appetite including myself. We were still hungry after our omakase and had to order ramen.....good bowl of noodle, I must say. 

Note the kobe beef on hot stones is a MUST.

Just had a business dinner here the other night.  It is located in the shops at Caesars Palace.  This is the second time that I have at there, but I will focus my review on this past visit.

We had a sample menu with a variety of different appetizers and entrees, so we really ate much of the menu.  For sushi on the Las Vegas strip, this place would get four stars from me.  I normally hate spicy tuna rolls, but I absolutely loved this one!  The rest of the food was just as impressive. 

Now the bad.  First, the service was only ok.   There wasn't anything that stood out as really horrible, but for the price of the restaurant I would have expected more, especially in Las Vegas.  Also, I am really into my wine, and this place gets an "F" for  their wine list.  There was nothing that really was appealing, and the cab I ended up trying was so bad that I changed to Sapporo.  

Overall, nice place to have some sushi while you are in the Caesars area.  Maybe you would have a little better experience than I did with the service only focusing on 2-4 people instead of 20-25.

We got the shishito peppers, yellowtail dice chilies, hanabi, spicy pork belly fried rice, and uni udon. The hanabi was perfect. The spicy pork belly fried rice was ok but a little too sweet. Uni udon was not what we expected and more like Alfredo but tasty.

I have just experience food heaven and a food coma all in one! I have always wanted to try this place because I have heard such good things. Their sunset menu before a show at the Gammage Theater was the perfect excuse. Honestly it was such a good deal for so much food and such tasty options. I went with my sister and we each tried something different off the menu and shared. For starters we got the edamame hummus and garden salad. The wonton chips with the hummus were so good and the salad was so light and refreshing. 

For the second course I got the vegetable tempura and popcorn shrimp. Both of which were good, but I would go with the shrimp. The vegetable tempura was good but a bit heavy before the final course. 

I got the salmon as my main course and my sister got the filet. The salmon was perfectly cooked, but I didn't need the rice and the sauce was slightly too sweet for me. The filet was so good with a great teriyaki sweet sauce and perfectly smooth mashed potatoes. Our waitress was very knowledgeable and helpful in our selections and the ambiance was nice. Not super crowded but we had an early reservation. I want to go back and try the rest of the menu.

I was referred here from a friend.  We went this past weekend and it was good sushi.  Nothing out of this world but good.  The waiter was cool, we had some great cocktails!  He then brought us the regular glass water.... OMG it was the dirtiest tasting water.  I thought it was just me but then my girlfriend said her water tasted dirty.  I tried hers and sure enough it was gross.  We told the waiter and he agreed the water was not good there.  We asked him why didn't he tell us and he said because he didn't want us thinking he was trying to sell us a bottle of water.  SOLD!!! we asked for a bottle of FIGI.  For an upscale place like this the regular / tap water was the nastiest I have had in Vegas.  

Anyways!  sushi was gooooooooooooood, over priced but still good and I would go there again and bring water or drink sake instead.

At here about a month ago with my wife & cousin before catching a red eye flight.  Food was a 10.  Great menu, great service, excellent atmosphere.  Its attached to Boa Steakhouse and has similar look & feel (& service).  You will find a diverse crowd...mostly hipsters and dates...pretty trendy overall.

I think this place is on par with the high-end Japanese restaurants in vegas like Nobu.  Will definitely return again.

WBV

3.5 really.  Good sushi and it seemed fresh.  But...the service was not good at all.  I was asked to move at the sushi bar when I first sat down (still not sure why as I was the ONLY person at a 20+ person bar).  The food took not too long, but I had to ask to get a drink refill.  

I had the sushi lunch special $17.  Overpriced, but hey this is Scottsdale.

Many people raved about this place but it's like an overpriced RA Sushi.  

I won't be back...to many other choices.

It just keeps getting  better. It's like being transported to heaven  

Haru is one amazing chef.
Beautiful decor! They gave us some free champagne since were there for our honeymoon. The tasting menu is very decadent, with caviar and truffles. If you like sushi, this is the place to go.
great sushi. Fresh fish. Their toro was particularly good. Did not like their hanabi. Everything else tasted amazing.

My husband and I were shocked at how mediocre this place was! Based on great reviews we were expecting great sushi and it just wasn't. The place was pretty dead for a Saturday night, I guess that should have been a sign. We had two rolls both were okay, nothing special. The sashimi was good. Service sucked. Total waste of money.

I have to say it was a bit difficult to find since its under the W hotel and if you don't pay attention you'll miss it. 
Parking was a bit difficult as well and it was only Sunday night but it was worth it. 
Nice atmosphere and the staff is very accommodating and helpful. 
The food is delicious and the fish is so fresh and the portions are just right. 
It's def worth another visit since we know where it is now : )

Average sushi joint at best. Showed up late which is a plus but had to wait for a 6top. That's pretty lame when there are so many open tables. We drank and ate and the food and service was good. I wouldn't go out of my way to go back with all the options out there but it was good enough to stop in again. Groups are rampant in Vegas so be prepared for them. Don't make them stand out front in ask way fashion while you quote 25min. Most people will leave. Invite us in to chill and we would've had a round of cocktails. Details really. All in all a good start to the night.
Doesn't even need a review. Just go. Get the yellowtail sashimi with ponzu appetizer and thank me later. ;-)

The service we received was incredible. The yellowtail carpaccio was one of the best appetizers I've ever had. We loved the sake as well! I will definitely be returning soon. It was an amazing experience!

Went with 8 girls and spent $340. Not bad for Vegas. 

Pros:
Great sushi, even though you're in the middle of the desert.
Good drinks.
Seaweed salad supposedly amazing, says two of my friends.
Atmosphere +++
Squishy seats at the booths. 

Cons:
You're not really going to feel full after eating here unless you're dropping some serious money. 
Skip the miso soup, sooo not worth $1, let alone $4

What we really liked about it is that we got a free dessert sampler thanks to a chef a friend knew and we didn't have to go far to hit up Pure. Good times.

Came in here about five o clock. A friend of mines made a reservations because I've read reviews saying this place is awesome and crowded.... It was a ghost town. I thought they said happy hour on Sundays? I guess not. The sushi was ok. My rainbow roll wasn't really a rainbow roll. It had waaaaaaaaaay too much avocado on top and no fish?! Literally 5 rolls were avocado and 3 actually had fog on top, with a little bit of avocado. 

Our server sucked big time. We were done with our food and he didn't  come to give us our bill. IT WASN'T EVEN BUSY. My friend was drunk and impatient. So I told her we will meet her outside. It took a while. YIKES.

I was pretty excited to go here because I live in California and wanted sushi so bad. I didnt know vegas much. It was a whatever experience here. Née going back. Both my friend and girlfriend made fun of me because I was super excited for this "awesome" place..... Fail!!

Good sushi but pretty pricey!
I had a dynamite roll that was not bad. I believe it was $14 for 8 small pieces. I guess you're paying for Vegas prices.

This place is in the Forum Shops so the location and view of the strip are the attraction.  Don't valet in front of Caesar's, go to the right of Caesar's (as you are approaching it and driving towards the valet area) and there is a driveway on your right.  Take that and it puts you in front of a steakhouse with valet.  Go to the 3rd level and there it is.  Nice place, great view, and the service seemed to be very good.  It wasn't busy for lunch though.  I had the basics - miso soup, yellow tail and halibut sashimi, and tuna nigiri.  It was all fresh and very good.  It is an expensive place though relative to sushi that can be had elsewhere.  If you're going to spend that much you may as well go to Nobu in the Hard Rock.  Nobu has marginal atmosphere but good crowds and great sushi.  I would come back here but only for dinner on a busy night.

Not bad for Vegas.  But is that really what you want when you're splurging on vacation?   I came here looking for an authentic Japanese meal.  They tell you the fish is flown in from Japan.  And to tell the truth, the food is not bad, it's just nothing special.  It's Americanized touristy stuff, without the exotic fish one finds in establishments that target connoisseurs.  The fish was certainly fresh, but that was not enough to overcome the abominable service.  That was unJapanese enough to ruin the meal.  The waitress didn't know the menu and had to go find the answers to our questions, until we got tired of asking.  Why is she even serving if she doesn't know what she's presenting to the customers?  We tried to ask the sushi chef about the menu, but his English was limited and he based his suggestion on how we could save money, when instead we wanted him to knock our socks off.  Then the bus boy took our plates away while we were still eating, which is downright rude.  I felt like just another tourist passing through a shiny hollow Vegas cash drainer.  I'm not coming back.

Enjoyed the salmon nigiri and Toro jalapeno. Sushi chef was great!

From caesers walk into forum shops near food court  and hang a right at fountains. Kind of difficult to find the restaurant.
Excellent sushi for happy hour. Daddy & I ate some rolls with soy paper. We had fun eating at the happy hour.

A very modern restaurant on the third floor of the Forum Shops. With such a high price piece of real estate you expect the prices to be a little higher then a normal sushi bar. 
I don't mind paying a little extra as long as the fish is top quality. 
The fish was real tender and full of flavor. 
We had tuna, yellow tail, albacore, shrimp tempura hand rolls and spicy scallops.
Great location
Great Sushi

The food here is way overpriced. You are paying for the location and the atmosphere. I've tried lots of sushi and this wasn't even that good. I might give it a better review if the food was actually decent but you don't even get your money's worth. I will stick with sushi brokers as my go to sushi spot.

The baked crab rolls were excellent!   I went here mid-afternoon and it was nearly empty, but the service was great, and I sat at the sushi bar.   Fun to watch them make your rolls right in front of you.

The restaurant itself is very beautiful and the service is excellent but the food leaves a lot to the imagination. My wife and I go to a great sushi restaurant every Wednesday in the city of Alameda CA and I ordered the same thing that I always order and am used to paying about $37.50. What I got at Roku was about 1/2 the quanity and about !/2 the quality. The Nigri pieces were cut very thin and the Chirashi pieces were also cut very thin and the quanity was very sparce. We received a bill without the tip for $97.40. What a rip off to say the least. I wasn't expecting it. I guess this restaurant is only for turists who probably never ate sushi or will never go back. I sure would not go back or recommend this place to anyone.

Craving sushi in Phoenix is probably a death wish.  (Sorry Phoenix people, I'm from California where there's sushi galore!)  I couldn't find any decent sushi nearby, and since I was staying near the W, I yelped and found Sushi Roku!! (Thanks again yelpers!)  

We got there in time for happy hour and enjoyed $5 appetizers and discounted rolls.  I had a bellini, my husband had a beer and we had a ton of food to share between us.  Delicious.  A little bit more on the pricey side, but very fresh and tasty.  

It also made me feel better that this restaurant is a sister restaurant to Sushi Roku in Los Angeles (one of my friends' favorite places in LA).  :)

Hmmm...just noticed some yelpers had breakfast here. Ew...sushi for breakfast just sounds kind of wrong!

I have to say that the sushi didn't "wow"
me...unfortunately!  I expected more for the price.  The ambiance almost made up for it as it had and absolutely beautiful, zen like decor and a view of the strip.  Our server was very friendly and gave great suggestions.  The yellowtail he recommended was fantastic, but, again, nothing out of the 10 sushi orders was anything I would come back for.  I enjoyed Nobu more.

We hit Sushi Roku before the Elton John show. We had 5:30 reservations but had to move them to 6pm in order to dine with a strip view table (only available after 6pm.) Happy Hour drink specials were great as was the wait staff. We were left wanting more, as the food was pretty average. The food quality was good but there was no "Vegas Flare" to the menu.

I did a reservation through yelp for about 9 people on a Saturday. 

I have to say I was blown away by the service here. We got an awesome server who was very attentive and accommodating. Water was always full and the food and other things we requested came in a timely matter.They accidentally forgot the birthday girl's dish, but was able to provide her with a free dish to make up for it. 

I got the Tako roll with the spicy octopus and salmon sashimi and both were delicious and tasted fresh. I also tried my friend's miso butter-fish dish wow! It was so soft and flavorful. 
The birthday girl got a trio of pastry dessert and a candle to blow out to make her birthday extra special. A nice finishing touch to a great dining experience.

Atmosphere was pretty nice too - upscale ambiance. I would return when I go back to Vegas.

Best sushi I've had in a while!

I won't spoil the surprise of the multi-course Omakase, but WOW, was it an experience. Apart from standard Sashimi/Nigiri/sushi fare, you're fed some very, VERY delicious dishes that I've personally never had served to me quite like this before. Okay, so it's not traditional Japanese fare, but it's extremely appetizing never-the-less.

A hint... King Crab w/ Champagne Butter? OMG YES.

This place bills itself as a scene, and on that level it doesn't disappoint: it's a restaurant with the feel of a nightclub, with big groups of dressed-up guys and gals celebrating among themselves and even, as we saw, sometimes in the direction of other tables. The sushi is top-quality, especially for the price, so no complaints there. The service was friendly if a little disorganized, and the drinks were overpriced. Pretty much exactly what you'd expect.

I had one of the lunch specials and was very satisfied. In particular I had a bento box with chicken, salad, rice and tempura. Everything was very delicious and filling. I also sampled one of the rolls was pleased and wished I'd gotten that as well. To drink I had a sparkling saki which was small but very good if you like sweet drinks. I would come back to try the rolls next time.

Do you like sushi? Do you consider yourself sort of a sushi pro? Then check out Roku. It is creative, fresh, fun, and an excellent dinner spot. If you can get a table by the window, you might have a great view of the strip. The service is attentive and professional, the wines are great, and the sushi is extremely good. I've been to a few sushi places in Vegas...all are good....this is the best.

I've only been to Vegas twice and both times we came here - my favorite sushi place ever!  Great food, great service, love the location.  We brought 15 people with us  and they've all been back!  The chef's selection was amazing and looking out on the strip was great.  I highly recommend and can't wait to get back on my next visit to Vegas!

One of my all time favorite sushi restaurants.  The service is very attentive and helpful.  My husband and I tried the chef's 6 course tasting menu and it was fantastic.  My favorite course consisted of the oysters with 3 different sauces.  Yummy! We will defenitely return the next time we are in Vegas.

I'll admit I went here out of convenience, 100%. I was staying at the W for a conference, needed to get some work done, so I got takeout and took it up to my room. I got three pretty straightforward items: edamame, yellowtail sashimi with diced chiles (supposedly a "specialty of the house"), and the tuna jalapeno hand roll - and was underwhelmed with all of them. 

The texture of the edamame was off on about half of the pods I got - grainy and not moist at all. The pieces that were prepared well were actually delicious, with just the right amount of salt. But WTH, why was half of it wonky? 

The yellowtail sashimi was completely overpowered by the sauce it was covered in. Don't get me wrong, the flavors were good, just completely imbalanced. Way too much sauce, and somehow, something with diced chiles didn't even have a hint of spice to it. The yellowtail was sliced so thin that it was unrecognizable even as fish, and the sauce effectively cooked it. This is a dish I particularly love, that my favorite sushi restaurant at home serves perfectly, so I was very disappointed.

These two dishes behind me, I move on to my tuna jalapeno roll. Based on its name, I'm expecting a very clean, crisp roll. When I open the box, I am accosted with huge dollops of spicy mayo on top of each piece. I dab it off so that the roll looks vaguely appetizing, if a bit smeared. I've never tasted a roll so bland in all my life. Apparently that's why it was swimming in mayo - to give it some flavor. Also, it was supposed to come with toro, but they were out of toro and subbed regular tuna, but charged me the same. Toro is a lot more expensive than regular tuna, so I wasn't thrilled about that, but I was expensing dinner, so the cost was really didn't matter. 

That said, if I was actually spending my own money, I definitely would not spend it here. Yeah, I'm not from Arizona, I've always lived by some water, so maybe this is the best you can do here, but I really doubt it.

Don't believe the hype.  
$16 dollars for 4 skinny pieces of salmon sashimi. Bogus. If you are going to drop dollars, don't do it here.  It may be an awesome restaurant for LA, but it didn't work for me in Las Vegas. 

Reservation highly recommended.  Even then, hope for the best! 
We had to wait over 30 minutes for our food, hungry. It didn't help that we saw tables seated after us getting food before us. 
From what I gather, everything else that was ordered was good:  the halibut fish special, the ramen, the chicken skewers, and the sushi were delightful.  If it wouldn't of been for the the wait, you may have seen 3 stars from me.  
If you are a party of 6 or more, 20% gratuity will be automatically tacked on to your bill, regardless the situation. 

Luckily for us, our waiter couldn't refute the mistakes and updated our bill.  Too bad he ended up with a couple of dollars, but maybe next time....a little more communication or some chips and salsa please...well you know what I mean. 

Drinks seemed appetizing, the bar staff was friendly, and the hostess was nice.   My company of 5 HOT woman made up for my meal.

No one receives five stars from me.

I narrowed down the search for sushi by searching yelp within Old Town Scottsdale for sushi joints with two $$ and below. This one fit my budget for happy hour only. After happy hour, this place is too expensive for my budget.

Here, I order several things off of the the happy hour menu. My first choice was the albacore Sashimi with the ponzu sauce. I was very impressed by the flavor of the sashimi, and the fried/crisped slivered onion strips were a wonderful and not overpowering garnish. However I felt that the albacore was a little bit too thin. Not enough substance. 

Next, I also ordered the spicy tuna hand roll - and boy was it spicy! It had a very good combination of spiciness and flavor it was not overpoweringly spicy, and the roll was of a decent size. Same deal with the salmon skin roll. Nice and salty just like how I like my salmon skin, and ditto with the size of the roll. A good solid flavor to the salmon skin - good taste. 

I must admit that I ordered doubles of the wagyu beef on a skewer. The beef was well-cooked, not too fatty, nice and tender, and with lots of sauce on it. The sauce was delish, and the meat was very flavorful and cooked very well (not well-done, but just slightly less than medium). I ordered two skewers, but in all fairness, may not be worth $7 each skewer. 

I do slightly regret not trying out the edamame hummus and spicy edamame, but I ordered enough happy hour selections to make me satisfied and empty my wallet, so I quit while I was ahead.

Keep in mind that, at this joint, you pay for the vibe and the rent just as much as for the food and service. I gladly paid, but it's not something I can afford on a regular basis.

The staff was very attentive. I had no less than three very good looking waitresses waiting on me as well as two other waiters. My food came instantly after I ordered it within about a couple of minutes after each order. And every time they brought the meal out to me they gave a brief description of what it was that I was receiving. 

All of the waiters and waitresses seem very happy and I believe they are well-paid this place is a very well-run operation the employees are very professional and the appearance of the restaurant is very good and clean.

 I do like the food dear however I would limit my purchases to happy hour it also helps that they have very good music and lighting inside the restaurant which produces a very nice relaxing ambiance

Roku doesn't disappoint in terms of freshness.  The sushi however lacks any innovation in terms of combining ingredients and wowing the taste buds.

The entrees are all decadent and savory on the taste buds but the steak is a bit over drenched in salt and oil.  

The desserts on the other hand are scrumptious and to die for.

Thieves!  Had a nice business meal a couple weeks ago.  Spent close to $700 that evening. But when I got my credit card statement they added an additional $300!  What the server or manager did was changed the first digit of the tip!! Called the manager and he responded with "oops".  Unbelievable!

Well, after being in AZ for the week and being pleasantly surprised at the low price of our restaurant/bar bills, we finally ate/drank a $200 meal. Hubby insisted on trying a sushi place in Scottsdale because of the sheer number and high rankings. I dubiously complied. While you won't find anything exotic or too creative, you will find a solid selection and freshness as long as you remember there's no ocean front property in AZ. The sushi chef was a young man from Japan and the waitress was super nice. The restaurant is located inside a W Hotel with a corresponding atmosphere.
Here are the turn offs: 1. I caught something moving out of the corner of my eye on my chopstick. I chased the bug down under my plate and didn't know what to do but smash it with my napkin. I did not want to look too close, flagged the waitress down and she took care of it wiping down and replacing my dinnerware. 2. Shishito peppers are drowning in a sauce that is overwhelmingly sweet and even more overwhelmingly salty. The menu does not indicate they are in a "sauce" and I expected them sprinkled with sea salt as I've usually had in other places. 3. I had the great misfortune of being seated where I had a bird's eye view of someone who was obviously a regular and her dinner companions shoving their tongues down each other's throat. Sigh, judgmental yes, but just not what I want to see while eating dinner and nothing the restaurant can do about that. Keeping in mind the context, if we are ever in the mood for sushi in Scottsdale again, we would return.

Some of the best sushi rolls I've had in my entire life!!!

This place is a must... and even better because it's inside the W Hotel : )

Best of the best. The quick fried nori is incredible, the spicy tuna on crispy rice (hanabi), the king crab fried rice, the fabulous rib eye... I can go on and on. Coupled with attentive and friendly service, this is the place to go. Congratulations to Johnny and his team, for not just the food and service, but the amazing consistency.

I failed to find any flaws in my Sushi Roku experience last weekend. 

The designers of this place had a clear vision of what they wanted in mind, and they executed it with complete, meticulous precision. You can dislike that vision if you want, because you hate Scottsdale's douchebaggery or whatever the case may be. But then, I would question why you'd bother to come here in the first place. 

The environment was typical of W's I've seen around the country: upscale, chic, a bit clubby, all the things that attract male douches and female hotties. The service was professional and prompt. The sushi was the best I've ever had in the desert with the glaring exception of Yasu. The bill for four of us was well over 200 bucks before tip, but we left happy because we got what we paid for.

You have got to be kidding me... Sushi Roku is ridiculous!  Ridiculously BAD, that is!  In fairness,  I give them one star for the service and another star for the ambiance (the restaurant is really gorgeous; if you sit in front of the windows, you get an amazing view of the strip).  But OMG, this place way overpriced!  I had dinner with 2 friends and it came to $300!  What the hell?!  The rolls were small and really not that special, and most importantly, they were NOT FRESH!  The nigiri looked like it had been sitting out all day!  Unacceptable!

While I would opt for Nobu if I could, Sushi Roku is a GREAT second choice in Vegas. I come here every time I visit. The sushi is fresh and delicious. I generally never have to wait for a seat. A touch on the pricey side - but it is Vegas. Order the tofu steak as an appetizer. Overall a huge fan. I've also been to the Sushi Roku in Pasadena - like the one in Vegas better.

UPDATE: Went back again today for lunch. The Uni and Hotate was awesome. Love the consistency...
Extremely tasty, nice ambiance, and good #customerservice. However, small rolls, can be a bit pricey, but a cute little date spot.

Rolls were okay.

Hamachi okay.

Seabass was overcooked for my taste. but okay.

should've went to nobu...

This review is a little stale.  Its been a few months, but Sushi Roku popped up as a place I had not reviewed yet.  The sushi?  Great.

That's not what this review is about.  Everyone at my table had been drinking, except me, the night in question.

We ordered up, I collected cash from everyone, and I paid the balance on my card.

When we got the bill back to sign - I noticed it was a little light.  10 dollars was missing from the cash amount.  What ensued was a debacle of the waitress trying to tell me that I counted the money wrong (I didn't) and looking around under the table for the missing money.

I have seen this scam before, and I am sure it works great on drunk patrons.  Not so great on sober ones.  I didnt want to waste anymore time so I just took the 10 bucks out of her tip and we headed out the door.

She chased us down to tell us she found the 10 dollars under the table.

The same one we just looked under with flashlights while she was inside.

I have told several friends about this - and I dont think we will be back.  I can only imagine how many other people have probably been ripped off like this.  After all - it's only 10 bucks, who will notice?

This cheap bastard.  That's who.

Service was out of this world. I haven't been to a restaurant in town with this level of great employees in a long time. attentive, refilled drinks quickly without being asked, and kept the table satisfied with the entire experience. The table had a variety of sashimi, lobster, steak and dessert. The best part was the fried rice with spicy tuna on top. While pricey, you are taken care of for certain! Giving it four stars only because of the cost.

Hands down some of the best sushi I've ever had. Not just in Vegas, but all over the world. Everything is so fresh and the dishes are unique and delicate. Well worth the price when you want the best sushi experience.

I have been coming to this place for almost 2 years now and...I LOVE IT. Joy, Lauryn, Lisa and Ryann are AMAZING. Their entire staff has been more than accommodating. Overall the place has a great energy. I will continue to come here and I recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice environment and great food.

Kinda pricey but food is amazing.
Located on the first floor of the W Hotel in Scottsdale, this is the best place for Japanese food.  Very well presented but of course the prices are a little higher than I like to pay for Sushi. 
Very dark atmosphere but that goes for the entire hotel so it's no surprise the restaurant is dark as well. Very comfortable seating and great service.  The waitress always was attentive to my needs. (and attractive too!)
Since I am only here for work I try to take advantage of the immediate area but I always end up back at this place.

My boyfriend and I are from Vancouver and knew we would be eating a heap of fast food on our trip to Vegas, so scoped out the top Japanese restaurants in Vegas ahead of time. Sushi Roku was one of the top on the list, and as we passed by it during the day at Caesar's Palace, the decor looked lovely, as did the menu.

I was really impressed with the ambiance of the place - it looked like it could fit 150 people easily and the furniture and light fixtures were grandiose. It was quiet on a Monday night, but allowed us to take in the spectacular night view of the strip. We started off with some edamame, Ingen Itame (Sauteed Chinese green beans with garlic sauce, $8), and Miso Eggplant Dengaku ($10) which were already really good. The eggplant was sweet tasting and crispy on the outside (Leo pointed out that it's because they removed most of the skin) but soft on the inside. Leo also ordered some Kobe Gyoza ($12) on special, which he was barely able to touch because of the entrees we ordered.

Since this place is named for its sushi, I tried out the Eel Avocado roll ($9) and Garden vegetable roll ($12).
