The eel roll was pretty standard, nothing better than what I think I could get in Vancouver, but no complaints. The thing about the veggie roll was that it had a pretty strong japanese herb called Mizuna which is in between mint and cilantro. Not what my tastebuds normally like.

Leo's choices were the special Baked lobster roll with creamy miso ($21) and the special Spicy crunchy shrimp roll ($18) which had tempura batter-like crumbs sprinkled over it. That was my favourite roll and definitely something I hadn't ever tried before. Leo wasn't impressed by the lobster, I think just because it was the most expensive and didn't really live up to the gourmet taste he was expecting. Most dishes involving lobster in the USA are pretty costly.

In the end we had to take home most of the pieces and had no room for dessert. The service at Sushi Roku was excellent - we aren't used to having one staff take orders and check-in and another serving food and drinks, so that was a bonus for us. The server even folded Leo's napkin when he went out to the restroom.

The only thing that lacks the extra star for this review was the dark corner table we had that made it almost impossible to read the menu in candlelight, and the just-above average rolls that were priced more than we'd usually pay at a restaurant in Vancouver.

All in all, not a bad place to try if you're craving some sushi, have some money to spend, and want a romantic place to dine at with a great view of the strip.

Meh, sushi is not that great and they raised their prices over the last few years.   I get that commodity prices have risen but $15 for a sub par spicy tuna roll?  No thanks.  Also, the servers are not very professional and don't seem to communicate.  We were asked to order drinks and dinner twice and we paid our bill then a different server dropped off our bill asking us to pay when we are ready.  Total bill was $100.  I would rather eat at a fine dining restaurant like Mastro's or Del Frisco's.  Twice the price but better service.

I have been to Sushi Roku twice and had an ok experience each time. I sat in the front area on one of my trips, which felt like I was paying high prices to eat sushi in a mall (because basically, that's what I was doing). If possible, asked to be seated in the back area. The setting is dark and romantic, and the windows showcase a spectacular view of the city. On a scale from 1-5, I would rate the sushi here a 3.5. Fairly middle of the road with a few nice surprises. I eat mostly raw rolls, and their menu has a lot of cooked rolls on it, which they were willing to modify for me, but the menu selection was quite small. If you are debating between Nobu and Suski Roku for sushi, let this place be the winner. Overall, not a bad place to visit, but if I come back to Vegas, I will likely check out a new place for sushi.

This was the beginning of my birthday / NYE night at the W Hotel.
Gorgeous, ambient,  classy restaurant with a beautiful flow. 
Love the booth seating and the place is super clean with a very upscale feel, it is a perfect addition to The W.

We were a party of 8 and we had reservations -we were warmly greeted and promptly seated. Solid menu which also includes non sushi options(plus GF.) We had a few apps to share at our table - Filet wrapped asparagus, Edamame, Hummus, Oysters, Seared albacore. The wrapped asparagus was delicious and tender,  the Hummus and wonton's were a big hit as well. The oysters and albacore were fresh and yummy.
Besides having a really nice menu they have a wonderful selection of Sake's and Asian martini's .

I knew i would be drinking so i steered clear of having sushi for dinner, so instead i had a fabulous Prime rib served with a super yum garlic sauce, my dining companions had the sushi assortment and the Lobster, scallops and prawns ..all plates were presented well and were delicious .Service was outstanding, they really took care of us and helped to make my birthday dinner very special .

Cannot wait to return !
We all had a brilliant time.

Pleasantly surprised with the quality of sushi here. Everything is fresh as can be including some killer uni and monk fish liver. The black cod was also cooked just right. Good vibe and space with good views of the strip. If you're looking for top notch sushi this place has it covered just that it comes at a premium price. But it is Vegas and someone has to pay for all those lights.

I LOVED this place!  The sushi and sashimi were amazing and the presentation and service were wonderful!  
My husband and I recently went to Sushi Roku on a date while visiting family in the Scottsdale area.  We are quite particular about the flavor and freshness of our sushi, but love to try new places when we get a chance.  We decided to go to Sushi Roku based on a recommendation from a friend who has been there.  We were SO glad we did!  The sushi was so fresh and flavorful and the presentation of the food and the service were just as wonderful. We also loved the atmosphere of the restaurant itself.  We chose to sit outdoors in a booth and the Scottsdale weather and the lighting were just perfect for an evening meal.  
If you love sushi, you should definitely try this place.  We will definitely go back every chance we get.

I would give them 4 stars for service, everything was good nothing spectacular though. It's more for the ambiance  and going with friends or on a date.

One of the managers there were super nice and gave us really good service.

Surprisingly I'm going to give 4 stars to Sushi Roku.

Here's why...

Being that it was my first time to this location I was SUPER skeptical because it sits at the W hotel in old town Scottsdale, which is nice but, it's a restaurant, not some hot Sushi/club scene that came here from LA as people portray it to be. 


So I was smart, I went on a Monday night when I knew the affliction and UFC crowd would be to a minimum and the staff could actually concentrate and relax instead of bustling around rushing because of a shouting, rude clientele. 

Not to my surprise the experience was exceptional, the staff was hands down friendly, confident in the chef and on track with recommendations including a delicious pairing with a bottle of chilled sake. 

I opted for the steak wrapped asparagus to begin and the stimulus menu for a main course.

To those who don't know, the stimulus menu is a 3 course meal served for $30.00 where you can choose either "Land" or "Sea" and yes, it's okay to mis-match them too. 

I had the "Land" as my first course which constitutes 3 of the restaurants most popular items, steak, chicken, etc and all were prepared absolutely to spec, well except maybe my steak was a tad cold but meh, everything was going awesome so far so why screw it up by complaining.

The second course however I had the "Sea" version in which 4 different pieces of nigiri are served with 3 different types of roll, also note, you can substitute fish in case you aren't feeling shrimp or whatever they serve you, a total plus. 

Third course is green tea ice cream, always a winner in my book.

To sum it up I'd say this location met my expectations with what I had become accustomed to with the LA locations, I'll be back for sure, just never on a weekend, not in Scottsdale at least.

The happy hour here at Sushi Roku at the W Hotel is good, just make sure you are on time as they are very strict on when it ends. The staff is very nice and checks on you often. You can move next door to the Living Room Lounge area which has a fireplace and nice lobby bar at the W, or go to the rooftop bar later for a club atmosphere.
The Kobe sliders have changed from two smaller ones to a single big one, but remains very tasty. The Tuna Tartare was just okay. The Albacore Sashimi was decent. The Crispy Mahi Mahi Tacos were good, but of course, fried.
The top pick probably is still the Kobe slider and the Mini Chocolate Volcano.
See photos.

So the long awaited W has finally opened its doors and so too has Sushi Roku! 
My "date" and I stroll in Monday evening and because it had just opened 3 days earlier I was expecting it to be much more crowded then it was. But that was OK. 
The whole atmosphere of the restaurant was perfect; dark and sexy until they sat us next to the sushi bar where some type of refrigeration unit was running. I could barely even hear the waitress when she came to our table. She did happily seat us at a table further away from what ever that thing was. 
They had a great cocktail list. I had a drink called the fusion which was the perfect blend of berries, watermelon and vodka. It was not overly sweet. They can make a mean dirty Grey goose vodka as well. 
The tofu appetizer was to die for, for those that are tofu fanatics. They make their own tofu in house and serve it with truffles, caviar and green onion. Heavenly! The yellow tail appetizer was also good but you can find the same at alot of other sushi places around town. 
Now for the Sashimi. Their pieces we cut quite a bit larger than most sushi places but also not cut through all the way so you end up with a huge hunk of fish. We did mention it to the waitress. We also thought the sashimi was not the freshest around. We felt like splashing some water on it to bring it to life! Same goes with the ginger, it appeared freeze dried! 
The roll I ordered was one of the best I've had though. It was called something like the Samir. Avocado and spicy tuna rolled in shrimp with rice paper, cilantro and some "hot sauce". Yum-E. It melted in my mouth and did not fall apart between my chop sticks! Impressive! 
So overall, I will definitely be visiting this place again. Maybe not for the sashimi but everything else was top par!!

I would definately agree with some other reviewers that this is an ambience place. At that, it is gorgeous. The food was pretty good but really nothing spectacular. Some interesting technique to put sticky rice on a kabab which gave the rice a nice texture. I saved up my OpenTable rewards points to go here on Valentine's day and ended up feeling guilty when we left. Staff was nice but I am all about the food and this place just didn't cut it for me, especially for the price/hype.

Great sushi, great atmosphere, great service and innovative cocktails.  I really enjoyed this place.

The room has hanging wook panels throughout and is reminiscent of a jungle somewhere far away.  Even the bathrooms are beautiful.  

The sushi is perfect and service was attentive.  I enjoyed my sake cocktail and my friend enjoyed her lycee mojito.

There is a great view of the Strip.  The restaurant closed at 11, but it was a Sunday night.  This might be a 5-star restaurant, but we arrived at closing time and there was a medical incident in the dining room just prior to our arrival.

Everything is overpriced in Las Vegas but sometimes the price - quality difference really astounds you. The prices here are a little too extreme for the quality. The sushi was OK. If I'm going to spend 50-65 dollars on myself for dinner I would expect better service or better food- either one. The sushi seemed rushed oh a rather empty night- I was in not in. hurry as I told them but maybe they just wanted me out of there. 

If they sit in the back you have very good views of the strip but if you are toward the front it kind of looks like it are sitting in a mall restaurant- and a rather low rent one at that. 

I went there because the reviews were very good and there was no line and the menu looks pretty solid. Unfortunately, I will not be back.

Located in Ceasars Palace, in the Forum Shops, near the exit to the Strip, on the top floor.

We came at 4p for their Happy Hour & dinner.  Since we wanted both, we sat at the bar which was great because we wanted to watch basketball.

Happy Hour-
Sunday-Thursday: 4-7p
Friday-Saturday: 4-6p

Nice ambiance, friendly staff, but I wish they were more attentive because everything came out quick except our mochi which came out 20 minutes after we asked for it (& all they had to do was get it from the freezer...), & the food was okay, very pricey but yet very simple.

Spicy Scallop Roll:  Good, simple.
Crunchy Spicy Tuna Tempura:  Very lightly crunchy.  Okay.
Salmon Nigiri:  Fresh.
Katana Roll:  Good.
Strawberry Mochi:  Very old!  The mochi outside crunched into pieces.
Cookies & Cream Mochi:  Good, the mochi on this one was soft.

Located inside Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, Sushi Roku did not disappoint. First, our waiter Sherman Fu was exellent! Attentive, great with recommendations and very polite. We started with cocktails - the Sweet Poochi was deliiiicious, followed by an amazing Omakase menu - 6 courses at the chef's discretion, made with the day's freshest fish - all original and timed to arrive just at the right moment as we finished the previous dish. We left there extremely satisfied!

I was fortunate to grow up on the California coast and have eaten some really incredible sushi. That said, being hundreds of miles away from the Pacific Ocean was not encouraging me to consume sushi in Las Vegas. But, Sushi Roku was a pleasant sushi slap to the face! The Happy Hour was a true hour, 5pm to 6pm, so if you are local and looking to head there at this time... do not underestimate the traffic! We made it with about 15 minutes to spare and were able order our meal, happy hour prices and all!

Said prices were around half off, and hand rolls were cheaper than cut rolls, but are not great for sharing. The rolls were a good size and the fish was good quality. I have found few places that use real crab in their CA rolls and luckily Sushi Roku's were on the money!

My favorite rolls of the night were tuna / avocado, tempura sweet potato, rock shrimp / jalapeño, & spicy scallop  (which I absolutely had to try because it was new & exciting). 

I will be trying more sushi restaurants on the strip. But will also be a reoccurring customer at Sushi Roku for their happy hour! Loved their quiet location in the Forum Shops, hip / cool ambiance, and sushi bar / table / bar-bar options for seating.

I had heard this place was just OK, despite frequenting the W in the last few months. I made my way over on a very busy Saturday night and requested a table for one. The feeling I leave this restaurant with is extremely happy and satisfied as the staff was unparalleled in their welcoming attitude toward me. I think because I was sitting alone, they may have felt sorry for me LOL, not realizing it was quite fantastic. 
The fish was fresh, I ordered the chef's choice sushi eight piece. They were single pieces of fish prepared with ingredients that would accentuate the flavor of the pieces perfectly. 
All of the staff seem to know the menu extremely well and all made similar recommendations which turned out to be epic. The brussel sprouts chips were very decent and light. I will be back. as much for the wonderful staff as much as for the amazing and fresh fare.

Everything we had was absolutely amazing.  After we finished our meals, a businessman sat down next to us at the Sushi Bar.  He began ordering some things that didn't sound familiar from the menu.....turned out he was a regular that had his own routine and they seemed happy to accommodate him.  We followed suit and ordered two pieces of gold truffle yellowtail.....simply put the best piece of sushi I have ever had....I fully expected each piece to run $30 for how elaborate it was but they ended up being $25 for the pair.  Still a pricey single piece of sushi but absolutely worth it.

Service was what you would expect sitting at a sushi bar....the sushi chef's were open to conversation and very polite.  

Price point is on par for being in the Forum Shops at Caesars.

Came here for happy hour and nosh on a Thursday night and had a great time!

We ordered appetizers off the happy hour menu but skipped the happy hour drinks because it looked boring.  Instead, we ordered a bottle of sake and Hendricks cocktails (gin, lime juice, simple syrup, cucumber).  These are the appetizers that we loved and would order again:  shishito peppers, green beans, spicy tuna rolls, shrimp & jalapeno rolls.  The fillet with asparagus, albacore rolls, popcorn/tempura shrimp were just okay and not worth reordering.

My hands down favorite were the shishito peppers!

Service was impeccable!  I can't remember our server but we were there awhile and had 2 different servers and both were excellent!

The menu had some really great looking things on it but the actual food didn't deliver.  We had...

1.  Filet wrapped asparagus - some of the lowest quality filet meat (if it really was filet) I have ever had.  So chewy and fatty that I had to spit out several pieces.  Kind of awkward when the server picks up your cloth napkin and a bunch of chewed up meat balls come flying out of it onto the table.

2.  Albacore sushi - tasted very fishy.  That's all I have to say about that.

3.  Eel and avocado roll - eel was fishy and chewy (kind of a mix between and the filet and albacore)...the rice was hard.

4.  Chicken stuffed peppers - extremely salty and oily.

5.  Truffle oil edamame - excellent!

6.  Green tea - excellent!  

The atmosphere is great and it's connected to the W hotel so there is some fun people watching but don't count on good sushi.

?????????????????????food and waiter's service were wonderful,but only the problem was the sushi chef. me and my bf seated in counter. Japanese sushi chef didnt notice I was Japanese, then they started to say bad words about my bf by Japanese.(my bf visited here couple of times, me first time) I know everybody has their emotion and thinking. but at least they should have said it in back yard if they want to say something. I will never recommende to somebody here.

Sushi Roku is the most amazing Japanese high quality restaurant I have been to in Vegas. The 8 years plus I have spent in Las Vegas I haven't been to a better sushi bar. The food although a bit pricey is well worth the investment. Sushi Roku is located in the forum shops located right next to Caesars Palace. This restaurant is located on the third floor which contains a variety of fashion stores to enjoy after your meal.

The appetizer i started with was the lobster Tempura for the price of $35.00. The meat of the lobster came from the the tail very juicy and delicious. The lobster was chopped into nuggets with a sweet and golden miso glaze. The first bite made me think I struck gold with this one. The baked crab hand-roll was my next appetizer and it did not disappoint me. This little morsel was $11.00 classically made with lobster,rice, and butter wrapped in soy paper. This like the lobster tempura had very juicy succulent lobster in it.

Then, I went on to my entree... the best steak ever. The uniquely delicious prime rib-eye steak  "JAPONAIS" was a meat lovers dream at the price of $48.00. The steak I chose was medium rare it was very tender and garnished with tomatoes. The sides included Japanese style potatoes in a delicious sauce and mini wedge shaped.Lastly, this dish included garlic green beans and a delicious garlic sauce that would make A1 cry.

Last but not least, the chocolate lava cake that blew my mind. The minute I took my spoon and cut into this chocolate volcano, chocolate flowed out. Their was also a small scoop of vanilla ice cream and a small cookie. The combination of all three would satisfy anyone after a 3 course meal.

The end of my meal included a birthday surprise for one of my family members. The staff brought my aunt a free creme brulee and brought a wine glass with a sparkler. The fireworks show was the fork in the steak and made the meal wrap up splendidly. Definitely a great destination for a birthday or any other sort of get together. 

This is my first post on Yelp! and well I hope you enjoyed it. Lets see where my taste buds take me next...Talk to you soon!
Sushi Roku is amazing! The food, the view overlooking the strip, and the ambiance was superb. The restaurant manager greets every table and welcomed all guests.

Yummy quality fish and unique flavors. Great view of the strip and great service. We started with the kale salad, but it was the only thing we didn't like. It was strangely salty. We were disappointed that they didn't offer a good deal on a combination plate of sushi or sashimi. We loved the baked lobster roll- it was super rich and indulgent. We also shared the gensai roll- which was fresh and crunchy. We had never tasted such a unique roll. It was okay enough to eat, but I don't think we would order it again. We also had the chicken fried rice, which was yummy. We would go back again.

What a great night! Had our wedding anniversary weekend early in Vegas and Sushi Roku took great care of us!!! Eric was our waiter and he did a great job!! Thanks Eric!!

Our favorite menu items: 
-Tuna Pizza
- Japanese Fried Chicken

..And Roku was so sweet to treat us with the best & most fun dessert, like, EVER:
S'MORES!!!!

Thank you for making our Anniversary dinner so special!

Wow - this may go down as my least favorite meal in Las Vegas, ever.  While the decor is a very chic contemporary japanese and quite pleasing, there are huge windows all around that turn this place into a sauna - even in January, when the outside temp is 60, it was borderline unpleasant while dining - can't imagine how it feels when the sun is really on.  Onto the food: I ordered 3 things from the menu - I sent 2 of them back - when I received my last 2 plates the fish inside was cooked, and this wasn't the description on the menu.  The only reason I didn't send all 3 back was because the first item I got, Hamachi sashimi - was "ok" taste wise, and since it was the first dish - I was hoping things would get better from there.  Yes - when I goto a sushi place, I expect raw fish.  Anyhow - the server didn't blink when I told him of my displeasure with the dishes, and the check was settled without any obvious display of annoyance.  I will say that this was a far cry from my experiences at Sushi Roku in LA, which were delicious.

We were  here for lunch during our engagement weekend and loved this place! 

Appetizer = Edamame Hummus
*nothing special, just yummy hummus with plenty of chips for it

Beef with Sushi Lunch Plate
*The MOST AMAZING beef ever. We asked our server what kind of meat it was and she said "filet tip". We are still thinking and raving about this beef when we order beef at other places.

Teriyaki Chicken with Tempura Lunch Plate
*chicken was seasoned very well. Tempura was perfectly battered

Fiance had scaallop sushi and a few others and said they were fresh and tasted great!

Service
*VERY attentive, not sure if it was because it was lunch time but it was great. 

As said by others, the view was amazing and we loved it even more when we realized we were eating right above our Trevi Fountain engagement site :) 

Priced a little high but worth it totally for us!

We will 100% be back here whenever we are in Vegas again!

Thanks Sushi Roku, you Rock hehe!

Sushi Roku was spectacular with their food and service! I mean, sure I don't eat sushi often and had a crazy strong hankering for some while scoping out the casino but that doesn't mean I'm biased! Proof? Very well eager Yelper.

First, the service. The ladies poised at the podium up front were all smiles and will be very quick to guide you to your seat. The lady at the bar was pleasant and helpful in her suggestions of what dishes were most popular (as well as her personal favorites).

Next, le food. Oh lawd. Each dish was elegantly plated, the food on the plates were excellent in quality and taste. I don't know how to put into words how happy the food made me. Turn to the pictures for a deeper understanding of what these morsels look like.

Finally, decor. VERY cool stuff. From the layout of the restaurant and seating, to the art on the bathroom - Sushi Roku made the food, the view, and the experience very much worth it! I'll definitely be back again.

Unimpressed. 

Our dishes got progressively worse as the meal went on.

The decor here is the highlight. Super-cool ambiance.

Otherwise, the food was a very poor value, even by Vegas standards.

I loved the Yellowtail Sashimi with diced Chilies. Very yummy!

We had 2 Tempura rolls and both tasted like a camp fire. Not sure if the oil in the deep fryer was burnt? But it was foul. Also, experience some severe fishy-ness in the couple of Tuna rolls we tried. 

I could find better fish at a run-of-the-mill strip mall sushi restaurant. Too many great restaurants to bother with this one.

I needed a little snack to tide me over until an evening event at Caesar's Palace, so I stopped in for a quick graze at the sushi bar.  I ordered a couple pieces of tuna and salmon sushi, as well as a spicy tuna hand roll, which I use as a measure of any sushi restaurant I visit.  Both were excellent, but the hand roll was a real surprise.

Many times I have had a hand roll that was acceptable, but this restaurant went the extra step to crisp the nori before wrapping the spicy tuna.  The result is an extraordinary crunch of the seaweed before biting into the perfectly seasoned tuna.  

Excellent atmosphere and great staff coupled with the food made me want to bail on my appointment and stay for a major feed.  Next year I plan to do just that!

Dimly lit, with hip, global influenced urban interior, Sushi Roku is sleekly packaged. 
Fortunately, the food is on par with its decor.
Everything we tried (beef tataki, kurobata pork, chilean sea bass, and lobster roll) was fresh and well cooked. The flavors was creative without trying too much. It was fusion while still retaining basic essence of good, clean Japanese flavors.The only complaint was the over peppering of the tuna steak.
A very pleasant dining experience if one ever needs a break from buffet overload.

Searched for a sushi restaurant that opened before 5pm and Sushi Roku came up. I was happy to see that there was a number of things for non meat eaters on the menu:) The food was awesome, the drinks were refreshing and the service was amazing!!! Thank you to our waiter Rommie! He was so helpful.. He recommended the perfect items and drinks and was super friendly and even gave us dessert!!! Thank you again Rommie!!!

If you are looking for a chic, elegant and youthful evening out then this can go into the suggestion barrel.   The W is like a modern movie set with lots of beautiful people running around.  Our waiter was a bloke from Brooklyn and he was fantastic--knowledgeable, charming and efficient.

The food really was delicious.  My wife had a plate of grilled vegetables that were excellent and my steak could not have been better.  Our daughters had noodles and sushi and, again, delicious.

Okay for you Japanese purists out there.  We sat next to a group of 4 Japanese adults who didn't have enough English to get through Run Jane Run.  As they left, I obnoxiously tapped one on the shoulder to ask what he thought of the restaurant's Japanese food and he articulately stated, "Not Japanese food".  Oh well, I enjoyed my American meal.

Such a romantic sushi spot! But my girlfriends and I enjoyed it sans men-folk .Great view of the strip and comfy/cozy leather lounge seating. 
Service was great and always with a smile. Wait, you mean my server is NOT annoyed that i'm here and ordering? nice!

Everything tasted delicious and most importantly fresh. Overall most things are reasonably priced but you will pay a bit more for specialty items. But honestly the food in some of the food courts in Vegas can get pretty pricey so I say you might as well get what you really want.

Happy hour! :) For food and drinks, but I only had water here. The water itself was deng sexy. LOL. Lemon placed in the cup with a toothpick, you wouldn't feel like it's just water.

The happy hour items had was:
 - Filet Mignon Wrapped Asparagus w/Soy Mirin: It was good! The sauce and juice from the meat thinly wrapped around 4 stalks (two halved asparagus) was delicious. The asparagus was cooked, but still had it's crunch in the center. (HH: $6)
 - A2 Fusion: consists of albacore, onion, avocado & jalapeno. One of the best rolls I've had in a while. (HH: $5)

You'd get more with sushi roll, $4 handroll isn't worth the quantity.

Decor was simple, had a hint of modern, and even thought it's in Vegas, felt like I was in California, if that makes any sense. LOL

For Happy Hour, you'd have to sit in a designated spot. Only minus 1 star, because I had to sit with people who were trash talking about Asians at the same table. It's not their fault, but I wasn't able to move from the table to another spot to avoid hearing them continuously bash on my culture. Made my eating a bit awkward.

By far my favorite sushi place ever. I absolutely love love it.  I honestly would love to see where some of the haters on here have had better sushi! Its my fav and I come here every time I come to Vegas

Had a business meal here and all i can say is WOW. Loved it. Great service and very good food. If you like Sushi then this is a must.

Visited July 201
absolutely love this restaurant......service, quality of the food, origionality of the dishes is superbe

We ate here for lunch. The sushi is average for the price. The crunchy spicy tuna avocado roll was yummy. I'd recommend this place for lunch, but certainly don't head here for dinner. It's in the middle of Caesars Mall smacked in between a bunch of stores.

This review is solely based on food because I ordered this for take-out. My lunch consisted of:

Baked Lobster Rolls
Scallop & Salmon Nigiri
Spicy Scallop Hand roll
Filet Foie Gras Skewer

First Impression, Fish pieces for the nigiri was relatively smaller than other a la carte places. Foie Gras Skewer, I was expecting a bit more for the price of $18. It was literally just 1 skewer. With super thin slices of Foie Gras between meat and asparagus. 

For the taste, the salmon, I couldn't tell too much how fresh the fish was. It had a little bit of aftertaste, a bit fishier than normal, although did not have a freezer burn taste, so I can't tell. The scallop tasted fresh though. 

Spicy Scallop Hand Roll, might be too spicy for some people, but I like my food SPICY. So I enjoyed the taste, but the texture was just too mushy.

The Foie Gras Skewer - biggest let down of my whole order. There was literally not any noticeable foie gras on this. I was expecting more. You can't even taste it. The beef filet was dry. Bleh. 

The only thing I semi-enjoyed was the baked lobster rolls. Chunk of lobster in each bite. But even so, still mediocre at best. Sushi Roku didn't really do it for me. It definitely did not live to its hype. Overpriced, and mediocre.

I n my humble opinion this is one of the best, if not the best Japanese Restaurants on the Strip. Excellent service, amazing salmon carpaccio, beef wrapped asparagus, wagyu beef, very good rolls and alcohol selection. Very helpful and considerate staff.

Went here for dinner with some girlfriends on Saturday night. It has a nice clean and trendy atmosphere with some tasty bites. It's a little pricey, as are most decent sushi restaurants. Their cocktails are yummy, I had a refreshing St. Germaine, as well as some miso soup and veggie tempura (not a fish person, ew).

Good place for girls night, or dates. If you're a resident of Scottsdale, they even feature a "locals discount" certain times during the summer.. Thumbs up to management!

Not sure what the hype is all about.  Maybe because it's sushi on the strip?  There's better sushi and it's outside the strip.  

Ok, I'm not saying it's bad.  The calamari was good and different from the calamari I'm used to.  The jalapeno glaze gave it a tangy crunchy flavor, which makes it unique.  We ordered 2 rounds of that.  

The endamame, I was expecting to have more spices added on to it.  There was barely any salt.  

Got the foie gras skewer as an appetizer.  It was just a small skewer wrapped in asparagus.  Tasty, but for the price, I wish I got more than a skewer.  It was so tiny.  

I also had the pork belly fried rice with fried egg on top.  I like the flavor of the pork belly and how tender it was.  Runny fried egg made it all better.

This place is good, but pricey since on the strip.  Ambiance was good too.  You need to make a reservation to get strip view seating.

I have died and gone to sushi heaven!  The irony is I happened to eat sushi earlier today at a different restaurant, and Sushi Roku's same dish, just blew the other place's right out of the water!  OMG!  

Add excellent food (the prices were definitely a bit higher than other sushi places- but still the flavor and quality were tangible things you can actually TASTE), excellent service (Angela was a complete doll!- and the GM Seth rocks!), and fresh and fab decor, and you have a winner!

Mark my words, this will be THE place to be seen for quite some time to come.  

On a side note, I also liked the trendy-ness (and yet very approachable and friendly nature) of the hotel in general.  Everyone was super cool and welcoming to my friend and I.....although it doesn't hurt that she is smokin' hot and we are both super friendly and nice!  But it did appear that EVERYONE was greeted and served graciously.

The fillet appetizer (wrapped around asparagus) was divine!  The spicy tuna rolls literally melt in your mouth, and the soft crab rolls are a little slice of heaven.  

Be sure to look your best and have fun people watching while enjoying a great meal!  (But save up, 'cause it ain't cheep!)  BTW, we went on a Thurs, and it was pretty packed.  MAKE RESERVATIONS!!

Warmest wishes,

Kirin :)

Because I was here on someone else's dime, I enjoyed the food very much.  I had the pork ramen and the salmon carpaccio.  Living in Austin, ramen is like rain, very, very scarce.  Out of the ramen I've had across the US, this was solid.  Nothing to obsess over, but FAR from the worst I've had.  The salmon carpaccio had wonderful olive oil, mint, and light seasoning that I loveeeeeeee.

$7 for a 12oz Sapporo?  Well, this is Vegas.  Find this place in the corner of the Forum shops on the highest level.

I was not impressed with this place despite having heard some positive things from my husband's friend.  We sat at the bar as we were not planning on eating an excessive meal and we were just looking to be a tad more low key than what I had seen in the dining room.  

I was not impressed with the quality of the fish, or the service here.  Decent, no complaints about the food, but it was just like what I could get back home (which is not all that impressive).
I love this place! I always go for happy hour which includes cheap drinks and eats. The bar tender is always very friendly and fun to talk with. Sushi is fresh!

Mmmmm, Mmmmmm, Great food.  The popcorn shrimp here are to die for-they leave a wonderful lasting impression.  So does their desert plate...The service was wonderful and quick and attending to us.  Also, we had been lounging at the pool all day and were not looking so sharp but they didn't seem to have a dress code or anything as they were more than welcoming.  It is a bit pricey but i'm not sure you can expect anything less when going to a W Hotel.  I recommend this place to anyone who wants a more chic sushi experience, cool atmosphere, doesn't mind paying the extra dollar and enjoys tasty food.

Absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas.  I come here not for "Authentic" Japanese food, but for fresh seafood and great drinks served in a very fun environment.

I usually go for several assorted sashimi/appetizer dishes, followed by a couple hot entrees.  The lobster tempura is excellent, as is the hirame sashimi, prepared with citrus and jalepeno.  Service is just as good as the food, as the waitstaff is very attentive yet not overbearing.

Tasty, unique rolls. My fav sushi in vegas so far.

love the location- in the forum shops... overlooking the strip.

Fresh fish and they do something different than K-RAB!!! thank goodness!

Fantastic sushi--and great atmoshere. My friend told me this is a chain store in LA, but the quality was great. WAY overpriced, but that's okay on the corporate expense account---LOVE corporate! I showed them some magic and the management was very sweet and friendly and open and nice. I'll be back!

My wife and I were looking for sushi we stopped at Sushi Way. We had the all you can eat for dinner 26.95 Bacon wrapped scallops are awesome coconut shrimp tempura was awesome every thing we had was awesome many things to order off all you can eat menu. The chef was great he helped us order and surprised us with different rolls. A great experience I had never had all you can eat sushi and was nervous but for no reason it was awesome.

Blown away by this restaurant! I've been looking for a good place for sushi in the valley for a while.. and I have been extremely disappointed at every turn. Out here it is almost never real, authentic Japanese sushi. I kid you not, it's hard to find one that doesn't put hot sauce on their spicy tuna.. it's frightening actually. Well, I stumbled on this place on a Saturday afternoon. My boyfriend and I were extremely underdressed, as the place looks really upscale. We almost turned around and left because of that, but I'm SOOO glad we didn't. The service was amazing. Very knowledgeable, fun waiters. The place is gorgeous. My cocktail was top-notch. But the SUSHI... OH MY GOD. It was AMAZING. The best sushi I think I've ever had even outside of Arizona. Extremely fresh. Made to perfection. Melt in your mouth, delicious, truly authentic sushi. We will DEFINITELY be back.. and definitely not in our sweats this time.

I was recommended to try Sushi Roku located in the Forum Shops and I'm glad I did.  
The restaurant itself is nicely decorated.  I liked the decor that's on the restrooms doors.
(See photo) 

Service: 
From the time I walked in to leaving the restaurant I felt like I was special. 
I was warmly greeted by a young lady in which I mentioned that I would be dining alone and would like a view of the strip.  DONE! She sat me right along the windows that overlooked the south side of the strip.  
Hugo, my server, was very helpful in recommending a sushi of my liking. He kept coming around to make sure that I liked my dish and we got to chit chat a little about the food.   (I don't eat raw fish often but in this case I figure I'd try it and see if it was fresh)

I'm glad I did. My sushi was topped with Tuna that was yummy and fresh. I also informed him that I don't like too much jalapeno's  so he made sure it was on the side rather than wrapped in my sushi.  The miso soup was tasty and very flavorful and I washed it down with a Blue Moon.  ( I know I should've had a Sapporo instead) 

My experience here was amazing that whenever I'm in Vegas I will definitely return.
Second time I was there to entertain business guests. Excellent service and great view of the strip. Tasty food, though a bit pricey. Of course, that's expected in Vegas nowadays.

Not accommodating at all. I'm a vegetarian and asked the server to see if the sushi chef can make some vegetarian rolls for me. They made a cucumber roll with cucumber and asparagus, which is fine. However, the roll is very small and asked if they can make another roll. The server asked and told me that the sushi chefs can't make anything else. So they are telling me that the sushi chefs can't make any other vegetarian rolls besides a cucumber and asparagus roll? That's a bit ridiculous considering this is an upscale place. Kabuki, a typical Japanese restaurant, made me so much different vegetarian rolls when I asked. Disappointed!

Great atmosphere though.
We went to happy hour and had almost everything on the menu. One of the best happy hours I have been to. Highly recommend the shrimp tempura, rolls, Brussel sprouts in bacon.

2.5 stars

Loud and crowded restaurant with over-priced sushi and misc. Japanese food items.

Ordered the miso soup ($5) and the BBQ chicken ($14). 40 minutes later, our food arrived. Long wait much?

The chicken were 4 pieces. Seriously?! Come on, dude. 4 pieces for $14? Don't cheap out on me. Ugh, I was still ravenous after my meal.

The miso and chicken pieces were good. But wished the portions were a tad bit more.

My girlfriend ordered the $14 ramen which was price-worthy. 

Despite our longer than average wait, our group was charged 20% gratuity. We protested, they returned the money. Seriously lame.

Not a fan of this place. Will not return; there are better places to eat on the strip.
All the steak dishes are absolutely amazing! So is their chicken fried rice. I come back everytime i come to vegas and will go again!

Swanky looking place inside the W Hotel --- ooooh...ahhhhh!  Let's check out the exotic cars parked outside -- ooooooh...ahhhhh! 

Let's try out the food............ ..... ..... ..... ..... ..... .....

Pretty cool place to hangout if I wanted to be seen with cool crowd I guess (my mom said I was cool....) I didn't think their sushi and rolls were to too exciting. I guess they had to please the crowd and what's hip and cool.  The only thing exotic is parked outside, not on the menu.  Pretty basic and mediocre at best. Nothing I haven't seen. 

Service was good overall and attentive.  Ambience is like a lounge and smooth.  I felt like I back in Hollywood Blvd hanging at Katana's. - Enjoy

There was this superstar basketball player at  my high school: he was tall, rich, handsome, got the ladies, and was very talented in comparison to the rest of the high school population.  All of those aforementioned things caused people to hate him, no, loathe his very essence, so every time he got the ball, the opposing team would yell, "Overrated!"

Some people would say that Sushi Roku is overrated, but I say those people are jealous losers who are sad they can't eat here everyday.

This place is soooo good, and I will not comment on the price because I never saw the bill (thank you to my employer).  But I will tell you about the fanciful meal I experienced.  We started with the BEST DISH I had there: the lobster tempura in a miso soy glaze.  Lobster, check.  Fried, check.  Tempura, check.  Yummy sauce, check.  It's like a Chicken McNugget on steroids!  

After that, I was afraid the other dishes wouldn't hold up, but they did.  Some sushi/rolls to try (I can't eat fish, only shellfish...don't judge me!): crab dynamite, hotate (so sweet, so buttery!), amaebi (yes, i like to eat the crunchy heads), and the baked crab.

P.S. Note on high school basketball star: he plays basketball for some other country because he didn't make it into the NBA, and there is a hilarious video on youtube with him trying to dunk and instead falling and banging his head on the ground.  He's okay so you're not going to hell if you laugh.

My boyfriend and I really enjoyed this place, I ordered salmon sashimi (the best that I've tasted) a few other rolls and my boyfriend ordered the Uni which he swears by...it is good quality fish and the views of the strip are awesome!
Good food and awesome Sunday night deal with the half off wine bottle! Thanks CJ for being a great server!

Yeah yeah yeahhhh...it's another chain sushi place.  I know.  But I really think it deserves five stars from me because we had such a great experience here!  When I go to restaurants in Vegas, I admit that I typically don't expect much from the wait staff.  There's usually some type of "air" about them as if they're above everybody else because they work at a restaurant on the Vegas Strip.  My visit to Sushi Roku pleasantly surprised me.  Our server, whose name I unfortunately forget (I blame Vegas brain, hard to remember), was amazing.  He recommended a Saki that was delicious, and he even offered us tastings of sashimi and another type of Saki on the house!  He truly went above and beyond what I would expect from a dining experience in Vegas, let alone anywhere else.  Also, the view in this restaurant is pretty nice if you sit in the room with all the glass windows.  One of my friends was in Vegas for his first time, and he was able to enjoy a nice view down the strip from our table.

We happened to have dinner here 2 nights in a row. The ambiance is young, vibrant, cool, and "clubby," not by chance, as Sushi Roku is part of the W Scottsdale and is adjacent to the hotel's trendy night spot. The food was consistently better than average: both nights the waiters suggested their version of chicken tenders as a house specialty, and both nights we weren't sure why. Some items were pretty good, like the sea bass and the spicy edamame. The wait staff was attentive and friendly. It was pretty good; I would just warn any serious foodies that they may be a little disappointed.

Came here for Arizona Restaurant Week although I'd been here once before. The tasting menu was a GREAT opportunity to sample their sushi offerings as well as some of their other entrees.

I'm still a bit of a sushi virgin and while I thoroughly enjoyed everything, my more seasoned sushi-eaters said that they had had better. They offered a braised pork belly that was fantastic and as one who does not like miso soup AT ALL, I LOVED the miso that was served at Sushi Roku.

We were puzzled that the sake we ordered was served cold as we're used to warm sake, Our server, who was awesome (and a ginger I might add) explained that warming of sake is usually done to make the lower quality sakes more flavorful.....not too sure about that. So all in all the sake was not the best we'd had but we made the most of it.

The atmosphere is cool and the service is great. I would recommend it to anyone and there are some great dishes for any sushi-haters to enjoy.

If I could give this 3.5 stars I would. The food is a solid 3 - really nothing special, especially considering the price. It's not bad, but it doesn't stand out. The ambiance is a 4. the place is beautiful.

Was in town for a girls weekend, staying in the W Hotel. This place was perfect for a late dinner on night one when everyone was flying in and just wanted to stay close. I wish I took more pictures of the actual food but it was all so delicious we gobbled it up asap. 

Appetizers - Premium edamame, Brussels sprouts chips, Beef rib eye wrapped asparagus, Hokkaido Scallop Sashimi

Entrees - tons of sashimi pieces, plus rolls: Crunchy spicy tuna, Shima, Katana, Tuna Jalapeno (my favorite!), Spicy Scallop.

Dessert - Smores and Chocolate Lava cake

All of it came out quick and really tasty. The wait staff was really great and made awesome recommendations (the hostesses weren't the warmest but I'll chalk that up to a slammed waiting area and Brody Jenner and some guy from the Jersey Shore being there!).
Took my wife out for our 10th anniversary.  The sushi was great!  We'll be back.

AMAZING!! My husband and I dined here for my birthday this past weekend and although I was at first let down by not getting a view seat due to a private party, the food more than made up for it! 

We started with the Yellowtail Sashimi with Chilies appetizer which was recommended to us by our waiter after attempting to order the Crudo Roku sashimi tasting. He said it was much better, and it was actually a few bucks less so we took his advice and loved it! The chilies added a great flavor to the Yellowtail and the presentation was great. 

We then moved on to the Shima Roll and the Albacore with Scallions cut roll. That Shima Roll...OMG...pure heaven!! I'm pretty sure it is the best roll I've ever had!! The combination of textures and flavors was pure perfection.  The avocado was so soft and ripe, the tuna was buttery and wonderful, and the cilantro and little dab of hot sauce added just the right amount of zing. The Albacore was also wonderful as were the subsequent items we ordered, the Live Halibut sushi and the Toro & Jalapeno Roll.

We enjoyed a carafe of sake during our meal and indulged in a few sake bombs before I finished with their wonderful Lychee Martini. I was then surprised with an awesome chocolate souffle birthday dessert! I was so stuffed already but managed to polish it off! 

The service was great as our waiter was very attentive and friendly. Though the prices are indeed a bit high, I felt it was worth it for the wonderful food, ambiance and service. We look forward to coming back to Sushi Roku the next time we're in Vegas and will also make it a point to try out the other locations in LA next time we're up that way! We've dined at their Katana Restaurant in Hollywood (see review) and loved it equally as well!

Anytime I am in Arizona I visit Sushi Roku it is a must for me. I love how friendly the staff is but most importantly LOVE Dan the GM, congrats on the promotion Dan you more then deserve it! Today I visited Sushi Roku Scottsdale looking forward to the food, friendly staff and of course seeing my favorite person Dan who sadly wasn't there at the time but still myself and company enjoyed ourselves. The food was amazing as always and Sarah our server was phenomenal, she is so genuine just all around an asset to the company, I also had the pleasure of meeting the manager on duty Steve he was also great and very sweet! Steve had heard about my horrendous Experience at the Sushi Roku in LA ( Santa Monica) as that is where I reside and took care of our dessert as he felt horrible knowing what my experience was like at the Santa Monica Location. I was thrilled to know there was one in my area, I talked so highly of Sushi Roku Scottsdale to friends of mine and told them there was one in Santa Monica and decided to show them what all the hype was about, only to walk out embarrassed as the Santa Monica location was just terrible the service was awful and the food was less then mediocre the menu also wasn't completely the same, they didn't have the miso glaze popcorn shrimp tempura ( which Dan got me hooked on it's seriously amazing) and they didn't have crème brûlée. So all in all I have come to the conclusion that if i want Sushi Roku with high end level of service, amazing food and phenomenal staff I guess I have to drive 4 hours to get it! Sorry I missed you Dan but your staff most definitely kept it consistent even with you not there major kudos! Until next time! -Ashley

This is a very belated review as we were there in May of 2015. I meant to write a review immediately and got lazy. I had researched with the help of yelp to find good places to eat while in Vegas with my hubby. I worked in a sushi bar run by a very meticulous Japanese sushi master, with amazing standards, for 10 years, so I am quite particular in regard to sushi and Japanese cuisine. I saw that Roku had a great happy hour deal. We went and you sit in the bar area. There were tables but we sat right at the bar. The bartender, Tyson, and a waitress, I think her name was Emily, and a runner, who was super knowledgeable about all the dishes she served us. We had the Garden Salad, the Rib Eye Wrapped Asparagus (not me, as I do not eat beef or pork), the Mushroom Tempura with Creamy Truffle Miso, TWO orders of Tuna Tataki, Albacore Tataki and also the Spicy Tuna and Cucumber  Avocado rolls. I had sake and my hubby had a big tall bottle of mineral water, some brand from France. All of these dishes cost from $3-7. Tyson was very nice and personable and gave great recommendations, as well as giving us some personal background, which was interesting, and background about the restaurant owners and the professionalism and authenticity of the chefs. After a very decadent meal and drinks, our bill was $60, and with tip under $100. Definitely a great deal on the strip in Las Vegas! Not only that, but it was one of those meals that leaves you craving to go back to experience those flavors again. I would go back to Vegas just for a Roku!
It's a beautiful restaurant with a great view looking over Vegas.  The food is great and you definitely pay for it.  Its a cool, trendy scene with "cool" trendy people.  Great sushi.
Expensive, tasteless Japanese food.  There was no flavor in teriyaki salmon, tempura, and California roll. Price was expensive, but I do not expect any less from Vegas.
The food is simply perfect. Come for happy hour to try many items at a discount. The steak wrapped asparagus is amazing.

Went to Sushi Roku for dinner last week with some friends and family, I frequent this place often for lunch when I'm in town.  This was the first time I've actually been there for dinner.  

Our dining consisted of the following items:

Appetizers (compliments of the host):

Filet Mignon Asparagus w/Soy Mirin Sauce 16
This was ok, didn't leave a lasting impression on me.

Japanese Yellow Tail Sashimi w/diced chilies 17
The Yellow Tail is a must have.  The fish was fresh and melts in your mouth. 

KaraAge with Cilantro Mayo 12
The chicken was prepared just right and with the cilantro mayo, it was quite yummy.

Rolls:
Shima Roll: Shrimp wrapped Spicy Tuna w/Cilantro & Avocado 18
This roll was quite heavenly.

Entrees:
Grilled Fillet Mignon w/homemade Terriyaki Sauce and Mashed Potatos 36
The fillet mignon was tender and cooked to perfection.  

Chilean SeaBass w/Truffle Miso Glazed and Sauteed Spinach 28
The seabass was pure perfection, cooked medium w/the truffle miso glaze... My mouth waters just thinking about it..

Sauteed Salmon & Hokkaido Scallops; XO sauce with Asparagus & Potatoes 26

The presentation of this entrée was pretty cool.  The fish and scallops were cooked just right.

Desserts:
The Chocolate Volcano Souffle was quite delectable.  

I was surprised with a some sort of Fruit Cup Birthday dessert which had blackberries, carmelized bananas, strawberries, and raspberries.  

The ambiance and décor is quite appealing.
As always the service is impeccable.  I would like to thank Kenji for being such a wonderful host and great dining experience.

Had a group dining here on Sunday night. It wasn't busy at all so they were able to accommodate a large group.  Atmosphere is dark and not too loud. There is a bar area as well. 
It was hard for me to find the restaurant because I entered at the Ceasar's Palace entrance and had to walk like 8-10mins to this restaurant was.
So if you are coming here via taxi/cab, make sure they drop you at the entrance closest to the restaurant itself.

To the Menu-
They have a nice variety of food here. Some people ordered sushi but if that doesn't tickle your fancy no worries.

Tasty items I particularly remembered-
Eggplant Dengaku (So yummy)
Edamame
Roasted Cauliflower
Steamed Shrimp Dumplings


There were a variety of sushi items ordered which I did not taste but everybody enjoyed their meal.

Better the second time around. First time in March second time this past weekend. Ask for Paul if you're there on Sunday morning or afternoon. He's helped us out both times and hes one hell of a guy. Just tell him Carlos and Luis (the regulars from L.A.) recommended the place. As good as this place is Uni is disgusting...dont believe me? Give it a shot!
Great sushi and great views of The Strip. I'd highly recommend the Makoto Roll; although the crunchy Salmon and Crab rolls were tasty as well. Lots of choices.

Great food and friendly service. The shishito peppers, tofu, and crab and uni tartare were really good. The Titan roll was just ok but all nigiri were really good. I'm glad my friend got the local discount because it was a very expensive dinner! That said, the sushi was excellent.  I was a bit apprehensive because the pictures on yelp didn't look that appealing but I'm happy I came here.

My son was in the mood for sushi, came to yelp and decided on sushi Roku. The place is nice it did not have a wait time in which we found convinient due to the fact that we where starving :). Let me just say this place is average in my opinion and this was the smallest and most EXPENSIVE roll i have ever purchased lol . The place was average ive had better, i would not come back and i would probably not recomend this place. P.S waiters where nice and attentive so was the lady who seated us.
Crystal is absolutely marvelous and charming. The happy hour specials were great too. Definitely coming back! **Birdman hand rub**

We came here for my cousin's birthday. It was a good experience. 

The atmosphere and décor was exceptional, very trendy and posh. The view of the strip was gorgeous! The service from our wait staff was impeccable and they made sure that we had a great experience. 

We had ordered the following dishes, of course I had to try a little of everyone's dishes.. with some exceptions... hee hee..: 

Japanese Yellowtail Sashimi with diced Chilies: Yummy!! The yellowtail just melted in your mouth. 
Chilean Seabass with Truffle Miso Glaze & Sauteed Spinach: This was my dish...it was seared just right and the truffle miso glaze was so delicious!! I would definitely order this again. 
Sauteed Salmon & Hokkaido Scallops; XO sauce with Asparagus & Potatoes: Scallops were cooked perfectly, not chewy or tough. 
Katana Roll: Tuna & Yellowtail atop Spicy Tuna & Shrimp Tempura: Great presentation, and the fish was really fresh 
Spicy Tuna Hand roll: I wasn't able to try this as it was only for one person. 
Grilled Ji-Dori Chicken with Sauteed Mix Mushrooms & Mashed Potatoes: Chicken was extremely tender, great combination with the sauces. 

This restaurant is a little pricey but c'mon it's Vegas. The ambiance, the delicious food, and the service is definitely well worth it.

I will say this, the sushi, once you finally get it is amazing so the two stars is for the sushi only. That is about all the nice things I have to say. 

I was here with a very large party for a friend's birthday. She warned them (and I do mean warned them) in advanced that it was going to be a large party so you would think that we would have maybe 3 or 4 servers for a party of 40. (not kidding on that number either) So the two servers we had were ok. I would usually name them by name, but alas I won't on this occasion because the service wasn't the best. I am not blaming the servers as they not only had our party of 40 but other tables as well. 

Anywho, my gripe is this. For a busy Saturday night, you would think that they would have enough people to handle all of the people that were at this restaurant. The bar was super slow, the sushi bar was well slow. Let's just say everyone else in our party of 40 were almost finished with their sushi by the time myself and another young lady finally got ours. Yes again , it was good, but wow, it took a very long time. We only had three rolls between the two of us. 

So don't got with a party larger than 6 max! I watched other tables with smaller parties get their food and drinks at record speed so size does matter in this situation. If you go, go early before it gets too busy so that you won't wait for your food or your drinks. Oh and it is a little pricey so be warned. I have no problem paying for good food, as long as the service is just as good. Catch my drift?

Where should I start. Our server mentioned about flavor, everything was to perfect full of flavor. Spicy edamame was perfect. Nobu specialty shrimp was out of this world. It was absolute great experience. I highly recommend it.

Food was tasty but not outstanding. You're paying for the upscale and  trendy atmosphere (though I wouldn't expect any less from the W hotel). 

Fellow yelper Dorothy C. and I came here for the lunch specials. 
We shared the sashimi salad which came with 6 pieces of sashimi, iceberg lettuce, and ginger dressing and also split the bento box with miso cod and veggie tempura. Servers are very attentive.

I went here for their happy hour, which really cannot be beat for good sushi on the strip. House Chardonnay was $5 and was very smooth & drinkable. $4 hand rolls: the spicy tuna was just okay, but the AB4 fusion was the bomb.com. I'd also order the popcorn shrimp with miso glaze again ($6). You have to sit at the cocktail bar to get the HH specials which was no problem, besides the 10 bar stools there is a separate long table with maybe 15 seats that also counts as the HH area. Staff was great and the place was pretty empty, so service was super fast.

I feel more 50/50 about our experience here but we walked away feeling positive so I gave it 4 stars. We had dinner reservations after the Celine Dion show and they sat us 20 minutes early which was great. Our table had a beautiful view down the strip but we found the atmosphere to be very rowdy. I know that's Vegas but geez I wish there was such a thing as a classy drunk.

We weren't sure how hungry we were so we shared california rolls, spicy tuna rolls, and a baked lobster roll (which was expensive but very different!). The signature drinks were also some of the best we've ever had anywhere (try the Tokyo Cooler!). Because it was after 10 PM the place wasn't packed so I would've liked a little more attention from our waitor, especially because we like ordering sushi on an as we go basis so we don't over order. Overall the food and drinks were great, but maybe I'd come here at an earlier hour for a different crowd and experience.

This is a great way to start a night in Vegas. Sushi Roku was amazing and such a great place to begin our night. The sushi and drinks were delicious! The staff very helpful and nice and the ambiance great! I highly recommend going here.

Amazing happy hour menu. The service at the bar was actually great and it didn't really feel like "bar food or service".... the bartender made sure to clear our plates fast, kept our drinks refilled, and engaged in conversation. Food was fast yet very tasteful and satisfying. Wanted dessert but didn't have any room left to eat lol. Definitely try the glazed shrimp, SIMPLY AMAZING! I ordered 2 servings!!! Will definitely return on my next Vegas trip!!

Love me some Sushi Roku in all locations (there's a few of them).  This review is about Las Vegas.  Food is always delicious. Pretty much same menu across locations. The menu is unique (gourmet?) and a bit limited. They do not create substitutes. (in other words, if it ain't on the menu, you can't have it)   Definitely make a reservation for this one because it's hard to get into to after 6pm.  And ask for a strip view (table by the window) if you're on a date. ;) 

The staff is always on the ball and pretty quick - even with a large group.  Like it's sister restaurants, the seating is somewhat 'tight' (if you're a big dude or gal, caution the seating set-up: not just distance between tables, but also distance from your lap to table top in some areas)  

As far as location - it's on the end of the Forum Shops inside Cesar's (strip side) Take the windy escalator all the way to the top.   When i stay on that end of the strip, i like the convenience of walking to Caesars and slipping in the side door. (I call it the "sneaky door" -- right after (or before) Mirage.) Thus avoiding the casino completely and that loooonnnnggg walk through the length of the Forum shops.

We are repeat offenders when we're in Vegas. We often bring guests or business associates (when there for convention) because we know we can rely on the food quality, atmosphere and  service every time.

Can't wait to visit this place again. I was in town for my bachelorette party and we were running late for our reservation! The front desk was very understanding when we called, and we didn't feel a single bit rushed when we finally arrived and sat down. Our waiter (so sorry I can't remember your name!) was really helpful in deciding how much of what to order and surprised me with a complimentary dessert. Yum!

Food was ok nothing spectacular for the price. The Vegas roll was not on the menu but the chef made it for us. I do admit that was nice and it was a good roll. The specialty drinks were good as well. We were here for a friends bday and this is when it went downhill. It took 15 minutes to receive our drinks, it took so long we would order our second round before even finishing our first. Our server rarely came around and was not very educated. Sadly I am giving them two stars not for the food but for the service we received. With paying that much for a meal/drinks I expect much more then what sushi roku provided. I do not think I will be back.

A friend of mine RAVED about this place. Always going on and on about how they fly the fish in fresh every day and it's amazing and the service is great and blah blah blah. I like that they offer a locals discount. That's awesome. But overall, I wasn't blown away. The salad I ordered was OK, it LOOKS great, but flavor wise, I really felt it was lacking. The veggie roll I ordered was cool. I've never seen some of the veggies they used in it. But again, something was missing. I like when your food just hits all the right notes and I didn't think either of my dishes did that. The service is eh. Nothing amazing, but not horrible. I would eat here again, but I dont see this as a '"go to for me.

Love this place!!!  Went in for the first time and didnt know what sake would pair with our meal.  Thankfully Bianca steered us in the right direction!!!  The Albacore Tataki was amazing and the atmosphere was great.  Will return for sure.  If you go to Sushi Roku order the Albacore Tataki and ask for Bianca if you can!!!

This is more than 3, but not as good as 4 Japanese restaurant & bar. The place is in the W hotel, right next to the lobby. Location is good, parking is convenient. Love the decoration, very contemporary. (It is a lovely place to have a drink and at the same time get some sushi & sashimi.) we went there for lunch, so didn't have drink. (Not sure about the drinking price) they have lunch bento box, and you may order two from the list. Love the flexibility and the combination.

My second chance to visit this place again. And I think my first visit was a bad day for me. This time everything is good.  The choice of Chef selection of sushi is too fusion, but it taste very good and adventurous.
Best Sushi I've ever had.  Get the crispy, spciy, ahi role... divine.

I LOVED this place.  Probably the best place I ate at all weekend. lets see what we ate:
-Crunchy Spicy Tuna: had avocado, spicy tuna, spicy mayo sauce and a crunchy topping it was AMAZING! i loved it
-Baked Lobster Roll: baked lobster, rice paper roll, asparagus, miso sauce.  it was all wrapped up and then baked and the miso sauce is nice and toasted and warm it was soo delicious
-spicy scallop roll: i had the cut roll not the hand roll. honestly it was just okkay. nothing super spectacular
-shrimp fried rice: pretty yummy just your basic fried rice we all shared it and it was good
-miso soup: perfect not too salty but just right
I mean lets be honestly everything in Vegas is expensive so I don't think the prices were outraged compared to everywhere else. I think for the price it is way better then anywhere else that we went.  If u are a sushi lover like I am then i think you will enjoy this place and bonus ITS AIR CONDITIONED inside the mall so its nice!

I went there with a group of friends during summer. The hostess seated us on the main dining room, it has a gorgeous view of the strip and the restaurant's decor was beautiful. I asked the hostess if we could have the happy hour menu and she went to ask the manager, then she came back and told us we had to move to another table. There were on the other side and there was no beautiful view and we sat beside a big group of table who were very loud, we had to speak up to talk to each other. Anyways, the food was pretty good and fresh. I cannot remember what we ordered but the price were reasonable and we had a nice time.

Amazing food
Fantastic service 
Great decor
What more could you ask for
Desert- the chocolate volcano, chocolate filled donut holes or fresh berries
Ordered the free ranged chicken. It was dry and tough to eat. Overall experience is over priced food for mediocre quality

Came in on a Tuesday night for happy hour with a girl friend, the bartender recommended some great dishes and drinks. The bartender, I didn't get his name, recommended we try the Smoked Old Fashion and the Pear Martini, both fantastic presentation and flavor. You'll have to try them!Our favorites on the happy hour menu were the Tai with black salt, spicy tuna with fried rice cakes, and the beef and shrimp skewers.
Food took a couple extra minutes to come out but was well worth the wait.

We ate here this past weekend for my Birthday dinner. Overall it's an okay restaurant. The interior decoration is steller and the views of the strip were amazing!

Our waitress also threw in a bottle of sake and if it's your birthday you get this fiery faux drink type thingy and everyone sings happy birthday so I suppose I would recommend for a special occasion. 

That being said the food wasn't anything to rave about. Living in SF it's hard to visit another city and not be a culinary snob, but I've eaten at some amazing spots in Vegas and this place did not live up. 

When our food arrived it appeared to have been sitting for awhile waiting to be delivered (e.g the sauce looked like something out of a microwave meal and the ginger was browning).  So I wasn't that impressed. The service was mid grade for not being that busy I was a bit suprised by the lack of attentiveness. 

If you go expect great ambiance and average food!
My fiancé and I love sushi. But you're really paying for the location because the food is not all that. Service is kinda slow too.

Really good deal for happy hour.  The food is excellent.  
But for dinner it was way too pricy.   The standard sushi wasn't anything special.  But the pricier items were tasty - like the yellow tail with chilli and ponzu.

Phoenix is in the middle of a desert, but the fish here may suggest otherwise. The chef's choice nigiri sampler is as fresh as what you would find on a coastal city, and the garnishes on the nigiri are distinctive, innovative, and absolutely delicious.
I also loved the Chilean Seabass and Roasted Cauliflower- two dishes I try at most restaurants I visit- and I was definitely impressed. These are classic dishes done extremely well, and while the bits at the bottom were soaked in sauce and overly salty, they were still happily devoured.
Restaurant vibes were great as well-clean, modern, and a great spot for dates/business dinners/when you feel like getting fancy.

Pathetic service. We made a reservation for dinner this evening at 6pm. 90% of the seats were open in the restaurant when we arrived. They seated us the worst table in the restaurant. They refused to move us to another table when there were plenty open. This is so unusual where in other restaurants if you don't like being squeezed into an undesirable place, they move you on request. We left without having dinner there and went elsewhere . We would never consider them in our future dining plans. 100 Rotten tomatoes.
Great view of the strip and good sushi. I like the dim lighting and it wasn't very busy late in the evening on a Monday.
The oysters were amazing would definitely recommend this place delicious fish and very clean.
Ok, but not that great.  Very nice atmosphere, but sushi was just ok.  I really wanted Shibuya at MGM, but for some reason they were closed all week.

We made a reservation here via the Yelp App for a Saturday evening of Labor Day. We had a prime table for Scottsdale people watching - from couples to bachelor/bachelorette parties we saw it all here. 

We had the bake crab hand roll, asparagus wrapped in beef, and sashimi sampler. Everything was fresh and tasty, but I certainly wish that they had gluten free soy sauce. I would assumed a restaurant this expensive and in a hotel would accommodate gluten free people. 

Due to no soy sauce for me, I wouldn't come back for sushi but maybe I'd try something else. Service was fine for a busy Saturday night, but nothing spectacular to share.

chain in LA, upscale. most entrees over marinated.  not as good as katsuya.
Tuna Sashimi Carpaccio with Sesame Soy & Garlic Chips was ok with the chip crumbles.
wouldn't recommend uni udon, which doesn't even use udon noodle.  several items try to be like morimoto but not close.  like Popcorn Shrimp Tempura with Miso Glaze.
brussels sprouts with bacon and yuzu.  too heavy on the sauce but tastes ok.
braised short rib, not the kakuni falling apart texture.
specials section, had the white lotus roll. ikura was acceptable.

We had 3 birthday at the same time last night everything was awesome nice place and great service perfect hospitality but I forget to ask our servers name and her food runner they were very nice and kind and perfect service I like her smile and her patience .

Very good sushi. GREAT view. Good service... all of the recommendations my waiter made were great.

favorite dish was the tuna w/ cilantro and shrimp roll. delicious.

Because the buffet at the Flamingo I'd originally chosen to go to had closed that day for remodeling (lucky me), I had to find an alternative. I ended my search at Sushi Roku. I sat at the bar and my server, an inked young lady whose name slips my mind, cordially suggested their Happy Hour menu. I obliged and quite honestly, I had ten very good sushi rolls and a drink for around $15, a 1/4 of what they wanted for the buffet at the opposite end of the Palace. I had the spicy tuna and something with salmon. Both were fresh, not over spiced so much that you couldn't taste the fish, and a nice serving. Service was attentive, quick and spot on with the recommendation. I'll stop in here again if I get a Jones for sushi while on the strip. The lounge itself is rather nice as well and would make a quality spot for a dinner date too, if I had a date (groan...). Maybe next time.

We had dinner here on 01/13/17. Place is very hip and comfortable with lots of people enjoying dinner and celebrating occasions (make a reservation). Service was decent. Took a little bit for the waiter to get to us, but was still okay.

We ordered lots of different sushi rolls and shared them among our table of four, that seems to be the best way to go. My favorites and biggest standouts were the Shishito Peppers (so good), the Black Cod is jaw-dropping, blow-your-mind delicious and also loved the Crab Dynamite Sushi Roll. 

We would not hesitate to eat here again.

Short Review:

THIS IS AN INCREDIBLE 5 STAR RESTAURANT!!

Long Review:

Nestled within Scottsdale W, a 5 STAR RESORT, is Scottsdale's SUSHI ROKU, a 5 STAR RESTAURANT.

ABOUT SUSHI ROKU

Sushi Roku is part of IDG, Innovative Dinning Group. IDG owns and operates, SUSHI ROKU, ROKU, BOA STEAKHOUSE, KATANA, and ROBATA BAR.

Sushi Roku combines the finest, freshest fish from pristine waters around the globe with the kind of artistry that can only be provided by a mature sushi chef ensuring traditional sushi, together with a splash of contemporary California innovation.

Sushi Roku has locations in Santa Monica, Pasadena, Newport Beach, Las Vegas, and Scottsdale.

THE STORY

I've had the pleasure of eating at Sushi Roku a couple of times, and it never disappoints. The last visit was OUTSTANDING!

We started with one of their sake flights (see pic). Their sake flights are innovative and bold, and included some Arizona sakes. We had a couple appetizers, including the A-5 Japanese Wagyu Ishi-Yaki, which is grilled over a bincho charcoal, was the best meat that has ever been in my mouth. Sushi Roku's Wagyu appetizer alone is worth the visit. Everything was unique and fresh, and had DELICIOUS BOLD FLAVORS. We ended with desert, the lemon soufflé, which was not only the perfect finale to the meal, but my photo was featured in their instagram! instagram.com/sushirokuaz (see pic)

SERVICE EXPERIENCE

The service was EXCEPTIONAL! We were treated like royalty and our main server was so fun and enjoyable, we kept mentioning that he should have his own show. It was the type of interaction that added to the meal, and was non obtrusive, which I always appreciate.

CONCLUSION

This restaurant is a gem! This is truly one of the best dining experiences I've had lately. As long as nothing changes, I would happily eat here again and again! I hope I get a chance to experience Sushi Roku's other locations too!

5/5 RECOMMEND 

OF NOTE 

*Valet Parking Available.

*Other Locations: Santa Monica, Pasadena, Newport Beach, Las Vegas, and Scottsdale

*Their Social Media is TOP NOTCH

*For More Information: sushiroku.com

Had a couple of really good appetizers here back in December for happy hour. 
Just needed a quick bite before the Shania Twain show. This place fit the bill..
Both the calamari and chicken satay skewers tasted great.. Along with that enjoyed a nice tasting glass of nicely chilled white wine.. Sat at the bar and enjoyed friendly efficient service and the price was right.. Will definitely be back next time in Vegas

On our last visit to LV, we had lunch at Sushi Roku based on a friend's recommendation and I'm glad we did. 

Everything was absolutely delicious. Each dish was prepared with thought  and was full of flavor. It was quite an expensive meal for the amount of food but it was definitely worth it. Quality over quantity.

Been here twice, and I love almost everything about this place. The restaurant itself is a site to be seen and the view of the strip is just as ppealing. I've tried almost everything from the sushi, to the kobe beef and tempura and being a veteran of many high end Japanese restaurants I'll put this place up there with the best. 

The staff and service was also top top... and if you ever get a chance to come say hi to the GM Kenji!

There was something just a little off about this restaurant.  Maybe the fact that it was virtually deserted influenced my perception, but the interior was just too dark and gloomy, this despite the fact that our table had a picture window view of the Las Vegas strip in its full neon glory.

The hostess seated us at a table that was broken--the bench seat backs were gone and were "being repaired."  There were at least two other similar tables on either side of us, so I dont know why she seated us there.

At first our server had a bit of an attitude, but she became very pleasant later on, so I forgive that.

Anyway, the sushi was okay, not spectacular.  I did enjoy the monk fish liver.  But the California roll was mealy.  Also, eel is suppose to be served warm, mine was cold and tasted refrigerated.  The tempura was kinda greasy, which is just unacceptable.  The Saki selections and mixed drinks were very good.  

Overall, a ho-hum experience.  Maybe I'm spoiled by the sushi restaurants in San Francisco, but this place just isnt up to snuff.

Overall: good but meh.

I have been staying at the W in Scottsdale for work for the past month, so I've eaten here a few times.  The sushi is pretty good, but honestly nothing spectacular.  Pretty standard special rolls.  Definitely nothing wrong about it.  I have also had the chicken entree.  The eggplant appetizer might take the cake at this place.  

The overall vibe reminds me of the W hotel.  It's trying a little too hard to be trendy.  Dim lights (like, too dim... I've bumped into a couple people here because I can't see two feet in front of me.   Can I get a little more than 2 watts up in here?), modern decor, etc. etc.  It's a good go-to for hotel guests, but I wouldn't travel out of my way to go.
Went in for lunch over the weekend & had such an amazing experience. Food was fantastic & service was spectacular!! I will definitely return & tell all my friends about this place!
Solid spot, crystal makes great drinks. I stay down the street but this sushi spot and customer service will Make me change my hotel.

Basically overpriced sushi and poor quality. I was not impressed by this place at all..
