This place is so dark inside I couldn't even read my menu properly.

I was on a work trip last week and went here  after being recommended this restaurant by one of my coworkers that has been to Las Vegas many times.  They had a happy hour menu so we started with some drinks off of that but they also had sushi rolls and appetizers for a discounted price.  My coworkers had the spicy salmon rolls off the menu and enjoyed those.  We then had some of the sushi rolls off of the regular and everything was very fresh.  We sat at the bar and the service by the bartender was very good.

Sushi was fresh and first rate.  Had a party of ten. However, service was spotty. Pushy waitress, Agnes, who I had to repeatedly call over put a bad taste in my mouth, constantly trying to get me to order the most expensive items and more than I needed. Was so bold that she then wrote in a hefty tip for herself on our bill! Diners beware!
I am freaking out over how good this Hanabi is (Spicy Tuna over Crispy Rice). I can't even. I literally ordered another! Lol.

Brussels sprout chips are omg delish!  Also had the sweet potato roll, also very yummy. Service was excellent and fast. Location is on the 3rd floor of the forum shops at Caesar. Seriously try those Brussels sprout chips...the truffle oil on top is sooooo yummy!

Waaaaaahhhh, this review is a long time coming as I've been here 5x within the last year.

Whether it be during happy hour (which is the best sushi happy hour you can get in Vegas) to restaurant week (best choices of prie fix menu); and best of all their anniversary week (50% off food menu); EVERYTHING was melt-in-your-mouth amazing.

I'll just name off my favorites: 
- foie gras and scallops
- yellowtail sashimi
- shishito peppers
- tofu steak
- grilled filet
- tuna tataki
- oysters with gold flakes
- waygu sashimi
-oysters with gold flakes
-fois gras wrapped in yellowtail

Foie and ANYTHING is just B.O.M.B.

One of the many reasons Sushi Roku is uhhh-maaaaze =)

Had a business dinner here and it was really good! I had shushito peppers, which were tasty and flavorful. Then the amberjack sushi (2 pieces) and an eel roll. That was enough food for me and I typically get 3-4 rolls at other sushi places. I really enjoyed this.

Robert is a diligent server. He was obliging and great at suggestions of fish to our preference on the menu selection. He went above and beyond to retrieve the sake sommelier to better acquire our taste pallets and table service. 

The wine sommelier's name was Steve. He was knowledge in the different rices and their fermation process. We choose the Otokoyama. They warmed it up for us. Delicious. It is dry and medium in fullness, without the sweet after flavor that I am personally not fond of. 


We enjoyed the Brussels sprouts, blue crab tartare, and a special that is not on the menu, but to die for, big eye tuna carpaccio. Then, we ordered the crab handrolls and finished with the matzu platter.
The food was horrible.  Do not go here.  The only thing that was decent was the beef teriyaki and seaweed salad.

Sushi Roku used to be our favorite sushi restaurant in the area. We've been here to celebrate an anniversary, a birthday, and fun date nights whenever we got the craving for sushi. Unfortunately, the quality seems to have declined in the past year. Our most recent experience left a bad taste in our mouth and I don't think we'll be returning any time soon.

We came here on a Friday night before the Christmas holiday and were surprised the restaurant was playing such loud club music. We joked that we felt we were eating on the dance floor. The ambiance just wasn't as inviting or classy as it was previously. Things went downhill from here.. 

The Katana Roll was not as flavorful as it has been in the past and the presentation was different. For a $17 "specialty sushi roll" we were expecting something special and were left quite disappointed.

The Caterpillar Roll was also not as good as it has been in the past. I could've sworn that this inside out roll used to include crab meat inside, but our server said that I must be thinking of their Dragon Roll. I highly doubt it because the Dragon Roll isn't even on the menu. In any case, this roll was also quite disappointing and definitely not worth the hefty $16 price. The roll had a tiny piece of unagi inside, which was cold rather than hot and freshly cooked. 

All in all, quite disappointing and sad that the quality of this once 5 star place has declined to the point that I can't rate it higher than 3 stars.

Agree with other reviewers. Expensive but it's located in the W so I would expect to pay $17 a roll (not with a smile.) Sushi was fresh but nothing unique or interesting. Straightforward. Shima roll with jalapeño is a nice fresh spicy choice. If you're looking for a no thrills sushi place with a lounge vibe and good service this will do you great.

HAD A GREAT TIME !!!!!!!
Service and Food Quality was fantastic. Great Server, suggested some of the best sushi I have ever had. My wife doesn't care for seafood so she ordered a Filet, it was great. We will return !!!!!!!!

This was a night of new taste experiences for me.  We arrived and the atmosphere was very light, ambient, and loungy.  No surprises since this is at the W Hotel.  The restaurant staff was very friendly, and we were greeted fairly quickly.  We ordered the edamame which was a first for me, (I'm behind the times on this one)  A nice different taste.   I ordered a blackberry smash which was nothing short of wonderful.  I definitely could have ordered a double.  Another person in our party had a cold sake that I found was soo good, I had to try it twice.  Our waiter was very friendly, down to earth and low key.  Amongst us we ordered some sushi, I ordered the Ji-Dori chicken and the other person in our group ordered the Braised Pork.  Apparently they were out of pork so that was not available which was a disappointment.   Food was out at a decent time and the sauce with the mushrooms and potatoes had a wonderful zing and afterbite.  Our sushi eater had his eyes rolling back the entire time with his head agaisnt the booth so I can only assume the experience was nothing short of orgasmic.  We only had a small snafu with a groupon discount, but that was corrected without issue.  I'll be sure again to come to try the pork and have multiple blackberry smashes.  Even though I have not been won over to try sushi, I'm more than willing to have this restaurant experience again.

Japanese food + fine dining = usually not a logical mix unless we're talking omakase or kaiseki. However, Sushi Roku did a pretty good job of taking care of my friends' birthday dinner here. 

Recommendation #1: Chilean sea bass with truffle miso glaze. Though it's listed as an appetizer it was big enough to be an entree.

Recommendation #2: Kurobuta kakuni. I ordered this for myself, but the rest of the birthday party descended on it like a flock of vultures before I even got a bite.  The plate came back to me with only the veggies and brown rice :( but I'm guessing the pork was really good?

I would recommend Sushi Samba at the Palazzo over Sushi Roku only because Samba has a more unique menu that imo is worth shelling out a few extra bucks for.  But if you're looking for more traditional Japanese flavors, Roku gives you more bang for your buck in a similarly high end setting.
Always great service and good food. A great variety of raw and cooked items. A view of the Ling Hotel and the strip.

If you know great sushi, this is what You are are searching for! 

They have a great knowledge of the saki and the sushi is just perfect... stick to the sashimi and carpaccio.

Dinner was absolutely delicious. We had the special and 2 rolls. We also had 2 lychee martinis that hit the spot. We requested a table by their magnificent view and they agreed with a smile. We will definitely dine here on our next trip to Vegas. They get 4 stars because of price.

Cute place. The interior is very upscale, and intimate. It's a nice place to have a nice romantic dinner with the love. I would suggest to request the strip view when dinning in because the strip view is just lovely. 

The menu is ok. I personally prefer authentic Japanese cuisine at a local area (Spring Mountain!), but there are a few things here that I like. Their signature martinis are good! I would definitely recommend the Lychee martini. You get a big piece of Lychee as a garnish, and you can taste the Lychee flavor of the martini. So if you are all for a nice sweet taste to your martini I'd definitely recommend it.

Our group ordered the Seared Tuna Tataki, Seaweed Salad, Yellowtail Sashimi, Crunchy Spicy Tuna, Rock Shrimp Tempura, and Chicken Yakitori Skewers. To me, it was nothing special or anything that stands out to where I feel like this place might be the only place to satisfy a distinct craving. The food is very light, fish is fresh, and the portions are small. 

I haven't tried the Omakase yet, but I would like to actually try it once to see if it is worth spending $90 for. The Omakase might be the only thing worth gambling on. All in all the experience was nice and the service was wonderful. If you don't mind burning a big hole in your pocket for a nice fine dining experience, and a small stomach and appetite then I would recommend it.
Asked the server if the chef did omakase and we were very pleased with what came out of the kitchen and from the sushi bar. Great service decor and food.

At a lower price point, this would be a commanding 4 star restaurant, but it fails to deliver for the high expectations it sets nestled in Caesar's Palace at about $50 a person.

Sushi is solid, but nothing your usual local Sushi bar won't offer for 12-15 a roll. Service is somewhat irritating- kept coming back too often and wouldn't let me have a decent conversation.

Start with an edamame; try the Filet Mignon Asparagus.

I went to Sushi Roku for lunch one day in LA and wasn't a big fan.  Since they opened in Scottsdale though and I love sushi, I thought I would give it another try.  It was only the second weekend they have been open so considering we had to wait an hour for our reservation wasn't so bad because the whole world seemed to be there so talking to everyone made the time pass quickly.  I didn't even think I was in Scottsdale.  Just watching the crowded scene at Sushi Roku and the W Hotel was enough to keep anyone occupied.  They offered us the sushi bar at one point but we opted to wait for a table since it was more of where the action seemed to be.  We got our table and instantly started eating because 1. The table sitting next to us starting sharing their sweet potato chips with us and 2. They brought us edamame without us even ordering it (that scores huge with me)!  At this point since we had waited for a while we weren't starving so we ordered the baked lobster roll and the yellowtail sashimi with diced chilies.  I was hesitant about ordering the lobster roll because I thought it would be heavy and it was actually the opposite - very light.  The yellowtail was so unbelievable I could eat it everyday, all day.  Now the table on the other side of us starting sharing their filet mignon wrapped in asparagus which was very tasty.  They also started pouring us their sake as well which was great!  The ahi tuna carpaccio arrived compliments of the owner as well as a dessert.  All of the desserts sounded so good we told our waitress to surprise us.  She brought some type of egg rolls with ice cream but we were too full to eat them so we reciprocated and gave them to the table next to us.  Our waitress for a new restaurant was perfect.  She was nice, friendly and knowledgeable.  The owner came to sit with us as we were finishing up and was asking ideas of where to possibly open a Boa Steakhouse (also one of LA's amazing restaurants that Innovative Dining Group owns).  I was so excited and told him that Scottsdale Quarter would be the perfect place for Boa.  Now we started our venture to the W Hotel Pool Bar.  To be able to describe all of this would definitely need its own review.  It was a little chaotic at first (with the line, etc - but we ended up only having to wait five minutes), but it turned out to be such a fun night.  I can't wait to go back and hope it stays this way for a while (not because it just opened).   It was fun running into so many people there as well all in a new atmosphere which was very cool.  I loved the pool!  I'll leave it at that and let Gabi write more on this since I wrote about Sushi Roku :)

Wonderful sushi and creative desserts to top it off! Sleek and cool ambiance with service that isn't rushed. You may want to give yourself extra time though if you're seeing a show after dinner or are on a tight schedule.

This is a nice spot for sushi and more. There were some pretty unique dishes...a sea bass with black truffle oil for appetizer was really good. The sea bass was so tender and yummy. There was a caulifower with some very light breading that was very good too.

For sushi - the fish seemed really fresh and melted in your mouth. We didn't try the really unusual rolls though - they had some pricey ones.

What I remember was the dessert. The green tea mousse was light and airy topped with matcha powder. The apple fritter with dulce de leche ice cream was very good too. They have a chocolate souffle on the menu too but we were running late so we did not try it.

They also had a variety of sake and cocktails so there's something for everyone here whether you like sushi or not.

Cool atmosphere, nice waitstaff, awesome cocktails and the food....I had this lobster sushi (I don't recall the name) that was to die for.  I had never really had sushi before, at least not as a meal and I have to say I was impressed.

Oh where do I begin ... 
So we arrive -- 10 min before our reservation time of 9p. We didn't get seated until 40 min after the hour. To be squeezed in a booth -- set up for 6. Although our party is of 7. Asked for an additional place setting 2x before received. 
The waiter, an underaged looking young man, id's us after getting our drink order, and takes 15-20 min to return with said drinks. And serves us tap water after clearly stating bottled. 
The food... Sushi- subpar... The entrees- burnt... He said it was "smoked" ... Yea no, it's burned buddy. Drinks - weak!
The people... So, this woman has her child.. Yes child ...  sitting at the table with underwear and no shoes and she's making out with this gentleman while her child is damn near naked. (Side eye)
Shall I say.. Never again!
Overpriced sushi, underwhelming small portion specialties, and arrogant, W-type servers. A scene for some (skanky women and douchey men in trucker hats), overpriced hotel food for most.

Don't let the $$$ discourage you... this place is worth it. I got a little bit of everything to make sure I covered my taste palette. Everything from a simple spicy tuna roll, fried rice, seared salmon sashimi, and ramen. Everything was full of flavor and good sized portions. In case you need more spice, you can request even more spices to give your entree more of a kick.

The service was excellent! The manager checked in regularly and even showed me the correct way to eat the seared salmon sashimi. I even forgot my sunglasses and got them back the next day. The hostess and server remembered me and asked about my dinner.

TOTALLY COMING BACK HERE!!  

My absolute favorite thing to order here is the SPICY TUNA CRISPY RICE! It was soo good i ordered two! MMM dreaming about it as I type.

I ordered the bento box too from the lunch special. BLACK COD and SHORT RIB? HELLLLL YESS!! I loved everything in the bento box! EVERYYYTHING :))) I would totally order this again! The miso soup was delicious too!

The people working here were reallyyy nice and the view was incredible! I am definitely coming back here and I am excited about it! YAY!

We were here on a Saturday night and we're so happy that they were able to fit us in for a last minute reservation. We both ordered the omekase and it was some of the best sushi we've had. My favorite was the toro. They also had a dish that was like a Japanese crab cake (yum!). The panko crusted sea bass (omg)! I forgot to take a photo of the first dish. Everything was amazing. I was sitting in my seat filled with joy because of the flavors and textures of the food. So happy that we went with the omekase even though it was pricey. We think it was totally worth it. 

The ambience of the restaurant is classy and they have a great view of the strip. It is located in the Forum Shops on the third floor. I wore my heels that day and boy, did I wish I wore flats. We did quite a bit of walking to and from the restaurant. 

Anywho, can't wait to go back.

Mediocre.
I went safe with a spicy tuna cut roll and it looked good but the consistency was like mush.  There was nothing else in there to give it that crunch that makes them so good.  Also, the only thing that looked good in the sushi case was yellowtail and it had excellent consistency but lacked flavor.  The miso soup was too salty at a rip off at $4.  I ate here for convenience only (stayed at the W).  Definitely a skippable experience.

Poor customer service. The only I gave this place any stars is because the food was actually pretty good but the customer service is so bad here I don't ever want to come back. They waitress is rude!! We came here for lunch and spent $200 bucks for just a few people. The waitress serving us never smiled and when she made a mistake in bringing us the wrong order and after we told her about her she like" oh worries..I will get another one...no apologies, no ownership that she made a mistake..: there is soooo many places to eat in Vegas. I will not be returning.

The sushi was better than ok. The curry flavored sushi was not a hit, don't know the name of it now. We ate there last friday night  with the kiddies without a reservation and there was no wait. Wait staff was nice. They offered us free dessert afterwards, don't know why, i think the hostess was enamored with my daughter, who knows? The bill for two adults was 166- so a little pricey. the sashimi with chiles was my favorite.
Spend a lot of my Friday night happy hours here! Great food and the bartenders are so awesome and friendly! Get here early to get a spot in the bar for happy hour

Delicious food!! Only to be outdone by the service- our waiter, whose name I can't recall but he had a great beard, was freaking awesome! We were a bit late to our dinner reservation so we only had 45 min to eat before our show- he had our whole order at out table in 20 min! The other wait staff was equally awesome and super attentive- never a half empty glass at our table! Would definitely return and give my highest recommendation! Every dish was just as yummy as the last!

Outstanding! We had a group of 21. Service was quick and friendly.  Food was outstanding.  I had the chefs special plate of 8 sushi pieces.  The sushi was different than I have ever had and was just as good as the sushi in Tokyo.

Prepare for long waits, being ignored and incompetent staff. Food was good but between screwing up my order (they gave me a menu that was no longer valid so I waited twenty minutes for an order that never came) and a bartender who ignored my existence, never again.

Updating. The manager comped my meal and the food was good. Upgrading to three stars until I try again.

Yummy mix of traditional and Californian style sushi - some wicked combinations but a little bastardised at times [sacrificing the simple elegance of quality ingredients for loud and bold flavours].  Flavour comment above may be more of a personal preference than a 'criticism' as I enjoy the simplicity of more traditional Japanese fare.

Busy vibe and great service.

Favourite dishes: yellowtail sashimi with crispy onions, fillet wrapped asparagus and the sinful [yet shamefully un-Japanese] mouth watering popcorn shrimp morsels.

Dinner food was excellent! Restaurant week 3 course dinner did not disappoint!

We were seated right away at one of the window tables and got a stunning view of the strip. The restaurant decor was tasteful, elegant, zen, modern, but still inviting. There was 2 choices for 1st course and 2nd course on the restaurant week menu, so we decided to order both and share. Each appetizer came with 3 different items, so we got a total of 6, and every one of them was amazing! We then shared the surf and turf, and the chef's sushi selection. I would have to say that the sushi here is the best I've had in town. It's better than Nobu, better than Blue Ribbon, better than Samba, and better than Raku. Then to complete our meal, the trio mousse just completely satisfied my palette, beautifully presented, and tasted just as beautiful.

Our service was a bit lacking, my tea was filled here and there, but not constantly. Other than that, it was a great experience, and I would definitely be returning to try some of the other

This is absolutely the best sushi restaurant  in Las Vegas. 
Expensive but worth it. 
I ate lunch there with 3 friends and we were all blown away from the Kobe beef appetizer to the toro to urchin. All of the tuna you can imagine. 

Atmosphere is great, service is great and of course the food is great. 

This is the place for top notch sushi.

Why are you wasting time reading this?  You need to go to Orbitz or Expedia, something and book tickets to Vegas just to eat here.  I mean it.  There is no time to gamble, catch a show, or hang out in front of the Bellagio.  
This is the BEST sushi i have ever had in my entire life.  (Trust me- I am old and I have lived in Japan.)
I suggest you bring zip locks to line your coat so that you can bring home  black truffle tempura hand rolls in your purse. I don't know how food safe that would be but  it makes me smile just thinking about!
We had a fabulous meal with an incredible view and just being there in a beautifully designed place.    Very nice attention to detail.
I looked through the review remarks about the price and I will say this- again, I am old- you get what you pay for and the food here is worth paying for!

This was really the only restaurant I went to in Vegas that didn't let me down for the price. Overall, dining in Vegas is quite a challenge. For the upscale eaters like myself, things feel overhyped and overpriced. Not this place. I ordered a raw sushi combo and the fish was fresh, large pieces and with a beautiful presentation. Service was prompt and the environment was pleasant. The edamame was also notably good...I make edamame at home so it's not very easy to impress me, but that was good. Would definitely go again

This one is hard. The whole place is conflicted between excellence and douchetasticness.

THE GOOD (aka: the food)
If you've been to another Roku, or even a Nobu, the menu will look familiar, as will the prices.

The sushi selection was pretty deep, with a good specials list, and lots of options. All the fish was very fresh, and as good as you can get in Phoenix, unless you're a regular somewhere else and get the special stuff. My benchmark for this is 'saba'. Usually, if you're not a regular somewhere, you get the dried out, pickled-herring tasting stuff. But Roku sent out the good stuff. Moist and delicious.

The sushi rice was excellent. Some of the portions were a bit awkward, with the rice ball minimized maybe to make the top portion seem larger...? But very good. I would sit at the bar next time.

The hot and cold plates were of the standard "inventive new japanese" type, but very well executed.


THE OKAY (aka: the bar)
Decent selection of beers and sake. Some frou frou specialty cocktails. But if you can't make a Vodka Tonic, you're fired. That wasn't tonic. Sent it back, came back again. Not tonic. 1 of 3 things going on here:

1) waitress screwed up twice (doubtful, she seemed competent and sober)
2) bartender screwed up twice
3) tonic is on tap, and tap was screwed up and only delivering carbonation and no syrup. if so, the bartender isn't checking the taps - see #2 above.

I like a Vodka Soda too, so I let it slide and didn't send it back again.


THE UGLY (aka: the overal l experience)
Normally, a W hotel is a chill spot in every city. You can count on upscale and relatively low key business/pleasure travelers, great service. Cool vibe. But I'm afraid this W will be plagued by the same velvet rope bullshit that haunted the James and Mondrian when they first opened. 

We scurried through the lobby and were greeted by a nicely scripted hostess (who knew how to work the reservations system), and an Atlantic City magician in a Sushi Roku host's suit (who didn't know how to work the reservations system). Guido act in full effect. At least he didn't punch us in the face or anything. Probably not fair to judge him. I'm sorry. He's probably a nice guy, but the demeanor doesn't fit the place. I would be floored if he could point to Japan on a map. Or if he punched me in the face.

The decor is very upscale, modern and generally over-the-top, but well done.

Then as we get escorted in...
Host bellows a Jersey Shore approximation of "Irrasshai!", to which all 3000 or so staff bellow back "IRRASSHAI!!!" This happens EVERY FUCKING TIME a new party is seated. The only thing louder was the table of seemingly underage rich kids getting hammered for someone's 19th birthday. "We're bombin, dude!" I think "bombin" means ruining both your sake and beer by mixing them in the same glass. The table was out of control and acted like they were at a Super Sweet 16, but were not approached by mgmt, as far as we could see. 

Elsewhere, cougars on the prowl. Some horrified rich people. And some troubled foodies.


OVERALL
The food was very good . The experience was pretty cheesy. Some of the staff must find it hard not to chuckle when they're trying to prepare and serve A+ dishes. They need to tone it down to keep a return business. The sake bomber crowd isn't gonna keep coming back at $100/head, and fine diners don't want their conversations (and even thoughts) drowned out by Vegas theatrics, unnecessary "security" and obnoxious guests. The servers are very young and inexperienced, and still in script mode. They need to be able to read when a table doesn't need to be taught about a menu. But I imagine the ones who make it will relax and hit a groove if management lets them.

We'll head back to the bar on a week night, as far away from the "show" as possible, and enjoy some sushi.

So I was just here at you would expect great service for someone from out of town . I received garbage service along with terrible looking rolls . If your looking for delicious sushi at an amazing price visit El Paso Tx . Danny at makoto will serve you delicious sushi with fresh fish

I set up reservations for 2 for a birthday dinner. The service was excellent, they comp'd any dessert on the menu for the birthday and they even served the dish with a sparkler. I would highly recommend this restaurant for any occasion/dinner.

Located in the W Hotel in Old Town Scottsdale, this hipster hangout is always busy.  I recommend a reservation if you're planning to dine here.  The Better Half and I drop in here from time to time.  Since I don't eat Sushi, I order:

Ji-Dori Chicken Skewers withTeriyaki Sauce - $10
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/DwP10iEz5LGf3fhcVQZm0Q?select=x_60nAIMvJX9k_s9HAPiOA

Filet Mignon wrapped Asparagus with Soy Mirin Sauce - $15
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/DwP10iEz5LGf3fhcVQZm0Q?select=19cHPtx8ahwZTPC5xIARFQ
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/DwP10iEz5LGf3fhcVQZm0Q?select=_4XhXTuYKQnypHmylm-mQg

And for Dessert, a warm Chocolate Cake...yum!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/DwP10iEz5LGf3fhcVQZm0Q?select=KoyBtoSTBrhM2dLD8zs_PA
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/DwP10iEz5LGf3fhcVQZm0Q?select=iKBiwthdGtENIqWfGK1V1A

The Chicken Skewers are very tasty.  The Teriyaki Sauce they are glazed are sweet and have the right amount of "sour" kick to it to balance the flavor.  The Filet Mignon wrapped Asparagus is awesome...the Filet is tender and juicy and the Asparagus compliments it well.  Of course, the Chocolate Cake dessert is a nice ending for the meal.

The service can be a bit slow at times, depends on the server.  Generally speaking, it's pretty good considering how busy they are.

The people watching here is pretty good...watching all of the hipsters is hilarious.

Return Factor - 93%

I ate here 5 or 6 times now. In fact... I'm eating here currently haha. so idk if that makes it 7 times or what. pretty much I eat here whenever I can because it's the best sushi in the best location with the best chefs: Jason, Kyle, the blonde guy and Shu San. All very friendly, and skilled. Jason taught me all about soy paper haha. 

The fish is all good. Bomb ass uni, but the baked crab roll was my drug of choice lately.  Way too good for $11.  I ate 45 of them lol, jk. 12oz of hot sake for $10. Good skewers as well. Really I don't think you can go wrong here. It's really very good bang for your buck here. I've had omakase a while back and it's was really beautiful and delicious. Good salmon nigiri, hella good snapper,  real wasabi, etc.. it's all good here. 

Good loud bar in back but it's not part of sushi roku. But roku has its own bar as well. Really good service maybe they like me extra but the hosts, waitresses and chefs and everyone are very intelligent and helpful and super nice to me!

So far this has been the best sushi I've had in Phoenix. If you can overlook the loud music, you'll appreciate the ambiance which is young and classy. Lots of beautiful women and clean shaven men to look at which made this evening worth the steep bill.

Came here for a birthday party of about 20 people.  The sashimi was so small I ate all 4 pieces in one bite.  After that disappointment I got my sushi.  I got the jalepeno roll.  Wasn't very spicy.  All in all average sushi.  This was a birthday party for 3 people I will add and by the time they brought out the birthday cake over half the party had left as we had finished our meal about an hour prior and there was only a handful of people left.

At the end of the night the wait staff tried to charge us all for items we didn't order which included $65 dollars in bottled water.  After we disagreed we asked to speak to a manager who shrugged the whole thing off and walked off during our conversation (possibly to admire his over priced suit in the mirror) leaving us wondering what the outcome was.  About 20 minutes later we decided to finally leave.  Not paying for overpriced bottled water.

This place is probably perfect for you if you want to get drunk and go upstairs and listen to horrible dance music after a average to below average meal
Okay. So they don't have Malibu Rum. But their sparkling sake is the bomb!! Food is okay. But really, are you going for the food... or the party??

My fave sushi place in Vegas! The view is killer, food is amazing and the drinks are FANTASTIC.  Try the filet mignon-wrapped asparagus and any of the sashimis--wash it down with a spicy passion and spice...I order mine with muddled serranos instead of jalapenos and it's DELISH.  The manager is super nice as well!  All of the staff are very attentive and helpful, and it's a great place for lunch or dinner.  I'm there every time I visit at LEAST once!

One of the best sushi experiences of my life. I ordered the 8 piece chef's tasting plate and was very impressed. Each piece was so interesting and delicious. A bit pricey but very worth it. The crab roll is crazy good too.

Short Story:
Vegas has some good sushi?!  I'm surprised...

Long Story:
I came here for lunch on Thursday, and it was not crowded.  We were promptly seated and we ordered the Karaage appetizer, the Teriyaki salmon, and the beef Teriyaki.  All the dishes were good and they came with sashimi.  I got to say, the sashimi was good, though I didn't have high expectations as this was Vegas...and not hear the coast.  It did take a bit of time to get our food, but it was forgivable.  

Verdict:
I would go back if and when I go back to Vegas.  Though I'm sure there are other good places to go too.

2 words to describe this restaurant - Par Excellence!

Service was exemplary. Our waiter gave us the right suggestions and the food was prepared in a timely manner. The restaurant was busy but there was no room for error.

Right from the appetizers to the entrees - sushi and sashimi, everything was prepared to perfection. Highly recommend the crispy Brussel sprouts, popcorn shrimp tempura, filet mignon wrapped asparagus, crunchy tuna and the spicy scallops.

For dessert do order the green tea tiramisu.

Drinks : We just did beer and wine and they have a good selection.

All in all a wonderful dining experience. Definitely a classy and EXPENSIVE restaurant - that's quiet normal for the strip, but it's worth the money you spend.

Stay away.
For being moderately expensive I was expecting good sushi but all that came was mediocre one.
The happy hour deal is great! Had the spicy tuna and spicy scallop roll - both were excellent. The service was also fantastic.

Not impressed for the price. Informative and nice wait staff. However they served us the wrong dish, which we starting eating before realizing it was not what we ordered, only to be told later when the bill was delivered we had to pay for the sushi they incorrectly delivered. Sushi was just ok...not worth the cost.

Went to Sushi Roku tonight with my family from CT and had a great experience.  We had Rene as our server and he was fantastic.  He knew the menu, was able to answer all questions regarding gluten free and vegan items, made great suggestions for the dietary restrictions and got everything right!  There were 13 of us yelling out food orders for rolls and appetizers and nothing was missed.  Our drinks were promptly refilled, table pre-bussed, set up nicely for dessert and everything was absolutely delicious!  Sushi Roku doesn't fall short in any regard...great ambiance, upbeat music, good energy, superior service and amazing food.    You can certainly tell that the management is exceptional!
Not much to say. It's sushi in Vegas and it is damn good. Pricey but that is to be expected. Definitely added to my list of places to eat when I'm in Vegas.

I recently spent the better part of a week at the W Hotel in Scottsdale.  Of course I picked the coldest few days seen in recent years in Phoenix!

Very happy to find that the "hotel restaurant" was Sushi Roku!  I'd been there once before in LA.

Some highlights....

-- very creative, out of the box options
-- extremely knowledgable wait team
-- impeccable service


A few of my favorites that our group enjoyed....

1.  Black Truffle Tempura Handroll 
2. Filet Mignon wrapped Asparagus
3.  The triple desert sampler (chocolate "lava" cake was awesome!"

While it wasn't cheap -- it was well worth the cost.  I knew it was pricey when I walked in, but the amazing menu, outstanding wait staff, and quality make you forget about the price!

Brought to you by the group that includes Katana and BOA, Sushi Roku is upscale chain restaurant found in the Forum Shops at Caesers. 

Best sushi in town (at this time). I always let my friend order for me here, so most of the time it's always too much food. Haru, my favorite Itamae, always makes consistent, beautiful dishes. Different items tried:

Ika somen with gold flakes
Kimo
Mackerel
Hamachi
Tuna Sashimi Carpaccio
Salmon Sashimi Carpaccio
Monkfish Liver
Tako
Tuna Belly
Bonito (one of my favorites)
Caviar
Yellowtail with Foie Gras and Black Truffle (another favorite)
Matsutake Mushrooms on the Bincho Tan

Polish this all of with a nice sake.

While the view alone might be reason enough to dine here, I would recommend just having drinks and enjoying the vista because the food here is not good.  It's expensive, yes, but most things on the strip in Las Vegas are.  If it were expensive and quality it would be well worth it, but it is expensive and lacks quality.

Even better than the LA location. The sushi is good, not mind blowing, amazingly fresh, OMG....but a solid good. So you get an enjoyable meal, with an intimate dining experience, and great ambiance. Good views of the strip and a little bit of a breather from the chaos. But what made it a fantastic night was the service. It was EXCELLENT. Best restaurant experience we had the entire trip! I will go back next time I'm in Vegas which I hope will be soon!

I'm picky when it comes to my sushi. I went to Sushi Roku for the first time last week and I was blown away. The food is SO fresh and the rolls were unique and delicious! The prices are average for the strip, but totally worth it!
Dinner was awesome! Very nice, clean and trendy restaurant. We had the toro roll, crab dynamite, baked crab hand roll and special roll all were outstanding! Can't go wrong with any of their rolls.

Best filet mignon I have ever had. Like butter baby. 
Teriyaki flavored steak and mashed potatoes at a sushi restaurant in Vegas?  Sweet baby Jesus that was so damn good.
sushi was just ok, way over priced.  Service was slow for the amount of customers in this place.

Great food - we had a couple of rolls, miso and some amazing seabass skewers. Service was fabulous. We are at 8 on a Friday and there was NO wait. Perhaps people don't know you can go out the doors in Ceasear's by FIZZ and walk down the driveway for a 2 min walk to sushi Roku instead of wandering through the mall for a 10 min walk! We did the meandering walk back but when we were hungry the fast walk was better!

The five stars is for their service and their sake, the sushi isn't the best I've ever had, but the ambiance at this location is intimate, inviting and sexy.
 A very open concept with the sushi bar being at the center of the restaurant. the lighting of the restaurant focuses on the sushi bar itself,highlighting the chefs as they create beautifully plated dishes.
We love the Sunday and Monday offer of 1/2 off all sake bottles! Some of the finest selections can be found on their menu. 
The manager sat with us and even provided tastings of some of his favorites all because I asked, " what is the real difference between..." 
in turn, I received a full lesson and explanation of the polished rice process. LOVED that! 
A 5 star " as good as it gets sake bar" experience for Sushi Roku

Extremely disappointing, I went with a party of 9 for my sister's birthday this last Saturday. Everything was going wonderful until a food runner was grabbing plates and spilled sauce all over my hair. I made it very clear that he spilled sauce on my hair, chest and shoulder he apologized and tried to wipe me down with what smelt like a dirty napkin. I told him it was okay and that I was going to the restroom, he then told me he would bring me a wet rag. In the restroom my attempt to rid my hair of the soy sauce was a complete failure. I returned to the table expecting a wet napkin of some sort that may work better than the wet paper towels but the gentleman was no where to be found, and never returned to check on me. I normally would of gone home showered and shrugged it off, but it was my sister birthday and I had to troop along the entire night (4 hours) in misery, smelling like thick, goopy, sticky, soy sauce. 
Thank you so much for a wonderful experience at Sushi Roku

(oh he also spilled sauce on my friends hair so not only did he spill sauce on my hair and I made it known he continued to not be careful and spill more on my friend!!!)

This place has a great mix of fresh sushi and cooked options! Located in the W hotel, it has a great date night or happy hour atmosphere and the staff was extremely attentive and friendly. We ordered the Katana and baked Lobster roll along with the wagu gyoza and loved everything! They also had a great selection of mixed cocktails and we both enjoyed our selections.
It was ok .... I guess maybe because I was not very hungry and the place was out of the way for me .... My favorite place is still Shari Downtown/Thornton Park ;)

Food was good.  Service was off the hook! Joy is the bomb!took care us us on our annual anniversary celebration. Even took care of hubby with warm salt water for post root canal. JOY IS THE BEST. Perfect for happy hour!

I would highly recommend this place.  Me and my girlfriends had the best experience. The staff went above and beyond.  Everyone was very knowledgeable about the menu items and gave us a guided tailored experience based on our preferences.  Great suggestions.
Love this place. The best sushi in town and our favorite server- Sarah S. !!! We will be back soon!

Boring and bland, it all tasted the same and at a premium price point I expected better. A
Slow lazy service.

I really am giving this place 3.5 stars for two reasons.  The noise level and the lack of server loyalty to our table.  Atlhough that's not necessarily a bad thing, it was a bit confusing.  I'll get to that shortly.  We arrived just a few minutes after our reservation, but that's because we got dropped off by the cab on the wrong side and had to hike to the other side where the shops were to get to the restaurant.  When we arrived we were seated promptly.  We were placed in a nice two top right against the window overlooking The Strip.  Really nice view.  However, although were so close to each other, it seemed difficult to have a normal conversation.  The music was a little loud, which in turn had the patrons talking louder, and the two tops are so close together, we were having to talk over each other tables conversations.  I'm sure they felt the same way.
This is where I get to the lack of server loyalty.  We had someone greet our table almost immediately.  He offered us menus and water and said a server would be over shortly.  He even put in an order of edamame for us.  Server #1.  Our edamame came out almost immediately, brought to us by what I assume was a runner.  Person #2.  The server came over to take our drink orders. Server #3.  This was also the same person that took our food order.  The previous runner brought out our first round of sushi.  The sushi was delicious.  We had a couple rolls and the Chef's Sushi sampler.  The tuna and salmon we had was like butter.  Definitely high quality.
When we were finished with our first round, a server asked us if we wanted anything additional.  This was a different server from our initial one.  Server #4.  We said we weren't sure and asked for another menu.  Once we decided, we had Server #5 come take our final order.  He also brought us our last roll, and brought us our check.  When we got the check, I was confused as to who would be getting our tip due to the number of people that served us.  While I certainly appreciated the constant attention, I wanted to make sure that the tip was given appropriately.  I tipped 20% as I do normally and hopefully the servers receive their tips appropriately, however that may be.  Not once did we ever see Server #1 again.
All in all, I would probably return here again.  Maybe not on my next visit, but at some point.

This place was fantastic!!!   We were staying a Nobu, a boutique hotel in Caesar's.  We just arrived in Vegas and were looking for a nice place to sit, relax and enjoy a satisfying meal.

We happened upon Sushi Roku and decided to give it a try.  We had a window view of the strip.  Not only that but the food was fantastic as well as the service.  I'm a vegetarian and was there with two co-workers who were not.   The waiter was very helpuful at answering my questions about the dishes.  I ordered a couple of appetizers because that's about all there was that was veg. The waiter was great about letting me know that we could start out with just a couple of the small dishes (salad & an eggplant dish),   He said if they were not sufficient he'd put in an orer for an additional dish.  That really impressed me. Often when I order veggie dishes the waiters will act like they think I'll be starving.  Not here!!  And my meal was more than sufficient.  And oooooh, so good!! The Miso Eggplant appetizer was especially delish.  

I'm so glad we decided to take the chance and stop here.
Love this place best rice in the world  and I've been to Japan. The prices are higher but if you love real high end fish this is the place to go!

I heart Sushi Roku.

Atmosphere, Food, Service - this place as it all.

Despite being located in an upscale section of a "mall - "Forum at Caesar's Palace, the dark, rich wood, ponds with koi, multi-leveled seating (booths and platforms) and the warm lighting made this place irresistable to not walk into during a break in my shopping frenzy. This place had the hints of a warm romantic restaurant with the modern edge that made dining here accessible to all.  No matter where you are sitting (even if you aren't near a window) you'll enjoy the view.

I was ready for a huge meal and my dining partner and I (having walked from MGM) were ready for a giant meal.

We took the server's suggestion of a Tokyo Breeze (a sake cocktail).  It was amazing!  Perfectly balanced - not-too-sweet citrus cocktail made from sake, to this day, as not found it's equal in ANY establishment i have been to.  It was amazing..

Starter:
Chilean Sea Bass Eggrolls- I think this has forever changed my view on eggrolls.  The buttery flavor of the Chilean Sea bass was perfect with this dish.  The tender fish paired with the crispy wonton skin... amazing.

Sushi:
Uni - Delicious!
Salmon - tAMAZING!
the server mentioned that this was suggested by the chef because I had ordered so much salmon sashimi (it was a special kind - i can't remember, but had thicker bands of the delicious fat and was a more deeply hued orange than what I am used to) 
Eel- (freshwater) it was prefectly sauced with great consistency.

The slices of fish were well matched size-wise with the perfectly seasoned rice

Sashimi:
Salmon, Yellowtail, and Tuna - all were delicious!

Rolls:
The rice was NOT smashed into the nori and the balance of all the flavors were perfectly matched!
We had the Kani Kani roll because we are crab lovers!  A roll done with crab 2 ways - inside (Alaskan snow crab) and outside - fried/tempura!  Delicious.
there was a great selection of rolls that seemed to cover everything from the extremely lavish to the simple but delicious..
TRY them all!


Service was extremely helpful, prompt and polite.  They were very attentive when we needed them and magically disappeared when they were no longer needed.. its that 6th sense that great servers are known for.. Sushi Roku servers had it.


This will be pricer than what you are used to, but it is every bit worth it.

Went here on our anniversary trip. The food was great, same as in Pasadena CA... service was slower and we were ignored or rushed depending on which server kept coming to our table, since we had 2 taking care of our table...

BUt the food was spectacular as always.
Delicious and great atmosphere. Best yellowtail sashimi ever: "yellowtail diced chiles"....

Ambience is nice, great music and decor... Located in the W hotel. Sushi is a bit pricey but very fresh. Menu is confusing and not much explanation is given. Alcoholic beverages are great as well, I ordered only 1 pear martini and it was STRONG!!

The Sushi Roku empire was built out in Los Angeles, but the trendy vibe was transported across state lines to be featured in their Las Vegas location.  The third floor digs inside the Forum Shops at Caesar's Palace provide expansive views of the Strip.  Being only a few flights above ground, you are able to enjoy the towering lights of the hotels, as well as the entertaining antics happening on the busy street.  The dim lighting and Asian-inspired decor make Sushi Roku a seductive spot.  However, the high ceilings and open dining room can get quite loud when full of larger parties.  (Our meal was continuously disrupted by a rowdy birthday celebration.)

Since we were grabbing a late dinner, we decided to opt for some light courses.  I ordered the Mixed Sashimi Salad, which was a mound of fresh field greens topped with radish slices and served over thinly cut raw fish.  The platter included tuna, salmon, yellowtail, and more.  A snappy ginger vinaigrette was drizzled over the dish, providing a gentle spicing.  Each piece of fish was light, fresh, and tender.  I also sampled their Eel Avocado Roll, which contained eel slices so warm that the maki easily fell apart, one of my pet peeves.  My friend ordered the special Katana Roll.  The massive portion contained about 10-12 slices of a mixed spicy tuna and shrimp tempura maki, topped with tuna and yellowtail slices.  It was a fantastic concoction that she reminisced about for days.

Many hip Japanese spots that provide fun atmospheres and innovative cooking styles, such as Nobu, often do not provide the same food quality as more traditional spots.  However, Sushi Roku scores 4 stars on all of points - style, creativity, and taste.

So I really was looking forward to coming back here but it was quite disappointing. I will start by saying they were very quick to help us figure out a seating situation for our group of 8 which was nice. We settled on the patio which may have been the reason for the poor service or the server could have been being over worked however when we could call her name for assistance we were often ignored u til she had time to help. It took a LONG time to get our checks and they won't split them for you. You have to do it. 

The way the food comes out is strange. It was all at different times and so all of us were eating sporadically and not together. The food was average. I am pregnant so I could not have the sushi but my husband said it was good. The atmosphere is definitely what makes the place. Would likely come back for a night out with the girls for drinks and atmosphere and probably skip the restaurant.

I lived in NY for while before I moved here to Scottsdale. Sushi Roku makes me miss NY a little less -- not just b/c of the cool decor and the semi-fancy without being too pretentious ambiance, but b/c the food is really good and the manager and chef are extremely friendly and genuine, which is how they are in NY. I don't go out that much, so when I do, I want it to be a relatively meaningful experience. The food is amazing -- MUST get the popcorn shrimp app which is the most elegant lightly fried shrimp I've ever had. The sushi rolls are great. Try not to get a super young server, there's one I won't name who kind of sucks. Other than that, it's a great experience.

Another favorite of ours in Vegas didn't disappoint us on this trip. 

My wife is not a fan of fish but there is plenty on the menu for her to choose from. 

She chose a cucumber and avocado roll and had them use soy paper instead of seaweed.  And chicken teriyaki, rice, with vegetable tempura. 

I had an assortment of rolls and a friend joined us late but the restaurant accommodated without any problems.  

As others have said there may be better sushi restaurants on the strip but we live the view, food, and service and will be back on our next trip.

Sleek contempary room with good people viewing seats within the Forum shops rotunda.  Very good sushi, very good service, reasonable prices by Vegas standards.  Worth a visit if you are in a sushi mood.

My boyfriend and I went for dinner before a show on Sunday night. It was not busy at all. When we arrived we first sat at the bar to wait for a table. We ordered some saki and a couple apps to start. The happy hour was great! We finally got a table and decided to do the chefs tasting.  The waitress told us it was a good portion and we would be fine each getting one.  Mind you it's $120 each.  When the food started coming out, the portions were insanely large which would have been great if we hadn't already purchased apps.  We ended up stopping at course 5 bc it was just too much and we were very annoyed that the waitress didn't just tell us and instead was just trying to up her sales and we didn't even get to enjoy it.  We don't mind spending the money but the waitress was very dishonest, we won't be going back.

We came for lunch and it was alright. There was no one at the front counter when we walked up and we stood there for about a minute or two looking like a couple of lost souls because we were unsure of the following:
1) Are they open? It looks empty. But there's a waiter walking around and there's sushi chefs behind the sushi bar.
2) Should we just walk in? But I don't know where to go... the sushi bar looks open but I can't tell if we're allowed to seat ourselves.  (Even the waiter who was walking around the sushi bar area, who obviously saw us looking confused didn't greet us...)

We walked in, got maybe ten feet inside before the waiter finally said, "oh she'll (referring to the missing hostess I assumed) be back... she went somewhere...." We said okayyy and went back outside to the front, where we waited a few more minutes.

My bf got the bento box with teriyaki chicken and spicy tuna roll while I ordered a vegetable tempura donburi and a shrimp and asparagus roll. There was something strange about the roll I ordered, though, but I couldn't place it... I think it might've been the fact that it had some kind of white sauce that may or may not have been mayo (thankfully, I didn't get sick after lunch that day or the next for that matter!)... the teriyaki chicken was excellent - prob the best I've ever had! The chicken was cooked perfectly - moist,  succulent and flavorful!  And the spicy tuna was also pretty awesome - way better than the roll I chose.

I would have given a higher rating, but after the waiter spilled a pitcher of ice water on two of the guests at our table, in front of a manager, and no one even acknowledged the incident.  (Management and service seem to be the consistent reason for poor reviews.). I just can't imagine why I would recommend anyone come here.

Oh and FYI, I posted the same review on OpenTable and it never was shown.  Apparently they don't post unfavorable reviews for the restaurants they work for.  So if you are looking for an accurate rating, don't trust their system.

Sushi Roku is my go-to for any occasion or none at all. Everything is delicious but my heart belongs to the pork belly. I adore the hostess Juliana. She's always accommodating, poised, and elegant and first impressions last so it's a good thing she's one of the first people to greet you at Sushi Roku. The restaurant is inside of the W hotel so put on your Sunday's best because this is the place to see and be seen!

This place is very good for Americanized Sushi, we can here for my wifes birthday and although they lost our reservation they got us in anyway. The sushi is very unique and tasty, its usually best to go with whatever is freshest. 
if you haven't been here you will never find it...no kidding.

Such a great experience! My husband and I celebrated our 1 year wedding anniversary.  Because I booked our reservation through yelp they knew it was our anniversary and surprised us with a delicious dessert! Sushi was delicious, service was great, and we'll definitely go back the next time we're in Vegas!

There is not a single thing we ordered that I wouldn't get seconds of. The list in order of absolute love:

1) Brussels sprout chips (tossed in truffle oil)
2) Shishito peppers
3) unknown name tuna role recommended by the chef with spicy tuna and jalapenos inside and fresh tuna on top - AMAZING
4) Beef rib eye wrapped asparagus
5) Crunchy spicy tuna tempura
6) Avocado Hanabi
7) Roasted Cauliflower

To reinstate, I loved all of it. Granted this list is short on sushi and it's not that we don't love sushi, it's that we LOVE appetizers and couldn't make a single choice. But for those on a budget, you might have to make some choices, and I hope this helps. It was the perfect filling amount for three semi-hungry ladies. 

The vibe of the place is perfect. It's in a hotel, and the only way I would notice was the swim suit wearing ladies at the bar. But that's not a bother to me as the waitstaff is incredibly friendly and professional. Note, the night we were there it was mostly a young, handsome, male staff. I'm not complaining just noticing. 

Next time I'm in a city with Roku, I'm coming back.

What a great place for Sushi!  Located in the Cesar, the locals we were staying with pointed this out as a great place with an excellent "Happy Hour".  We decided to give it a try and to my surprise they had an excellent selection of rolls decently priced from 4-6pm!  As well, they had some drink specials too.   A couple nice large Sapporo for $5 for me and wine for the other guests and about 6 rolls and a couple appetizers for us to split, all for just about $60 was a great deal!

Check them out for the happy hour, it is totally worth it!

Great sushi & atmosphere. First time here with a group of girls, we arrived around 8 PM on Sat night and there was no wait but the place was pretty busy. Our waiter CJ was so nice & attentive. Wine was $10-16 a glass, I got a cab for $12 & it was good. We got an array of sushi for the table, all was great. The roasted cauliflower is to die for!!!!! The only weird thing was I got the baked crab roll and it wasn't sliced, it was just one long sushi roll, sort of awkward, especially because we just had chopsticks & no knife or anything. But food was great! Will be back.

I let my non-Yelping brother-in-law select where we would have dinner on his final night in Las Vegas, and his choice, Sushi Roku, did not disappoint. He doesn't eat sushi but his lady and I both love it, and we all left Sushi Roku very happy with our meals.

Sushi Roku is located on the third floor of The Forum Shops at Caesars Palace, almost directly above the valet (so really easy to find). The space is sleek and sexy, and we had a great view of the Strip from our booth. Service was excellent all night;  patient (we are a chatty group and I think our waiter must have come back to take our order 5 times before we decided on anything) accommodating to special requests and able to answer the plethora of questions we had about the menu. 

Highlights from our meal would be: 

Brussel Sprout Chips with truffle oil - addictively delicious 
Spicy Pork Belly Fried Rice - My brother in law was so in love with this dish he had the waiter bring out another order before he was even halfway finished. He was kind enough to share the pork belly which was absolutely divine. 
American Wagyu Beef Skewer - The pork belly stole the spotlight, but this skewer was a close second. Melt-in-your-mouth deliciousness. 
Albacore Sashimi - Super fresh and served with a nice, light ponzu sauce

I didn't see the check so I can not tell you what our meal set us back, but based on how happily my brother-in-law paid it, our meal was obviously worth every penny to him and that's all that really matters to me. I will absolutely return to Sushi Roku in the future,

Loved every thing on the menu. The miss soup is the best I have ever had. I had their specialty roll with spicy tuna and jalapeño (it's not on the menu but you can ask for it) the pork belly fried rice is unbelievable and I'm not usually a fan of fried rice. I would definitely recommend this resturaunt and come back.

YUM. I went recently and was very happy with not only the food, but the service. My water glass was never empty, and they often came by to check on us. 

The food: I had the Yellowtail Sashimi appetizer with diced chilies. For an appetizer, $17 is a bit high--the portions were a bit small, but this was so delicious. The chilies did not seem spicy to me /at all/ but the whole thing was really flavorful. I could have easily eaten a pound of this. 

I got a few sashimi pieces (maguro, hamachi), and the crunchy spicy tuna roll. Yes, I evidently love tuna. At any rate, these were all really delicious and I was totally happy with my selections. 

The restaurant itself is beautifully decorated, and its location inside the forum shoppes is convenient. 

Would definitely eat here again!

Horrible service. Made a reservation for 8:30pm & our party wasn't seated until 9pm...then we were held hostage unable to pay due to a system crash....the service was slow & the food was mediocre. The Chilean Sea Bass was over cooked & the desserts inedible.

I would give it 10 stars if I could. The service was outstanding and the food was off the charts. We had the Brussel sprout chips and tempura vegetables for an appetizers. The chips were amazing. The baked lobster roll was to die for. I might eat here again tomorrow.

My husband and I really enjoyed the generous happy hour here. Out favorites were the spicy yellow tail, the filet mignon wrapped asparagus and the albacore sashimi with garlic aioli. The bar staff was fun and friendly. We will return!

YUMMMMM. Try the KEN Saki! They have delicious roasted cauliflower and really amazing crispy Brussels sprouts! The sushi is always good!!!!! I love going here when I haven friends or family come from out of town!

Most pleasant dinner in Vegas. Great happy hour with very friendly staff. Owner made a point to check in on all guests. 

Only tried the happy hour menu but thought all the food was fanatic, especially for the price. 

Highly recommended

Yellowtail sashimi w/ diced chiles is amazing but if you want to be in heaven, try the specials, they were like a party in my mouth. The sashimi was fresh and tasty, including the uni, so you know it was amazing. The restaurant was beautiful with a great view of the Strip. The managers were very gracious and knowing we had a show to catch, ordered us the chocolate cake for dessert. Plus the sake list was great and we were able to enjoy an excellent Daiginjo-shu. I can't wait to return.

Wonderful service , good atmosphere and delicious food. My all time favorite was the tuna carpaccio and blue fin tuna sashimi. Ordered the poke tuna and ribeye steak, both could be good also but the sauce was a bit salty. Overall, everything was perfect. FYI: was celebrating our 3 years being engaged. Definitely will be back ;)
Great sushi at a reasonable price for Vegas.  Fun staff with big smiles.  Excellent fish.  All purchased directly from Japan.

Never a dull moment eating here. The Filet/ Wagyu wrapped asparagus is a must try, served on a hot rock table side where the sauce is poured at the table presenting a cool little show. Some of my other favorites are the Hamachi green chillies and just simply a chef's selection sashimi plate.

Another great dinner in Vegas. Craving something lighter than the Italian fare that every restaurant seems to have, we opted to walk to this restaurant in Caesars Palace. The atmosphere and food were good. We ordered dishes to share including a veggie roll, miso eggplant dengaku, and roasted cauliflower. 

We liked everything but the tofu three ways. It's just three blocks of cold tofu, with different soy sauces and toppings. We ordered it without the caviar, but neither of us liked the truffle or kimchi one. This could just be us being picky eaters, but I didn't like that we left 95% of it untouched and the waitress didn't ask what was wrong; she just cleared the plate.

All in all, a nice pre-drinking dinner.

Came here for lunch with my boss. It was alright. Very American catered sushi. Fish freshness was average.

Spicy scallop handroll (3/5) too much mayo and meh...

Salmon skin handroll (4/5) it was crispy as should be

We had a cooked roll (2/5) it was alright hence why I cant remember the name

Hamachi nigiri (3/5) not as fresh as I liked.

I have been to this restaurant twice and I hate it.  I can't believe that this place is so popular.  The sushi was AWFUL.  I hope that I didn't contract parasites from the tuna.  The service here is DREADFUL and the scene is HORRIBLE.  
Stick with Wasabi on Sahara...it's the best in the world.

I'm mainly giving this restaurant 4 stars for its awesome view of the strip and hip interior.  Medium to high noise level.  Me and my friend had miso soup, edamame, beer, the "Hanabi" spicy tuna on rice cakes appetizer and shared the Katana Roll.  My desert was the most memorable part of the meal.  I got the flambe fruit desert.  Mixed sauteed fruit, served in a crisp pastry shell with vanilla ice cream.  Very good.  Everything else was fresh and good, however, I feel it was rather pricey for the amount of food that we had.   You probably pay for the view.
First time at a sushi restaurant.  It was great.  I did not try the sushi. Maybe next time!

While shopping in the Forum we happened to go up to the 3rd floor and found Sushi Roku.  Both times I have been here has been in between lunch and dinner, so it has been quiet and practically have the place to ourselves.

Service has always been fast, friendly and thorough.  Everything I have had here has been amazing.  One of my favorite things is their kimchee cucumber appetizer.  This is the best "pickle" I have ever had. This is so delicious and it takes them 4 days to make it and it is worth it!!!

Two other of my favs are the Unagi and the Korean Pork Belly Fried Rice.  Unagi is cooked perfectly and is so delicate it melts in your mouth.  The Pork Belly Fried Rice is not only a beautiful dish to look at, but it tastes amazing.  There is a good sized portion of pork belly and the poached egg is really the cherry on the top.

For you Saki drinkers, they have an extensive list to choose from.  This has become a must visit restaurant every time I'm in Vegas.  Definitely worth finding the elusive 3rd floor in the Forum Shopping Mall

Love the food here unfortunately cant say the same about the service specially if you end up at the bar for hh. Avoid at all costs the female server at the bar area that is tall, asian looking, should i say more? The nice young blonde girl thats behind the bar usually is covering the other girl's lack of service and miserable attitude. When i see that the tall one will be my server i just ask to be moved to a restaurant table and if all booked, i just go another place to eat and drink. For that reason only 2 stars, service is the mist important thing specially if you are spending  $100 for food and drinks. Get rid of that horrible server that is killing the bar and make everyone happy.

We ordered the Japanese peppers--so great!!! I could've ate the whole thing!! We had a number of rolls that were all good, but my favorite would have to be the spicy tuna roll. One of the rolls that was ordered wasn't favorable so the management made it up with additional rolls. Awesome location in the W and close to great night spots in downtown Scottsdale. Will return!!

I want to give this place 3.5 stars. Please note that my Yelp rating is higher because I round up for my reviews. This place is probably the better sushi places in the phoenix area. The atmosphere is very romantic. The lights are dimmed yet there is enough light fixtures to set the mood. It's a sophisticated environment. This is the effect place for a romantic date night, a first date or a night out with the girlfriends. 

I will have to say that as far as the food it's not that great compared to sushi places in Washington DC or New York. However, considering this area (phoenix or for that matter Arizona) it's good sushi. It's very westernized and not truly a Japanese style sushi restaurant. So don't expect too much. A lot of people thinking they are eating authentic style sushi in the restaurant... (that's a different rant for a different time and place...) 

They offer a great listing for cocktails! My favorite was their lychee drink. Their sake is on point too. With that being said, on the weekends, this place is packed with people drinking. There are a lot of drunk people eating dinner. It gets pretty loud and hectic...

Now Sushi ROKU.. I do like. 

It is located in a even pricier area of Caesars Palace.... on the 3rd floor. Views from up there are cool.. prices @ Roku are also a  bit high as a result.. but go for the Happy Hour! As of the last time I went.. all beer and liquor was very cheap and most of the Hour items were about $5. Good Food too.. I always sit at the bar, and always get great service.

Tasty sushi (though not mind blowing), friendly staff, great atmosphere. We sat at the sushi bar and the sushi chef next to us was fantastic - memorizing all our orders while he was completing 3 other orders was no big deal for him, even the waitress couldn't keep up with him! Spicy tuna cut roll was just okay, along with the Hirame nigiri sushi. But what blew my mind was the hotate nigiri sushi. It was so fresh and melted in my mouth! Suitable place for a date or with groups.

Delicious sushi, lively atmosphere and attentive wait staff.  I came here with my boyfriend last week and we had some of the best sushi in Arizona thus far.  The spicy tuna roll was our fave! The atmosphere was really comfortable and the music was well-fitting for the over all ambiance.  Our server, Clayton was very attentive, helpful and had an outgoing personality.  Will definitely return and ask to be seated with him again!

Came as we had a ramen craving in Vegas, and it was the closest to our hotel at the Mirage. It's pretty swanky located within the shops at Caesers. Service was really good, and we got a popcorn shrimp roll and 2 bowls of ramen. It was a bit pricey for both, but expected. The roll was simple and tasted good. The ramen, the broth was a tad heavy, noodles weren't chewy, but overall, it wasn't bad. It hit the spot for what it was worth, but obviously for the $, you can get better at a hole in the wall. Great view of the strip, so good if you're looking to spend some moola for sushi.
Yum, nice ambiance , Dan is the best really makes sure your visit is right. I come here often. Logan is the greatest , very attentive . Friendly.

Made a reservation the day of without any problems. Had to wait just a few minutes, but gave us some time to get some drinks, which were quite good. Food-wise, we split the kobe beef cooked on a hot stone and then shared a bunch of rolls as well as some sake. No complaints from anybody about the food, but the only issue we had was our i'm-better-than-you waiter who served us. Definitely talked down to us and tried to make us order the more expensive sake, the more expensive rolls, and another appetizer of the already expensive kobe beef. But even the annoying waiter couldn't keep us from enjoying our food and the restaurant.

For the four of us that ate there, the bill came to about $250. Luckily we were there for work, so it wasn't actually our money we were spending. Might not have enjoyed the place as much otherwise.


The table next to us had a man in his late-60s or early 70s flanked by two busty girls in their late-20s or early-30s. We tried to figure that relationship out. Ah, Vegas.

This was great!  Sea bass sliders, rib eye wrapped asparagus, and lamb chimichuri define the label of Japanese fusion.  Service was wonderful and a well earned 20%.  Ask for Juliana.
So here it comes.

Al says; You gotta eat here.

Great service, great food. Loved the ambiance - romantic, inviting, fancy. Soup was good, we enjoyed the food, edamame with chili garlic was yum. The rolls were delicious, a tiny bit overpriced for what it was - that's my only complaint. For the portions and menu variety and quality, it was just a bit overpriced in my opinion (i am an avid sushi eater). I still highly recommend it either way. Our service was outstanding, our water never reached the half level, it was constantly tended to.

My fiance and I decided to wait for our anniversary dinner until we visited Las Vegas and we decided to give Sushi Roku a try. Man, am I glad I did!

I called to place the reservation and they asked if we were celebrating anything. I gave them a cursory answer about a late anniversary not expecting anything and locked in a later reservation.

We arrived and were seated immediately and they had no problem with a request for a view of the strip while we ate. The restaurant is quite and the ambiance was great. It was darker so you had more of an illusion of being alone and the server was extremely attentive!

My fiance ordered the Pork Belly Fried Rice and was smitten from her first bite. She didn't have to add any soy, a first for her! She loved ever bit and it was still good when we ate our leftovers almost 3 hours later, cold.

I had the "Chef's Choice" sushi platter. 8 pieces of finely crafted sushi, all with their own signature sauces. Eat bite was unctuous, delectable, and so satisfying! I couldn't remember them all, but the Uni, the Scottish Salmon & the King Crab leg were to die for!

At the end of the meal the wait staff surprised us with a complimentary chocolate lava cake that was the highlight of the meal. They even wrote Happy Anniversary on the plate, a special treat that showed they really paid attention to their customers!

We'll definitely be going back!

Great spot for sushi in old town!  We have been there dozens of times and each time the food and service is on point.  The management is great there as well and if it's your birthday the hook up the desserts.  The yellowtail with diced chilis and ponzu sauce, steak wrapped asparagus and popcorn shrimp with miso sauce are our go to apps.  As for main courses there are too many to choose, but you can't go wrong with the sushi rolls and the jalapeño and sriracha rolls with tuna are amazing.  And for dessert you have to go with the assorted mochi ice cream. The best flavors are pistachio (when available), passion fruit, mango, and blueberry.  Enjoy!

Organized a dinner for 13 of us here. The private room, the attentive service from Miko and the amazing food selection, made for a great night. The atmosphere and view sent the night over the top. The robata skewers of sea bass and Kobe beef were enjoyed by all. The roasted peppers and tempura shrimp were a hit as well. The sliced tuna was amazing and converted two more to sushi.
Best experience as a business traveler getting tons of attention from the sushi chefs and managers. I love it there and can't wait to try all the concepts in LA.

I went here for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. There was literally no one in the restaurant. We were sat in a giant booth for 6, just the two of us, it was very comfortable. We got water right away and our waiter was super nice. The only thing I liked about this visit was the waiter. He was helpful and friendly. 
The water had a horrible aftertaste to it and the people that came in after us noticed it too. If there is a problem with the water, dont serve it. The food was just ok. The kicker is when we got our bill for $60! It was lunch! Highly overpriced for the product. Probably won't go back again, but hey, we tried it. 
I also want to add I am a vegetarian and the only vegetarian item on the menu was vegetable tempura for $11. It was mostly broccoli which I don't like. I ate maybe 3 pieces. The bento boxes offered for lunch don't have anything that I could eat.

My friend and I hopped over to Sushi Roku for our last meal in Vegas on the recommendation of her family. Her family is Japanese and said that they experienced some great sushi here. You can't go wrong with that type of recommendation, right?!

RIGHT! This place was spot on. Everything from our edmame, spicy crunchy tuna rolls, and chefs sashimi plate was excellent. The fish just melts in your mouth and the rice was the perfect consistency. 

This place isn't cheap, but either is the food quality. Great way to end our stay in Vegas!

Why come here to eat? We just spent $130.00 and going home hungry. On top of it we found a long piece of plastic in our rice but they said it was crab. For this price they should make sure no UFOs are found in our food. Overpriced and not so good food. Very small portions, I mean small.

Nice looking place.  The server was an AZZ.  I don't know if it was because our party of 6 included 2 kids or maybe he didn't like my shoes...  I dont know.  Everyone in our party just got the feeling that we were bothering "Gregory".   There was only 3 other people in the restaurant at 4:30 pm so I have no idea what the problem was.  Check my reviews...  I am not the negative rating yelper that only rates poor service.  This guy made us all just want to leave.
Eating here now. Excellent food, Juliet is awesome! Glad we came. Will stop here again on our next trips. The shrimp appetizer is huge. The Katana roll is delish.
Best place in Scottsdale to get sushi , great service, Jennah made our experience personal and had such a great attitude, I'm definitely going back and telling all my friends
Fantastic.  Katana roll is where it's at.  They even gave my wife a set of chopstick helpers to help the struggle. Haha

I've always felt there are two items that are consistent indicators of the overall quality of a sushi restaurant... saba or uni. I took the saba test and Sushi Roku got low marks. The fishier the saba generally the less awesome your sushi meal will be and sure enough, my saba was pretty fishy and the overall meal was edible, but not stellar. 

Granted I was eating sushi in landlocked Scottsdale, so perhaps the joke is on me. Alas I was tired from my travels and was in desperate need of food, so I can't say I thought about my dining decision before going in. 

The interior is pretty sleek (as is the decor of the whole hotel) so I'd say it'd still be a fun spot for a date. Our server was pretty cool too. 

Final word: If you're staying in the hotel, don't feel like branching out, and have no price sensitivity, it's fine.

If there was a rating system for price, I'd give this place a 2 but being that every restaurant on the strip and in a hotel is expensive, I'll just level the playing field and ignore the price. In terms of the food and atmosphere, it was great! For an appetizer we ordered the edamame hummus which came with chips (although not enough and when we asked for just a few more chips, when we got the bill they charged us $3 for extra chips - not cool - you should tell us there is going to be a charge first). We also ordered the cod and the spider roll - both extremely good! I guess if we had gotten there just an hour earlier we could have gotten the same thing for half price - but oh well, good to know for next time!

I haven't been to the locations back home but I was pleased with my Sunday afternoon lunch here.  Nice decor, including the restrooms.  I had a $17 lunch combination (teriyaki chicken and tempura) which comes with rice and miso soup.  The tempura was tasty.  For you chocoholics, the volcano cake is to die for.  It's really yummy with the vanilla bean ice cream and strawberries.

I agree with others. My wife and I came here for a quick and quiet anniversary dinner. Although it was not the least bit quiet as a result of Karaoke (sp) night at the club across the way, it was pretty quick. We had a very good rainbow roll, some nice hamachi, etc. The fish was very fresh and delicious. The rolls were a good size and not too over-priced. We thought it would have been even more expensive considering the atmosphere, but it was a pretty good price. I would go back to this place because it is conveniently located on the walkway that connects the Forum Shops to Caesars and was actually not far from the elevator to our room. I thoroughly enjoyed it and will likely be back as soon as I can get back to Vegas.

Sushi Roku has the most amazing service.  We sat at the sushi bar and Toby was fantastic.  Our server Kenji was quite attentive.  Special kudos go to the manager Fan.
