He did a fantastic job helping go through the saki menu and explaining everything.  They all knew the menu so well.  Truly an amazing experience!

Perhaps the best sushi we've ever had- rivaled only by one special dinner in NYC. An amazing experience of flavor, service and ambiance.

The main restaurant has nice ambiance but a very "club" feel with loud music so we asked to sit out on the patio where we could hear each other talk. Giovanni was our server and he quickly suggested that given some "guidelines" he'd be happy to select our dishes - a surprise for each dish, and pushing us out of our standard "Philadelphia roll" boredom. We said yes, and were then treated over the next three hours to a set of masterpieces from Brussel sprout flakes to fluke quat to oh toro to tuna tartar and more, finishing with a flourish of zen smores for desert. Each dish was presented by Giovanni with nuanced descriptions and clear love of Japanese food. The flavor of each dish built in the one before, was multi-layered and delicate- we were laughing with amazement at how many ways by the end we had eaten truffles, for example.

A masterful evening, and we plan to come again soon for sake tasting. Fantastic restaurant!

The customer service we got here was incredible! Came during happy hour on a slower day and the staff took the time to explain the full menus as well answer my boyfriends 100 questions about it ( we had never been here before) and all of the food was delicious! I would especially recommend the avocado hanabi!!!

I'm not sure I can unbiasedly review Sushi Roku because we went there straight after a big win at the tables, so we were really excited and a little tipsy. :)

The truffle roll was unique and delicious...it was my favorite one.  We also got the tempura crab roll (good, not amazing) and something with unagi and avocado (may have been a dragon roll?).  We only had a few rolls and then were pretty hungry later that night, so next time we'd order more.  But we were in a hurry to catch our flight later and couldn't spend a lot of time.

The service was great..I don't remember our server's name, but she was great.  We also chatted with the sushi chef as he was making his creations.

It was pretty expensive, especially because we didn't fill up on the food.  I think for what seemed like 3-4 rolls plus 2 sakes it was like $85!  Kind of crazy.  But it was good quality and good service...so I thought it was worth it this time.  Or maybe I was just feeling rich. ;)

We would go back just to see what else they have on the menu and to spend a little longer relaxing with our meals.

It's so hard to decide where to go in Vegas because there are SO many options - but I'd say this is a nice spot for a date and a pretty good experience overall.

I can't believe this place wasn't packed out. The sushi was amazing. We got the 8 piece chefs choice and he hooked us up! Sea urchin, salmon, yellowtail, eel and more. All delicious with unique garnishments. We also got the Kobe beef potstickers which were abolsolutly divine and filled with beef, not just a little beef and a lot of fillers. And lastly don't sleep on the cold ramen appetizer because that dish was my favorite of the whole weekend in Vegas and I will go back just to eat it. Service was fantastic too. Manager came around and checked on us.

Typical high end Vegas restaurant which in no way is a bad thing. Fantastic atmosphere, very interesting decor, our waitress was very knowledgeable and attentive. Service overall very good. The food was prepared and presented extremely well. Everything we ordered we thought was excellent. We had a couple different types of spicy rolls along with some yellow tail tuna sashimi which was incredible. We also had some raw kobe beef, yakatori and some tempura seafood which was also fantastic. Even the little bowl of miso soup I had was exceptional. We sat right at the windows with an incredible view of the strip. You will pay the price for this level of quality and surroundings but as a special occasion sushi place, I would certainly go again. Was a great place for a special date night.

Pretty average sushi nothing too special. The restaurant was pretty empty on Wednesday night. We ordered multiple roles the best role what's a spicy tuna the little piece of jalapeno on top of each roll. I've had a lot better sushi at better prices but I guess this is what you can expect in Vegas. At least I can say the fish tasted fresh

Good space and atmosphere. The happy hour is an awesome deal with lots of rolls and appetizers, beer and sake on special. 

Would recommend the "hanagi" (sp) spicy tuna roll. It's deep fried rice with the spicy tuna and sauce on top. Our server told us the restaurant won an award for it. 

Only reason it's 4 out of 5 stars is they don't always read reservation notes, it was my finances birthday and they didn't acknowledge it.

Day one in Vegas and we stumbled on Sushi Roku.  We tried 4 different rolls and had the Gyoza. Everything was amazing. You will wait quite a while for service but it is so worth it. Skip the California roll.

Was recently there for a friends birthday party.  The portions were very small and expensive.  I order the grill chicken as the entre, Lets just say as an avid griller theirs was no comparison to mine, There was no taste to it had no spices or anything, they grilled aplain piece of chicken and covered it in cheap teriyaki sauce, as for the mashed potatos they were plain too, seemed to be fake potatos not real ones no flavor or spices, they also had grilled asperagus on the plate too, also plain no flavor.. To top it all off I was forced to pay 20% gratuity for avaerage service.

We went for their HH deal. It was 3 of us, we were seated right away. Only the bar/lounge area is available for happy hour. 

Their price seemed very reasonable when looking at the menu, but when we got the actual food, we were somewhat disappointed with their portion. They literally provide sample portions of their actual food at somewhat reduced price. I do not recommend any roles, as I thought they were like AYCE sushi quality. Very small 6 pieces of roles for 6-8 dollars. I don't know how much they would actually charge for the same role during non-HH price- so go ahead if you want to risk it. 

Also, their fried calamari was very oily and sweet level was to the max. Their wagyu wrapped asparagus was very good, but again, only 4 pieces of half asparagus were offeres. Their drinks are "hotel" HH price. 

The one thing that I would definitely go back for is their MUSHROOM TEMPURA!! That was the best fried shitakes ever. They were deep fried softly with an essense of truffle oil. So good that I can still smell it! 

Their service is just average, nothing stands out. I would recommend places lime sushi Ra or other local places if anyone is craving sushi for HH prices and is looking at this place.

I came here on a Saturday night with a huge group. They accommodated us very well. We had reservations at 8:30 and were seated immediately. The service was great, our server was on top of everything. The sushi was delicious and it is obviously pricey because you're paying for grade A quality fish. Appetizers were great, especially the peppers. Serving sizes were fairly small but it is expected. Definitely recommended!

Have had why better sushi at a handful of places. I guess by it being in the lobby area helps with the rating of this place. $12 for 4 slices of octopus is way over priced by about $4. The place does look nice thats for sure. Would not go back unless I'm suffering from toxic silicon sickness from all the silicon in the swimming pool upstairs

Happy UPDATE!!

So I'm happy to report, I've been back two times since this first review.
I must have been there on a bum night the first time, but overall, I like this place. 

The Miso Soup is delish, the Tofu-yaki (tofu teppan yaki) was REEEEDICK!!  I get happy thinking about it. And the edamame has pieces of salted-crack sprinkled on them, I don't know what makes theirs soo flippin' good.

But it's pricey and we left a tad hungry.

The ambiance is quite pleasant and modern, the service both times was great!!  I'll go back and I'm happy to RE-review. 

Local Discount 20% off

Meh. Overrated. Acceptable food, creative rolls and fish, excellent service but the food is, in my humble, "yet incredibly spoiled for sushi" opinion, this was just "OK". I've eaten sushi & sashimi all over the world and looked forward to trying Roku Scottsdale (we've been to another location and were underwhelmed but thought we'd try again). We were staying at the W and based on their website (silly me!) we thought we'd give it a try (from the W website: "Voted "Top 10 Asian Restaurants" by Arizona Republic, Sushi Roku, our Scottsdale restaurant, pushes the boundaries of modern Asian cuisine with a dazzling array of fresh sushi, luscious salads, thoughtful appetizers, and an extensive selection of hot entrees.:) Top 10 Asian restaurants? Pushes the boundaries??? Dazzling array???? Me thinks not so much....
The yellowtail with diced chilies (aka jalapeno slices) was the best dish we had, I would recommend that. OToro was quite good, the rest? Not memorable (I can't even recall what we had). We had ordered salted edamame as a starter, however, it came out after we finished all of our sashimi and sushi and it was burned, actually inedible. Great 1/2 price Sake deal mid week was a nice touch though. Again, the chefs and the servers were excellent, but I would recommend Kodo Sushi & Sake in No. Scottsdale WAY more.

We went here for dinner since it's located next to the W and seems to always be hidden to me. The atmosphere was amazing. Dim lighting candles lit, very upscale, modern, oriental and there's also outdoors seating. Their food was good and the service was also good. It's a really good date place and to meet people.

Food: 4/5
Service: 4/5
Cleanliness: 5/5
Decor & Style: 5/5

The food is definitely good. Nice view of the strip. You can tell it's a pricey place by the way it looks. The place is pretty dark, but that is because they want everyone to notice their huge view of the Strip.

Wasn't a fan of this restaurant. The rolls were just OK. Tuna tataki was great and suprisingly (I am a beef lover) the veggies were great (brussel sprouts, eggplant, etc.). Other than that, nothing was above average. Las Vegas has better restaurants for the same price.

Me and my company really enjoyed our dinner here. The sushi is quality, the service was great, and they willingly catered to our special needs (shellfish allergies, needed to make sure there was no cross contamination). 

We were seated at table with a wonderful view of the strip below us, all in all, very ambient, romantic atmosphere. Fair prices- some of the Japanese restaurants in Vegas can go quite high, but this was fair in terms of good quality and good prices.

Excellent Service, Delicious food and drinks. This past Thursday was the first time I had been to Sushi Roku, definitely will be back the next time we are in Scottsdale. Our bartender/waiter Alex makes incredible drinks and his customer service is terrific. He made the whole dining experience for our table of 7 ladies lots of fun!!

Sushi Roku offers high quality Japanese sushi and entrees. I was very impressed by the presentation and quality of their food. My favorite dishes were the ribeye and Brussels sprout chips. While dinner was amazing Dessert left more to be desired. They served our bread pudding cold which was a little shocking as this dish is usually served warm.

The great thing about Las Vegas is you can always find a fantastic restaurant. I've had sushi at other places in town but Sushi Roku is by far the best. We made lunch reservations for 2:30 and thank goodness day drinking had not really started because we wandered around the forum shops for 45 minutes just trying to find the 3rd floor. Ok I am a little challenged with reading maps but I'm sure it would have been way longer if I was buzzed. Finally arriving on the third floor we were seated immediately. I ordered the sake sampler...so good!!! And started with the King Crab fried rice, by far the best fried rice we have ever had in our lives. I had the nigiri lunch combo with a spicy tuna roll and my fiancée had the fried tuna rolls. Everything was just exceptional! I will definitely be back for lunch or dinner on my next Vegas trip! Sushi is after all my favorite thing to eat!!
Had my bday dinner here. I had a spicy tuna octopus roll which was SO good. I love octopus. Also, for dessert they gave me chocolate souffle with a sparkler on top. Love it

What a great dining experience before making our way to Elton John (it is a quick 5 Minute walk to the theater - ask them for the "short cut").  First off kudos to our server as well as GM Johnny who was personable and gave us local love.  Room is awesome - very cool with tall glass windows with view onto the strip.  Every item order was on point.  We were big fans of the jalapeño tuna roll and wagyu dumplings.  Look forward to returning soon!
Best sushi me and my family has ever had. Instantly seated and ate within minutes. Awesome staff.

I love coming to Vegas and trying different sushi places each time.  My roommate picked this place due to its reviews.  We were not disappointed!  Our favorite roll for the evening was the Jalapeño Tuna roll.  The server suggested the roll.  I was nervous about the Jalapeño so she had them make the roll without them.  It was such a mouthful of flavors.  The cilantro set the roll off and I never would have considered that combination but it totally worked.

As far as pricing I was not upset.  We ordered 4 drinks, 3 rolls and a side to share. When the bill came it was $130 before the tip.  Considering this was an on strip restaurant I didn't feel that was a bad price.   I'm sure you can find a cheaper place but the sushi won't be even close in comparison.

We came on a Sat night with reservations. The place was busy. Super busy. They tried to seat us on a wet booth and looked at me like I was crazy when I declined. We waited at the bar for 20 minutes for a table. 

The wait on our order for 6 rolls - was 45 minutes. Just to get one of our rolls. The drinks were served fast- I will give them that. 

We ended up leaving though we weren't full- just to head somewhere else. Food tasted fine. Nothing extraordinary. Service was good. Not her fault. Kitchen was super slow - they did take the rolls off our bill to apologize.

Maybe you will go on a less busy night.

I went to the sushi bar. The sashimi was fresh and the sushi bar chef was nice but not too helpful-- "everything is fresh." The sake list is pretty short. Overall 4 stars especially for the Japanese scallops!  The toro was buttery but expensive. I would eat here again. The service for a slow Monday night was great.

Sushi was good but not as good as Sushi Samba in Venetian mall which was cheaper.  We only ordered basic rolls: eel avocado was best tasting,  shrimp tempura was somewhat disappointing.  Big plus for waiter though, he was very friendly and patient even after it was apparent we were only order a few basic rolls and water.

Went here for the first time last night. The katana roll was FANTASTIC - my new favorite!! Perfectly made with the perfect ratio of fish and rice. We ordered the lava cake, which was really good, too, but slightly overcooked (crispy edges); the sake bombs helped us to overlook that :)

TIP: Dress to impress on weekends

My sister and brother-in-law took me here for a late dinner raving about how awesomely good this place is. And I have to say, they did not lie. The dishes here are amazing.
My sister favorite is the sea bass cooked or steamed in some way that is melts in your mouth. Not literally, but the fish meat is very tender and the sauce has a hint of sweetness. Too bad it isn't on the menu anymore as we were told.
We also several sushi rolls and those were good as well.

Service was excellent. Granted it is located in a hotel, so that is sort of expected.
The decor is trendy with a lounge like ambiance. There are actually several locations, so this is definitely a place I need to check out in L.A.

I have mixed feelings about Sushi Roku.  It's not the best, nor the worst experience I've had.  I guess if I had to sum them up in one word, it would be mediocre.

My gf and I went to Sushi Roku on our first day in Vegas.  The two of us have had omakase at some of the best restaurants NYC has to offer.  We've been to Nobu, Nakazawa, Gari, and Akio.  Seeing that Roku offered omakase made us excited as we wanted to add another feather in our cap of excellent sushi, but in truth it was a bit of a dud.

The omakase is six courses, really just three sandwiched between an appetizer and a dessert.  The appetizer was an interesting salad, the dessert was a strawberry shortcake thing that you could likely find at a local diner, and the three sushi courses were more or less forgettable.  I'd like to give you more details, but honestly that's all you need to know.  There was no ah-ha moment were I thought that they had created something special.  I can't honestly say that it was bad though and had we not previously experienced some of the most amazing sushi you could eat, we might have been more impressed.

The one highlight of Roku was the service.  We had a great sushi chef and a great server.  Our server really went the extra mile and gave us some help in finding the perfect place to watch fireworks on the 4th of July.  Additionally, the beer and spirit offerings were great.  I had a fantastic rice beer that I wish I remembered the name.

Go to Sushi Roku, just don't have the omakase.  It's not worth the price.  You'll have a good time though.

My guess it deserves a much higher star rating, except for the terrible service. That is the shame of the industry. As it has such great ambience and I can see where there be a draw but it took me a half hour to get served 10 pieces of sushi.

The waitress she was very sweet I didn't get any alcohol just got water in it was refilled wants the sushi was very good but they were small portions.

I guess since it's in a hotel this is it would be referred to as the touristy place and I don't think I would be returning to have sushi here.
Staff is snobby and unhelpful, place is nice, their sushi was gross and way overpriced for tasting so horrible will never go back

We LOVED our meal. Sat down immediately at a cozy booth, we had a wonderful and attentive waiter, CJ. We loved his recommendations and his service was impeccable! Definitely ask to be seated in his area and you will sincerely enjoy your meal. The food was scrumptious and the preparations were different than what we have had at other sushi spots across the globe. 

What we ate:
- Eggplant miso: the miso sauce is amazing and the eggplant was so fresh. 
-Albacore sashimi with fried onions: the fried onions add a nice crunch
-Tuna tartare with truffle: literally the best tartare I've ever had, melted in your mouth- and the truffle was very present 
-Beef ribeye wrapped over asparagus- the sweet sauce was finger licking good. 
- Creamy miso popcorn shrimp (replaced with seabass instead of shrimp): thankful that the kitchen was ready to accommodate, also the best creamy Miso sauce. A must order!! 
-Spicy tuna crispy rice (aka hanabi): a generous serving of the spicy tuna on top, and it was served immediately so you had a good mix of the hot rice cake with the colder tuna.
-Tuna Jalapeño roll- super fresh, served with fried onion, and so much tuna!

Finished off with two of their classic melon mix shooters. 

Overall an extremely delicious, and memorable meal. We would definitely recommend coming here and if we return to Scottsdale we would reserve here for sure.

Great ambiance.  They sat us at a two top over by the big window that overlooks the strip.... that combined with the mood lighting(dark) and music, you could really feel the energy of vegas.  The sushi was pretty good too.  Lots of fancy rolls along with the basics.  Got the seaweed salad as an app.  Good portion for 2 people.  It was different because they mixed in some baby green with the seaweed which added a different dimension to the dish.  The best thing we had was the fresh sweet shrimp(amaebi).  A little pricey but worth it.  It was served along with the deep fried heads.  Don't want to disgust anyone but if you been to new orleans, "pinch the tails, suck the heads"  Seafood perfection!

I never tried sushi until visiting here about a year ago.  I'm hooked now.

This place has a few areas to sit.  There's the sushi bar if you want to simply experiment and order as you please.  There's a more cozy seating area near the entrance.  There's also a large area near some huge windows with a great view.

The staff has always been patient and willing to help a sushi-noobie figure out what to order.  I enjoyed sitting at the bar a couple times (I visit Vegas often) and the chefs are almost like bartenders.  They have personality and will talk with seated customers.  

I've tried a number of different dishes (don't ask me to name them).  Before I took the plunge, I had steak and it was well prepared.  I haven't tried anything exotic like eel or squid and kept mainly to the safer meats like tuna and shrimp.  The food has been great.

This restaurant is usually near the top of my list to visit when I simply want to stick with what I know instead of exploring other restaurants.

I can't say it enough. I love Sushi Roku. We came back this past Friday for my girlfriend's 30th. Everyone LOVED it. The food was delicious. The service was prompt. The drinks were tasty (I couldn't resist ordering the Lychee Martini again). The ambiance was incredible. We were an hour early for our reservation and they still sat us with no issue!

Pricing is very reasonable (for dining on the Strip) and the staff was super friendly.

We had the Baked Crab Handroll (yummy), Albacore Tuna sushi (the fish melted in your mouth and the rice didn't fall apart), and the Rock Shrimp Tempura with Jalapeno roll. DIVINE. Everyone scarfed their meal down.

I can't wait to go back again.

My boyfriend and I came here for dinner the other night on our trip to Vegas. We're from Southern California so we know good sushi and while this place was absolutely gorgeous inside, I was a little disappointed. I knew it was going to be pricey, but I thought maybe the portions would be a little bigger and the sushi would be more unique. We ordered the jalapeño tuna roll and the scallop roll. The food runner accidentally brought out a roll that we didn't order but he said we could just keep it, so that was a plus! It was good, don't get me wrong, but I've definitely had very similar sushi rolls at numerous restaurants in California. Our server was very nice and our food came out quickly. I would recommend this place for sure, I guess I'm just spoiled when it comes to the sushi places by my house :)

Sushi Roku will always have a special place in the heart of my wallet. I was in vegas for a bachelor party. Initially my group of 16 was going to eat at Texas de Brazil, but after a couple days of buffets and steaks the guys in my group couldn't handle it anymore. We made last minute reservations at Sushi Roku for a party of 16 on a saturday.

I arrived a bit later but when I did some of the guys were getting hooked up big time at the bar with shots and drinks which was real cool. We were seated after taking some shots and just started ordering an assortment of sushi rolls and king crab fried rice. The king crab fried rice was simple yet so pleasing. It really hit the spot and filled us up quickly. Sushi rolls were all pretty decent. Of course we all partaked in sake bombs. 

The service was off the charts. The waitresses were so accommodating and polite. Upon getting our check they said we could take $400 dollars off. This was absolutely mind blowing. Apparently one of the guys of our party was chopping it up with the General manager unknowingly and complimented the dude on his $1600 dollar armani suit. BAM instant savings son. We all suspect he performed sexual favors to get us the discount. You do what you got to do when you are a team player I guess. I kid I kid.

Anyway the meal was decent, the service was ridiculously good, the restaurant decor was swanky and chill, and the bill for us, vegas standard wise, was an all time winner.

General Manager Johnny. Compliment the guy on his suit *cough*. The dude is an all time legendary great.

Sushi is just sushi but this place takes it to another level.  With the location, view, ambiance and of course THE MANAGER AND STAFF!! They make it worth the experience.  Highly a must do in VEGAS BABY!  Johnny and Gary Thank You! Hope to see u soon.

I have lived here for nine years and this is by far the absolute worst sushi restaurant I have ever eaten at!  Hamachi was 'fishy' and had to be sent back.  GM offered to replace the returned dish with another one and ended up charging us for both.  After we received the bill he was nowhere to be found.  Everything else was just mediocre and way overpriced!  Chilean Sea Bass was cut wrong and very tough.  

Very disappointing and will never go back nor will I ever recommend Sushi Roku to anyone!
Amazing sushi, love that place! All dishes were amazingly delicious, very friendly service and beautifully restaurant. Definitely will come back next time I'm in Vegas...

It's ok. Ate there on 7/12 with the family. Nothing really special for the price they charge you. Didn't have saba or the white tuna sashimi we wanted to order. Feels like resturaunt in a mall. Meh...I would not choose to eat there again.

So here's the skinny on Sushi Roku.  It's overpriced (welcome to Vegas!), better-than-good-but-not-great food with a very nice view of the Strip.  Did we enjoy the meal?  Yes.  Would we go back?  Probably not.

I would recommend getting a window seat, especially in the evening, when the lights are up.

Service was mixed; the greeter / host was really nice and engaged, but our waiter was somewhat absent.  It seemed he was covering a lot of the floor himself, but still.

The sushi itself was very well presented.  We got the chef's selection, which had some intriguing and tasty combinations - I'd recommend going that way.  Oh yeah - the Wagyu pot stickers are almost worth another star by themselves.

So -- not a place to avoid, or one to seek out particularly.

I came here on Wednesday night before an event and I was in a terrible hurry. The hostess was naturally a bit overwhelmed because there were so many people crowding the connecting bar and almost flooding into the restaurant. When j told her I was in a hurry she suggested I take a seat at the bar. We found a table in the bar area and were immediately greeted by Alex our server. He was absolutely wonderful and immediately took our food and drink order. He completely took care of us and we were eating in a matter of minutes. I give this place 5 stars because of Alex's 5 star treatment to us. He fulfilled our every request quickly and speedily and got us to our event on time!
Horrible. How this place has 4 stars is beyond me. A total waste of a dinner. I would never go back and I know good sushi be it masa, sushi of gari or sugarfish. Do yourself a favor and AVOID

Having been a frequent visitor to the establishments in LA when I was living down there, I have always had a soft spot for Sushi Roku.  Having been to Sushi Roku a few times in Vegas, this is my first time actually reviewing it!  My fiance and I had dinner here on a Friday night while in town, and Sushi Roku definitely did not disappoint. After getting seated at a table with a beautiful view of the strip, we decided to go with the following:

Drinks:
Me: Pear Blossom
Him: Salary Man
Share: Recommended sake from our waiter

-Tuna Carpaccio: I've said this a number of times (including in my review of Sushi Roku in Santa Monica), this is and has been one of THE best things I've had...ever.  The sesame soy dressing and garlic chips that comes with this makes it absolutely amazing.  As I've said before, if licking the plate was socially acceptable, I would do it, especially for this.  An absolute must-have item.

-Chicken Karaage: Delicious, hot, and crispy, this dish definitely did not disappoint. The delicious wasabi cream that came with this was definitely helpful for this.

-Chutoro sashimi: It's been a really long time since both of us have had quality pieces of fish, and this certainly was worth every bite.  The fish quality was so great, we decided to follow on with another few pieces of Otoro later on.  Definitely nailed both of these sashimi dishes, but the Chutoro was definitely the winner.

-A^2 Fusion Roll: One of the night's specialty rolls with albacore, avocado, and cucumber, I think?  Either way, it wasn't great, and was one of the more disappointing dishes we had that night.  Didn't stop me from eating all of it, but Greg didn't want any part of it.

-Gyoza: Delicious dumplings stuffed with Kobe beef! So amazing! I don't think I've ever had anything like this.  After the tuna carpaccio, this was Greg's second favorite dish.

-Raspberry Bread Pudding: AMAZEBALLS. The dish came with chocolate ice cream on top, and a cream, caramel, and raspberry sauce at the bottom.  With my cappuccino, this was absolutely amazing.  It was definitely a fantastic way to end our meal.

Sushi Roku was definitely everything I remembered and more!  We definitely had a great experience here, and will be coming back for that Tuna Carpaccio!

my second time at sushi roku and all of us loved it! ask for a table by the window so you can enjoy the view of the strip. the tuna tataki and black truffle hand rolls were a taste explosion in my mouth. we kept ordering more of those! to celebrate our anniversaries we ordered the tropical cheesecake which was tasty too, and enough for the four of us. I love sushi roku and definitely recommend it for a tasty meal, without breaking the bank. go for sushi happy hour (4-6 or 3/5??) to really get a good deal!!

The location of the restaurant is awesome!  The main dining area faces out onto the main LV Strip.

The service is top notch. The food taste heavenly.  The beef ribeye wrapped asparagus was awesome! You have to try it. 

My wife is GF and they have an awesome GF menu for her.  I'm not GF, but I ate the GF items and there's no complain on my behave. The beef ribeye wrapped asparagus is on the GF menu.

I would come back here again and again.
Awesome experience every time! Everyone is great and so is the food! Happy Hours always great for taking a load off. Definite place for anyone to visit and get dinner or enjoy the happiness of Hours!
Nicole saved our day after a long day she started our meal off with some quick side orders, was totally attentive and very nice, the food was great and the live octopus was great.
everything here in this place is bomb.  seriously this place is pretty damn good overall but their service wasnt the greatest cuz they were busy...
It was ok... Decent food, creative cocktails. Nice modern atmosphere. Not bad for an evening out in Scottsdale.

Well... it wasn't great. 
We went for an event at the W related to The auto auction and decided to grab a quick bite at the high top table near the entrance. We thought we were lucky... nope. 
Table wasn't cleared completely, so the hostess decided to help by picking up an almost full saucer of soy sauce and dripping it all over my lap and floor. She looked at me and just turned around and walked away. She was young, and i think embarrassed. Regardless, no apology. 
When i returned from the rest room the server, who took forever was visibly over loaded. Between the mediocre sushi and slow service it was actually a terrible experience. The one highlight was the sea bass, exceptional and almost worth the trip. 
Overall, the experience was crowded, loud and service was slow and very inexperienced (poorly trained) for such an upscale establishment.

The food was good however it was overpriced.  we got there around 8 p and got right in.  We had 4 rolls and after the tip we paid $100. We only had water to drink.  Like I said the food was good but the cost was high.

I haven't been a fan of fancy or trendy restaurants lately, so I was a bit hesitant about Sushi Roku.  Located in the W in Scottsdale, we pulled up to the valet among Maseratis and Range Rovers.  I immediately missed my t-shirt, baseball hat and sports bars!
BUT... that all changed when we sat down.  The service was amazing, we felt welcome and comfortable, and we were given all kinds of amazing suggestions for food.  The pricing was on the higher end, but fair, and the quality of fish and other items made it VERY apparent that these people REALLY care about their product.

SUSHI/RAW RECOMMENDATIONS:
Fluke Kumquat
Sakana Roll
Tuna Tartare

COOKED RECOMMENDATIONS:
Shishito Japanese Peppers
Chilean Seabass (the BEST I've ever had)
Beef Ribeye Wrapped Asparagus
Grilled Octopus

DESSERT RECOMMENDATION:
Lemon Sorbet with Raspberry Coulis (has a home-made granola and fresh raspberries...OUTSTANDING)

PROS: Tasty food, reasonable prices, lovely ambiance, excellent service
CONS: ?

We came here to celebrate my father's birthday, and the food blew us away. We got some small plates, ramen, sushi, and desserts to share, and everything was delicious! Our wait staff was also very attentive without being intrusive and made sure we had a good time. Overall, I was quite surprised by this spot, as it wasn't outrageously expensive, considering the quality and location. A definite recommend if you are on the strip and looking to break away from all the buffets and burgers.

Very nice setting, very plain sushi.

I had heard so much about this place. I gave it a shot and ordered some of their best stuff. Very very boring, very plain. The fish quality is superb, but at these prices it better be. But in terms of being creative, having a vast list of fish, etc -- not there. The jalapeno white tuna roll sounded interesting and it turned out plain awful. After the waiter saw I was not enjoying it one bit, he asked if it was ok and I said I dont like it at all and he started explaining why it is a creative fusion dish. A high class place would have taken it away and brought me a miso soup at the least to cleanse my palate. 

Poor service, nice ambiance, ridiculous prices. If that is what you like, check it out.

Sushi Roku was my favorite meal in Vegas on a long weekend trip. All the food we had was delicious - the sashimi was fresh, the rolls were innovative and the hot food was cooked and seasoned perfectly. My favorites were the yellowtail sashimi, kobe meatballs, and the rolls we ordered from the specials menu (unfortunately I can't remember what they were). While everything was great and high-quality, I would suggest ordering more of their unique dishes as those were the stand-outs. The baked cod has the standard miso coat popular at similar restaurants and the whole sea bass is reminiscent of what you can find in Chinese restaurants.

Service was excellent - our servers gave us great recommendations and were very helpful in helping us understand portions and accommodating special requests. We were celebrating a bachelorette, and they sent over complimentary desserts with a sparkler! Overall, our experience was memorable and I highly recommend  Sushi Roku for special occasions or just a nice dinner out.

This has got to be one of the absolute best Happy Hours in Vegas - certainly the best on the Vegas Strip.

We came over after riding the High Roller...  it's very conveniently located to the Linq in the Forum Shops at Caesars.  It's on the very top floor tucked away in a corner...  

HH is 4-7 on Sunday through Thursday and 4-6 on Friday and Saturday.  You can easily make a delicious meal out of their outstanding Happy Hour, which is what we did.  Skip the line and walk on into the front bar area to take advantage of the deals.  And come early - this is justifiably popular!

Cut sushi rolls are $6 (hand rolls are only $4) and I just HAD to have the shrimp tempura with asparagus - delicious.  My SO had the vegetable roll and the unusual sweet potato tempura roll, both of which she said were fabulous.  I also had the miso glazed popcorn shrimp tempura...  this is a specialty at Sushi Roku and this HH portion was large and wonderful and only $6.  The mushroom tempura with creamy truffle miso is a very similar dish, but for vegetarians.  And it is also a large portion ($5) and just as freakin fabulous as the popcorn shrimp dish.

The HH menu is just outstanding with so many reasonably priced choices in generous portions.  And a good mix of meat/seafood AND vegetarian dishes.  There are even dessert choices at HH prices.

When you throw in that champagne is $6 a glass along with all this deliciousness...  it's pretty much impossible to imagine a more perfect Happy Hour - which easily subs for a bargain dinner that will likely be one of the best meals you will have in Vegas.
Thought the place was decent. Liked the Shima roll. Everything else was good. But did not have the WOW factor working for them

Hello everybody I'm a Vegas local girl and tonight, my husband and I went to celebrate the anniversary of Sushi Roku. 
Everything went perfect, the food is always impeccable, except for one thing:  The service!
We ordered a $43 small bottle of sake.  When we're almost done drinking (but still with some sake left in the bottle), we ordered a second bottle.  When he brought the second one, he took the first bottle without pouring the rest of it.  I stopped him and nicely asked him to pour the rest of the sake before taking it, and he got upset and poured the drink fast and said:  "you drink a lot!"

First of all:  Why does he care???????
My husband and I were shocked with the comment, specially when it comes to where this guy works.
Vegas!  The sin city!!
I should have complained to the manager but I don't like to do this kind of thing.

Love the W but don't love that this is where I had to eat breakfast when i was there for my stay-cation.  Don't get me wrong, the Eggs Benny are fantastic and the sushi is too, but the pricing is eye-popping-high and the service "yokunai desu!!"  Kind of expect a jacket-required/reservation needed for their Shibuya style high prices but maybe they want to weed out the $ 30k millionaires.  Um, we're not in Tokyo anymore, Toto.  Since there are no other options when dining at the W, I will have to admit, I will probably be back, but not by choice.

Wow....where do I start. We headed to Las Vegas to celebrate my 40th birthday and because I love sushi I wanted to experience it Las Vegas style. I went onto Yelp to see what people had to say and discovered Sushi Roku. I literally read through each and every review to see what the hype was all about. Everyone kept talking about how great the wait staff was and how if its your birthday you get even "better" treatment. 
We showed up for our dinner reservations (and the host staff and wait staff was aware at this time that it was my birthday) and the two hostesses were so cold to my party. We then were seated at a window seat which was great I have to admit, the views were wonderful. 
The "waitress" finally after about 8 minutes decided to grace us with her presence and didn't introduce herself to us and blankly took our drink order. My first thought was "wow she is so not personable". It proceeded to go down from there. The food arrived so that one person was eating like 10 minutes before any of the other food arrived for the table. She never gave us the time of day but was working the other tables. Finally one of my friends asked her if she was aware it was my birthday and with a cold glare she said "yes". At that point I was ticked, you would think as a wait person (which I have done for years in my past professions) that you would try a little harder for the tip you EXPECT to receive from a group. 
Needless to say I approached the manager on the way out and told him that I felt very disappointed in my experience there and obviously they should look at their staff members. I would never go back there based on my experience. If you do try it good luck hopefully you get someone nice but dont expect anything special even on your birthday.

I've heard good things about Sushi Roku, but I also heard it was quite pricey. That kind of made me hesitant to try it out since there's so many sushi places in Old Town Scottsdale. But last weekend I had dinner there, and it's definitely worth a try. 

The atmosphere is exactly what you'd expect from a restaurant inside a W Resort in Scottsdale. It's hip and trendy. If you hate the Old Town crowd, you may want to avoid this place on a Friday/Saturday night. 

The staff is super friendly. We had to wait a few minutes for our table (even though we had a reservation), so we hit up the bar. The bartender was really good about recommending some of their specialty drinks, and explaining what was in it. When we did get to our table the waiter was really good about guiding us through their menu. 

This place serves a lot more than the standard rolls you find everywhere else. 
We had a Toro and Jalapeno roll. Excellent. Exactly what it sounds like. 
A garden roll. Really good, it had a Mizuna sauce (think spicy mustard) which really enhanced the flavor. 
And a Crunch Spicy Tuna with Avocado. I was a fan, and I'm not usually too thrilled by tempura. 

The fish was all fresh and fantastic. Prices were a little more than most places in the area, but nothing to complain about. I would recommend anyone hit this place up with a group before heading over to the bars and clubs in the area.

I've been meaning to go to Sushi Roku for a while now and finally got the chance.

For starters, I'm less about the sushi and more about the fish. Don't get me wrong, I love a good rainbow roll but sashimi is the main event.

I had the chef's sashimi sampler and I have never had fresher fish in Phoenix. The blue fin had a perfectly delicate flavor while melting in my mouth. I'm usually not a huge fan of uni, but it was so fresh, I had to finish every last bite. The blue fin special with truffles (definitely not to be confused with a blue light special, mostly because of the truffles) was the perfect starter.

I was planning on going for a drink and a couple of small appetizers and ended up eating a full meal (I am powerless against the rainbow roll, especially after a few drinks of saki).

The place looks great. It is clean and well designed. The staff was also excellent with just the right amount of attention without being bothersome.

Overall, it was a great dining experience.

It's one of the best sushi places in Vegas. The dining experience was simply superb. Their manager Johnny provided omakase dinner complete with multiple courses of nigiri, crispy brussel sprouts(a must have),  Waygu beef on hot stones and many more.  Prices are reasonable as compared to other upscale venues on the strip.
Geat happy hour spot! $6 cut rolls $4 hand rolls and $4 donut holes filled with chocolate served with vanilla and carmel dipping sauces! Great atmosphere and nice view if you get a good seat

text.text:
Came to Sushi Roku with a bunch of friends and was able to secure the private room for a private dinning event. Located on the 3rd floor of the Forum Mall, Sushi Roku is probably one of the best Japanese restaurants that I've been too offering a beautiful view of the strip. 

We got here and the room was all set for the 20 of us that would be dinning that night. As I mentioned before the private dinning has a great view of the strip. The atmosphere here is definitely hip with low lighting. You have the high end modern Japanese with lots of dark wood used throughout with hints of red and stone accent pieces. We had a prefix meal sampling meal served family style so all we had to do was sit down, drink several rounds of Saki bombs, and let the food come to us. 

First up was the edamae. Fresh with a touch of sea salt was just the right way to start off a night of eating and doing Saki bombs. Next up was a Chinese chicken salad. Good, nice fresh mixed green lettuce with a dressing with a nice blend of balsamic and sesame to it. The shredded chicken was also very good. Chicken skewers were next up on the menu, again, very good. Chicken was done perfectly and the sauce that I had was a sweet sauce with a little bit of heat at the end. After the chicken out came the rolls, there was a traditional California Roll, (good but not mind blowing), the Spicy Tuna (though small, everything here tasted really fresh and with perfectly cooked sushi rice and a nice amount of heat, really really good) and probably the one item that everyone raved about was the fresh Soft Shell crab roll. While simple, it was just very fresh and outstanding. This alone I would come back for again. We got two desserts for the nice a chocolate lava cake with a vanilla cream sauce (second best I've had with the best being at Roy's in Maui) and Ice Cream Mochi which was pretty good. 

The service here was excellent. Very professional and friendly especially considering how rowdy this group can get. Overall all the food and Saki cost around $80 a head which seemed reasonable for the amount of food and drinks we got that night. No one in our group of 20 left hungry and there was plenty of food left over. I have to say, this is one of the best Japanese restaurants that I've been to and will give Sushi Roki a rare 5 star rating!

Our waiter was awful. He was absent for pretty much the entire meal. It seems like the flavor of choice here was Wasabi. There was so much Wasabi in some of the Sushi that my throat was on fire. I like to be able to taste all aspects of my food not just one particular spice or seasoning. On the bright side the view if you have a table by the window is really something else

Here's a perfect example why I am hesitant about fine dining sometimes. You get great service, pretty looking food but it doesn't even taste good. So what are you coming for? The food itself or the service and food presentation? 

If I had to describe the food here in one word, BLAND!
A few more words, EXPENSIVE FOOD COURT FOOD.

And the walk here is such a PAIN IN THE @$$ from the front entrance of Caesars.

Ok, the place is very nice. The service is excellent. Food presentation is wonderful but that does not mean it tastes good.

The Calamari was way overcooked. I sent it back and the chef said that's how it is. It's supposed to be dry and rubbery? I should take the cook over to Cheesecake Factory and let him try to Calamari there. I couldn't even chew it. Spat it out and they were willing to take it off our tab. Thumbs up!

Prime rib was so so. I wanted to ask for some A1 sauce so you know the marinade wasn't flavorful enough.

Crunchy spicy tuna roll and lobster specialty rolls were absolutely bland. No one at my table tasted a single thing. Of course, there was no way they could mess up a regular tuna roll so that was fine.

Sea bass was probably the best dish and when I say the best, I'm being generous. It was still so so.

$6 extra for miso soup and rice to add to your entree? Ehh...

$160 including tip for 4 people. Never again. Social House @ TI is a bit more expensive but at least the food tastes MUCH better.

Awesome sushi!! The restaurant has couches at some of their tables which I thought was cozy. They have a separate gluten free menu and Tamari. The waitress we had was so wonderful, kind and attentive. They had a special king crab fried rice and they were able to modify it gluten free for me. I tried the baked lobster roll, which I didn't care much for, but the hand king crab rolls were delicious! My husband loved the shrimp tempura with jalapeños, something a little different. This place will definitely be added to our list for our next trip back!

We were looking for a good sushi happy hour in Phoenix and decided to try Sushi Roku - it did not disappoint!  Walked into the restaurant at 7:30 and it was busy, but not crowded.  Patrons ranged from a group of business associates to an 18th birthday party.  

To partake in the specials, we sat in the bar area.  Our server was extremely pleasant and attentive throughout the evening.  We started with the Sushi Roku vodka drink special, a Kirin and a cold sake.  ($3 for sake and $4 for the vodka)  Sake was unfiltered and slightly sweet - we really enjoyed it.  Could have done without the vodka drink, which was way too sweet and seemed nearly non-alcoholic.  Moving onto the food... we ordered the miso eggplant, which for $3 was delicious and a steal.  Also tried the spicy yellowtail roll (average), tuna tartare (slightly below average - was practically minced and not well seasoned) and the Kobe meatballs (great).

Walked out with around a $40 tab and very pleased with the experience.  We'll definitely be back, as there were plenty of other specials on the menu which we didn't get to try.

I ate here a few days ago and I need to admit, the food was great.  It was a friend's birthday so I expected to blow it out. I regularly eat at higher end restaurants so I expected it would be somewhat expensive since its in the W hotel.  To start I must say, the food was all delicious although the portions seemed smaller than typical for sushi restaurants.  We were suggested by our waitress that" usually" she picks the menu based on a few questions she had for us. Of course you know in that situation it's going to be more expensive.  We ate had sake and beer and it was great, until we all said we were done. Our waitress dropped off another dish and said she had already put the order in before we told her we were full.  Of course we said it was fine.  Then 10 minutes later another dish shows up.  At that point we objected sending it back.
I think we were all surprised when our bill was just under $800 for the 5 of us.
Maybe I'm just out of touch with high priced places but that's just too much for what we had.  Of course we paid and took care of our waitress but I don't see a return trip anytime soon.  I think I'll just go to the French Laundry in Yountville, CA next time.

Im not a fan of sushi, but this turned my experience around!! 
I went to this place with my fiance, dad and 2 friends and they all had a great time.

We got the best table in the place and surely it got one of the best views on the strip! The server was great all thru the night and we got 2 free cocktail samples each, and gave us a very good recommendation of sake.

Later we had the pleasure meeting the owner, who was very friendly.

We never got to the dessert because the sushi rolls was really toooo goood!

I will come back thats for sure!

Awesome Japanese cuisine. Thanks to Keiko for the great hospitality. And thanks to Lewis for excellent service. I loved the tuna tartar, lobster tempura and mochi ice cream. Great view of the Las Vegas Strip.

First time here, food was amazing with the quality (fresh toro) and sashimi. Great service and amazing atmosphere. The manager Gary was very nice greeting the tables and making sure everyone is taken care of. My new favorite Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas!!!!
Amazing  Kobe beef accompanied with very good sashimi, and great house drinks = good dining

The ambience is a feast for the eyes and for the touch, this much is true, but one is paying a very high price for this exclusivity.  While I liked waiting in the lobby- couldn't sit at the sushi counter until it was open for dinner service at 5:30p- I did notice that for a venue that strives to project a life of luxury, housekeeping hadn't come by to clean food debris off of the coffee table (closest to the sushi restaurant's host desk).  Not even when a rep came by to alert me to a bar menu sitting on the table and asked me if I had wanted anything from the bar- she had to have noticed the mess?!
I ordered a $9.50 spider roll (soft-shelled crab), a $10 veggie tempura app, and a $19 baked lobster roll, all priced at 50% for one week during their 1-year anniversary.  They're all good, and factoring in the ostentatious surroundings, I'd pay $9.50 for the soft-shelled crab roll, but I'd put my foot down on the other two.  50% maybe, but $19 for a five-piece lobster roll?  Yes, it was very tasty, and yes, the cream sauce was orgasmic, but for $19, I expect moments from the restaurant scenes of "The Ugly Truth" or "When Harry Met Sally," take your pick.
If you've money to burn or have someone else paying for the bill, then this is your sushi stop near Old Town Scottsdale.

We ate at Sushi Roku at an off-time around 2 pm, and the restaurant was not very crowded.  Much of the seating in Sushi Roku offers excellent Strip views which is a definite plus.  We were originally going to be sat at a booth/table close to another couple, but asked to be sat at a separate table for a bit more privacy.  The hostess got very huffy and irritated when we made this request, so our dining experience did not begin well.
  
The server was efficient, but not overly-friendly.  We ordered edamame, miso soup, and several sushi rolls (Katana, spicy tuna, California, and toro & jalapeño).  The food was good, but overpriced, and the quality/taste wasn't heads and tails above more economical sushi restaurants.  Of course, you're on the Strip, not to mention paying for a Strip view, so the high price is to be expected.  All in all, if you're looking for a sushi restaurant with a Strip view, Sushi Roku is not a bad bet.  For me, however, there are several other "Strip view" restaurants that I prefer over Sushi Roku, so I can't say I'll be eating here often.

Dined here for my boyfriends birthday on vacation in Vegas. I chose this restaurant based on the price vs. reviews and we were NOT disappointed! Both of us eat sushi regularly, and tend to be a bit picky, but Sushi Roku delivered. After finally locating the restaurant (we got lost in the HUGE Ceasars hotel), we were greeted by the super cute and friendly door girls. I was pleased that we had a table with a great view of the strip. Our server was helpful in recommending drinks, and we both started off with an order of Miso Soup and Vegetable Tempura. The soup was the perfect amount and so flavorful, the Tempura hot, fresh, and delicious. For sushi, we decided on the Yellowtail, Salmon, Crunchy Spicy Tuna, and Tuna. Everything was spectacular! The yellowtail was fresh and melt-in-your-mouth delicious. I wasn't a HUGE fan of the Crunchy Tuna, only because I don't really like 'hot' rolls, but it was still yummy and hit the spot. For dessert we had the Creme Brulee Trio, which topped off the meal perfectly. I would definitely return, the service was great and for the price (especially in Vegas), you cant go wrong!
Sushi was good, our waiter CJ deserved 5 stars - he was knowledgeable and very friendly

This place was absolutely delicious. I got sick in Vegas. The worst place to be sick, by myself on a work trip. So I came here for dinner (mainly out of convenience) because it was on the way to the Bellagio where I was going to see Cirque du Soleil (O). 

HH is pretty damn good here. So many options, which were reasonably priced. Hot sake for $3?!??!?! WITH 3-4ish shots?! The hanabi. OMGGGG out of this WORLD. Spicy tuna on top of crispy rice. Just do yourself a favor and get this. 

I sat at the bar, and both bartenders were extraordinary. Seriously, an uplifting meal for me. I went hard. I ordered rolls, hanabi, wagyu skewer (SO TENDER AND MELTS IN YOUR MOUTH), some mushroom tempura? and a chocolate lava cake. You can get so many different little bites and flavors. All of them were awesome. I would say the wagyu & hanabi were my favorite things. 

I wish this place was right next to work. You'd see me here practically everyday.
The food is really good it is nice and upscale. My group tried it on "National Sushi Day" so the whole menu was half off which was a great deal!

So I usually try not to eat sushi in cities so far from the coast. But we came here for my bachelorette party because one of my friends has celiacs and can't eat gluten anything. So Japanese tends to be safest for her.

The sushi wasn't bad.. I didn't get sick so thats a plus! I did venture into some raw fish and it was okay. Not fresh like what you get in SF.. but okay. But really.. for the price, I'd never go back.. its super expensive for what you get. And my teeny bottle of sake was double what it would have been at a restaurant in SF (and triple just buying it at a store).

The staff was nice, everything looked pretty. But two stars because I have experienced better.. a lot and I will probably never go back.
Expensive and yet the food is marginally above average.  The waitress is hot and the fellas are handsome!!  All around a nice place but dam, don't try so hard.

Went here for dinner last night during Happy Hour but decided to sit at the Sushi Bar instead due to personal preference; Happy Hour is only available in the Bar area. Located inside of the W Hotel, the interior of the restaurant is beautiful with an expansive circular Sushi Bar at the far end of the restaurant.

The service by both our waiter and the gentleman behind the sushi bar was excellent. They were very helpful with navigating the menu and making suggestions. 

For dinner we had a few cut and hand rolls of differing varieties. The sushi was fresh and delicious. Benefit of ordering from the sushi bar is that you are able to customize and even ask for certain things off the menu.

The price does slightly leave a little more to be desired as this place truly is in the $$$ category which is why we can only give it a 4 star review. Overall it was a great meal and we plan on going back soon.

Some of the best sushi I've ever had! The lobster rice was to die for! The decor was slightly dark but out really worked for the romantic dinner my husband and I were looking for.  I wad super happy to find a good sushi place in Vegas that wasn't too outrageous on the price side

We came here during anniversary week which meant our food was half off! What a great special and they were slammed. We will definitely go back even with out a special going on.

We started off with the sashimi which was yellow tail with a spicy sauce and fresh cut cucumber and jalapenos on top. YUM this was probably our favorite out of everything. The we got a couple of rolls  - soft shell crab and a crispy spicy tuna. The soft shell crab was huge and delicious. Great fresh flavor. The spicy tuna though is part of the reason for a star deduction. I was under the impression it would be, well... spicy and, well... crunchy. It was neither. The flavor of the fish was good and the sushi itself but the batter wasn't cooked until it was crispy so it took a lot of the flavor away instead of enhancing it. 

We finished the night off with tempura popcorn shrimp which was very close behind the sashimi. These things are so delicious and popable and its a huge portion that could have easily been shared between 4 people instead of two. It comes with shaved asparagus and mushrooms and the sauce is just creamy and delicious.

Our server Kristen was amazing. She was just so cute and patient with the two tables next to us (one was really annoying and demanding and outright rude and the other just needed a lot of attention). 

The other reason for my star deduction is that when a new guest comes in and is seated, the hostess yells out something that sounds like "airhsay" (totally butchered that but I dont know how to spell it) and the sushi chefs and staff yell it back. After hearing it about 50 times during our meal and having it interrupt our conversation, you just get mad about it. Please take note staff of the restaurant...its not you guys its the yelling during the meal! Its really, really annoying.

Anyway, I was very happy with everything in the end and would definitely go back there for sushi (I have been really picky about where I eat sushi out here).

I went here for the first time the other week. The food was a little pricy but well worth it. Our server Giovanni was more then helpful to recommend us with some new rolls (new Favorites) that I have never tried before. This place is a must for any sushi lover. Also thx to Giovanni for turning me on to their amazing smoked old fashion cocktail.
Fantastic!!!! From the food to the service, all was absolutely wonderful. The view from the diningroom is a real treat. The tuna tartare was delicious!!!!!

Delicious food with a great little view of the strip.

A co worker and I came here while journeying on a business trip. We were hungry and this menu looked good. The place was fairly empty and peaceful on Wednesday at about 1:30 pm. The view is small, but you see the Imperial Palace and a bit of the strip. The interior is beautiful and incredibly comfortable, I really loved it.

Our waiter was kind and courteous and service was great. Our warm sake was delicious and my mixed tempura donburi bowl had delicious shrimp and impeccably cooked rice in it. I was filled and happy by the time I left and I wish I could go back daily and that it was closer to me!

I've had plenty of sushi from various places but this restaurant blew my mind. We had three rolls, all recommended by our waiter, and all three were absolutely amazing. Their tuna jalapeño roll (modified without the jalapeño) was my favorite. The citrus olive oil in the roll complimented the tuna and avocado really well. Their tuna melted in your mouth like butter and the soft shell crab roll was amazing. I've never had crab in sushi before but I gotta say, this exceeded my expectations. The pineapple fusion was also delicious. The vanilla bean in the drink was a nice touch and the drink went well with our rolls. 

The atmosphere is nice and we were seated right away. I definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for something good to eat on the strip.

Was very happy with my sushi - great fish quality. And fun/different rolls. The waiter suggested some of the daily fresh nigiri specials and they were delicious as well.  I think the hamachi was some of the freshest tasting fish I've ever had - I could have eaten it until I exploded!  And not going to lie...was not so sure about ordering sushi in the desert :) 

Their bottles of bubbly were decently priced and they had a good selection. I LOVE the sushi and champagne combo :) 

The waiter was very attentive without being bothersome, even after it started getting more and more crowded. It did get pretty loud toward the end of our meal but it's in the W so not surprising. 

I would definitely return.

In my opinion this place was average. The rolls we ordered were decent. The view was incredible. I was expecting a place with large roll selection but they only had about 8 rolls to choose from. It would be great for someone would wasn't looking for rolls.

Atmosphere was great.  Made a reservation and was sat immediately.  I ordered the garlic edamame, which was amazing! Also ordered the baked lobster roll...excellent.  Overall great experience, drinks came out quick, and staff at the front desk were extremely friendly.  Only thing is our waitress could have been a bit warmer....seemed like she had a lot going on personally and didn't smile nor was she friendly enough.

This is a nice sushi spot right inside the forum shops at Caesar's palace. We came in for happy hour and I got a nice sampling of items, including some sashimi for a grand total of $23. Food is so pricey here it was great to come across a nice dining option, outside fast food, at this price point. Their happy hour menu is limited but they still have a nice variety of rolls, sashimi, hot appetizers and salad. Service was excellent. Las Vegas must have sent a memo to all the restaurant service workers because everywhere we have gone has the nicest people.
The sushi had a fishy smell, so we didn't feel comfortable eating it. The spicy tuna roll appears to have canned tuna instead of fresh. Over priced and underwhelming. Do not recommend!

The service is friendly and pretty efficient.  We arrived Friday night with a party of 8 and they got all our orders correct.  The tempura took longer than our rolls.  Waitress explained that tempura does take longer.

Each one of our dishes was artfully presented and delicious - I tried almost each dish at our table.  The kale salad is a must - the mushrooms and tangy dressing add texture and great flavor.  

We had reservations but I don't think they're necessary unless visiting during peak Vegas visiting periods.

Very nice sushi place. 
The service is great, the sushi is fresh but some of them were not fully closed, And were opened while holding a piece of cut sushi with the chopsticks. 
Great view and location.

Edamame with truffle salt was great; really livened up what can be a bland experience.

the sushi was good, but very overpriced; not too much for $25 roll.

Went here after supper at the Italian place in fashion square wasn't as fulfilling as we had hoped.

First time eating toro and damn, it was worth every penny! We ended up getting a couple orders along with some spicy tuna roll (which was great) and some other sashimi which I failed to find out what it was but still tasty nonetheless. Along with a couple of the large Kirin beers, it was a treat to eat here. Loved it.

Most of the stars that Sushi Roku receives are for its amazing view of the Las Vegas Strip. No doubt about it, my sights were pleased with my experience, beautiful view, beautiful people, beautiful Vegas....

Sushi Roku is like Ra sushi disguised as a Nobu. Adequately fresh fish with subpar textures and preparations for stellar prices. Granted, the miso glazed popcorn shrimp and black pepper kobe beef skewer are standalone wonders, they would be better off in a restaurant that doesn't call itself SUSHI Roku. I guess I should have known something was amiss when the non-sushi appetizers were so astounding. Sushi Roku did rebound well, though, with its fantastic chocolate cake, which was discussed at the table as possibly the best chocolate cake ever tasted, or maybe it was the vanilla bean cream, or maybe..it was because we munched on the decadent dream while peering at the most decadent town in the western United States.
Try the talons roll GREAT! Good service with a manager that cares.

Like everything in Las Vegas, this place is overpriced for what it is.

However, the few sushi rolls that were under $20 a roll were good, but not the best I've ever had. But I guess that's what you get for ordering raw fish in the middle of the desert.

As impossible as it was to find this place, it was worth the run through Cesar's to make our reservation. The place was very clean, the staff was incredibly friendly, and the service was pristine. We had a group of nine on a Saturday night, and they didn't miss a beat. 

Everyone ordered something different and we did a lot sharing, so I think I had a taste of 10+ rolls! I absolutely loved the crab roll, and the edamame and hummus appetizers were outstanding as well. What is that bread they use with the hummus?! It's other worldly, and I must have more. I would definitely recommend!

Get the omakase.  I regretted not getting this.  3 people around me ordered it.  Looked so delicious.  Tofu 3-way was so yummy.  2 piece toro was $26!  But it melted in my mouth.  Sit by the sushi bar and get the omakase.  You'll leave happy.

Came to Vegas on vacation with my cousin, aunt, and mom. Walked in and got excellent service, our waiter Frank was very attentive and friendly and was accomodating to our jokes and such. On top of that Pablo, super cute waiter as well, forever refilling my water. Needless to say that was the fastest I've ever fallen in love. Great service, amazing food. !!!

Excellent!! Simply superb sushi restaurant!! I have been here numerous times and have never been disappointed. Elegant ambiance with an incredible view of the Las Vegas Strip. The food is always fresh and the service is top notch. Good happy hour, friendly staff and great bar tenders who know how to mix a great drink!! General Manager, Johnny Seo is magnificent and knows how to cater to his clientele to keep them coming back again and again!!
Fine establishment! The food was delicious and prepared perfectly. We had various sushi plates, amazing rib eye, perfectly cooked fried rice, finished with mochi ice cream and donut holes.

Quite disappointed with this place on NYE. The portions were soooo tiny, MY GOSH for $145, I'd expected more. The girl on the phone said 7 course, when we got there it's only 6 course. Not only that but seriously, everything is tiny! I been to Japan and even their portions were bigger. 

The sushi did not seem fresh at all. The color was quite dull. The tofu lobster thing was alright, and the dessert-- I definitely had better.

The worst part was the fact they kept forgetting about our order and wanted to rush us to finish. The couple next to us was even asked by the Manager to leave and move to the bar if they wanted to stay. 

I didn't even get my champagne toast because it took them so long, so I left. The view and the seating was disappointing, despite the fact I have already requested a good window seating.

The cocktail was good, ginger lychee mojito, but gah...I'm quite disappointed and would not come back. Maybe if I was coming back for the Anago since it's the only place I've seen so far that serves it. I should of ordered off the regular menu, but the girl mentioned the pre fixe was better..yea..right..

First thing: 20% off entire check for LOCALS!
Second: birthday dessertS (yes that is plural) are complementary!

So we had a pretty good waiter, we got the strip view table, and waters were regularly refilled.  Everyone at the table (party of 6) had very different meals - some had the special sushi assortment, one got the seabass (supposedly the best ever), one had tempura, my bf had salmon and scallop entree (he thought the salmon was dry), and I had the complicated order.

My boyfriend and I split the crudo roku appetizer (all 6 sashimi specials in mini format): halibut with chili paste, yellowtail with diced chile, tuna carpaccio with ponzu, albacore with crispy onions, salmon with fresh greens and truffle, and octopus with salsa.  Yum little flavor fest.

The menu had daily specials which had Japanese and Spanish mackerel, and the regular sushi menu had regular and Spanish mackerel.  They were out of all of it (the waiter said new owners are too lazy to swap out daily menus.  He also said previous owners made poor cocktails...thanks for the commentary) - instead I got whole scallop sushi (Hotate), softshell crab roll (very nice, not too fried, lots of yummy sprouts), a yellowtail scallion handroll (good quality fish, but not fresh nori), and miso eggplant appetizer (good sauce, yummy, hot).

Also, I had the ginger yuzu martini - very refreshing with the meal...yuzu juice, ginger vodka, and ginger-vanilla something.

Overall, it was very pricey but tasty and delicious.  For our birthday girl in the party, they brought out TWO desserts ON THE HOUSE: wonton wrapped ice cream with tropical fruits, and chocolate lava cake with ice cream and berries.  Those were polished off fast.  Then I told our waiter that my bf and I were locals and he gave us 20% off the entire 6-person check (we saved $60).

Don't think I would rush back because of sheer cost, but I would recommend the experience.

OMG!!!! Why haven't we dined here before?!!!

Came in a 1/2 hour before closing on a Saturday night. Too bad they don't have late hours---This is Vegas!!  Although empty, the hostess sat us right away at a crappy spot. I kindly asked to be  moved & she had an attitude.

Besides that, our gorgeous server was great! We ordered the Cruncy Spicy Tuna Tempura Roll w/Avocado and a Baked Crab Hand Roll (soy paper)--Both excellent!!! Sadly, the Edamame was on the bland side.

Located on 3rd Level of the Forum Shops at Cesars Palace--fair pricing, great view of the Strip, hip music & romantic. We can't wait to go back!!! And they have locations in Pasadena & Santa Monica, Yasssssss!
Service was very slow. Food delivery was inconsistent. Not worth the price we paid. Won't go back.

Dined here on a Mon night with an 8pm reservation. Sushi Roku wasn't overly crowded so we probably didn't need a reservation, but always safe to make one just in case! 

Split two apps (between 2 ppl) - the asparagus wrapped beef which comes on a hot sizzling stone and the tofu 3 ways. I do not like tofu, but this tofu was out of this world. We then split salmon sashimi, the katana roll, and an eel cucumber roll. The katana roll was SO good, but pricy. We each got dessert too - mochi (3 ways) and the smore's. Definitely enjoyed sushi roku but felt that it was overpriced.

food: got the worst food poisoning after eating at sushi roku in vegas.  worst.

service: bad

final thoughts: awful

Great service and great food.

I was in a party of 6 and we were very taken care of. The server was super nice and made the best suggestions. All the staff was fast and efficient, being able to clear plates as soon as they were empty. Refills were promptly taken care of too.

Food we had:
- 16 piece sashimi of various fish, some were first time tries for me!
- Brussel sprouts. They were super savory with bacon pieces, yum!
- shishito peppers, delicious with a little kick at the end
- tuna carpaccio was flavorful
- yellow tail sashimi with diced chilled, super tasty with the sauces! Reminded me of carpaccio 
- king crab handrolls were exceptionally good. I loved the butter dipping sauce on it. They bring out kind of last to coat your palate better. 
- beef wrapped asparagus was really good with the teriyaki sauce and cool hot stone on the bottom
- we had the flute sashimi special that came over ice. The dipping sauce had a little bit of a kick but it went really well with the cold fish. It was hard to take off of the lead though :(

Dessert:
- we got the platter to share that came with the lava cake, creme brûlée and a banana egg roll. The creme brûlée was really tasty and not too sweet. The others were okay. I wish the lava cake cake with ice cream though to balance the chocolate in the middle.
- we also got mochi. You pick 3 flavors and the ones we got were red bean, green tea and passion fruit. These were tasty but melt really fast! They cut each one in half too so it's easy to share.

Wine on Sunday as well as sake were all half off if under $130 so we got red wine and tried a sparkling sake called Pouchi Pouchi. It's a bit dryer with a hint of sweetness. 

Bathroom - my coworkers told me the men's restroom has a picture of a lady looking at your package in there.. Seems interesting! :)

Loved the atmosphere - two separate areas that are both trendy. We sat in the area with the sushi bar which was more romantic. The service was great - we didn't have to ask for someone at all (granted it wasn't a busy night). 

Our favorite things were the blue fin sashimi and the knife jaw snapper sashimi. We also ordered another red snapper sashimi, yellowtail diced chilies, yellowtail roll, tako rolls, spicy octopus roll, Katana roll, and Makato roll.

We ordered the Passion fruit and spice and honeydew drink which were both refreshing. Overall a great experience, fresh fish and good service.

The food was delicious, but the service, while enthusiastic, was slow.  We had the tofu appetizer, which was very fresh and flavorful.  I especially liked the tofu with the truffle.  We decided to get entrees rather than sushi for our meals, so I can't say anything really for the sushi despite it being part of the restaurant's name.  The entrees had a very generous amount of food on them, and were pretty tasty.  

Part of the price tag on your menu is reflected in the atmosphere, and while the meal I had was good, I probably could get something with similar quality for cheaper at a different Japanese fusion type restaurant.

Fantastic restaurant, though a little overly expensive for what you get. They have an excellent selection of different sushi rolls, both classic and some very interesting ones. The appetizers were all excellent and i could have easily used the entire meal just sampling through the appetizers menu. The lamb was particularly good. The cocktail menu is also fantastic and they do some pretty awesome and original drinks. Definitely worth trying a couple different ones. I always like to see restaurants with a mezcal cocktail. Overall, there is better sushi out there but Sushi Roku offers an interesting experience with some extras on the menu to make up for it. Just be prepared to spend a good bit, and don't come here if you're extremely hungry or your wallet will hurt!

This was my second time at Sushi Roku, and I must say I came back for not only the amazing sushi and sashimi selection, but for the service as well. I'm leaving this review because the manager, Mr. Mike Kirsch, gave me and my friends amazing service. Simply top notch. I had friends from out of town that were visiting and they thought I was a VIP of some sort because of the attentive service I was receiving. Everything on my order was correct, and compliments to the chef as well (I believe it was Joey). 

The popcorn shrimp was simply amazing. The timing of our different orders getting to the table was perfect! I would recommend Sushi Roku in Scottsdale to anyone and will be taking all of my visitors from out of town here so they can receive the same level of service I received from other members of the Sushi Roku team, including Mr. Kirsch (I hope I spelled that right haha).

The view is amazing, and that's where it ends. 
The selection of sushi really disappointed my girlfriend and I, so we decided to try two of the signature rolls and one old favorite. All of it was bland, over-priced, and just really not worth the time and effort to go there. 
The only other upside besides the view was the house Sake was pretty decent. Other than that, spend your money elsewhere.

Went in tonight with my boyfriend for our anniversary and it was perfect!! LOVED our server/bartender.. I forgot her name but she's the adorable blonde bartender that works all the time.. Shoutout to her for making our night so special! Food was amazing as always. The general manager, Steve, bought our dessert. Thanks for everything!!!!! Definitely worth 5 stars :)

Another overpriced sushi joint in vegas where you pay for ambience, this time in Caesar's.  I ordered one of their lunch specials, for $18 I got 7 sushi pieces and spicy tuna roll.  It was lunchtime so hardly anyone was in there, I can see this place banging at 10pm on a Saturday night.  Ambience is pretty and loungelike, paying for ambience here kids.  Sushi is fresh and made right.

This restaurant provides a great view of the strip. The atmosphere is hip and modern. The fish is fresh and very tasty. Most of their dishes are unique and very appealing. You can tell they put a lot of effort into small details. The sushi is very good. You can taste the quality and freshness of the food. They recommend to not use soy sauce as every sushi piece has it's own flavors. 
The service is unfortunately slow. Just to give you an idea our appetizer were delivered before our drinks! We had to wait about 15-20 to get our drink. Overall a good place to get good sushi, just be prepared for a larger bill as you need to get several dishes to get full!

I am iffy about anything Ryan Seacrest related...  However Sushi Roku (Seacrest is part owner) was surprising good.
