Sushi Roku is a "High-End Sushi" Joint, but with good quality sushi.  Which hardly is the case at a lot of other High-End Sushi places.  The sushi was fresh, portions were fair sized, appetizers were delish, and service was excellent.  

I recommend the Toro & Jalapeno Handroll.  It tastes like butter. MMMMMM.

Very pricey, don't come here after a losing streak.

-1 star for price.

Seacrest Out!

The sushi was OK, but I would spend my sushi budget on another of the many places in the valley where you can get very good sushi for a reasonable price.  My wife and I went for lunch on a Monday - the place was almost empty at 12:30.  The first demerit was the fact that they had the AC turned down to 60 degrees.  Ironically, the doors were opened wide to the patio as if they were trying to cool the desert  - the electric company must love them.   We decided to stay warm and sit outside on the patio which fronts Camelback Rd  - pretty busy and loud with road noice (second demerit).  A salad, a roll, four sushi (8 pieces) and water to drink plus tip was almost $70... quite a bit more than your average lunch.  I would not have minded if the sushi was outstanding, but it wasn't.  Although the quality seemed to be very good, as you would expect, but the sushi themselves were very moderately sized.

I had dinner here on a Saturday night with a group of friends during a bachelorette weekend. The restaurant had a nice, dark ambiance. I'm usually not a fan of sushi, but my opinion has changed since dining here. We ordered the Edamame Hummus with Vegetable chips to as an appetizer. The chips were so crispy and fresh tasting. We ordered the seaweed salad, a tofu dish, spicy peppers, tempura, two vegetarian harvest sushi rolls, two sweet potato rolls, and two cucumber, avocado, and jalapeno rolls. Every single dish was fresh, tasty and filling. The portion sizes were decent enough to share. The service was excellent.  We were in a rush to finish dinner and our waiter did a great job of getting our food and drinks to us.

I came here for a friend's birthday dinner. The best part about my experience here was the service. Our waitress was super sweet and awesome. She was helpful, made great recommendations, and even went over and beyond by asking her manager to print out some tickets we needed printed. She definitely went the extra mile. All of the staff was super sweet. The food was tasty (even with me not being a sushi person)! I got the crunchy spicy tuna roll and a side of the cauliflower. My only hang up is that it's super pricey. The cauliflower I ordered was $12. It was delicious, but it was the smallest portion. I expected a heftier portion for $12. The ambiance is nice with nice big windows for a good view of the strip! I tend to prefer more budget friendly places, so I would be interested to try their happy hour - which looked a little more budget friendly for someone like me!

My husband and I shared a late lunch at Sushi Roku because we were SO famished after shopping the forum shops. It was pretty pricey (though, what ISN'T in Vegas?), but the roll we split (the Shima roll) was great! Quite spicy, but in a really good way. The tempura was good, crispier than tempura usually is. That made me happy. :) The view of the strip is wonderful from here, I can imagine it'd be gorgeous at night. We may visit Sushi Roku on another trip to Vegas. I'd recommend it!

I had the truffle edamame and they were delish. The truffle tempura roll wasn't as truffley as I'd like. The salmon truffle carpaccio was good but not very truffley either. And the lobster roll was really meaty!

We ate at several sushi places while in Vegas, this one was the very best. Great ambiance, great server, fresh sushi. Crunchy tuna sushi was amazing. California roll with real crab and a special tuna roll with cilantro was awesome! I would go back to Vegas just to eat here

No reservation and still got a table....I say that is why I gave 3 stars and it would have been 4 stars had the host not tried to pawn us off to eat dinner at the cocktail area lounge. We strongly said a big NO and that we wanted an actual table. We did get a table and then proceeded to do the famous Saki bombs I love so much and have become accustom to doing at this place it seems on every visit. We even got the east coast ladies across from us doing them too. Sushi was excellent . The lobster special rolls though $21 were delish and worth the splurge plus the lava chocolate souffle desert was heaven. Pricey food but hey I figure its Vegas so I deal with it. I know I will be back on my next visit for sure.

Sushi Roku is pricey and I'll lead with that because it's probably the worst thing about the restaurant. Once you get over the price the experience goes up from here, I love how trendy this place is, and they have a fantastic selection for sushi as well as wine. The staff are pretty friendly, although the one staff member I dealt with didn't know a lot about the wines on the menu so that was a little frustrating. All in all the location is great, the food was delicious and the experience I had was great. Would I do it again, absolutely!

Great space on the third floor of the forum shops with fresh, skillfully prepared foods. My husband thoroughly enjoyed his ramen and short ribs. I loved the hanabi which was tasty spicy tuna atop warm crispy rice squares. The large tuna jalapeño roll was tuna sashimi atop a spicy tuna, avocado roll, garnished with jalapeños and crispy onions. This was our second time eating here and we'd definitely come back.

Sushi was delicious. Service was terrible. We saw our waiter twice. Had to ask 2 other waiters just to get water. Got our miso and salads AFTER our sushi. Disappointing considering there are many other sushi spots around that can surpass their service level.

I've been to Sushi Roku twice. Both times have been fantastic. The fish was great, and the service was excellent. 

I feel like there is a knack to having the best possible experience here. 

1) eat the fish in the right order
2) spend a lot
3) avoid the rolls at all cost, they're terrible.
4) the beef

We went through 3 or 4 bottles of sake, which was poured for us as often as we poured each other's. Exceptionally friendly service from everyone who helped at our table.

The fish is excellent. A lot of fish is fairly delicate, so eating from mild to pungent is important. Hamachi after mackerel is not going to be ideal. A little experience is necessary because they're just going to bring what you order. You can also ask your server, and they'll be happy to guide you.

Highlight of my last trip was the beef served with hot cast iron pucks to cook it on. Ridiculously tender and tasty. Right up there with the best steaks to be found in Vegas, but in a few tender little bites instead of an entire cut. I would happily eat this every day for the next 60 years.

Ambience is nice. I didn't notice it being too dark as another reviewer mentioned, but we arrived before sunset and were there for over 2 hours so we probably adjusted.

Having had 2 exceptional visits, I'm always happy to recommend Roku to people and even happier when I get a chance to go again myself.

Ive been to a few rokus.. but the one in scottsdale is where you need to go. Ask for Dan the manager if you want sake. He'll explain it in depth. Hes passionate knowledgable and personable, especially when it comes to sake.
This place is the bees knees. Nicole is great and Mr. Chow made some great rolls. Excellent service, quick, and very nice staff!

Best sushi I've ever had! My wife and I came here last night for our 1 year wedding anniversary. The service was excellent. The food was absolutely amazing. My wife made a reservation through yelp, mentioned our anniversary in the occasion section, and our server surprised us with an amazing dessert and champagne sparkler.  Couldn't have asked for a better anniversary dinner. Next time we come back to Vegas, we'll be making a point to come back to Sushi Roku.

Overpriced,small portions, and bland.  Need I say more?

I have eaten at much better sushi restaurants for much less!  Stay away! Do yourself a favor .

We went here for my wife's birthday dinner and it did not disappoint. It has a cool ambience and great tasting sushi. 

Devin did a wonderful job as our server. He was knowledgeable and attentive. Sushi chef Toby made the best little crab roll I've ever had! 

We'll definitely be back.

Came here with some coworkers and friends and we decided to do the chef's tasting menu. It was quite pricey at around 100.00 per person but the quality of the food was SO WORTH IT. 

I've never cared for oysters. I've tried them several times but they have always tasted like ocean death snot. So I was pretty amazed when I discovered here oysters that I -not only- don't hate, but actually enjoy eating. Big win!

But what really impressed me was that literally every dish they brought to our table was mouth-wateringly, succulently, mind-blowingly tasty... and amazingly FRESH. 

I'm not usually into sashimi but DAMN. Just wow.

Even the lobster dish (we're from Maine so of course we have pretty high standards for lobster) was absolutely the bomb.com. 

We had a friend with a gluten allergy with us and they were extremely attentive and understanding, offering alternative dishes for every one that had gluten in it. They made him a fresh crab leg roll that didn't look like much, but he couldn't finish it so asked if anyone wanted it. I was stuffed but I wanted to try it. I was so blown away at the simply fantastic, sweet-savory flavor of the crab roll that I couldn't stop eating it. I ended up finishing it because apparently I have no off switch and let's face it, you only live once.

Bonuses: the cocktails were on point, the atmosphere was comfortable, and our server actually spoke Japanese! 

Sushi Roku was not only the best sushi restaurant I've ever tried... I legitimately believe it was one of the best restaurants of any kind that I've ever tried! I'm starting a savings account so that next time I am in Vegas I can be sure to afford to eat here again!

So glad we dropped in after shopping at the Forum. The edamame was delicious with the garlic and spicy. The sushi was delicious and our server Luis was excellent. I look forward to coming here again when we return to Las Vegas. Get the shimi roll

Great Night Out.... Took our nephew out for his birthday this last week and was so thankful for the amazing dining experience at Roku. 

The design of the space is cool and stylish. The food was delicious fresh and tasty from beginning to end. 

The star of the evening was our server Amy. As soon as we begin our dining experience she was welcoming, charming and just plane on point. She guided us through our progressive meal with great knowledge of the menu items as well of a sense of fun and care you don't often get with dining in the Scottsdale area.

Hats off to Roku for a great menu and who the manager who hired Amy. Her service alone was worth the expense of the evening.
My favorite place in the whole United States. I have been here many times and it is the best.
Nice view friendly staff okay food
If you go here for the sushi bar expect to pay around $90-100 for 4 rolls for two people. They have great customer service, clean restaurant and great sushi!

There's a sushi roku in L.A close to where I live but I never got a chance to try it out. Glad I did it in Vegas.

Met a friend (then turned date I guess). We were thinking about what to eat for lunch. After a few minutes of discussion, we chose to have sushi. I wanted to have sushi, and my friend said said he loves sushi too. So we drove down the strip, not the fasted way to get somewhere but it gave us time to find a good restaurant. I was looking for recommendations on Yelp, the top choices are all open only for dinner, and then I found sushi roku. Great, I thought. And conveniently, we were right by the entrance of Ceasars Palace. 

It was a long walk from self-parking garage. Most of the casinos are extremely self-parking unfriendly. The restaurant is located on the 2nd floor of The Forum Shop. The closest entrance would be the main one on the strip, but we walked all the way through the casino. (I'm not a big fan of Ceasars Palace so touring around wasn't exciting to me.)

The hostess took us in and let us chose our own table. We sat down at the very back of the restaurant by the windows. It was a nice view, you can see the happening strip. (But not anything close to the view you would get in your own room at some nice hotels like I've had.) Since they're open for lunch, we ordered some lunch items as well as some specialty rolls. We also tried sashimi. They had two kinds of meat there - Blue Fin is the more premium one, but we had both. Needless to say, blue fin tastes so much better. It is more tender. I love the feeling that it's like melting in your mouth as you're eating it. But my friend prefered the other, he thought there was more texture on it and he likes to chew a little bit. Blue fin is just too soft for him. The sushi we had was beyond ok, but not even close to the best I've had. Except for one. Unfortunately I forgot what it's called as I always order something I've never tried before. And usually I don't even know which is which when they present it. But the service there was really really good, our server explained to us thoroughly on every dish we had. (Still I can't remember the names..) I would give the sushi a 4 star.

For dessert we had mochi since my friend had never had it before. It was $10 but there were only 3 mochi, each was cut in half. For the same money you could buy two packages of some better ones at an Asian supermarket. But the way they put everything together and decorated it justified the price. It looked amazingly beautiful and somehow romantic. If you're there with a date, go for the mochi. I guarantee it'll be a good choice. 

And what's better than a meal with a date that actually enjoyed the food? Discount! When we were about to get our check, I asked our waiter whom we had been chatting with throughout the whole time if we could get any discount had we been staying at the hotel.(I remember seeing coupons were given out upon checkin at casinos. They wanna tie you in.) Btw our server was very very attentive as the whole place was almost empty. If I didn't have to meet with my friend I would've probably been hangover too in the afternoon. But I'm I wasn't. It was nice spending time with my friend together. Before I could finish my question, he said:"you're already getting a discount." It turned out that since we had been chatting so much, he gave us a local discount(which you can find at many places in Vegas) considering my friend was moving there. Nice, so we had 20% off of our total bill. Couldn't be happier about that. It was MLK day and I had a wonderful African-American server.

As we were leaving, my friend and I got confused whether we just had lunch or dinner. It was already dark outside and we probably sat in there for 2 and a half hours which we really didn't feel long at all. We concluded it as our early dinner, even though my friend said it could be he's breakfast since he hadn't eaten anything before that. And then we started getting closer and made out.. It was incredible feeling a cute guy who's also got a hot hot body.

This is not just a review, it's also a journal I'm writing about our first meet because I know "you"(my cute date) could be reading what other people are saying about this place after you got home. If you did read this, consider it a secret way I'm telling you I really had a good time with you being my foodie companion. So looking forward to exploring more restaurants with you ;)

This place is fantastic. Beautiful view, delicious food and amazing service. We were a group of 9. Our waiter was friendly and very attentive. At the end, he asked if we wanted to split our bill according to our orders. I was shocked that he even asked. Most places give us a hard time about splitting bills. He gave us our separate bills and they were precise. I was flabbergasted!

Love this place! My  bf and I stumbled across it by accient while exploring the Forum Shops @ Ceasars. Not only is it romantic, and candle lit, but the sushi was amazing. Very fresh and reasonably priced. The staff was phenomenal and  so attentive. I Loved  the unsweetened iced tea - it was passionfruit flavored- omg. Great ambiance. Def cozy. We had a great time there and got a beautiful picture of us there. Def recommend it and would return when Im back in sin city.

My husband had to travel to Phoenix for business and the kids and I tagged along.  As luck would have it, my brother (who lives in Texas) was also in the Phoenix area for his company.  He loves sushi and we pretty much only eat California rolls but we are adventurous!  We decided on Sushi Roku.  At first, it was a bit intimidating for my family as we had not idea where to even start on the menu.  My kids are adventurous but if they didn't like sushi, we really didn't have too many other menu items to fall back on.

From the moment we stepped in and until we left, I was impressed.  The restaurant was beautiful and I loved that you can see the sushi chefs creating the dishes so close to our table.  We left the ordering to my brother as we had no idea (I actually thought the "caterpillar roll" on the menu was made with caterpillars).  Dumb, I know.

The food was exceptional!  We ordered:

Edamame Hummus w/Chips
Yellowtail Sashimi (it was so good we ordered 2 plates)
Baked Crab Handroll 
California (of course)
Popcorn Shrimp Tempura w/Jalapeno (excellent - not what I was expecting for a tempura dish)
Spicy Tuna
Mackerel Sushi
Salmon Sushi
Yellowtail Sushi
Stir Fry Chicken Rice
And 2 other rolls that I can't remember

I am happy to say that the food was very good.  My boys tried everything and loved it.   My brother (who eats sushi a lot) said that it was very good.  Our server Max was very attentive and allowed us to put the pace on the meal.  It was a very pleasant evening and now we are wanting to check out a good sushi place when we get back home!

FYI...unless your kids are adventurous eaters and well behaved, this is not the restaurant for kids.  At first we got a lot of strange looks (and some worried) when we walked in with twin 7 year olds.  It is a more upscale adult atmosphere.   But the pace of the dinner and spreading out the dishes kept things interesting for the boys so they were never bored.

Stumbled on this place while on a shopping excursion at The Forum Shoppes.  The timing couldn't have been better since we arrived during the afternoon happy hour.  Nothing we ordered from the happy hour menu was over $6, including
- Stella Artois
- Blue Moon
- Spicy Tuna Roll
- Rock Shrimp w/ Ja Roll
- Shrimp Tempura Roll
- Whitefish Tempura Roll
- Eggplant Tempura Roll
- Albacore Tuna Roll
- Filet Wrapped Asparagus
- Crispy Chicken
- Chocolate Volcano Cake

The sushi was fresh and the tempura was crispy.  The true testament to this place is that my wife, who does NOT each sushi, actually enjoyed most of the sushi!  We both thought the Eggplant Tempura Roll was inventive and as good as any of the traditional rolls.  You'd be wise to skip the Crispy Chicken completely as it was tasteless and dry.  The Chocolate Volcano Cake was...amazing and I could drink the vanilla bean sauce that came with it with a straw!

Keep in mind, this is basically a happy hour review, so there are probably much cooler and fancier offerings on Sushi Roku's full menu.

Lastly, a shout out to James our great bar tender!

The ambiance (dim lighting and Japanese modern furniture) and view of the strip really drew me in on my first visit here.  

The sushi was good.  I really enjoyed the spicy tuna hand roll, California roll, & the Shima roll.  Everything we had was fresh and delicious.

I highly recommend calling ahead and booking a reservation.  Also, plan to spend at least $75 for a dinner for 2, and that is without drinks.
The foods was amazing!!!! My new sushi spot in Las Vegas The service is very upscale and the people are very attentive to your every needs

Grabbed a light snack before The Mavericks show at the Livewire and I was impressed. Happy Hour has a stellar menu and its prices are amazing. The Kobe Beef Potstickers were crazy good, and every piece of sushi was fresh. Looking forward to going back again

Not very strong in Nigiri. A server has lack of knowledge where each fish is from. She could not answer any of Nigiri choice that I ordered and ended up giving me very vague answer (Canada/Japan with a hint of hesitation) Roll might be a better choice to order in this restaurant.

Uni Udon is more like pasta with cream made with milk.
Great drinks fresh and delicious sushi! The ambiance is lively yet romantic and the all the dishes are worth trying

I was in Vegas for a convention but made a mistake in planning the trip so I arrived a day early. I deciding on what to eat and was staying at Caesar's Palace and remembered that this place was in the Forum Shops at Caesar's so I decided on having lunch there. It was a Wednesday afternoon and the place was pretty empty which is a far cry from what it usually is like at night. I sat at the sushi bar and had one of their lunch combos (sashimi and tempura) and added an order of fatty tuna sushi. This was really tasty. I hadn't had sushi in a while and it really hit the spot. I also got a chance to chat with the head sushi chef, Kiichi, who was a really cool guy. I've been to the other Sushi Rokus (Santa Monica and Pasadena) but this one is my favorite. This place is highly recommended, but be prepared, it is not cheap.

Came for happy hour and loved it!
Sushi rolls, veggie tempura, and mochi were fantastic and I'd recommend to anyone.

Without happy hour pricing, it was definitely out of my reach. So heads up.
Great, fresh sushi! Healthy options. Super sweet hostess' + waitress! Great view of the Strip. Love the ambience!

We spent the last night in Vegas and this is where we chose to eat.  We had a large group of people with usually high expectations of dinner, especially since the night before dinner was a disaster.  Sushi Roku was AMAZING and the service was top notch.  We had Bailey as our server and she made all of our sushi dreams come true.  Everything tasted wonderful and I would 100% return when we go to Vegas again!

Decided to go with friends and check out their happy hour.  The atmosphere and setting very nice and clean, maybe because there was only two other parties in the restaurant.  The service was great, the waiter was very nice and helpful.  Sushi, I only had the california roll, but they do use real crab, plus their wasbi was really good, soo much better than Stingray, which in my opinion is over priced and not worth, and the rock thing, seriously, I don't know of any Asian that has a rock on their kitchen counter to set their rice spatula at home nor for their chopsticks.  I tried their Kobe sliders, I've had better at Roka.. I think if you are going to the W and the restraurant enjoy the sushi, serivce and maybe the drinks, but everything else, is up to you for review.

I'd say that the two times I've been here were just ok
I really liked your little rice cakes a lot
But they really weren't very accommodating to me because I really don't like raw fish and I really like my sushi done a specific way and if I can't get sushi done a specific way then I get a little weird

The service here is very good there is always parking I've only been here twice and prices are normal but I just think that the food is put me in a weird way because I just like getting what I want and if I can't get a certain way then it bothers me that's why took away a star so I had to settle for things on the menu and rely off of my friends
And the things that my friends pick out are completely disgusting. 
The desert here is absolutely amazing
The food had so much flavor! I'll definitely return; their happy hour was so worth it. 5 happy hour menu items for $27. My favorite was the mushroom tempura and Calamari.

First I want to say the food was amazing. We tried literally everything on the HH menu, and had sake to wash it down. Food was amazing. Service was so-so. They screwed up our tabs, overcharging me and other in our party. We didn't have any flatwear/chopsticks for a straight minute, and had to flag down someone to get some minutes after our food arrived. Service needs to be tightened up, they need a manager on duty at all times or something. Also it's not a bad idea to have your food runner smile. He hates his job and he projects it, dampening our loose, and fun group.
Oh my god!!! It was amazing!!! The Brussels sprout chips are a great appetizer. The Jalapeño roll is delicious. Everything is great. Service is excellent. I will definitely be back.

I am giving this restaurant 2 stars, because the service was amazing. The food gets one star because Yelp does not have zero stars for food. The chicken fried rice tasted like refrigerator and didn't have an Asian flavor due to the bland flavor and lack of seasoning. The sauteed brussel sprouts were really over cooked and very dry. This might have been the intent but they should go more for the soy sauce and vinegarette flavor.  We could only stomach one bite of the tempura sushi that again had no flavor and required us to request what flavor did we order. Anytime you have have to verify your sushi type, is not good.

Great spot to end a wonderful girls trip in Scottsdale!  We came on a Sunday night and were all pleasantly surprised when we found out that Sunday was all night happy hour!  Woohoo~  We ordered a variety of rolls and nigiri specials, they were all delicious!  A couple of stand out menu items also included the tuna tartare crostini and the kobe beef sliders.  As for drinks, the strawberry fizz and pear martinis were both delightful.   

I honestly don't get the negative reviews, my girlfriends and I had a great dining experience.  I liked it so much that I wished there was a location in the DC area.

After the disappointment of Joes Stone Crab (see my review), we left and went upstairs to Sushi Roku. Great service and great specials adding to a great menu. Not too extensive, but a fine selection. Thank you Joes. We'll come to Sushi Roku now.

I felt like a lot of dishes were made before we even sat down because they came way to fast to be freshly prepared. The carpaccio seemed to be extremely cold and stuck to the plate as if it had be prepared beforehand and sitting in a refrigerator for awhile. The tastes of a lot of dishes were actually pretty good. The presentation was on point. Overall the food was meh for the prices paid.
Good sushi. Service is bad. Not kidding you on the service. Will completely ignore you when you are waiting to get their attention for the bill.

Delicious sushi and cocktails. A bit pricy but worth it. Bartender and manager were very nice and made me feel welcomed and special. Come for happy hour for cheeper sushi rolls and drinks. Happy hour starts earlier on the weekends   They have happy hour everyday of the week. They are always happy to also customize a sushi roll to your taste or make you something not listed on the menu. Will be back again soon for sure. Make sure you try the pineapple brown sugar cocktail...so delicious!

Enter the forum shops across the street from Harrah's, that way you are not walking miles through the mall looking for the place.
The ambiance was very nice, although the service was a bit slow the staff was very nice. For the price we were expecting more. The taste was fresh but overall we weren't to impressed.

I've been a big fan of the Sushi Roku in Pasadena for years! The Vegas one is a step down from the one in Pasadena, but it's still enjoyable if you're looking for reasonably priced sushi in Vegas. It's located inside a mall, so the location leaves something to be desired, but whatever.
We got an assortment of rolls and sashimi as well as some alcoholic beverages. The waitress forgot our sake so she ended up giving us an extra one for free! Really nice of her! 
SERVICE: Minus forgetting our sake, the service was really good.
FOOD: the rolls were really good but the some of the sashimi were cut unevenly. 
I've been to other sushi bars in Vegas, however, and they were all twice as expensive as this place, so I thought it was worth it. Also, they have allot of non sushi items on their menu too, so if you're going with sushi lovers and you hate it, there's plenty for you!

Came in the other night with my parents, the staff was extremely knowledgeable from the waiters to the bussers. There was an exceptionally friendly busser named Skyler that was a fairly neat guy.The food was fantastic though, especially the salmon and the waiters were helpful in explaining the dishes. 5/5 stars I will definitely be coming back.

Ambiance: Great view of the Las Vegas strip if you sit near the window, nice dark interior  trendy decor, and the bathrooms were even nice!

Service: Top-notch service, couldn't ask for anything more.

Food:  I will make this short and sweet.  Me and my girlfriend both agreed we had the best roll (Spicy Dragon Roll)and best prime rib steak we ever tasted.  YES thats right, the best steak we have ever had was here at a Japanese restaurant.  Order the Prime Rib steak, SO juicy SO tendy SO flavorful.

Overall: Yes this place is a little pricey, but this is Las Vegas and this is not bad in comparison to other fine dining options.  The quality of food you are getting lives up to it.

Loved the atmosphere, friendly chefs! And absolutely delicious food! 
I recommend the Hakata ramen!!

The ambiance of this restaurant is awesome. It also helps to be located in one of the best hotels in the city. This is my second time here and because of the great experience I had (again) I wanted to leave another review reiterating the wonderful experience here.

One word that describes the sushi here - OUTSTANDING. One of the best sushi restaurants I've been to on the west coast. I highly recommend coming here. This will be a frequent stop every time I am in Scottsdale.

Loved all the sushi and plates we ordered. Excellent service and a nice place to eat. Maybe a bit pricey but in a special occasion its worth it. I don't recall anything I didn't like so if you like sushi in general you can try anything and will be really good. The only thing I remember not liking as much was the spring rolls with strawberries for dessert. All other desserts were really good.

Go during happy hour!!!  We easily ordered over $250 worth of food and it came out to be only $100 for two people. The crispy rice dish was so good we ordered it twice. Get some hot sake and chow down on the hand rolls. The salmon and tuna were fresh. 
Also, the manager (or maybe owner) was extremely attentive and took the time to give my friend and I some background on Vegas, Caesar's palace, and the strip. 5/5 for food and service!

As soon as we started to check in, the hostess had an attitude with us just because we didn't want to sit at the bar and asked to wait for a table. 
I ordered the ramen and this is by far the worst taken I've ever had, noodles were not cooked properly and the broth tasted sour. 
I also ordered the katana roll and the salmon was not fresh and really warm.
Other than that our server was really nice and took this time to explain the menu.

My friend took me here for a late lunch and surprisingly, there was only one other occupied table in the main dining area. Love the hip and zen-like ambience.  This is by far the best joint at Caesar's Palace. The portions are small and the prices are a bit steep, but hey this is Vegas. I rather  feed my tummy than those slot machines. I would def let my friend take me back here again :)

Oh btw- I had the lobster tempura and calamari salad.

I live very close to a Sushi Roku in Santa Monica, California so its a bit strange that my first experience with the restaurant was so far from home (in the middle of the desert no less). On the brighter side, it was a business lunch so the price tag didn't hurt as much as it should have.

All in all, the food was really great. It wasn't the best sushi I've had, but it was pretty close.  I really dig spicy food, so the spicy tuna with jalapeos really hit the spot! Also had a "Shima Roll" which I highly recommend... spicy tuna, shrimp, soy paper, and hot sauce. Yummy!
Our waiter was helpful. The sushi had a powdery consistency. It was barely edible. We wouldn't come back.

My favorite place to bring my family and friends. Great food, service and atmosphere. Can't beat the all day happy hour on Sunday's. We always request to have Jenna as our server. She has great knowledge of the menu. We recommend this place to everyone.

Excellent sashimi. Ok sushi rolls. Music is way too loud, we could barely have a conversation.  The bartender service was slow - our food came before drinks. Decor is very cool. Do not recommend the desert menu. Our bill was overcharged cocktails we didn't order, but they corrected. Very high price tag for mediocre/slow service.
The environment and ambience is beautiful! The service was top-notch! I haven't seen better service elsewhere! The food was pretty good too! I had the ramen and my fiancé had the steak.

DESSERT.  I know, I know, it's a sushi restaurant - the fish dishes were great and the service was topnotch.  But what stood out to my boyfriend and me was the last part of our meal.  His three Pate Choux were filled with different-flavored housemade ice creams accompanied by a small cup of melted chocolate; each was unique and we loved these light and airy puffs!  My rice tuile cup filled with mango, green tea, and sesame (?) seed ice creams resting on a bed of delicious apple pie filling was FABULOUSLY inventive and pulled together very well!  Presentation of these dishes was artistically appealing.

Loved the vibe.  Beautiful, romantic night scene of the Strip played out before us from the large picture windows, and we were seated Monday night at one of the cushy tables along the opposite wall (which can fit 6), so BOTH of us were able to look across the entire dining room and out through the windows.  The space was much bigger than it looks from the entrance inside The Forum shops.

All I can say is the sushi dishes were outstanding.  Delicately displayed, each plate contained quality, fresh ingredients, and it all tasted as good as it looked (we ordered 3 dishes before the dessert).  Sure, everything is a little pricey, but what isn't along the Strip?  At least this one was actually worth it.

Service was excellent; in fact, the best I experienced at any food establishment in Las Vegas during our time here in Sep 2012.  We were seated right away even though we were 20 minutes earlier than our reservation, and our server and team were coordinated, quietly friendly, and discreetly responsive.  There were no pretentious airs. 

I would not hesitate to go there again and give it my full recommendation.

Quite literally one of my favorite restaurants in town, little on the pricey side but it's well worth it. My friends and I come here a lot the food and service is nothing short of amazing. We always ask for Maiko she's great, very personable and loves food and recommends so well. Also the environment is comfortable and elegant. Do recommend and recommend this experience with Maiko as your server.

Came back to Sushi Roku with a friend and it was still fabulous.  They've expanded their happy hour menu.  We ordered the Sauteed Chinese Green Beans, Miso Eggplant Dengaku, Spicy Tuna Roll, Spicy Yellowtail Roll and the Tuna Tartar with Avocado & Crostini.  Everything was so flavorful, fresh and delicious.  Our server was very friendly and attentive.  We got all that food for under 20 bucks!  Sushi Roku is the best kept secret for quality sushi at amazing prices.  The W Hotel is so beautiful too!

Went with a large group, and the food was wonderful.  Unfortunately, our service was not.  We had a party of 18, and our server seemed very annoyed that we didn't want to order family style (at $85 per person), and then proceeded by telling us he would not split the check more than 6 ways- which was fine, but he also brought the manager over to tell us the same thing.  His annoyed attitude as if we were inconveniencing him by being there left a bad taste in our mouth, and two of our guests decided to leave and dine elsewhere.  Luckily, we really enjoyed the food very much, but were definitely disappointed with the service.

Without question the single worst dining experience in memory. I kept glancing around for a candid camera or something. We left in a stupor of disbelief, disgust and regret. 

Four of us show up around 10pm on a Friday night. The place is still fairly busy but not packed by any means. We were seated almost immediately next to the image I would expect to accompany the definition of Scottsdale d-bag couple in the dictionary. Over tanned, tatted up, huge biceps and pudgy middle, fake lips, boobs, everything, tons of makeup, absurd amount of jewelry. Cross between circus clowns and the cast of Jersey Shore. That was as good as it was going to get. 

We sat there for at least 15 minutes before a single person stopped by our table. When our late 20something male server showed up he wasn't apologetic. He immediately tried to bond with us like we were long lost bros finally reunited. It was obnoxious, contrived and poorly received considering he was off to a miserable start. We order drinks, which ends up being very confusing for him. How many large bottles of beer? What brand? Five minutes later he stops back to "double check" our drink order. YES, that's the order. Now put it in already. We've been here 20+ minutes and you haven't served us a drink!? 

He comes back again to take our food order. In his defense (he really doesn't deserve any), two of us are native Seattleites and consider ourselves sushi connoisseurs (not in a pretentious way - we just have a deep appreciation for and eat it frequently). We ask about the size of the sashimi and nigiri orders and he launches into a long description of the difference between the two. Yes, we know. We order an assortment of nigiri and a roll to start, which is our standard approach to ordering at a place new to us. Sample a bit and assess the quality. After more hemming an hawing, he finally takes our order and leaves. Five minutes later he comes back AGAIN to double check our order. "Now that was all nigiri, right? The sushi with rice underneath?" He says he's going to do us a solid and redeem himself by sending out a free warm crab roll. Ohh, yay! At this point we think this must be a prank. Is this guy high? Inept? Both? What is going on? We confirm, again. He leaves. 

Then he FINALLY shows up with our drinks and he's got the beer wrong. At this point he launches into a sob story explanation about how he was called in outside his regular shift, only had 3 hours of sleep, blah, blah. He's now playing the sympathy card. I was getting nauseous. Please just bring the food and leave us alone. The last thing we want to hear about it your problems during our dinner. 

At least 20 minutes go by while we enjoy some time without our server making us cringe and the food finally arrives. The portions are small to tiny. The quality is okay at best. I've had better at a conveyor belt place back home. The server comes back and says something like "Isn't that the most amazing roll you've ever had?" Dear God. No, actually, it's not. Please leave. 

We foolishly decide to order a couple more items (we were still hungry) and our server tells us the rather expensive snapper on the fresh list is incredible. In the five years he's worked there they've never had it and it's the best fish he's ever had. That should have been our clue not to order it. We did anyway. It comes out and it's seared skin on. It was, again, just okay and certainly not worth the price. Here comes server guy telling us how amazing it was again. Please, please, please just bring the check. 

He shows up with the check and, this will shock you, it's wrong. He's charged us for the roll he sent out to redeem himself. We point it out and request it be removed and he's stunned. No waaay. I'm so sorry I'll take that off right away. He shows up five minutes later to "double check" that we wanted the free roll he sent out removed from the bill. I almost fell out of my chair. Then he has the audacity to deliver the final, corrected check and tell us when we come in next time, to request him and he'll give us some free rolls to redeem himself. You have got to be joking? The kicker is the price of such a horrific experience. We were so ready to get the hell out of there we just paid and split. If it had been earlier in the evening I would have spoken to the manager and made sure I wasn't ripped off. 

Quick summary - this place is in the W and it's targeted at what I can only assume is their typical demographic. They substantially over charge for mediocre sushi because they can and, based on other reviews, practice suspect billing (like trying to charge us for the comp'd roll). I will never, ever return and hope some day my friends and I can laugh about how we were literally robbed of a couple quality hours together while we endured this debacle of a dining experience.
This Place is very good I love the food fresh very friendly very kind and I would always come here when I come to Vegas

Food was very good but definitely overpriced. I highly recommend the sashimi platter. The coconut shrimp was actually very tasty. The roasted cauliflower was not worth the price. It said it has pine nuts but the nuts were definitely not pine nuts. The pear martini was too sweet. The overall atmosphere is intimate and enjoyable. The service was pretty good

Had a late night snack as well as breakfast while staying at the W on a business trip. Both in the evening and morning, took the staff nearly a half hour to serve me after ordering with very few customers while the food is great, service needs to improve.

We are regulars at Sushi Roku and had dinner there last night; as always the dinner was amazing.  The restaurant has great atmosphere and the management team is fantastic.  If you are looking for suggestions on Sushi rolls, just ask.  They are always spot on.  Stick around after and have a cocktail and listen to music in the bar next door.  The Katana Roll, Baked Lobster Roll and the Spicy Tuna Jalapeno rolls are a few of our favorites.

AMAZING. 
Best Sushi I've had in Vegas so far. The Ambiance was beautiful, service was very friendly & food was top notch. I ordered the Katana Roll which was my favorite, the lobster roll was really great as well. And the toro? BEST TORO I'VE EVER HAD. My mouth starts watering even thinking about it now! & the great thing was, my boyfriend, who hates seafood, ordered the Ji Dori Chicken & loved it. If you're looking for a top notch sushi dinner with a romantic setting & nice view of the strip, this is the spot!

Located in the Forum Shops, Sushi Roku was your standard quality sushi, but pricier.  The view is nice (you can see Las Vegas Blvd from the windows), but their sushi was nothing special.  The yellowtail with chillies was probably my favorite dish, but the nigiri and rolls did not do much for me.

(+) location, view, waitstaff
(-) value

Today I had the farty part of the tuna thanks to Jeff. And you know what, I liked it! 
I need more farty parts in my life. 
You have to try it. This was part of a delicious feast. The food is honestly great here.

I went to Sushi Roku on a Tuesday night after a convention. This restaurant is amazing on all fronts. Great food. Great service. Great atmosphere. 

Service- The hostess was extremely nice and asked us for our preference in seating. We chose a table, rather than the sushi bar. After being seated, we were greeted by our server. He was very friendly and extremely knowledgeable about the menu. I asked him for his recommendation in sake and food, both of which he answered with great detail. Throughout the meal, he was extremely attentive. He checked on us multiple times, and never let our drinks become empty.

Food- The food was phenomenal. Based on the server's recommendation, we ordered the Chilean Sea Bass as an appetizer. It was absolutely amazing. The flavors were delicious and the sea bass literally melted in our mouths. We also ordered the chicken fried rice which was exceptional. As far as sushi, we ordered the California roll and baked lobster roll. Both were phenomenal. Overall, everything was extremely delicious.

Atmosphere- The restaurant is dimly lit and cozy. There is a great view of the strip if you are seated inside of the restaurant, rather then on the forum side. It does get a little loud, and some of the tables are rather close. However, that didn't bother us. A lot of the tables around us were having a great time. 

Overall, I would definitely dine at Sushi Roku again. Everything was exceptional. It definitely has great reviews for a reason!

We went for a late dinner before a 9.30 show. We got lost finding it and when we called they were great directing us to them. Once there we were seated immediately. Staff were friendly and great to work with. The food was excellent! Must try the baked crab roll! Too die for!!

Dining at Sushi Roku on an expense account was the main highlight of the experience.  Although the dishes were good, it wasn't up to the rave I expected.  Perhaps our group was there on a "bad day."   Overall, it was a nice dinner.

My daughter and I visited Sushi Roku for dinner and we had a wonderful dining experience.  We loved the atmosphere, food, and service.  Our server Klayton was friendly, charming, knowledgeable, and very professional.  We highly recommend this restaurant!!!
Everything was delicious. The service was helpful and on time and she was definitely willing to make recommendations for the meal. Sake selection was great and I would definitely recommend.

Dear Sushi Roku,

How dare you not have any uni when I came here!   I don't care if you said your Friday was busy and you ran out - ORDER MORE!  

Also, your yellowtail sashimi with jalapenos was so slathered in sauce that I thought the fish might come alive again thinking it was back in the ocean.

I was going to give you two stars because your black cod miso was decent but then you sat me next to some whiny girl complaining about how there are no decent men in Las Vegas (does anybody go to Las Vegas to be decent?) and some teenager who was introducing sushi to his girlfriend and kept asking her "isn't this like the best thing you have ever eaten in your entire life?"  barf barf barf barf.  

Toodles,
Zach

Had dinner here last night and didn't need a reservation! We walked in and got seated right away. I love how the restaurant is on the 3rd floor and we were sat by the window so we saw the gorgeous view of the strip. Now .... let's get to the food!

We ordered pork belly fried rice, wagyu skewer, seared salmon sashimi, Salmon nigiri, baked crab handroll, and a roll. 

The salmon nigiri was fresh and tasty. The baked crab handroll was simple but good! The pork belly fried rice had lots of flavor as well. The roll we had, had shrimp tempura, yellowtail, red tuna, and albacore I believe. All of these were satisfying dishes.

However - the most outstanding dish to my boyfriend and I were the wagyu skewer and seared salmon sashimi. The wagyu melted in our mouths and the seared salmon was absolute perfection especially with the avocado, ponzu sauce, and the veggies. They were so good we had to order them TWICE (along with another order of salmon nigiri)

Service was very attentive, I believe his name as Matthew. He was great. Always patient and kind. 

So glad we came here. There were plenty of sushi restaurants to go to on the strip but the pictures sold me. Definitely will be back with my Sushi lovers whenever in town!
SooOoo hard to find good sushi in Scottsdale.

Excellent service, great view, chic decor, and perfect chilly soundtrack.

The toro was rich and fatty, incredibly decadent, and meltingly delicious. Roll were nice, if a bit standard. Seaweed salad was cool and refreshing, and piled high, more than enough for two to share. Mochi ice cream was the perfect topper.

After reading others reviews, I am now so sad that I missed the view of the strip.  We were seated in the "mall view" area.  Not sure why, the place was not that full.  I guess that is the low-rent district....
Ah, but Sushi Roku, I can't stay mad at you.  Your sushi is delicious.  The Toro Tartare blew my mind (pinon nuts... Sushi Roku, you are a genius!) The yellowtail and fresh scallops were succulent.  The presentation was nice and the cocktails... quite inventive.  
Okay, I guess we made up.  This will be my go-to sushi place in Vegas.  And next time, I'm gonna see that view.

ALWAYS amazing...we started with miso soup, then the shishito peppers (YUM) and then bluefin tuna and Japanese mackerel sushi, then a roboto skewer of filet wrapped around fois gras and asparagus,  Next, a spicy yellowtail nigiri sushi, plus uni and masago.  Perfect balance, great view, romantic, YUM.
What a great date place!  Lighting was beautiful, service was good and the food was awesome!  Will go back.
I love Sushi Roku! It's my go-to. Dan is the man! The yellowtail with diced chilies is the BEST thing on the menu. I come once a week and it never disappoints! Such a good vibe and fun time
Best sushi I have ever had in Vegas.  Not cheap, but what do you expect.  Blows Nobu out of the water.

Nice environment...supposedly rated most romantic spot...I think they exaggerated a bit. This place looks, feels, and is expensive BUT the food does not match up. I tried their "best" roll Katana and it was very disappointing. My friend's rolls were disappointing as well, fish was dull in color (not fresh) and didn't taste like the $29 I paid for. Also tried the King crab fried rice and that was disappointing as well: not much crab meat and just nothing that special. In general, the food was not bad but I just dislike places that try to make their food seem good by making it super expensive and making the place expensive. One more thing: I came in a group of 7 people and the server helped us all write in our tip....like rude much, if gratuity is included then get it printed...its unprofessional. To describe this place in one word: phony. If you want to have great Asian food, go to Tao (I'm not advertising for Tao btw). I would go back to Tao a thousand times and probably never voluntarily go here again.

My experience here has left me with no words. Bad service. Mediocre food. I can definitely say I'm never coming here again. It took over 20 mins to get our table some water and the waitress didn't own up to her mistakes and blamed the busboy for not bringing the water. When we got the water, it tasted horrible. Our hotel room sink water tastes better than that. The food came so late as if they left to catch the fish we were going to consume. The waitress then forgot to put in one of our rolls and apologized in the most stand offish way possible saying it was a "human error" as if she wasn't even sorry about it. As we received the bill, my friend realized she got spicy tuna when she had wanted yellowtail. All in all worst place ever! The only decent person was the busboy. Avoid the waitress with a feather tattoo behind her ear.

Sushi Roku one of the best places on strip to go during happy hour.They have great prices, yummy Champaign, big selection of sushi and appetizers, great design and welcoming service.
We came here after I found this place on Yelp and as a true sushi fan I had to try it. Well bar was full during happy hour so they gave us nice table outside ( close to cute Christmas tree). I was more than happy because I don't like laud bars. 
All sushi and sashimi that we ordered was extremely tasty, savory and fresh. $6 Champaign sounds reasonable. I will definitely come back!
Sushi heaven!!  An truly unbelievable place!  A must if you are in Vegas!

So I typically stay at the W when I am in Scottsdale, AZ, so this is an easy go to for our team. I have had breakfast here a few times and dinner once. 

Breakfast service is not the best at all and is very slow. The food is amazing though. I've had the Huevos Rancheros multiple times and they are so good. They are not definitely what I would expect when you say Huevos Rancheros as I am from a very Hispanic hometown, but they are delicious. 

Dinner service tends to be better as I am assuming this restaurant is made for dinner. We had a handful of rolls, Miso Soup, and the Asian BBQ Shortribs "Yakiniku." By far the only stand out item was the Beef Skewers! They were to die for. All of the other food was definitely average to me. I have definitely had better sushi in Dallas, Austin, and Atlanta. For the price point I don't think this would be a favorite restaurant of mine, but for the convienence, it isn't horrible.

This was a fantastic meal in an excellent setting.  There was a group of 6 of us eating, so we had several dishes.  The service was excellent, as we never had to wait long for new items once the food started rolling in.  Although we had primarily sushi, the star of the dish for me was the wagyu beef.  For $60, you get 6 strips of melt in your mouth steak that you cook at your table on a hot rock.  Just a dip in a soy sauce based sauce, a few seconds on the hot pot, and you are set.  The mouth feel was "melt in your mouth," the fat breaking down and the steak seemed to melt as you chewed it.  The flavor was off the charts, all agreed.  It was a great way to get a couple of bites of such an excellent piece of beef and not totally break the bank.

As I stated, we had many dishes, the standouts were the yellowtail sashimi, the crab dynamite, and a tempura shrimp roll that was a special, but I can't recall its name.  This one had a lot of spice to it, and the tempura was fantastic.  Not greasy in the slightest.  The makato roll was such a favorite we ordered another.  We tried the baked lobster roll which for me was decent, but not nearly as good as the other items we ordered.

The wife had the sauteed spicy shrimp.  They make this dish out to be spicier than it really is.  It has a nice sauce on top that has a little sweetness.  The real star of this dish was the housemade potato chips.  They went very well with the creamy sauce.

Very solid drink menu with a lot of Asian beers, which is typically my preferred drink at sushi places.  The view, as many have noted, is great of the strip.  But, if you don't want to watch cars or random people walking, you can certainly sit in areas of the restaurant that don't have the view.

Will definitely return, and highly recommended.

If it wasn't for yelp I wouldn't have found this place, it's tucked away in the shops and on the third floors.  

The atmosphere is definitely "uppity."  Very dark modern feel to it.  

Ok, so as far as sushi goes, this place is pricey.  But, we went to Vegas for a friends bday and wanted a nicer place to dine. 

Started with the edamame hummus - which had a more watery consistency to it than I am used to.  There was edamame beans in there, which added textures.  I did not, however liked the chips that came with it for scooping.  

I tried the spicy tuna and spicy scallop roles.  They were good, I guess.  I think I've had better sushi elsewhere.  My friends raved about the crab dynamite roll, but I didn't try it.  The portions for the BBQ chicken special was so tiny for the price - I couldn't see anyone getting full by it.  

The best part of the meal was the dessert.  We told our server one of us was having a bday and they brought two sufferer deserts, and a cool flaming firecracker type candle.  Considering the place was dark, it lit up our table and made for a fun presentation.  Also the desserts were very delicious - a very rich chocolate brownie with ice cream and strawberries, and a fruit blend type of tart, I can't describe too well.

I think this place is more presentation than food quality.

Fresh, good sushi...in the desert? Call me skeptical, but yes, this is Vegas, after all. In the heart of Caesar's Forum Shoppes, the three curving escalators to ride to get here make it seem more exclusive than it is, but enjoy.

This place is all about three things: decor, wide selection of modern interpretation of Japanese cusisine, and overly friendly service. Let's get it out of the way: the place is beautiful. Very modern, very rich, and dark, it's a visual treat. Set against the overlook of the Strip (so, why DO people go to Imperial Palace?), it's a visual masterpiece. The bench seats that line the windows actually have lit rock gardens underneath them...very cool.

The food: good, but won't wow you into submission. I'm just a spoiled San Francisco sushi man, so it might be amazing for others. The Chicken Kara Age was exceptional, however; highly reccomended. The sushi? The sushi itself was good: fresh, flavorful. The rolls were overstuffed with so many things, it was hard to get a sense of the delicate flavor. Be warned: you are paying Vegas prices here ($100 for 2 of us with about 5 small plates), but the quality and ambience are good enough to overcome that.

Service was almost obsequious, although getting tea refilled seemed to be a foreign concept. Hey, I know the desert's hot, but I can't have my hamachi without some tea to go with it. ;-) Very prompt delivery of items, very courteous. 

Odd notes: the place was only half full for an 8pm reservation. We used Open Table to ensure a seat, but we needn't have worried. And a note if you plan to sit by the windows: there is a typical Vegas video sign just underneath the restaurant outside, so you'll get a lot of flickering glow, which can be distracting.

I'd say it's a good casual sushi place, to take a date, or to enjoy the fun of being in Vegas without killing you on price with no quality to show for it.

Just ordered sushi from them via Uber Eats. The food showed up warmer than room temperature and scattered as if the delivery guy was using this bag as a means to win a pillow fight. I understand Roku isn't liable for what happens when it leaves the restaurant but the food was subpar it would be more fit for a five dollar plate atmosphere in a strip mall. The overall experience was collectively horrible. They lost my business indefinitely.

No reservations,no problem ,we can accommodate.
That's what we all love to hear once in a while and that's exactly what we got when we came here.

As I was reading the menu I couldn't decide what to order,so I did my usual and started off with dessert.
Chocolate volcano cake and the banana flambé.
The chocolate cake was rich,moist,decadent and came with a scoop of ice cream that worked really well with it.The flambé was just like the name,simply 
bananas.The next item I was eyeing,Pork belly with egg on top of spicy fried rice.If I could give a dead man walking a last meal,this would definitely be it.The pork wasn't to fatty and the egg actually help calm the spice of the rice to balance out the dish.
Most of the sushi items were great but some them were not at room temperature and had a little to much ponzu sauce but that's just my tastebuds.

Overall this was a great dining experience and must 
give them a 4.5 star rating.All points were hit I just feel they came up a little short on some of their items.Great ambiance and decor mixed in with chill
eclectic beats make it a must if ones hanging out in Vegas and looking for a sushi spot.I am out,Peace

On our girls trip to Vegas this past weekend, we were craving something other than the typical Vegas quick-fix like burgers and tacos. Instead, we literally took a journey down Las Vegas Blvd, through Caesar's casino, through the Forum Shoppes to get to our destination.

We were quickly led to a table that overlooked Las Vegas Blvd. This restaurant is gorgeous and one of the best decorated Japanese restaurants I've been to. Even their bathroom is art in itself. Us 5 girls sat in one of the leather booths in the middle of the main dinning hall. 4 of us ordered the lunch special of teriyaki salmon with tempura or sashimi that came with a side of miso soup, salad, and rice (about $17-$19), and the last lady ordered 2 sushi rolls (their rolls vary from $12-$30). We had 2 large hot sakes which gave us girls about 4 shots each. Don't waste your money here because those shots did absolutely NOTHING! For $9 a bottle, put your money towards a Fat Tuesday drink instead.

The salmon, tempura, miso soup, and rolls were pretty good. However the salad was a different story. For a salad that took up almost half a plate, why did it feel like only 2 spoonfuls of dressing was mixed in? I'm not a dinosaur. I don't eat grass and plants and greens by itself. Yuck. 

Our bill for lunch came out to $125. Luckily we were only 5 because like all major restaurants, 18% gratuity is added to a party of 6 or more. If you're looking to spend around $30 for one of their special sushi rolls, come here. Other than that, look for a better lunch special elsewhere.

I've been to the Santa Monica location http://www.yelp.com/biz/qZNLvgtZ89PeWcX3n0dovA?hrid=HAdjWsGURjDL6aSm0Q7lSg) and heard good things about the Hollywood one (http://www.yelp.com/biz/9LvbzUke1gSRJMwYc5PV0g), so the expectations were high.  I made a reservation with Open Table (http://www.yelp.com/biz/W2rSvA2Vvt5Eh9LQqR7zqg?hrid=ObmqaqLHQcctioT9HcxwNg) and I was not disappointed.  The ambiance is great; I love the decor and I got to peek in the private banquet room which was lovely.  Our food was excellent as was our sake.  Be sure to check out the quirky menu of cocktails (including one that comes in a glass rimmed in crushed graham crackers).

After having a hefty brunch at Bouchon, we opted for a lighter dinner of sushi.    We made a 8:30 reservation while we were shopping at the Forum Shops.  My gfs and I order a couple bottles of sake and a mixed tempura plate to get the evening started.  We all really enjoyed the pricey sparkling raspberry sake ($34 a bottle!) and the tempura.  We also got a couple of rolls to share as our dinner and all were delicious.  Our only annoyance was when we wanted to order more food and drinks our server could never be found.

I went here during lunch time to celebrate my husband's 31st birthday. His parents were in town and we were with my family, so we decided to do a meet and greet. My husband and I have been together nearly 9 years, and my family has never really met his family. Since my husband loves sushi, I found this place on yelp, due to the incredible yelp reviews as well as they serve affordable lunch combination plates. However, when we got there, since it was on the weekend, I guess they did not have and lunch specials. We ordered quite a bit here, we were a party of 6. My family being doesn't really eat sushi, or anything raw, I knew it was going to be interesting. We ordered tempura and miso cod fish for them. We ordered this delicious sashimi with shaved blacked truffles on it. Also a couple of yellowtail rolls. This was my first time trying ikura, and it was delicious and very fresh. We also ordered some bluefin tuna and it was very fresh and practically melted in your mouth.

For fresh delicious sushi, this is a definite must.

On an unrelated note, the women's bathroom stalls are really really low. Considering I'm already short, I had the stoop pretty low. That I found amusing.

Great view of the strip from up here!  hidden on the top floor of caesar's palace, i didnt know this existed since there's no signage outside. was taken here by a VIP and treated like a rockstar! shook hands with the GM and staff, who were all very friendly. ate plenty of delish food and left stuffed.

I stumbled upon Sushi Roku on the 3rd floor of Caesar's Palace. This place has a cool décor and an amazing view of the strip from the dining area. I wasn't too hungry when I stopped by, I just grabbed 1 roll, the Katana Roll. It was a solid but pricey choice. Actually it was quite delicious but no better than sushi I could get back at home for half the price. Still you don't go out in Vegas for value eating.

Awesome service, 100% attentive and endearing. Great food, beautiful view, and our waiter Matthew  was the best server we've had in a very long time. It happened to be our 1st wedding anniversary and they surprised us with a sparkler and special writing on our dessert. He rest of the staff was very accommodating as well.

Terrible service, management, and overpriced. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!! Overbooking tables, then telling customers that they have a 1 hour limit for dinner for 4? Just embarrassing. Will never return, refer or recommend!

This was one of my two favorite restaurants this trip. Great ambiance. It is dark and semi-romantic if you want it to be with an awesome angle of the strip. 
We did not have a reservation and were seating immediately by the window. 
Our waitress was perfectly attentive and very helpful with recommending new nigiri for me to try when I was feeling adventurous.
Pricing is not the cheapest I have had but it is more than worth the money.

- Solid edamame
- Squid sunomono was delicious.  Tangy, crisp, and the squid was perfect
- The shishito peppers were ok.  Not crisp enough and the sauce was a touch too strong
- The sushi was all very nice
- The saba was strong
- The kampachi was probably the best I've ever had (firm, but not too firm and borderline buttery)
- The ocean trout was much different than I've had before.  Usually it's a little strong.  Sushi Roku's was smooth.  I liked it
- The oh-toro was amazing, as it should be.  The bacon of the sea
- My only quibble is that the portions were a smidge too small, even for a higher end place
- Service was solid
- Loads of gluten-free options/substitutes

I came here for Happy Hour, and it's the best deal in town! Swanky restaurant in the Forum shops, they have an excellent variety of Happy Hour choices for so reasonable! I ate tuna takari, shrimp tempura. hand rolls, all were phenomenal! I ate and drank up a storm and my total bill was $40.  And I got to hang in a relaxing place!

The place is beautiful and the view of the strip adds to the ambience.  Sushi is fresh and delicious, just like you would expect from a place like this. We ordered several rolls and they were all great.  One roll was off the menu called White Lotus and was the best. If you like crunchy rolls, try it out as it had a great combination of white albacore, aspagharas, avocado and crispy onion strings. Frank was awesome!

I would expect so much more from a fancy sushi place in Vegas.  The food was very mediocre, and the drinks were okay.  I would not suggest this place to friends.  If anything, go there for the view of the strip.. although you could go to many other places and get the same.  This is a pass for me.

Went here for dinner....the view is just gorrrgeous, but the food was just "okay" for the prices.

I had the dragon roll and it was somewhat bland, but it wasn't horrible. Service was fine, except our short changed us and got her math messed up....lady, can you just use a normal calculator and not your iphone to calculate our change, then maybe you'll get it right and not confuse our whole group??? what about that?

Other than that incident, it's a nice restaurant with a good vibe and of course great view!

This place is located at Cesar's forum shops.  It is a really cute small space with modern decor.  I went there for happy hour with a friend and they have a decent menu.  We were greated right away and sat at the bar because we wanted happy hour.  There were hot and cold appetizers, sushi, sashimi and desserts to chose from.  Wine and cocktails were 5 dollars i believe.  We ordered the spicy scallop role, the spicy tuna roll, the calamari and the albacore sashimi. Everything was really good.  My favorite was the albacore.  It came with crunchy onion bits and they gave you really decent size pieces for 5 dollars.  The fish was tender, fresh and delicious.  The calimari was good too.  Squid was really small so it was a little over-fried.  I wanted more of a chewy texture.  Came with a sweet plum sauce to dip.    

The rolls were really good too.  I really liked the spicy tuna.  The bartender told us to order it with rice paper because she likes it so much better and we did.  It was alright..and we got charged a dollar extra for it.  But the fish was good and their sauce was more than just sriracha.  I also liked the spicy scallop roll but it was not as fresh as I hoped it to be.  A little too much mayo in it too.  

Drinks were good as well.  We ordered wines and they have good house selections for the price.  I would definitely come back for happy hour and for their regular menu.  Place is not crowded at all so it will be quite easy to get a table if you don't go at a prime hour.  Can't wait to visit again!

I came by on my last visit when I heard about their happy hour in the bar area. I have to admit it was pretty amazing. Everything came out fast and was warm and full of flavor.  Also, a good thing to know is if you are a local you get 20% off your check when you have dinner.
This place is ALWAYS awesome.  Great food, good cocktails, and a great atmosphere!  Go here!
Had dinner here and they helped me charge my phone! I like the noodle soup and salad is good but small. Overall a good place to go when you want sth Asian.

Roku ROCKED my world!  Fabulous view of the strip. All dishes were on par,fresh, delicious, unique, and presented nicely to us. Top it off with 5 star service, I couldn't ask for anything more! Hell yes every dollar spent was worth it here!

We were at the w waiting for Gretchen rossi's fashion show to start when we decided we would get something nearby to eat. Roku sushi is connected to the upstairs pool area, so we walked down to see if they could fit us in. It was very busy as it was a Friday night. However the hostess was able to find us a table outside. The servers and server assistants were all very helpful. We ordered drinks as well as the sushi for two people platter. Three people asked to take our drink order and three people asked if we received our order. The sushi came out first which raised a flag to ask where were the drinks we ordered.  When we finally got the drinks everything else went smoothly and the sushi was very good. The server also took it upon herself to surprise us a molten chocolate cake dessert for our wait on the drinks. Very kind and generous and I appreciate the empowerment. I know things like this happen, so I was very impressed she went beyond the call of duty to keep a certain level of service. I would say this was fantastic.

AG made reservations here (Saturday night, 6:30PM) for us to celebrate the end of YM's days as a single lady.  

AMBIANCE: Dim, sleek and sexy.  We were seated in a booth, which I think is the way to go (although the tables near the ceiling to wall glass windows with a view of the strip lights seemed nice too).  The noise level was low to start the night, but gradually got rowdy-- you could definitely tell that some of the tables were downing liquid courage.

SERVICE: Our waitress was super cute/friendly, but did mess up our drink order once.  The GM stopped by our table to say hello, but it didn't seem like we got any special treatment.

FOOD: Average.  I think there was either a set menu, or a previously decided upon order, since our food started arriving course by course as soon as our drink orders were taken.

- edamame: Sprinkled lightly with sea salt, I was disappointed the seasoning wasn't evenly distributed.  It also seemed strange that a seemingly nice place like Sushi Roku would charge for edamame (or include it as one of the charged for courses in a set menu).
- Hamachi carpaccio (1 slice of fish/person): Eh.  Also slightly disappointing.  The flavors were good (yuzu drizzle, etc), but the fish could've been fresher.  The girls really liked this dish though, so maybe its just me.
- Filet mignon wrapped asparagus (1 roll/person): Presentation was nice-- the rolls were stacked up on each other on top of a sizzling rock.  A soy glaze was poured on top before serving, and emitted an impressive amount of steam.  I ended up with a piece that was sitting on top of the rock-- the meat was fairly tough for a supposedly tender cut.  I'm also not a huge fan of asparagus, so this dish was meh for me.
- Crispy miso shrimp (several shrimps/person): My fave of the night, but it was essentially honey walnut prawns, minus the sweet mayo.
- Chicken & beef teriyaki skewers (1 of each skewer/person): The beef skewers featured nice tender chunks of beef.  The chicken wasn't as good as the beef imo, but at least they were juicy and not dry.
- Assortment of sushi (a couple pieces of sushi/person): Eh.  Par.
- Dessert trio: Cheesecake (thumbs down; it had a REALLY hard buttery crust), cinnamon sugar donut "holes" (good, very fluffy, came with caramel and vanilla dipping sauces), and a molten chocolate lava cake (very good, very lava-y).

The cocktails were hit or miss, but I really liked the bourbon one with cilantro and raspberries.

OVERALL: Solid 3 stars.  I actually have no idea how much the meal cost, so my rating may change after I see the bill.  Anything more than $40pp would be too much for what we ate.

This is a review only for their Happy Hour.  Taking in consideration Vegas prices, this place is a steal if you go during Happy Hour.  I suggest only ordering the rolls because i ordered the sashimi albacore and it was literally 2 tiny pieces. My friend ordered the calamari and it was not enough to share.  The rolls run $5-6 and the drinks (including beer and champagne) were also around $5 a pop. The dessert is around $3 and it was a decent size.   We had great service also.

For a sushi place in Vegas...  This was so good.  Omg.    In a heart beat I'll be back ...    Everything was fresh..  The chicken, steaks shrimp skewers and the sushi was all so good..  The drinks were spot on.  It is expensive though.  But hey...your in Vegas.

***GUILLERMO GUTIERREZ*** you made our experience at Sushi Roku a 5 star visit. Not only did you recommend decadent dishes, but you guided us in making all of the best decisions for both our pocket and our tummies. Everything we had from our drinks, to our appetizers, to our entrees, to our dessert was top notch quality! 

This establishment takes pride in their food to another level. Yes, it is one of those places where you pay a little more for a little less in portion, but was it worth it? Every penny! The quality of fish here is outstanding! If you're a fish snob like me, you can understand that quality matters and paying bigger bucks is worth the expense. 

It's all in the experience, and the view of the strip is pretty badass. 

Thank you to Guillermo for accommodating our need to watch the hockey game and making our satisfaction your absolute priority. Way to get personal and make us feel right at home. ARIGATO
Bring back the Crab Dynamite! Great restaurant - but now indistinguishable from the many other great sushi restaurants in Vegas,

I love sushi, and it doesn't get better unless you're in Japan. I'm a fan of the elusive bluefin "otoro" sushi, which is next to impossible to find. Sushi Roku, which means sushi 6, after the 6 chefs that started it, has both the bluefin belly as well as the choice cuts from the rest of the fish. The bluefin (Nigiri or Sashimi) will set you back $24 for 4 pieces of the choice cut Hon Maguro or $38 for 4 pieces  of the otoro belly. There's the master chef "Makuto San" who has a rotating staff of 5 assistants that he supervises. The master chef was born in Japan, and unlike most of the sushi chefs in Arizona, is actually Japanese and not Korean. They actually have REAL Kobe beef at Sushi Roku, which is also next to impossible to find. When ordering Kobe anything, please pronounce it "Ko Bay" not "Ko Bee" like a certain moron who's parents are too dumb to name their son properly. When ordering Sake, either Salmon or the drink, please pronounce it "Saw Kay" not "Saw Key," you will avoid sounding uneducated. Remember that the best Sake alcohol is served cold, not hot and comes in several different varieties as wine does, and has subtle changes that will please pallet. Please enjoy, it's a great place to eat.

Listen to your server when she tells you to order appetizers. 

The fluke sashimi in yuzu is fantastic. The bf still talks about it a year later and says it changed his understanding of what good fish is.

The rolls are totally forgettable and very small for what you pay. I honestly can't recall what else we ate there.

The service is great - everyone is a real sweetheart and our server had a wonderfully dry sense of humor. She also helped us stay within our budget (we tend to go WAY overboard when we do a la carte). 

The sake was served at the perfect temperature. 

Honestly, the three stars are because I think your money is better spent elsewhere in Vegas and because there's such a huge difference in quality/value in items on the menu. The sashimi was some of the best I've ever had, the rolls were some of the worst. 

But the fluke was so good that the bf suggested going back just for that.

If you are looking between here and Roka Akor, as there are many similarities on the surface, I STRONGLY suggest you choose Sushi Roku.  We visited Roka Akor last weekend, had a nigiri and drinks course, left and went to Sushi Roku, and were so glad we did!  (Research!)

Sushi Roku had a great atmosphere, once you got in.  Parking is a bit tricky as the W valet was overwhelmed, but once we were settled into the cozy, elegant booth things were 100%.  Great service, delicious pieces of tuna (best bluefin!), salmon (including a fatty king!), albacore (not seared like Roka Akor!), chutoro and otoro.  Prices were a skosh high but we all understand Phoenix is not on the ocean.  Between us we also tried two cocktails and a joyous sake flight that was presented with a complete non-condescending explanation.  Large group of happy-looking women flanked the dining area along the banquette and couples and groups alike held down the booths in the middle.  We felt like we were somewhere :-) but somewhere that invites all.

Roka Akor, parking was a breeze and the hostess was a darling but everything else was supersnob, especially the sushi chef who wouldn't serve us our food (even though we were seated at the sushi bar in front of him) but preferred to yell to a server to come bring it to us.  The restaurant was also pretty empty.  Food was meh at best.

I saw this restaurant on yelp and figured I'd give it a try. I made a reservation on open table because we needed to eat before heading to see the Backstreet Boys! When walking in we were greeted warmly by the staff and chefs. The ambiance and decorations are comforting and fit well with the type of cuisine. We ordered edamame and two rolls and I felt like we were moaning with every bite. One of the rolls (something with crab I think?) tasted like it was broiled over a flame and it was absolutely the best tasting roll I've ever had in my life. We ended the meal with their take on s'mores, which was served on a plate of crushed graham cracker with a small flame to melt the marshmallow, chocolate pieces and mochi.
