It was cute, packed with flavor, but difficult to eat. Still, we really enjoyed our experience and will definitely come back here the next time we check out Vegas!

This place amazing I took my boyfriend here for sushi and he loved it 
The ambiance was great every plate we ordered was great and even the drinks were great. I do think this place should have $$$$ instead of $$$ because our bill was like $250 but hey its Vegas baby. Even at the end they gave us a free birthday shot which taste like chocolate mmmm really good and a tiramisu cake which was just divine. We left happy and full and it was a great time. Even the service was great I'm actually really impressed at how nice Vegas people are oh and yes ill def come again

We came on a Sunday night, and I think that was the perfect night to go. Originally, I had made reservations on opentable but had to cancel due to changing plans. I ended up going anyway, and we were seated right away. However, the waitress told us that the night before was insane and completely packed. She was really friendly :)

We ordered:
2 Eastern Mules (I think that's what it was called... deeelicious)
Kobe Gyoza (yum!)
Deep fried sea bass (om nom nom)
filet mignon (i cannot attest to this plate but I can say that my spouse licked the plate clean)

Drinks were on point, gyoza yummy, and fish soooooooo good!!

Rolls sounded pretty yummy too.. I was happy with my choice to come here!

this place serves average sushi at premium sushi prices. we sat at the bar, and the sushi chefs and waitress were somewhat attentive, but nothing could make up for the flavorless, lackluster tuna and slimy uni. i didn't try any rolls, or tempura/cooked dishes. if you're looking for great, fresh fish in vegas, this is not the place.

After talking with friends and getting recommendations, was looking forward to dinner. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to expectations. Edamame came out burnt, the short ribs were extremely overcooked, and the lobster roll had some sort of cheese/Benedict sauce on it that wasn't appetizing. Maybe it was just an off night, but we were disappointed to say the least.

Yeah, this is without a doubt the best meal we had in Vegas - and it wasn't even a meal in the traditional sense.  We had their Happy Hour, which my wife assured me would be LIKE a meal.  I don't usually believe her when she says stuff like that.

This was outstanding.  Lots of vegetarian options and the food was out of this world good.  I'm still thinking about the sweet potato roll I had and even better was this amazing mushroom tempura.  I am not someone that believes Happy Hour food = a meal but in this case,  I was sold.  We had so much food we had to take some back to our hotel.  And the service at the bar was perfect.  Cannot recommend enough.  This is the best deal in Vegas.

i've been here twice.  it has a good view of the strip and the ambiance is nice, but the food and the price don't go well together.  the chilean sea bass appetizer was good and we did order 2 of those, but everything else was just alright.  the sushi rolls we ordered weren't spectacular either.  the baked lobster roll was pretty plain and the spicy rock shrimp tasted pretty ordinary.  ummm...if you want to eat somewhere for view and ambiance and have a mediocre meal that costs more than mediocre, then this is the place to go.  it's not terrible, just don't expect food that's greatness.   happy sushi roku-ing.

Yum! Summer picked Sushi Roku for her Vegas birthday celebration dinner and I'm so happy that she did! The six of us were seated at an awesome round table with a super view of the Las Vegas strip.

We started with a large order of sake-bombing materials (two of the six were sake-bombing virgins!) and a couple of the signature cocktails. I tried the lycee mojito which was good but not lycee-y enough and the other girls loved the tropical peach passion and lycee martini. 

We ordered a wide variety of dishes to share and for personal consumption. I liked the crispy chicken appetizer with yummy dipping sauce and the spicy tuna and california rolls. I usually love eel sushi but our eel was overly fishy. Summer tried a signature roll with tuna, cilantro, and more which was yummy though wasabi-infused and spicy! The salty edaname were also very good and Rachel couldn't stop raving about the sea bass main dish. 

Our sweet waitress gave us a complimentary birthday sake jug and a fun mini-birthday celebration of molten chocolate cake and a crazy sparkler. For about $65 each, we all left satiated and ready to party!

Delish!

Well, this super cool spot was my favorite sushi spot in LA, CA and now they have graced Scottsdale!  I would compare it to Asia De Cuba (but better - not trying that hard) and decor blows ADC away! 

Very hip and not too crowded (yet).  Hope it can keep a trendy feel (while still remaining sophisticated).  All sushi rolls were great and loved the Filet Mignon wrapped Asparagus (very tiny, but tasty) Loved banana desert & signature cocktails.

The decor is amazing.  Upstairs bar with pool is pure eye candy.  Love the red shades.  A back drop for a great night out for sure.

Service was AMAZING.  Hostess was friendly and professional, GM came to our table - very cool and nice.  Waitress rocked - what more can I say?  LOVED IT!  Going back again tonight!

They charge $50 for 8 pieces of sushi. This place should have four dollar signs instead of three!!!!! It was okay. The price is not worth it and no one was even full. The service was pretty bad too. We had to ask for wasabi and ginger.

I did not expect to find good sushi out in the desert. This place was a very pleasant surprise. We were seated at a square table with comfortable leather bench seats for all. The big windows gave us a great view of the strip.

Props to our waiter for pushing the yellowtail diced chilies hard. In addition to the great service he provided, his recommendation was maybe the best thing we ate. 

We ordered several rolls, most of them some variation on spicy tuna. We also ordered the crab roll. With the exception of the tuna jalapeno roll, all of them were great. Nothing mind blowing creatively, just quality ingredients and great execution. The jalapeno in the tuna jalapeno roll was just too spicy and washed out all of the other flavors. Just remove the jalapeno and you have a fine tuna roll. In addition to the rolls we ordered the short rib fried rice which was also delicious.

For dessert we had the donut holes and the green tea tiramisu. The tiramisu was a little light on flavor and I wasn't a big fan of the donuts but at this point I was completely full so I wasn't in the best position to judge.

The bill also wasn't as much as I'd expected to be. Good times.
We had the soft shell crab roll. It tasted like shrimp that had the tail on and was rolled in sand. Very odd flavor and textures. The staff is really nice though.

Great service, amazing Sushi, conveniently located in the Caesars palace shopping forum. I was thoroughly impressed with everything we had. Which included the Katana roll, Dynamite Roll (which was outstanding), rainbow roll, and various Sashimi.

I am an avid patron of sushi restaurants and had never tried sushi roku before this past weekend when my girlfriend and I decided to give it a try. Immediately I felt comfortable with the decor, lighting and layout; it felt like a place I would enjoy. All of those emotions came to fruition with our server, John. He was friendly, energetic and clearly knowledgeable and able to answer all of our questions. Then the food came brining it all together. Starting with the edamame and though out all of our various rolls, I was very pleased. With all of this said, I cannot wait to come back and have recommended sushi roku to some friends ( and to sit in John's section if at all possible)

Grade A sushi quality.  A few specialty rolls...outstanding. I came for lunch. Pleasant staff though service flow was rushed.  I detest all courses being delivered at once.  Other than that the dishes were beautifully prepared and presented. I'm really a fan of the crunchy spicy tuna roll!
Excellent Sushi. Very good view. Service was excellent. Not a fan of the signature cocktails. Expensive, but this is Vegas... So to be expected.

Good sushi spot, cool views of the strip. typical vegas prices, ie you get half the quality at twice the price, but how else can they build all those casinos? cant rely on gambling loses anymore i guess. we very much enjoyed the meal. sushi was VERY slow coming out. everything else was quick  and good.

Very surprised with the quality of sushi here. Even though Vegas is in the middle of the desert the fish was FRESH! I highly recommend this place, the service was great and we got a great view. 

The only complaint I have is that the hot stone plate I ordered wasn't what I was expecting. It was still good though!

I'm not a huge Sushi person, but our host was, so game on!  I had the Makoto Roll
(Spicy Yellowtail & Shrimp Tempura wrapped wtih Seared Tuna,
Spicy Creamy Sauce 17) and it was the best of all the things we had.  I don't even know what the others ordered, but they were all just ok.  The atmosphere is really chic, the wait staff is helpful and attentive.  Our host had said this was a great place, but I wasn't overly impressed, though I would never say that to him.  Maybe if I was more of sushi person I would have thought more highly of it?

Sushi Roku is very elegant and romantic. The perfect spot for a date, really. It has an awesome view, is dimly lit, and it just makes you want to cuddle a little closer together. 

My experience here was great. If I had been the one to pay, though, I probably wouldn't feel the same way. We ordered 2 Miso soups with Tofu, a Sashimi combo (6 pieces), the Crunchy Spicy Tuna w/ Avocado Roll, the Katana Roll, Green Tea fried ice cream, and some banana dessert. The portions were smaller than usual, but the quality, I would agree, was also better than the typical. The total came out to be a little over $100, not including tip. 

Thanks, Bug, for such a romantic and fun date. Swooooon. :)

We came here for a really fun birthday celebration! The decor is stunning, and views of the strip are amazing. What really cracks me up is that front and center is the Imperial Palace, and I have never seen it look so good as from this vantage. 

The lychee martini was to die for, and sake bombs tasted like sake bombs always taste. Once the waitress found out we were celebrating a birthday she comped a bottle of sake! I loved our crispy chicken appetizer with delicious dipping sauce. Our rolls were decent, but the eel was a little off. The sushi wasn't as fresh as I am used to, but you are in the middle of the desert for god's sake! 

The birthday desert was the best part of the meal! They brought out this crazy sparkler that shot sparks about 2 feet above the table. I was seriously worried birthday girl was going to get burned by more than the sake. Sushi Roku had it under control. The chocolate cake and vanilla ice cream they brought out was great, and they were super quick with our bill as soon as we let them know we were running late.

We walked up to the empty restaurant around 9:45/10 and there was no hostess. She saw us and took her time to come back and asked us if we had a reservation with a lot of attitude. She even made an exaggerated sigh as if we seemed to bother her. We ended up leaving and eating at Nobu which is the better option!

Decided to dine here our last night in Vegas on a whim. Needed someplace we could just walk in. This was perfect! Went early evening with my husband and another couple and were seated immediately. It was Sunday night and pretty quiet. I ordered a dirty martini right off thebat. It was served quickly and was perfect. We decided to order some soups and a couple of rolls to start. The soup was delicious, just what I want in a miso soup. The waiter was very helpful in suggesting what rolls we might like and what looked good that evening. All were quite tasty and beautifully presented, simple but beautiful. He was very patient with us as we like to order just a couple of items at a time so as not to crowd the table or over eat. Great view of the strip as well. Prices were reasonable and I would definitely come again.

Good sushi makes me cry.  This night, I was a baby that couldn't stop.  Seriously, wow.  Hot damn.  More please.  Expensive? Yes, but who really cares when it is mind blowing good.

I started with a Lychee Mojoito (tasty) and miso soup (average to good).  My world officially became rocked when the Hanabi: Spicy Tuna over a Crispy Rice Cake came to the table.  I'm sure if I saw a video of my reaction, I would be completely embarrassed but I can honestly say it was one of the best hot appetizers I have ever had. My poor waitress had to put up with me through all this.  I'm so sorry.

We ordered two rolls, Shima roll: spicy tuna & avo w/shrimp, cilantro & wrapped with soypaper; and the Baked Lobster Roll: Lobster & asparagus on the inside and a baked yellow sauce consisting of sweet miso & egg.  I was in sushi heaven.

Great service, awesome atmosphere, pretty good chill music for the environment.  All this with a beer and another mixed drink, approx $150.  

You can not stop me from going back the next time I'm in Vegas.
This place is AMAZING. Food, drinks, atmosphere was fun, exciting, and delicious. Thank you Dan for taking care of your customers! Me and my friends will be back 100%! This is a must go restaurant!

Like this place, came the day after thanksgiving for lunch, and it was nice, the place wasn't that busy, but it meant service was great.  Waiter recommended some items that didn't disappoint.  We didn't drink, but had a look over the Saki menu, looked good.

Wonderful Japanese cuisine. I am not a Japanese so I am not sure if the food here is authentic, but what I am sure is that the food tastes great. This place has unique cuisines like mako sushi and katana roll that are definitely worth trying. Food is well prepared and fresh.

Had an amazing meal experience! Everything was extremely delicious. Fresh sushi, great flavors, great service. CJ knows everything about the menu and made amazing suggestions, request him! Baked King Crab roll anyone. Half price wine bottles on Sunday and Monday too! Will definitely be going back!
Really wasn't impressed. Ordered several different rolls and an appetizer but meh. Service was fine, got seated right away. There's gotta be better sushi  somewhere else in LV.
Went here for a birthday. The food was good and the service was good, I would go definitely go bavk again (especially since I found out they have a happy hour)

We ate here on the first day of our trip to Las Vegas. We quickly learned that happy hour was the best time to check out the restaurants we were most looking forward to, Sushi Roku was one. Located at the forum shoppes at Caesars, we were quickly pleased with their happy hour menu, lots of delicious choices. 

There was not a huge amount of bar seating, a smaller bar and a family style high top table were the only options. We ended up having to wait a little for two seats together. After we did we were quickly greeted by our waiter. 

I ordered Hanabi- spicy tuna on crispy rice, an organic garden salad with yuzu ginger, a salmon avocado roll, shrimp tempura with asparagus and Wagyu Skewers (not on happy hour menu) along with a glass of their happy hour champagne. 

I loved the hanabi. It was absolutely delicious and something I have never had before. The salad was not the typical Japanese salad I was hoping for, it was just Ok, this was something I could have done without. The salmon avocado roll was delicious and exactly what I was hoping it would be. I was pleasantly surprised at how much I liked the shrimp tempura with asparagus because typically I don't care for asparagus. So far, so good. 

Here is where I knocked off a star for the overall review. Never having wagyu before I didn't know what to expect it to look or taste like but I have heard incredible things about this particular meat. I was very clear in ordering the Wagyu skewers. However come to find out thats not what I got and unfortunately I didn't realize until after I had ate them. I saw a plate of actual beef and skewers pass me and I realized...thats definitely not what I got and I didn't even enjoy it. So I looked back at the menu and what I received was the Rib-eye wrapped asparagus. How does one screw that up? They don't even sound similar. But again, I just figured okay the asparagus was the skewer and I had no idea what the Wagyu would have tasted like because I had never had it. I was beyond disappointed. I called over the server and I asked him what it was that was brought to me. He said, It was the rib eye asparagus. I kindly replied, that wasn't what I ordered. His response "oh I rang it in wrong" ... no apology or anything? Then not only that, but I was charged for what I didn't even order and mistakenly ate. Had I not ate it, I would not have accepted this but being that I ate it I just let it go. However being that he acknowledged he rang it in wrong, he should have compensated in some way. This was incredibly disappointing. 

Overall we enjoyed our meal. Aside from our server- issues and the rib eye wrapped asparagus which I did not enjoy, I would still recommend this for anyone looking for a sushi happy hour.

My girlfriend and I had a last minute trip to Las Vegas on Valentine's Day and of course just about everything was booked! So we went on Open Table and found out Sushi Roku had late night reservations. We went for a nice stroll and went to our dinner. We were sat at an great table next to an exquisite view of the Las Vegas strip. It was very romantic, the crowd was very hip, and the attire was semi-casual. We ordered the truffle edamame (definite recommendation) and 3 rolls of sushi to split. Don't bother going to Kabuki or any second rate sushi place because the sushi here is delicious! The only thing I would complain about is the price but you pay for quality and you look like a stud waving the check to your date at the end of the night!

Wow. I'm not easy to please, but this place just became a must visit on every trip to Vegas for us. Sushi Roku and Mesa Grill. Those are our two must hit spots. 

The Salmon Carrasco and the Matsu were unreal. Tuna Poke was delicious, and the Chocolate lava cake was equally amazing. Nothing that we ordered was less than excellent. 

Service was perfect. 

Cocktails were good. A bit underwhelming for the $15 price tag, but all were good. Their beer selection even had a couple of beers that I haven't had, which is rare. 

All in all, a home run.

This is the sushi place you need to go to instead of nobu.  For a fraction of the price you get sushi that is just as delicious, and with happy hour bar and sushi prices.  Can't beat it.  Last time I was in Vegas I literally went to nobu, spent $100 alone, then left and went to sushi roku and spent $35 and got full. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the food is delicious.  Some of my favorite sushi ever, not just in Vegas.  It's hidden way at the top of the Caesars forum shops, but it's well worth it to go and eat there. So delicious!!

We ate here mainly because the online menu looked like "normal" sushi. Although when we got there, it was mostly Japanese entrees with some sushi. I personally like the Americanized sushi rolls that contain very little raw fish. I know that's not what real sushi is, but I'd rather not eat a moving octopus.  Anyways, they had some good stuff. We had the Crunchy Tuna roll and the Katana roll. The Crunch roll was amazing, it had spicy tuna inside. The Katana roll had raw tuna on the top that was like warm, not a fan of warm raw fish. But it looked nice. 

The atmosphere was interesting. It was super dark inside like a fancy restaurant but the techno music was so loud that I couldn't  have a conversation at all. The staff was super nice and very helpful though. 

Did I like it?; sort of. Would I come back?: No.

Sparklers on your birthday?! Count me IN!

FOOD: My friend ordered the scallops with foie gras..and then ordered two more for the table. NO JOKE. This dish is a MUST ORDER. The scallops were cooked to perfection. Me, not being a big fan of foie gras, even loved the combination. I ordered the hot soba, which was pretty good! Their rolls are a good serving size, so I would suggest ordering rolls or an entree and splitting the scallops. Did I mention that they're amazing???

SERVICE: Our waitress was super nice. When the restaurant was a little less busy (we were seated at 5:30PM), the manager even came over and asked us how everything was. Superb service! We had mentioned that it was our friend's birthday that day, so they came out at the end with molten chocolate cake and THE MOST AWESOME SPARKLER EVER. Seriously, such good service.

Why the three stars? Everything was pretty expensive, and there is much more for your money on the strip. If it were anywhere else, this place would definitely get a four!

Lovely atmosphere and truly AMAZING sushi!  High quality sushi, created by knowledgeable sushi chefs.  The nigiri was perfection. Can't go wrong here; it's all delectable. 

Our server was great too. 

There was a large party dining at the same time and it did not affect the timing in our meal.

My relationship with Sushi Roku is a love hate thing, from beginning to end. I went with a group of 7 friends on opening day and we were able to get a reservation simply based on our positions at various hotels around the valley, and saw a 30 minute wait after our 8:30PM reservation, which was ok seeing as they squoze us in. When I pulled up, I was amazed at all the vehicles in the valet lot, so I kept driving and parked around the corner. The place made me feel small from the beginning!

The entire space is beautiful and very well done. It's hip, yet upscale, and a very fun atmosphere. The servers are very friendly even though some of them are not fully trained in the restaurant. The food I had was delicous. Tuna on fried brown rice cake was delicious, as was the salmon and toro sushi. The yakatori sticks were very bland and almost seemed as though they were done with a greek seasoning, rather than a sweet Japanese. The food did come out quickly, even on a day when the place was packed way over capacity. Drinks, however, were not so quick. I had 2 greyhounds @ 14 each and I swear neither of them had any alcohol in them and have heard similar grumblings from others as well. I have to assume their bartenders have previous experience from other places, but it didn't seem as such. I heard a LOT of smashed glasses as well. The whole night seemed like a mess for them.

The restrooms were very cool, if not a bit confusing. They told me to go in through the door to the restrooms and I saw a lot of women standing around and figured I was headed for the womens room. But infact the men and women share the communal sinks and waiting areas, but have their own bathroom area, which was different. I feel the atmosphere was definitely typical Scottsdale but a little different in some areas where it was obvoius they put some neat touches in it. 

I had one major gripe with the place, a little out of the restaurants control, was the overzealous attitude of their loss prevention department. These guys thought they were professional bouncers at Las Vegas night clubs.  We had been going back and forth between the restaurant and the lobby all night with no problems. At one point a big black guy said I cant come in, and this was after my whole party just went in front of me. I said "look count chocula, I've been in here all night, and all of my friends just walked by you. Don't stand there and tell me your hands are tied or you are over capicaty or something like that, because I know it is bs. I'm going past you." His co-worker came over and told him to let me in. The guy would have beat  me into the ground if he had wanted to but it worked out. 

They need to get their security department going in a proper fashion, and work on the bar quite a bit, and the place will be a real winner. I'm sure that it will come with time, so I'm giving it 4 stars under the assumption that it is going to improve in time.

Holy sh*t this place is awesome. First, the atmosphere - it's loud, lots of people, fun music. Cool interior design and lots of big windows to look out over the strip. 

More importantly - the food. Wow. I don't want to say too much lest I oversell here, but it was soooo good! We started with the shishito peppers - very crunchy and good spice. We also ordered the Brussels sprouts - so delicious with chunks of bacon and sweet sauce. Then we had the katana sushi roll - the fish just melted in my mouth. We then had the toro roll, which was delicious and had a wonderful crunch from the jalapeño (but not very spicy). My friend ordered the pork belly fried rice - such a delicious, flavorful bite with fantastic texture and yummy egg. She also had the braised ribs which had a wonderful, unexpected melange of flavors. Our other friend ordered the chicken, which was delicious if not a little boring in comparison to all of the other amazing flavors on the table.

I'm not too crazy about sushi, but I loved Sushi Roku!

We had to wait quite a while for our table, so we had some apps and drinks at the bar. When we were seated, we put ourselves in the waitress' hands and left the ordering to her. I think it might have been the chef's tasting menu.

We were pretty full on the soup and apps, so by the time the sushi came out, I was pretty full, but tried the sushi anyway. if I can eat at Sushi Roku every time I try sushi, I may learn to love it after all...

Was seated and ignored for 5 minutes, no greeting. Then the waitress comes up asking if I was "ready to order?" Of course I said yes because I didn't know if she would come back if I had said "no".

Where the service lacked, the fish was their saving grace. Had the yellowtail sashimi and their specialty roll - the Titan! Delicious all around. Wish I could do 2.5 stars cause that was my overall experience.
WOW! This place is amazing. Great service, fresh sushi, and the mixed drinks are to die for.
Great find for us only being here for 2 nights. Probably top 3 sushi I've eaten. Adam our server was excellent. Recommended some great dishes. May even come back tomorrow night to try rest of menu.

Service was great!!! 

Food was good.  Now I understand the difference between normal mackarel and japanese mackarel.  Japanese one is better.

Portion sizes were very very very small.  We ordered the Omakase, and left hungry.  Had to stop at I *Heart* Burgers at the Palazzo shops to fill up.  So, go for a snack, not a meal.
The sushi is sublime. You will not be dissappointed. Very expensive but worth it I think.
nice decor, view of the strip at certain spots, good variety of sushi, just get ready to spend bank if you want to try all the good stuff, this place is a bit expensive...

An absolute favorite of ours!! The food is outstanding, service impeccable, and just an overall wonderful dining experience. My husband has eaten sushi in many places and feels this is by far the best, and for the non sushi lovers the steak is amazing. Can't wait to go back.

Great atmosphere. Wait staff are all young men who are very polished and extremely polite. Our waiter was very excited to talk about the vast variety of sake available, and through a series of a couple of quick questions , he was able to identify what sake he could recommend. And he was got it right! The food was great. The salmon capriccio was excellent

Celebrated my spouse bday last night at Sushi Roku LV. It's located at the forum shops 2nd Floor. Love the ambiance and it's not too loud inside. Food was good but not that great. Their lava cake is a must try! The best I had so far! Will comeback next time and will try their happy hour.

Halibut.  Yellow-tail belly. Seaweed salad. Katana roll, Tori Jalapeno.  Sushi Chef.

Dinner was good, service has been generally good on most dinners here, but every so often I will get left alone and not helped properly.

The sushi is generally good however, extremely over priced compared to other sushi places in the area.

Very trendy and worth a visit, however, unless you are staying at the W, i doubt it would become a regular stop, outside of their AMAZING happy hour specials.

Inventive, creative dishes in a weird location. 

Yes it's mall sushi. But Vegas mall sushi means ignoring the entrance near the dress shop and escalator and sitting by the window overlooking the strip.

With hip decor and a robust menu, there's a lot here to like even before taking your first bite.

And the first bite changes everything. Butter poached lobster. Truffle edamame. Ginger marinated octopus with citrus. Even things that you've had taste unique. It's not to be missed.
This is sushi and service at its finest, though you will pay for it. I'd suggest dressing up for this place. After dinner try the W hotel's rooftop bar.

Good sushi.  Retarded servers and infested with snobby young Scottsdale douche bags.

If i were to go again, I would go before the Snottsdale kids wake up and I would sit at the bar :-)

Went here for Happy Hour with my daughter.  We didn't have our car so when I Yelped sushi restaurants on the strip, not many came up. I felt that the price was right for happy hour, the service was mediocre, but the food items were hit and miss.  Some were amazing and others were just "meh." The California rolls were surprisingly bland. We had an amazing sashimi fish dish that was served with ponzu sauce and had some yummy, fried brown onions on top. It was so good we ordered another!  
Overall though, don't expect a lot from this place. Consistency throughout is what I look for in any restaurant and we were desperate for sushi so unfortunately I would say, we kind of settled.  We did feel satiated in the end because we got our sushi fix, but I won't ever go back again.

Stopped by, had a couple of rolls, a bit of salmon nigiri and some tuna poke, a beer and sparking water. 

Not bad, just like its franchise brethren here in LA, and one of the better sushi places in the Vegas hotels but at a price point that wont suggest you're actually in Tokyo.

Brussels Sprouts chips were good. Cosmopolitan was great! Spicy tuna roll was sort of good. Beef wrapped asparagus was great! Only thing that was unusual was when we were walking in and the staff was yelling out, but I suppose enough people like it to the point where it's become their "thing". The waitress was super nice especially considering the fact that she was working December 24th.

Do not under any circumstances try and get to this place by going through Caesers....you will go hungry :-(   We made that mistake and 40 minutes later, on foot, we finally found it.     At this point, it was worth it because we were frustrated, needed a drink and were super hungry after the unexpected workout.   That being said, they must get that often because they held our reservation or they just weren't that busy.   I'm guessing it's the latter.  In it's hey day, it was probably the talk of the town and it's still a nice restaurant with just a touch of over ambiance but they do offer gorgeous views of the strip.    The food was great  and priced really well if you need a sushi fix.   Our waitress was super nice and on top of the service.   We let her know that we were short on time and had to make a show.   She was attentive but not pushy and made sure we got our food timely.   Ask for recommendations on food because there are a number of special rolls that are available and not on the menu.   The Lotus roll in particular was very good.

There is seating by the windows and booths along the wall.   Ask for the booth because it is more comfortable and also a raised section, that's where the best view of the strip can be found.

This place is located on the 3rd level of the Cesar's Palace Shops.  It was a bit of a walk, but well worth it.  We were craving sushi, so we were looking at all the reviews on yelp and decided to give this place a try.  Came at about Noon on a Tuesday, so it wasn't busy at all. We ordered the following:

- Salmon sashimi - the color is a bright orange and the taste was so fresh.  Definitely a very good grade of sashimi.  It's buttery and melts in your mouth. 

- Cucumber roll - this was very good as well.  Most of the time cucumber rolls are just ok everywhere, but this was delicious. 

- Spicy Tuna roll - I love spicy tuna rolls and this one was very good.  Just enough tuna and spiciness to make it a great roll.

- Pork Belly Fried rice - my husband loved this and so did I.  The fried rice is already packed with flavors, but when you mix the pieces of pork belly with it, it adds an explosion in your mouth.  So delicious!

- Uni pasta - this one was very disappointing. I've had uni pasta before, but this one just tasted like an alfredo sauce with pieces of uni. 

Overall the sushi was great.  It's a bit pricey, so be prepared, but you get what you pay for.  Good sushi doesn't come cheap.  Staff was friendly and service was fast with the exception of my uni pasta.  That one took a little bit longer then everything else, but the server did prepare me for that.  I would definitely come back here for the fresh sushi and the fried rice next time I'm in town.

We found this gem on Open Table and after checking reviews on Yelp, and decided to dine here while visiting for a conference. The three of us were very impressed by the quality of the sushi. The White Lotus roll was amazing, the albacore just melted in our mouths. The Tuna Jalapeno,Eel Avocado, garden roll, Curry and California roll were also just as amazing. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal and the light and fruity cold sake. Will definitely be back when in Vegas again!

I would love to give this place more than 3 stars. But the service was the worst part of the experience. They serve happy hour all night on Sundays which made up for the bad service. I ordered a pear martini which took forever to get and it's even worst when you are trying to get the attention of someone to order a beverage or food. They were busy watching the football game, And avoiding the table. But the pear martini was delicious. The albacore salsa roll was very flavorful! We also ordered a few spicy salmon and spicy tuna roll. The Kobe slider with bacon jam was sooo good! Didn't expect that. Most defiantly recommend that on the happy our menu along with the albacore salsa roll. The tempera asparagus with aioli sauce was also not so good. Too thick and crunchy tempera almonds a more simple asparagus would have been better with the sauce. Overall I enjoyed the night but probably would only go back to try the main menu on a different day then Sunday, unless I'm up for happy hour and a pear martini.

Beautiful restaurant! Terrrific service! 

Wonderful, fresh and authentic cuisine - what more can I say but don't miss the Carpaccio!

This is really only for the breakfast served at the W hotel...I didn't eat here during lunch or dinner...but bfast was good.  It's a little pricey, but the service is super friendly and the restaurant itself is nice.  Swanky.

It was uber convenient so all good with me.

A friend and I stopped by during their happy hour. The bartender was real nice and held a good conversation. The sushi though was underwhelming. No real taste and left us unimpressed. Wouldn't stop here again but I imagine you could do worse.

I was part of the large group mentioned by another reviewer. I was lucky enough to get the undercooked chicken. I've been very ill since. The chicken was an appetizer and came as part of our tasting menu that the restaurant created for us. I'll never forget the experience because of my current state of hell. Thank you so much for trying to kill me.

Seriously....so glad we found this spot last year and returned during our week in Vegas. The happy hour is amazing and the bartenders they have now are cool. Good vibe in there for sure. Will return when we are back in town! Thanks guys!

My favorite sushi place in Vegas. We went to several sushi places in Vegas while we were there and this one was easily the best. The rolls were great and we went during their happy hour so they were also well priced. The food is fresh, the service is great and the location (view of the strip) was phenomenal.

I hate shopping because it makes me hungry. So, after a half a day of shopping at Forum Shops, we went to Sushi Roku. They have big tables and couches so you're not cramped/ feeling claustrophobic.

Since we weren't terribly hungry, we only ordered a few rolls/nigiri ($7-22 or market price): black truffle tempura handroll, salmon, albacore uni and tuna. We also ordered from the specials menu ($6-90). With a glass of Riesling in hand, we got...

Yellowtail-wrapped Foie Gras with Truffle Soy:
My eyes automatically scope out "foie gras" and "truffle" and send a signal to my taste buds that I'm about to have something amazing in my mouth. So amazing that my hands did not get a signal to take pictures. You'll just have to try it to know how beautiful this is. 5/5

Robata Style Japanese Wagyu Beef with Hawaiian Pink Salt:
You get a nice presentation of your skewer on its own robata grill and a spoon with pink rock salt. The wagyu is tender and fatty - feels nice on the tongue. The pink salt accentuates the flavor of the wagyu. 5/5

Scallop and Foie Gras Togarashi with Black Pepper and White Truffle Oil:
It's like a re-run of the first dish I had except this time, I got distracted by the black pepper taste. The scallops were perfectly cooked. 4/5

Blue Fin Tuna Sushi:
The fish was at the right temperature. The texture of the rice was just right. The fish to rice ratio was perfect. 5/5

Black Truffle Tempura Handroll:
This is wrapped in a thin soy paper. There's avocado inside. The truffle flavor is in the sauce. 4/5

The service was excellent. Our server was attentive.

Went here for lunch - great sushi (especially the Shima roll and the Tako roll) and nice view of the Las Vegas strip. The owner, Johnny Seo, made a point of coming round, talking with people, and really connecting. Rare you find someone as passionate and caring about his restaurant and guests. Definitely coming back!
Great service great food it's almost as good Nobu minus the Ambience and 1/3 of the price  ... The staff was very knowledgeable staff... Their sashimi toro was very fresh....

Great place for lunch in Scottsdale! Free valet parking, and you can also hang out at the pool upstairs afterwards. It's a great way to beat the heat! They have bento boxes for $10-$15. Can't beat a deal like that, especially since it is very fresh fish. Excellent sushi!

Excellent service, great sake selection. My new favorite place for sushi in Las Vegas. Ask for a table by the window. Great atmosphere easy to have a conversation but still overall good vibe.  Just simply cannot say enough good things. Try the Kim Chee.

One of the Best Sushi places in Vegas!  We went here for a friend's birthday and have returned twice because we can not stop thinking about it.  We ordered so much food, I tried almost everything on the menu and there was was nothing on the menu I didn't like.  The service was second to none and the food was an experience I will never forget.  The flavors and presentation are awesome.  If you have never been, go and if you have gone and weren't impressed go back and give it another try. . . this spot ROCKS!

Meh. Came in for sushi after reading pretty good reviews. It just so happened to be happy hour score! They had 6 piece sushi rolls for 6 bucks cant beat that and specialty rolls 30% off. Tried two happy hour rolls and one tempura  spicy tuna roll. The tempura oddly enough tasted stale/old just not good at all. The other rolls one with rock shrimp and one with scallops. I didn't really care for the rock shrimp one like eat one piece and done. The scallop one wasnt awful. Overall really unimpressed. The bar tender was nice on a positive note.

The main reason I'm giving 5 stars is for the Bluefin Sashimi that they do topped with shaved black truffles, truffle oil, microgreens, and parmesan cheese. It's an unexpected flavor combo, but it is downright euphoric and should not be missed. I can actually say that this is the best sushi dish I've ever eaten and it's hard to go back to eating sashimi sans truffles. When Bluefin is not in season, you can get it with regular tuna or salmon and they are both amazing. It's not always on the menu, but if you ask, they'll make it. I've tried ordering this dish at other Sushi Roku locations, but instead of using shaved black truffles, they use a measely amount of these sorry crumbled truffle bits. It just doesn't compare.

The other 5 star dish is the Tempura Fried Green Tea Ice Cream. Its a chunk of ice cream encased in a little  spongecake "box" which is then dipped in tempura batter and deep fried. It's also topped with a little raspberry sauce drizzle and garnished with fresh berries. The cake insulates the ice cream so it doesn't melt when they fry it. Not only is the flavor outstanding, but the crunchy tempura combined with the softest spongecake I've ever had is pure heaven.

Some of the other dishes here are just kind of so-so and they are usually quite salty. I LOVE the spicy tuna on crispy rice at Katsu-ya, so when I saw that item on the menu here, I was excited to try it. Unfortunately theirs is extremely greasy so be prepared to blot the hell out of it.

My family and I have dined at Sushi Roku on a few occasions and have had the pleasure of having "Bianca" as our waitress almost every time. She has always delivered excellent service & is great at recommending items to fit our taste buds. Whether it be a glass of Kistler Chardonnay...or our newfound favorite Yuzu Salmon Roll. She even spoke to the chefs to have them add jalapeños to our roll when we wanted a little "kick." Overall, Sushi Roku has great food, ambiance, & excellent service due to employees like Bianca.

Great location, ambiance, and food...who would have thought you could get quality sushi in the desert???

Yes it's more California style sushi vs. traditional but more mass appeal for a place like Scottsdale.  Baked lobster roll was absolutely delicious.  Spent about $200 for 4 people, but we did have sake, wine and beer to go with our meal.  Would gladly come back.

The server was a bit arrogant when we tried to order dessert after we paid our bill....Bento box lunch was OK...the fresh sushi rolls tasted somewhat better. Just disappointing for the location of this restaurant.

We used to love this place and would have previously rated 5/5 but our most recent experience was horrendous food. 

I'm wondering if there is new ownership?  Regardless stay clear, our group of 6 Connoisseurs was horrified by the food. At one point my wife actually spit out the Lobster roll. We paid our $500 left and went to eat. 

I complained to the hostess on the way out but she didn't really seem to care.

My friend and I had time to kill before she had to go in to work. We stopped by Sushi Roku since it was close to our work. On Fridays, their happy hour ends earlier than the rest of the week. Monday through Thursday, it goes until 7pm. On Friday, it ends at 6pm.

Since we missed the happy hour by a few minutes, we still decided to grab a bite at the bar. The mushroom tempura is, by far, the best item on the menu. Light batter, fried crispy, and tossed in truffle aioli makes for the perfect snack. The miso black cod is also very delicious. The fish flakes into beautiful slivers. The octopus carpaccio is not as tender as I would hope. It pales in comparison to the first two dishes.

Now I need to sneak away at a decent time to attend their happy hour.

really great seaweed salad. not too salty like i've had in the past. mama liked her sashimi with eel sauce.they had kirin on tap. very sophisticated looking spot. we only did bar service. bartender was helpful even when we had to return an item. didn't see too much spit on it. 

nice location in the "mall".

EXCEPTIONAL

I haven't had better sushi or service in town. This restaurant is inside the W Hotel in Scottsdale. You can park in the hotel parking or there is easy to find free street parking right outside. 

I came here for a friend's birthday dinner. The ambiance was perfect. The 5 of us sat comfortably in their round booths. There were plenty of other parties in the restaurant but honestly, didn't even feel like they were around. Our server was attentive, knowledgeable, and personable. There was never a time our glasses were not full, recommendations were amazing, and never a dull or awkward or intrusive moment when he came by to check on us. He always seemed to have perfect timing.

As for the food, we ordered a little bit of everything: cold and hot appetizers, steak, wagyu beef, sushi, sashimi, and sake. The fish is so fresh! The amount you pay, is definitely for quality. My favorite has got to the the wagyu beef and toro. Second was the oysters and chocolate lava cake.

Nothing negative comes to mind when I think for Sushi Roku. If you are looking for quality Japanese food and a good night out, this is your place.

Tip: Monday night - 50% off bottles

As a New Yorker I have a pretty high standard when it comes to sushi. I found Sushi Roku to be a good spot for anyone visiting Scottsdale. The food was great - try the special rolls and the service outstanding. We selected a roll that we didn't like, they were quick to comp us (despite us not asking) and the manager stopped by to check on us. I found this refreshing. Seems like a good spot for groups.
Decent prices, King crab rice a must have, seaweed salad was real good. I wasn't happy with the fried calamari. The salmon dinner was awesome. I would definitely come again.

I came here again this past weekend for Valentine's Day and had to write an update because our waitress Erin was just so great. And also, they DO still offer a 20% local discount! Just not on holidays. I did not like the R'eye cocktail, but Erin switched it for me to a Salary Man which is the same one I had last time. I still LOVE their crispy rice with spicy tuna (it's called something else there) and their baked crab hand roll. We ordered the Katana Roll, Tuna Jalapeno Roll, and Baked Lobster Roll and all were delicious, our favorite was the Tuna Jalapeno. We didn't have dessert but next time I want to try the cinnamon donuts, Erin said they are awesome. Can't wait to come back for another date night and use our local discount!

It is a very nice place to go and have a great ambiance, but I don't think the cost defines the food. The sushi and sashime are very fresh and good, but nothing you can't find for cheaper and with equal quality. Service was very friendly and professional with great recommendations.

Trendier/Fancier sushi restaurant located at the far end of Caesar's Palace. It's a hike to get here from hotel registration, just FYI folks.

DO:
-Order any of the rolls here. They are all very delicious! The fish is fresh here.
-Order yourself a cocktail, something with Sake is preferable. However, my colleagues did order themselves a few Lychee Martinis that were apparently superb.

DON'T:
-Expect the best service when they are packed with diners. Your food will come out in time. No worries. Just make sure your cocktail gets to you before the hangry mood sets in.

After spending the morning at the pool, I needed to run an early afternoon errand to pickup some tailored items I bought as the Forum shops the previous day. The four of us were hungry and decided to grab something right inside the Forum shops. I valeted and was pleased to find most of the food joints on that end of the mall. We all had seen the Sushi Roku sign from the strip so decided to give it a try.

The sushi was off only mediocre quality, at best. For that quality, it was extremely overpriced. Each of us only had one cut roll (I also had one hand roll) and the bill came to $120 for four people.

I can't tell you where else to grab sushi in the Forum Shops, but there are plenty of more cost-effective options in there. I'd suggest Spagos (near the entrance to the casino on the second level).

A bit pricey but well worth it!

The views at night are pretty cool as you can see the strip all lighted up....the sushi is delicious and the Kobe is a must!  

They bring you the raw meat out in thin slices (about 6 slices I think?) and you cook it at your table so you can eat it fresh off the heated rock!  

The service is top notch, very attentive and ready to answer any questions you have.  It also helps that the servers are pretty attractive, pretty people only please.  =P   Yes, it's one of those places in LV, like many....you're there to be seen and look cute.

The ambiance, food and service are all right on....really romantic and fun...you won't be disappointed...a nice stop after a day of shopping at the Palace.  =)

Wow THIS is Japanese food at its best. Don't be fooled by its location in a tourist trap mall, this place is excellent and is a must try if you want a Japanese lunch. I had the beef bento box which came with some of the best beef I've had anywhere and tasty California rolls, a salad with ginger dressing, and a huge portion of rice. Try the beef here and you won't be disappointed.

Stopped by randomly for lunch this weekend with a girlfriend, and it turned out to be the highlight of our day. Our server, Rob, was excellent and super knowledgeable about the menu. He gave us some great suggestions - all delicious! Definitely try the wrapped asparagus, grilled salmon, tuna tartare, and the mochi is the perfect dessert. Everything was spot on, I couldn't be more pleased :)
Awesome view awesome sushi. priced on the high end but quality is top notch. our server was great. the service is A+. great place to take a date or with friends.

It's hard to give a place in Vegas that does it as big as Sushi Roku any less than five stars. It just doesn't work.

If you are a sushi, sashimi, whatever-i fan - this place has it all, you will not get it as good as you get it here, unless you cross the pond to japan. From the excellent food, to the exclusive sake that they serve, you know you're getting a one-of-a-kind experience here.

The service is excellent, and if you're there for work (boo-yah! expense that junks!) and you can splurge, they know when you're spending money, and you'll find your dessert comped if they can tell that you are dropping some dollars.

Ask for Kenji if you want to feel super duper cool and VIP. Tell him the place came highly recommended by a friend from New York, and you were told to make sure you give him their best. Joke, laugh, exchange business cards. It'll be the cherry on top of the whole experience.

As much as I hate Vegas, it's places like Sushi Roku that make me love Vegas.

Enjoy!
Amazing experience.  Jenna was our server.  Food was outstanding and Manager Kyle was attentive and top notch!!  Will definitely return.

Very impressive.

We had a lot of Nigiri tuna (and blue fin tuna) as well as some halibut and the crunchy spiy tuna with avocado (this was tempura, misleading dish name)

I had beer, girl a martini, some edamame to start, as well as some of the BEST miso soup I have had.  Seemed fresh and was delicious.

Would recommend to anyone who likes sushi.  The view of the strip was awesome, even though I had my back to it (gave the nice view to the girlfriend)
Had lunch here with friends after a local recommended it. Fabulous view of the strip with great lunch specials.  The server was very friendly and efficient. Highly recommend.

My fiance and I came to Sushi Roku while on a trip to Vegas. It was our first stop on our 3 day trip and we had a great time. The truffle oil edamame had good flavor and was different than what we typically order. Our waiter recommended the Yellowtail diced chilis appetizer and I thought it was perfect! My fiance did not care for it but he enjoyed the sushi. I felt the sushi was average. Our waiter was very helpful and professional. We also requested for a window seat to look out over the strip which they accommodated. We had a great time and will be returning on our next trip!

Best Happy Hour for Sushi on the strip. Customer service is on point, everyone is super friendly and go out of their way to accommodate you. Sushi is fresh and delicious. We come here for happy hour every time we come to Vegas. Enjoy the view at night. SUSHI ROKU ROCKS!!!!

I'm sure there are other great sushi spots in Vegas, but, if it ain't broke...

The most recent trip to Sushi Roku is 4-star worthy, just like all the others. Wonderful sake and lots of different sushi selections. I still stand behind the spicy tuna hanabi and filet-wrapped asparagus. I'll also add the seaweed salad to the list of winners at Sushi Roku.

Service was super friendly as always, and the nigiri and sashimi was very tasty and fresh.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas.  I love the chic atmosphere, the fresh sushi, and the great views of the Strip.  Wonderful spot to people-watch.  

Tip:  The $19 lunch specials are an excellent value.

I've eaten here several times before & always loved what I got. I'm not a huge fan of the prices as it's NOT cheap (that's the only reason I took 1 star away from my review). But the quality is pretty good & the drinks are strong (just wish they were bigger!). I love the decor & ambience here.

On my last visit here (mid-Jan 2012, on a Saturday), I went for a late lunch (around 2-3pm), got the Shima Roll with a side of Edamame. Ate these with a Grey Goose with a splash of Sprite. Very yummy, wish I had gotten another roll because it was very tasty.

Server was so nice, very warm & friendly. Hostess was also super nice.

Sort of funny story: I was seated on the end of 1 row of tables, on the booth part of the table. 2 guys were on the opposite end of my row. The guy sitting on the booth part kept shaking his leg or something, which caused the row to shake a bit ... along with me attempting to eat my sushi!

Ambiance: Stylish, sleek, authentic
Food: fresh seafood, melts in the mouth
Presentation: fabulous
Service: very attentive and knowledgeable
Price: high but reasonable for what you get

The three of us (my dad, my husband and myself) had miso soups, a garden salad to share,  2 sets of sushi rolls (we had to go for a second of the baked crab roll -  sooo good), octopus sushi,  2 plates of Chef's Sashimi combination, and a carafe of sake.  Oh, and don't forget to go for their deserts!!  We had mochi (strawberry, espresso and mango). Espresso was by all means our favorite. Very rich in flavor and don't be surprised if you leave your plates crystal clean :) 

For our dinner, we paid close to $270 (with tips, taxes). High, but something worth the experience.

Bon appetite.
Ulyana

Nice restaurant all the time we come to Vegas wait over there with a friend with a family where they get the seven is the weather is amazing the guys over there is very good the food is very good and I enjoyed to eat over there I'm going to arrive to Vegas

Ok I went here once before just thought it was OK. But I just tried it again and was pleasantly surprised.  The only thing that wasn't stellar was our server, but she was OK, so we left her 15% all the same.  This place is on the third floor of Caesar's Forum shops next store to BOA.

a) Foie Gras topped scallops $21 AWESOME, we ordered another round of these they were that good
b) yellowtail and jalapeno sashimi platter really good and lots of it
c) lychee martinis --yum yum
d) Great view of the Las Vegas strip :) 
e) regular sushi rolls very good as well
f) great music
g) nice ambiance
h) availability to book online quickly makes me happy too!

I had some time to kill after my meeting got out. Nobu wasn't open for lunch so I decided to give this place a try. I had the restaurants two signature dishes: a sashimi sampler that included Toro and Sea Urchen and a roll. Both were amazing. I capped it off with their signature cheese cake, which come wrapped in cotton candy and is lit on fire. Also very good. 

I only gave it 4 stars because although the foot was good, my bill came to $100 with tip (with green tea and miso soup). I thought he price was a hair steep for what I got. But a great experience nonetheless.

Sushi roku is one of my favorite sushi restaurant in the US. If you are in Vegas you must try this place inside the Forum shops at Caesars Palace. The sushi chefs are Masters creating some of the most creative and delicious dishes you will ever eat. The fish is super fresh and they have some really great specialty rolls. The crunchy tuna roll was excellent as was the salmon egg sushi and get this octopus suction cups filled with sake. Sashimi was great especially the scallops....very fresh.  Go figure being in the desert.

Kyle H. is amazing - request his section!! Came here during their anniversary week, so 50% off all food... heaven!! Kyle was attentive the entire meal and his recommendations were amazing! Shishito peppers, yellow tail app and crispy spicy tuna on point!! Fun atmosphere and great food!

This restaurant is a fancy contemporary Japanese restaurant with extremely beautiful ambiance. The menu is quite large, with some traditional items, fancy, unhealthy rolls, as well as a couple of entrees as well. I tried the kobe beef skewers that was a bit overcooked to me. Perhaps that was their take on it, but I definitely think that kobe is best cooked to the minimal. I was not too impressed. The slow cooked pork dish with rice however, was delicious! The pork was so tender and the sauce was amazing. I would definitely have that dish again! Great view of the strip as well, and the service was decent but not the best. Pricing is decent for a nicer restaurant like this. Solid 3 stars.

I typically don't venture into old town in the evening, but went to Sushi Roku for a client dinner. The atmosphere was really fun, and the food was great. I actually don't eat Sushi, but everyone at my table said it was incredible. I got a filet and it was great.

Really dug the vibe of Sushi Roku. Good decor and music. Hip vibe. Services was good. We had some yellowtail sashimi for an appetizer. It was very good. For my meal I had Hanabi off the appetizer menu that the waitress recommended and a signature roll. I didn't like the sauce that topped the roll at all. The hanabi was ok.  The person I was with loved his food.  He had the seabass and a roll. I'd give this place a second shot but would stick with the more traditional stuff I know.  I also had their gun blossom cocktail. It was delish!
Happy hour was excellent! The spicy tuna and California roll were delicious and just $6/each. Service was on point!  This is what I call a happy hour!

One of the best sushi places i have ever been to in my life!  This is honestly not an exaggeration as I tend to do that at times.  I was only in Vegas for three nights and I came here two out of the three.  Highly recommend and absolutely everything we ordered was amazing.  There was a special crunch spicy roll that was to die for.

I went here for their happy hour and it was a great deal. The sushi for happy hour were basic rolls, but the fish tasted fresh and good. They have a more extensive menu that seems delicious! The happy hour was fantastic though, 3 rolls and a beer for around $20. Decor is nice. I went here after walking all around Las Vegas and sat at the bar. I felt a little uncomfortable in my shorts, sneakers and casual shirt so I recommend looking fairly decent and not like a tourist a Disneyworld like me!

I came here with a group so we tried a bit of everything. We ordered multiple rolls and there's really not much to critique here. The sushi was fresh. There wasn't an overwhelming amount of rice. And overall, they were good portion sizes. 

What I did love was this crispy spicy shrimp that they offered. It was lightly friend shrimp so it didn't make you feel full and bloated with unnecessary carbs. And the shrimp were whole pieces instead of the cheap "popcorn" type. It was a good portion for sharing and we even placed another order because it was so good!

After that, we headed upstairs to their rooftop lounge. One thing I love about Scottsdale is the dry heat. Even though it was 80+ degrees out, it was so refreshing to be outside sipping on a cocktail.  The space is huge! It's great for a wedding/group outing of 50+ people. If I worked in the area, this would definitely be the spot I'd choose for happy hour :)

Lovely little spot. I ventured out for a solo dinner while friends were snoozing. 

While I am a vegetarian, I cheated with a few seafood items while in Vegas, and Sushi Roku was one. I went with a sashimi app ($26 for eight pieces) and a spicy tuna roll (with add ons). 

I agree that it was overpriced, but the service and location were stellar. I do wish they'd had a larger selection of specialty rolls.

The fish was of seriously impressive quality - it was worth my one-time cheat. 

Back to vegetarianism, now and forever!

Sushi Roku is easily the best sushi spot in Scottsdale. In addition to the wonderful flavors, the service is top notch. I'm writing this review because our server, Jon, gave my friend and I astounding service. He gave us a variety of recommendations and really helped us through the menu as it was our first time. All of our food came out perfectly and tasted even better. We will definitely be back soon!
Excellent, fresh fish and extraordinary side dishes - don't miss the crispy Brussels sprouts.  The service was efficient and accommodating to requests; highly recommended
Sophisticated and fun atmosphere with excellent food and service. The manager and waitstaff were attentive and engaging. Really great place for a date night or girls night.

Have come here a number of times and always great sushi.  We have always stuck to our usual orders but chose to venture out tonight with Julia as our server.  We couldn't have been more pleased with both her suggestions and her service!  She made this the best experience!
Beautiful sushi, classy ambience and service was good.  Pricey, but it should be given the quality of food.

Sushi Roku stakes claim to an amazing ambiance. The modern vibe and styling of the W Hotel that Roku is located in, carried over and translated very well into the restaurant. I loved the upscale and hip vibe! My party and I decided to each order a roll... We're from California and are spoiled with our fresh seafood. There was a question mark on how the sushi in Scottsdale would compare to that of the bay area. Everyone was VERY pleased with both the portion sizes and the quality. The lobster roll was a table favorite. For dessert, we ordered the dessert spring rolls. They were amazing!!!!!!! Um... think spring roll filled with berries. banana, and paired with vanilla ice cream. Now, imagine what heaven would taste like, and there was our rolls!

Next time I find myself in Scottsdale, I would absolutely return!

Unbelievable meal.  The only way to go imo is to do the omakase at the sushi bar.  That way you're literally salivating at what's coming up next.  Call ahead and make sure Kichi is the chef that night.  Every course is like heaven.  Comes to about $90/per person not including alcohol and would gladly spend that again anytime my friends want a fantastic sushi dinner on the strip.

Ehhhhh.... its okay.

Gots to give it to them for the decor and ambience they've got going on.  The service was fabulous and they checked on us, refilled our drinks and what not.  

I had a bento box with spicy tuna sushi rolls and the food for some reason tasted mediocre to me.  

But what really impress me about this joint is that the decor was very nice, but I hate it when I go to a restaurant where the food isn't up to par with the restaurant though.  I like the factor that they used real bamboo as their coverings in the window as tourists would walk by, and the atmosphere was very relaxed and somber like.  

I wouldn't mind coming back here, but I just think that you could've found a better place compare to here.  Its just overrated.
Overpriced and average food.  The service was surprisingly slow for the restaurant not being busy.  I doubt I will done there again.
View was awesome. Sushi so so. Do not order the toro. Lmao quite the rip off. Other then that it was a fun place

Was excited to try Sushi Roku for the first time, and let me tell you I was NOT impressed and was very disappointed.  Customer service was great but the food, nothing to rave about.  If you come here, you are paying for the name.  

We came here for lunch so it was a slow afternoon.  We got a table right away without a reservation.  Ordered a $6 miso soup (since I was feeling under the weather) and it sucked...nothing special for such an expensive soup. The tuna sashimi...delicious; the rolls....terrible and bland.  DO NOT come here for the rolls!  The drinks were just okay.  If you are looking for overpriced sushi, then come here.

We ate here on a Friday night as part of a group of fourteen from Vision Expo and the food and service was excellent! The friendly, professional service staff brought out many unique, tasty dishes and all of us walked away very satisfied. We were seated in a private area that looked out on the Strip, which created a very nice atmosphere.

The flavors were great in the rolls we ordered, and it was very clear the quality of the fish was high and fresh.  However I wish especially in the specialty rolls that there was a better balance and variety in texture. When a roll is specially designed like that it is always nice for me to have an element of crispness or crunch that was not present in the majority of the sushi we ordered.  We had two of the gin specialty drinks in the menu and they were extremely refreshing!  Lovely, aromatic mixtures though the cucumber garnish was not in great condition.  Ambiance was nice -- competition with Tao it would seem.     Our server as well was sweet though it seemed he was a but overwhelmed... It took him a while to get our last roll to us, and he double checked with us on the order at least 5 mins after he should have already punched it in.  Overall,  I might not dine here again because it was extremely expensive, and I'd rather explore other Vegas options.

I wish I could say something. Anything. But, all I got is nothing, because that's what I got before I left the most craptastic table known to mankind.

I never heard of this place before until a friend suggested that I go because they were having their 5 year anniversary special. If I liked it, my job was to report back to my entire sorority so they could try it out on another day and we would be a group of happy fatties. If I didn't, at least I didn't pay full price. My sister and I were pumped to go as it would be a new experience in Old Town. My phone was charged; I was gonna take an ungodly amount of photos of my food. I called to make reservations and they told me that they had limited tables and I would be at a high-top table. I'm not usually one for such seating but I understood that they would be packed so I took it with joy and excitement.

I got there early and checked-in with the hostess who said that my table was ready and all they had to do was clean it. You know the feeling when they lead you to a table next to the kitchen entrance, the bathroom, or some reckless child throwing spaghetti who needs to be tied up Silence of the Lambs style? Well, let me challenge that.

They had moved a high-top table from the bar area into the lit walkway where everyone walked in and out, but pushed it toward the wall where there was absolutely no light. I thought Cornish Pasty was dark, but where it was placed, I needed to turn my phone on just to talk to my sister across the little 2 ft. wide table. You could tell that a table wasn't supposed to be put there because well ... it was a walkway. If a party of more than 4 was coming through, one of us would definitely be bumped into. It only had 2 chairs, 2 settings but I reserved for 3. They said they knew and would set it up, even though I looked and the table was already clean and set? We waited for about 20 minutes and finally hunger overtook my sister who got up and asked if we could sit down. They told the same excuse to us they told everyone else 'We're waiting for some tables to move." My hopes for a better table soared like an American Eagle, but not another second longer did they shut down my dreams like the government. They pointed to the same table, and we awkwardly sat down ... while my boyfriend stood up waiting for the chair they still hadn't placed. There were at least 4 employees standing at the hostess podium, 2 feet away, just walking around my boyfriend like he had suddenly turned into stone. 

The chair came 5 minutes later, but only because of my boyfriend's invisible yet oh so intense laser beam eyes gored into the back of their heads. No menus were given to us the entire time we sat. Once again, we are sitting so close to the hostess podium, I could play patty-cake with them. Then we waited until our server came, who immediately told us that we couldn't sit there if we were just waiting for a table, and that we would have to excuse ourselves to the bar area. 

That was pretty much the last straw. Not even cheap Chili's would give this kind of rude service. My sister told her that we were her table but we were leaving. I walked the 2 steps over to the 4 hosts who looked baffled as to why we was leaving, but even a 3 year old watching Dora could have figured it out quicker than them.

We left and walked over to HiFi disgruntled, but even there we got better service even with the unwanted boobies all up in our faces. 

Basically, I am appalled at what happened. I understand that you're packed with such an awesome special going on but lord did they over-estimate the crowd, taking reservations when they shouldn't have, giving tables to customers that not even a cave troll would deserve, and the lack of communication between the front of the house and the dining floor. People go out of their way to try new places and if you can't be organized without being blinded by profit, why should we as customers waste gas just to be shafted. We left so frustrated and sad, not even getting the slightest chance to try anything that we had drooled over previously through Yelp photos. Not even a freaking glass of water.

Food was good, happy hour prices were a little steep for the quality of sushi. I got a simple California roll, and it wasn't too special, wanted cream cheese inside, she brought it to me on the side ? Argggggg. The waitress wasn't very attentive I was going to order a bottle of wine for the table, or at least a glass for me, and couldn't find her, you would think if we were the ONLY ones at the bar she would be able to help us 100%..nopppeeee. Maybe I should try something more innovative next time I may like it.

Wife and I visited the W Scottsdale for dinner, it is a party scene, restaurant is quite loud and happening. The sushi was really good. The service was a 3 of 5. Bachelor parties next to us, some real broskis looking to get turnt! Food was really good though, if you are looking for a party scene with good sushi this is your spot, not a quiet dinner with your grandmother.
Sushi was good. The seaweed salad was really good. This was the most expensive sushi place I have dined at. Good view of the strip if you sit near the window.

Love this place and its location!!! I always have the best dining experiences at sushi roku. The atmosphere of the restaurant is perfect for a date night, girls night out, or any other fun occasion. The food is fresh, fun, and DELICIOUS!! My favorite thing on the menu is probably the seared salmon sashimi appetizer. I love the smores dessert too. I've tried a variety of dishes on the menu and loved them all. Our waiter Jon was amazing. He was attentive, polite, and gave us great suggestions on what to order. Sushi roku continues to impress me, and I'm sure I'll be back soon. Shoutout to the super awesome and thoughtful manager Mike too!

Not bad, yet not too impressed to be coming back. We came here for happy hour and sat belly up at the bar. We ordered from a few items on the menu as well as the happy hour menu. The fried rice was way to greasy and salty for my taste. We also ordered the oysters and they tasted okay but had a little fishy after taste.
The service was  not bad at all, but I wanted this sushi joint to make my taste buds dance and unfortunately it didn't accomplish that.
Sorry Sushi Roku, we won't be coming back.

Nice atmosphere. Great service

Halibut sashimi 9.5/10
Lobster duo 8/10
Wagyu potsticker 7/10 nothing special
Edamame 7/10 ordinary
Sake sampler 10/10
Katana roll 8/10
Eel and avocado roll 7/10

LOVE THIS PLACE! The Katana roll is amazing! It is a little pricey but considering what my husband and I paid at Tao- it's not bad. The atmosphere is wonderful, very romantic and unlike Tao- we didn't have to yell to hear each other or feel like we were in a high school cafeteria. WE WILL BE BACK!

By the time that I got off the plane in Las Vegas, I was already starving. After dropping our luggage off in our rooms, we promptly took to yelp to find some sushi for my poor landlocked friend. We ended up at Sushi Roku and had a pleasant lunch. We each ordered iced teas. The iced tea had some sort of fruit flavor that we couldn't place. It wasn't sweet, but you could taste something tropical. 
I opted for the lunch special which included salmon teriyaki, salad, rice and sashimi. I also added a miso soup. My friend ordered a specialty roll and a seaweed salad. My expectations were actually kind of low (this place is inside a mall) and they were easily surpassed by this lunch. The miso soup was flavorful and served at an appropriate temperature. My friends salad was really delicious. It was made with the very dark green seaweed and not the weird neon kind. My salad was pretty generic and with the exception of fishing out and munching on the the bitter micro-greens, I basically left it untouched. My sashimi was ok. Nothing really special. It could've been a bit colder. My salmon teriyaki was very flavorful, but a tiny bit overcooked. The rice on the plate was plain steamed rice. It was exactly as expected. My friends roll looked pretty good, but towards the end, she just took it apart and ate the fish because the ratio of rice to other ingredients was too high.   
Not a terrible lunch, but also not the best I've ever eaten. It was definitely OK.

Fresh uni with a sashimi platter of the chefs choice was amazing. The saltiness of the ocean laid nicely on my palette with a cool and light sake to wash it down. This place is never a disappointment if you're on a quest for great seafood.

I've had a handful of sushi places in Vegas. Perhaps from all of the bad experiences my expectations were low...but bar none, this is the best I've had (in Vegas). The sushi was very good, wait staff was friendly.

We had a late afternoon reservation but not late enough. They only opened the seating area with a view at 5:00pm. We didn't make a big fuss. We had a very attentive and friendly waiter. Service was quick and the food was good. The only issue we had was their system didn't accept our American Express Serve card even though the funds were available.

Very Swanky Restaurant!  The sushi was decent and the cost moderate.  I had the seaweed salad, spicy tuna roll and asparagus/spicy shrimp roll.  Spicy tuna was definitely the best of all three dishes.  I'm not sure what kind of spices are in the roll, but it's definitely very good.

I would go back.

Once again, for sushi restaurants all I gotta say is OMAKASE!!!

The $95 omakase at Sushi Roku kind of gave me a mini heart attack because you never know what you're gonna get....I've heard of Sushi Roku before, but didn't check out the reviews for it before going in. So this was either going to be really good, or really crappy!

Apologies ahead of time for the lack of details, as it was on a girls weekend to Vegas that I dined here, and as with any Vegas trip - details are a bit blurry!!!

This is what our omakase came with:

kobe beef

foie gras wrapped in toro (i think it was toro)

fantastic tuna sashimi (sorry, can't remember exaclty what kind)

miso halibut (or was it cod...regardless it was so good, it melted in your mouth!)

sushi plate of various oceanic delights

mini chocolate souffle

Service was great, ambiance was great, my only complaint - they need to carry magnum size sake! For five girls a magnum liter sized sake bottle would have put this dinner over the top, but we managed to tame ourselves and ordered only one bottle and cocktails..  : - )

Overview: Omakase - do it!

Tip:  This is in the shops at Caesar's, at the beginning rotunda, third floor.

Ordered using Uber eats, delivery took about 1 hour which was fine. I ordered miso soup, crab fried rice, and shrimp tempura roll. The portion of soup was very small for the price. The fried rice was really good, the roll had cream cheese in it which I didn't really care for.  I would order from this place again when I am too lazy to drive.

The shrimp tempura and asparagus roll is one of the best things I have ever tasted. California roll was pretty good, but where was the cucumber? Heirloom tomato roll was... weird. But I can't really fault them for that, I think my tastebuds just weren't used to such weirdness. Jess said the salmon sushi was delectable. I'd maybe give this place 3.5 stars normally, but I'll bump them to 4 because I'm in a good mood.

I have been here many times and it never disappoints. The food is incredible no matter what you chose and the staff is friendly and service is great. I'm a foodie and a sushi/Asian aficionado and this ranks pretty high.  I recommend it highly. Check out my photos and see why I have high marks. Not only did it look good it tasted great.

Definitely one of the highlights in my trip in Las Vegas.

The seared salmon with ponzu sauce melted in my mouth & I loved it. The Wagyu skewer was cooked to perfection... and it was very tasty. We also had the salmon nigiri, wagyu gyoza, a handroll, & pork belly fried rice. The pork belly was delicious.

Overall, this place is one of the finest sushi place I've ever been to. I really liked the interior as well.
Service was great, so that's definitely a plus.
Great sushi! Very fresh food and solid service. The beer list was good too. I had never had or seen Asahi Black before. Definitely worth a visit.

We made reservations to come here for dinner. It seemed like a high end sushi place. I had the organic salad and spicy miso. I enjoyed the spicy miso. And that organic salad is definitely organic. We had the hanabi "crispy rice" for appetizers and you definitely should try it. It's really yummy. As for the sushi. I wasn't super impressed, but it was good. Usually I stay for dessert at restaurants, but I felt like the atmosphere made me feel uncomfortable. It felt like the workers were a little judgmental, as if we didn't have money to eat there or tip. Which is untrue. I would never go to a place and not have money for either. So ya I didn't get to try their desserts.

If I could give zero stars, I would. 

I came here with a group of girlfriends for one of their birthdays.
