Each time we ordered a new glass of wine, it took at least 20 min to come out, one of our appetizers was the very last item to come out (about 2 and a half hours after we ordered), and the wrong order was brought to our table at least 6 times. We had to wave down multiple bussers just to get any type of service, and although the manager comped a round of drinks, both the server and managers seemed to want us to just get frustrated enough to leave. 

And the cherry on top is that we refused the dessert that we had originally requested since it was a birthday celebration, so instead they brought us a round of shots. We didn't ask for these, nor did we want them as all we wanted to do was get out of there and end our terrible experience. The entire tray of shots was spilled on one of the girls at our table, and to our party it was hysterical after the horrendous dining experience we endured, however, the person who spilled them should not have been laughing like he was. 

Our entire bill should have been comped and I probably wouldn't be writing this. I reached out to the GM, and gave him a chance to rectify this situation but apparently he could care less about his customers experiences just as his employees. It's no wonder where they get it. 

All in all, I would never recommend this restaurant, or go back. If you want mediocre sushi and terrible service then you'll probably be fine, but I expected much more from a restaurant associated with the W hotel.

Amazing!!  Great atmosphere and unbelievable service!! Bianca was out server and she rocked!  Blue fin Tuna, fluke sashimi were some of our favorites. What a great spot and amazing service. Will be back!!

Stopped in here on a Tuesday night after hoofing it through the Forum shops for a while. Super friendly hostess met us at the door and walked us past the sushi bar where all the chefs hollered out a welcome.

Loved the decor--dark, rich, invitingly modern and warm without being dreary. Never having been here before, what did we do? A little of everything. Edamame beans as well as edamame hummus served with wonton crisps. Husband had salad with a delightful peanut-based dressing; I had crab miso soup that was good, but not worth the money. Better off just ordering standard miso soup.

Then came the rolls. A spicy tuna with a serious kick, and very good flavors. But my favorite? The Takana roll, which was draped with the most perfect, buttery yellowtail I have ever had in my life. It melted with each bite, and was the highlight of the meal...so much so that when we finally launched into our baked lobster roll, I did the unthinkable--I sent it back. It was positively bland and flavorless compared to the Takana roll, and was a real let-down following that amazing yellowtail. The manager, Gary Min, came over and removed it without batting an eye, and was incredibly gracious and accommodating from beginning to end. Our waitress, Tina, was also delightful, and very helpful and present without being overbearing.

Overall, a really good meal. We'll be back for sure!

Went in the other night to check this place out with my wife, hands down best sushi in the valley.  The manager brought us an order of their Pork Belly on top of crispy rice, the sauce was amazing to compliment such a well rounded dish.  Energy in the building is awesome to see in person.  The sushi quality is like nothing you will find in the valley.  I forgot to get our servers name but she was a lovely young lady!  We finished off the night with after dinner cocktails, the list gave us quite the choice to pick from.  I would recommend this place to anyone who wants a good sushi dinner.  Amazing.  Keep it up!

I came here after shopping in the forum shops and have to say the day I dined in all the fish were very fresh. It's a bit pricey, but the atmosphere is nice and if you're craving sushi after shopping this is a great place to go!

Atmosphere here is definitely a 5, especially if you like the swanky/loungey type place. 

Service was decent.

However, considering the atmosphere and the price, the food does not come close to matching. We started with the shishito peppers and the tuna rice cracker, which were both pretty good. Then, we had 2 rolls, which were unnecessarily jazzed up with extra sauces/oils and the flavor was fair at best. We also had the ribeye, which actually was quite tough and fatty and pretty low quality considering the steep price.

All in all, this place is a nice destination if you are seeking atmosphere; however, if you are a foodie and are expecting a quality meal to match the steep price, you may be sorely disappointed.

So I came here with a friend for happy hour after wanting to come for happy hour for a long time. The deals seemed very good, almost too good. Turns out that they sort of are. They have tasty drinks for cheap, which are definitely a good deal. I had some drink that was fizzy and had fresh strawberries in it... very tasty indeed. My friend and I split two apps, the tostada sort of thing with raw sushi on it and the pork belly on top of the rice cake, on special for 6$ each. They both sounded good and were recommended by the bartender. The tuna tostada was ok, but overwhelmed by a huge amount of pureed avocado. The portions were a little on the small side. Neither of us would order that again. The pork belly thing, on the other hand, was crazy delicious... I would definitely get it again, but the portion was small... like two bites. Anyway, I would go back for happy hour, but it might not be my first choice.

We were staying at the W this week for a local conference, so decided to eat here on Sunday night. We live in San Francisco & love Roka Akor, but wanted to try something different. We loved it! The yellowtail sashimi was melt-in-your-mouth delicious & all the specialty rolls we had were great too. And oh! Don't forget the toro tartare! Ermegawd, I was in heaven. The waiter we had was super nice, very attentive & even scored us a free dessert, as he overheard us mention our anniversary was coming up in the next month or so. Sunday nights are a great time to dine here, as all wine & sake by the bottle is 1/2 price! So we had some sweet M &C for a great price. In addition, on Sundays in their bar, they have an all-night Happy Hour stating at 4pm. The drinks were tasty, albeit kinda weak ( not a surprise) but the food was really good & generous portions for only $5 per plate. So we came here after a day of lounging at the pool..then went back to our room, napped, showered, came back for dinner 4-5 hours later. Good times. :)

I can't remember when I've actually spit out my food because it was so bad, but that's what happened to me with Sushi Roku's tofu.  I had ordered their "premium homemade tofu" three ways (truffles, caviar and lemon oil, scallions and sesame oil).  The tofu had this sourness that concerned me about its freshness...and then I literally spit out the truffle tofu because it had a rotten taste to it!  Bleh!!  

I wasn't expecting great Japanese food in Phoenix, but I thought Sushi Roku would be a good bet since it's part of a group that has restaurants in SoCal and Vegas.  Wrong bet.

The king crab miso soup tasted like the instant miso soup you buy at the grocery store with old frozen crab stuck in it.  Ironically, I had thought it'd be safer to minimize the sushi since I'm surrounded by desert, but the spicy scallop roll was the one item that was actually wasn't bad - nice chunks of scallops that weren't overly sauced.  

I've had decent sushi/Japanese food in Phoenix before...but it was definitely not at Sushi Roku.  To add insult to injury, they charge high prices for the bad food and slow service.  Thank goodness I didn't get sick after eating that tofu!
I come here every time I go to Vegas, normally more then once in my trip. The sushi is amazing along with the staff.

Didn't know what our group waned to eat so we left it to the waiter. We told him the things we liked so he could sprinkle it throughout our menu. It was a surprise followed by surprise. Everything was so good! The vibe was definitely club-ish and dark with loud electronic dance music. Lots of suits, money and egos flooding the place but I didn't mind. As long as the food spoke for itself, which it did.

DON'T DO IT!  You're in Vegas, looking for a dining hot spot, and you're gonna be tempted to buy into the the Sushi Roku hype.  Don't do it!

I'm usually skeptical of people who give a place 1 star - I mean how bad could it have been if a sophisticated Yelper went there in the first place, right?  But I have NO idea how this place has 4 stars: there is nothing special AT ALL about the food, the service was pretty poor, and the prices are outrageous.  I've figured out why people go here - there's very little sushi competition in Vegas.  But that doesn't mean it deserves 4 stars.  I think Vegas restaurants must beget a chicken-head lemming syndrome (i.e. girls who didn't pay for the meal highlighting that they have wealthy boyfriends who take them to Vegas headline spots in order to impress their "friends" on Yelp).  I hope I'm wrong, but I don't think I am.

A group of us ordered a wide variety of a ton of food there this past weekend for dinner on Saturday night.  I personally tried a few pieces from the Chef's sashimi selection, the braised pork belly, and a couple rolls (crab dynamite and tempura shrimp).  The fish was fresh and tasty, but that's to be expected right?  To me, that's just securing fresh inventory via reliable transportation, so the credit should go to the inventory buyer, not the chef.  While I realize that rolls are the good-intentioned, but unaccomplished cousin in a good sushi restaurant, shouldn't they be pretty easy to make fairly enjoyable?  These were entirely forgettable.  The pork belly was well prepared from a cooking standpoint, but was gaudily overseasoned with ginger, which everone knows can easily overpower a dish.

Another point that irked me was that we made a 9:30PM reservation after a Cirque show.  We showed up early, waited an hour, then were given 2 separate tables for 12 people, despite having requested one large table for our group.  We declined the two tables and waited a while longer to be seated at a clearing large table.  I usually don't mind being split up, but in this case ppl had flown from all over the country to meet in Vegas 1 year after graduating from b-school - we wanted to sit together, and weren't asked about being split up.

The food took FOREVER to order and FOREVER to come.  The waitstaff noticed how long it took, so they brought our group 4 free desserts, which was a nice gesture, but only delayed them bringing the check and prolonged a dinner that took 3.5 hours and killed the rest of our night in which we were planning to drop in on a lounge.

To summarize:
Minus one star: Food flavor
Minus one star: Service (our servers had great attitudes, but at a place like this, execution is what counts, not intentions)
Minus one star: Value (I don't mind paying a premium for great food, service, and overall experience...but this wasn't any of those)
Minus one star: overall poor experience from waiting one hour despite being early for our reservation to having post-dinner plans nixed due to slow service.

Would not recommend to anyone and would not return...can forgo sushi/japanese in Vegas and just get it here in LA.

Sushi Roku is my go-to place for special events such as birthdays, graduations, promotions, etc. the ambiance is wonderful and calming, the service is spectacular and the food is simply delicious! 

For appetizers I would recommend the popcorn shrimp tempura (my favorite!) or the lobster tempura. Hot, crispy, and cooked just right, this appetizer has your mouth singing! For sushi, I love the lobster roll with miso sauce, and any type of sashimi is fresh and delectable. 

If you are a local, you know there are items that can be ordered off the menu. All are delicious, but the white lotus roll is my absolute favorite. 

If you are in the mood for some upscale sushi in a quiet environment with a great view of Vegas, Sushi Roku is for you. The only downfall is the price - a little steep, bit you truly do get what you pay for here.
Good lunch.  Empty restaurant.  Skip the chicken teriyaki in favor of the salmon and sushi.  Everything freshly prepared.  A good choice for a decent meal to break mid-shopping at Forum shops.
Yummmmm.... sushi was awesome!!! We sat at the sushi bar so we got to see them create our plates along with everyone else's. It was super cool to watch!! Would definitely go back

This is my favorite sushi in the valley, especially when someone else is paying because it's pretty pricy. The sushi always tastes incredibly fresh and the menu has several creative options. I'm not usually a big fan of yellowtail but a friend insisted I try their yellowtail sashimi appetizer. The fiand was so fresh and delicate and the ponzu sauce was so fantastic that I had to restrain myself from licking the plate. I tried big eye tuna sashimi for the first time here and was blown away. I've since tried it at other places and it didn't come close to the flavor and texture of the dish at sushi roku. We had some standard rolls which were also great but my absolute favorite thing I had was the lobster Roll with soy paper and a misoyaki butter sauce. It was so unbelievably delicious! I've been back several times for that roll alone. The ambience is very cool and is great for a special occasion or business dinner.

My husband and I were celebrating our 5th wedding anniversary and in search of the best sushi in Vegas. But where? But HERE, recommended by everyone we asked.
Over my ginger mojito and baked lobster roll I gazed adoringly at him, the sparkly strip beyond him, and I realized I could not have asked for more succulent morsels, more perfect service, or a more romantic experience. 
We hope to return to Roku on our 10th, 15th, 20th and so on. Because truly great sushi makes for long, happy lives together. 
Well, probably not. But it should.
This is another expensive sushi place, so it better be good.  I went here late night.  The music is loud, the people are beautiful and the food is good.

Had a double date here. We came to Sin City to watch Tiger Jam at Mandalay. Being in Vegas, we wanted to eat at a place we normally wouldn't go. This place fit the bill. We loved the trendiness and ultra-chicness. The food was outstanding. We tried the kobe beef for appetizer. You cook it on hot rocks. We loved it so much we got another order! The drinks were just as tasty as our meals. Don't ask how much the bill was. Just let me say that I could've purchased a small plasma TV for that amount. I think we saw Tom Hanks show up when we were there. Sushi Roku's manager was really cool and so were our servers. The manager got a little drunk while were there and gave us all a big hug as we said our good byes.

Inside the world famous Forum Shops, Caesars Palace.....wonderful. 

The service was incredibly wonderful. The ambiance and the location are amazing with a superb view of the strip. The decor is beautiful and very romantic. 
  
Only draw back for me is that they are a bit pricey, however locals do receive 20% off.

Love it, Love it, Love it, Love it, Love it.

This place is fantastic.  The sushi was unbelievably good (we are in the middle of a DESERT!!!!), they have 22 oz. Asahi beers and the folks behind the Sushi bar are actually japanese and seem to have studied the art of sushi for a long long time.

I had an excellent experience here and hope that everyone else can experience the same as me at this wonderful restaurant.

Underrated. Hidden gem. Great find.

Sushi Roku was a fantastic little hole in the wall that without a little investigating, may have never found. My fiancé and I got reservations here and were astounded with the view. You could see the entire strip from our table in a beautifully dimmed atmosphere that was everything we were looking for. 

We started with the usual - sake and edamame. The hot sake was pretty good, but it was the sushi and sashimi that stole the show. 

My personal favorite was the Katana. I have not had anything like it. The server also recommended the skipjack with my choice of yellow tail sashimi.

Big fan!

Sushi Roku in Vegas is not exactly a great option for sushi IMHO. The food here is ok, a bit on the pricey side for what you get as nothing really stuck out for me as good nor recommendable. The establishment itself is fairly nicely decorated and has a decent location within the forum shops overlooking the Las Vegas strip. The ambiance is pretty cool with nice decor and quite a functional layout. The cuisine and service however just didn't do it for me and there are several better options for sushi consumption in Las Vegas. 

Pros-
Nice location 
Ambiance 
Great sake selection 

Cons-
Below average food 
Small portions 
Somewhat confused staff 
Price per portion ratio is not great 
Lacks any sort of "wow" factor for the price point
Great sushi. Everything was really fresh and came out very fast. Service was excellent. Definitely recommend the Hanabi, Yellowtail Diced Chile's and the Katana roll.

Came in on a Monday night when it was relatively quiet and had some wonderful food! But, it wasn't the best sushi as it didn't seem super fresh. 

I got the softshell crab, spicy tuna and yellowtail roll. Very filling but was definitely still hungry after spending ~$60. The sushi portions are very small, and it's probably best to combine it with something a little more carb heavy. 

Although it wasn't very busy in the restaurant, service was a little slow.

Not sure I'll be coming back for sushi here!

Top notch sushi + Japanese style steakhouse.

let's talk about the sushi first - sushi is all about the rice, it literally means prepared rice.  I say sushi executed at the highest level is 70%rice 30%fish.  The rice at the bar is prepped meticulously;  perfectly al dente, exact same temperature as the fish, just enough moisture and wasabi paste to stick onto fish.  The fish is aged PERFECTLY, breaking clean at the teeth and giving enough funk to remind you what you are masticating afterall.

The steak, oh the steak - absolute, beautiful piece of prime rib eye charred to a perfect medium rare,  served with roasted garlic butter with a side of blanched green beens.  Heaven my friends, absolute heaven.

Great place to grab dinner after some shopping.  It's top notch sushi and steak for about $25 per person.  Worth every penny.  5 stars.

I felt that the sushi was good quality but overall, the food and drinks are still overpriced for what you get at Sushi Roku. I tried the chef's nigiri set, which was beautifully plated with interesting flavor combinations, like shaved Parmesan on tuna and Yuzu jelly on another fish. It was good, I prefer more traditional places that focus on the fish and less so on the ambiance. 

Happy hour (bar seating only) seems like a good deal here, but otherwise the extensive sake list is not that accessible unless you're willing to spend a lot more than what it's worth. I don't think I'd be back (unless with a group for work on company dime). Sushi Roku definitely has decent sushi and a fun vibe if you're looking for a more trendy upscale restaurant, but it just isn't really my thing.

My boss had made a reservation for us after working the FN Platform trade show at Sushi Roku- and maaannnnn did this place really top my night and talk about how amazing the food was to all my friends back home.  The experience and food itself was so perfect that my boss and I came back the following night!

Let me just tell you- I rarely eat sushi- not that I don't eat it but its because I never had a memorable moment with it until I ate at Sushi Roku.

The highlights of my night:

1. The view- I'm all about the views and for my first time in Vegas at eating on the third floor of Caesars Palace really set the mood for the night.
2. The service was outstanding. Our server gave us his favorite meals, suggestions and the food was prepared in a timely manner. 
3. We ordered Scallops with Foie Gras and White Truffle Oil, Spicy Tuna Rolls, Pot Stickers and Chilean Sea bass.
4. The second night we ordered the Pot Stickers and Chilean Seabass again because it was that good.

Now that I found out Sushi Roku is in LA I will be having dinner there all the time!
Next time I'm in Vegas this is definitely the dinner spot I will always go to. Thank you for the experience and best dinner Sushi Roku!
Great food, AWESOME HAPPY HOUR!!!!! Tuna Tataki, best ever!!! Highly recommend Tuba on Crispy Rice!  Also Foie Gras Sushi Roll is phenomenal! Highly recommended!!!

My boyfriend and I go to Sushi Roku often, food is amazing & the service is what really impresses us.  Julieah & Jennah are awesome, extremely attentive, very acknowledgeable of the menu and pairing foods and beverages! I highly suggest you request a table in their sections if able, I guarantee you won't be disappointed!! Thanks again Julieah & Jennah!!

The way they treated us was world-class. These well dressed managers Dan and Stephen were on point. Even the guy who filled our water was on it. Their food is amazing especially the steak wrapped asparagus and the miso cod.

With management like this, it is no wonder the W partners with Roku for their target clientele.

This place continues to amaze me. The service and quality of sushi with a great Las Vegas feel cannot be beat. It's really the ultimate sushi experience on the strip. I highly recommend it and Johnny Seo does a wonderful job keeping this restaurant in top form. The sushi chefs are amazing. I continue to go here every time I visit Las Vegas and love it.

Sushi Roku has become one of my favorite places to go to while in vegas.  It's tucked away on the top level of the new Forum shoppes area at Caesar's. The ambiance is something special..it feels very intimate and at the same time you get a nice view of the strip. 

I've dined there three times and all have been great experiences. The first was with a group of sorority sisters, the 2nd with coworkers and third with my mommy when I treated her to Celine Dion. During my first visit, the Manager (a young gentleman) came around to talk to us. We told him we were from the Bay Area and were celebrating 2 birthdays. We chatted a bit about various sushi places in the Bay..and he gave us his business card! By the end of the night, 2 'happy birthday' dessert dishes were brought to our table, compliments of the manager! During the second visit, the same manager came around again and I mentioned I had met him a few months before. At the end of the meal we discovered a nice surprise when the bill came, our dessert dish was removed from the bill! Once again, compliments of the manager. Third time, it was just me and my mom and it was just 4 months later..once again, the nice young gentleman came around and he recognized me. I told him I was back in Vegas treating my mom for her 60th birthday to watch Celine Dion in concert...and now this was the icing on the cake (literally!) ... he ordered the dessert for us and had it delivered to our table as soon as we were done with our main course.. because he didn't want us to be late for the concert!  Once again, compliments of the manager.. 

Now, besides all that luck (or coincidence that he is just always there when i'm there) ...the food is superb. I started to wonder how fresh seafood gets to the middle of the desert and stays fresh. But I immediately forgot about all that once I started eating at this place. Also, from my 3 experiences there I think i've tried all the dessert dishes. They're all delicious and the presentation is lovely. 

Go to Sushi Roku ...and don't forget the dessert! =)

Good food, but way overpriced for the quality. $24 rolls ?? come on I know we're in Vegas, but come on. The service also needs major improvement. Food was dropped off and never once were we checked on. Extra charge for wasabi ?? at a sushi place.. lol really ? Never again!

Hands down some of the best sushi I've ever had in my life. We were worried that there weren't many people here, and it was tucked way back into the Forum Shops, but we were completely blown away by the food. If you are looking for very fresh and delicious sushi, definitely come here!

Very good sushi here.  Came here on a Saturday for lunch and was impressed.  Very fresh selections of fish, delicious Ankimo and Uni.  Had a very nice bottle of high end Sake.  Sat at the sushi bar as we do in all sushi establishments and had a good time with the chef's and staff.

Tempura lobster is very good.  Loved the Aji.  I will be back for more from Sushi Roku.

You must try the crab tartare (crab with uni, caviar, and truffle oil), toro sashimi (cubes of toro with caviar on top), and wagyu beef. Other carpaccio dishes were amazing as well. Oh, the green tea tiramisu was pretty good too. 

Their oyster shooters were a big disappointment. Oysters were slimy, the sauce was too salty and warm (ewww), and mind you, it was $15 each! 
Their sushi rolls sucked!

I'm pretty happy with what he had here. We considered going to Shibuya, since I knew it to be good, but since we're in the Venetian and it's in MGM Grand, that's a serious hike. So we headed down to Ceasar's for this spot, and were well rewarded.

Service is very friendly - we walked right in and sat at the bar. We ended up ordering a decent selection of nigiri, as well as a spicy tuna, spicy shrimp, and white lotus roll. I also had my standard seaweed salad, which was excellent, although tasted a little like there was a fruit dressing, which I could have done without. Maneki in Seattle still has my all time favorite sunomono.

Rolls were very good, especially the white lotus roll, which, if I'm remembering right, was crispy shrimp, avocado, and asparagus inside, with yellow tail on the outside, fresh hot peppers, and some various sauces. Awesome. I'm really starting to like the fresh peppers in sushi, which I'm seeing in more and more spots. Also worth mentioning, the hamachi I had here is maybe the best I've had. Super tender, super flavorful, just awesome.

Price was excellent too - they left an item off our bill by accident and when we reminded them, they just waved it off. Even with that on the bill, for two people including a couple drinks, the total came to under $100. No, not cheap, but it's sushi...in Las Vegas...and we ate ourselves full. Definitely a would return.

I wasn't blown away by Sushi Roku. I only went to the bar so maybe that was the problem. The drinks were great, bartenders were awesome and it was pretty easy to grab a beverage. There didn't seem to be too many places to sit down as most of the bar seating had already been monopolized. 
The menu looked good and prices good, so I recommend at least a happy hour there!

Flew into Vegas and had an immediate hankering for sushi and a hope that sushi in Vegas would live up to Vegas' other over-the-top, excellent experiences.  Two types of tuna and a salmon roll later, I was sufficiently satisfied.  Decor could have been better, too dark for my taste, and I got the impression that they were more interested in catering to all of the Japanese customers.

This is probably one of the worst restaurants I've ever been in. Sat at the table for 15 minutes without being offered water or drinks, food came out before drinks, they screwed up my order and then said "it would be too much of a hassle and time to make it right again" - even though our food actually came out super fast in the first place, even before drinks - so basically screw me. My friend had food poisoning after eating the cali roll and crab hand roll. Will never go back or recommend this place to others.

I had the opportunity to dine in at this location awhile back. The food was great especially the Oysters, it's was amazing. The Unagi was also the best. I would recommend any one who visit Las Vegas to visit this restaurant. Free valet parking..

The sushi was ok,but they have trouble cooking a steak properly.  First one was too wel done and second was too rare.  Service was ok.  Not sure I'd go back.  Mostly empty on a saturday night should have been a tip off.  The view is great!!!
It's so damn expensive.  but the food is legit.

Pricey but good.  Sits adjacent to the W and has a pretty nice selection of sushi as it relates to flavors and variety.  The website says no casual pool dress, but the place was full of that attire so I am not sure what that is all about.

Very over priced, but worth it. It was the best sushi I have ever had. Views were great, service pretty good. The pork belly fried rice was amazing!!! The drink menu is fun. I had the Roku Infusion, It came out with smoke like dry ice, but it tasted pretty bad. I wouldn't recommend it. Cant go wrong with any of the food..it was so perfect.

Pretty sure I died and went to sushi heaven after eating here last night! Sat down at the sushi bar and had the most entertaining sushi chefs! I tried their recommendations of the hirame (winter halibut) and rotate (sea scallops), both sashimi style was out of this world!! Freshest and best selection I have enjoyed in a long time!! For drinks, went with hot sake but they do serve quite a collection of wine, specialty drinks (which I will have to try next time) and other sakes.
Expensive but worth it!! Location, ambiance and food here made for a great evening!
Thank you Sushi Roku!

Oh dear god can someone get me another black truffle tempura handroll STAT. That's all you need to get from here. $10 or so and you'll have this beautifully crunchy and nutty mouthful of sushi. The black truffle is in the dipping sauce they serve the roll with so don't be an idiot and go dipping in your regular soy sauce! I would only come back to Sushi Roku to order this handroll. 

Yes you do get a nice, undisturbed view of the strip (towards the Bellagio and Paris) but you'll definitely pay an arm and a leg for very small portions of sushi. Delicious, yes. Filling? Not so much. 

The lobster roll we got has a special sauce drizzled all over the plate that tastes a lot like Todai's creamy sauce baked over their lobster halves and boy was it fingerlicking good. But it was $21+ for 5 (kind of small) pieces of sushi (see my picture if you don't believe me). 

You are definitely paying for the view and atmosphere here. So go ahead, bring a date here if you want to splurge. But if you want a full stomach without breaking the bank, Sushi Roku ain't the place for you!

P.S. I'm all for ambiance and I understand that this is a sushi restaurant so the saying "quality over quantity" is taken very literally, but if a place is going to charge that much for their food, I expect service to be top notch as well and for me the service was just so-so. Hence, the 3 stars.

I come here every time I'm in Las Vegas and have done so for years. There is one close to me in Los Angeles, but I truly believe the Vegas location is the best of them all.  Yes, it is expensive, but the fish is flown in daily and it is consistently the best tasting fish available.  

Do yourself a favor and order the Shima Roll with spicy tuna, shrimp, cilantro and sriracha.  It is fantastic. Other Must-Try menu items are the garlic green beans, tuna carpaccio with garlic chips, the baked miso black cod, yellowtail sashimi with diced chilis, anything from their sushi/sashimi menu and their specials are always great. Whenever foie gras is on the specials menu, my partner always orders it because he can't get it in California and he always enjoys what he orders.  

When you make your reservation, request a table by the window for a spectacular view of the strip. This makes an already romantic setting even more special.

I wanted so badly to love Sushi Roku... but alas, poor service has ruined an otherwise wonderful restaurant.  But there's just no excuse for bad service in a high-end, expensive Vegas restaurant like this. Not when there are so many other amazing restaurants to enjoy.

The first time I came here, we were promptly seated at the sushi bar, where we just sat... forever... with nothing.. no drinks, no water, no menu. We looked uncomfortably around wondering if the restaurant was really even open yet. I finally had to awkwardly ask the sushi chef if we were supposed to order drinks from him (which is normally bad etiquette in a sushi restaurant, as the chefs only make the sushi). Finally a waitress showed up with menus and took our drink orders. And at some point later in the evening, those drinks finally found their way to us.

In sharp contrast to the incompetent waitress, the sushi chefs were AMAZING. We ordered several of the high-end specialty sushi rolls (at about $26 a roll), and what we received was as delicious as it was beautiful. My favorites were the Titan roll, which was like a piece of art, and the Katana roll. Everything was so fresh and tasty.

Meanwhile, we finished our drinks and ordered a second round. Once again we waited.. and waited... and waited. Keep in mind, there wasn't ANYONE else in our section... the restaurant was not busy at all, the bartenders at the bar looked bored... yet we waited and waited and waited some more for our drinks. By now, we had already finished the meal, and honestly, probably even digested it already. Once again I had to awkwardly ask the sushi chef for help. Only this time I asked for a manager (after explaining to the chef that he had done nothing wrong!).  The manager apologized, and soon we had our drinks. But really, we didn't even care at that point because we were ready to leave. Then I was shocked when I first received the bill, as nothing had been comped, but later when the slip came for me to sign, I found that he had comped the drinks and some of the sushi, so at least there's that.

In our most recent trip to Vegas, we decided to give this restaurant another shot, since we liked the sushi so much. This time we sat at a table with a great view of the strip. I really liked the decor of the dining room, and felt quite comfortable there. But once again, the service disappointed us.  The first item we tried to order was the Oyster sushi, and were told they were out.  Next we tried to order the Spanish Mackerel sushi, and were told they were out of that too. Finally we ordered some rolls that they did have... and the waiting began again. As more and more time passed and we still hadn't received our sushi, I realized that this restaurant just has fundamental service problems. The waiter apologized and explained that sushi chefs were "slammed," but really, there's just no excuse for that when you are paying $26 a roll. We had tickets to see a show later, and I was starting to stress about whether we were even going to make it on time. I was also annoyed when the waiter gave us only a little bit of wasabi and ginger, to share, and then he even took that away partway through the meal!  I had to ask for more.

I think this restaurant has so much potential, and I really do think the sushi here is very good. But bad service just ruined the whole experience for me. If it weren't for the great sushi and wonderful view of Vegas, I'd definitely be giving this restaurant only one star. Later in this same trip, we ate at Blossom in the Aria hotel, paid $20-$25 per entree, and had some of the most amazing service we've had in a restaurant. When you are in Vegas, you want to have fun and be treated like a king... and Sushi Roku just didn't do it for me. So disappointed.

We used to come here often in Vegas specifically for their tuna tare tare. They have a new tuna tare tare that has a crispy dough cup that has now replaced the infamous old tuna tare tare and let me tell you it pales in comparison to the old recipe. 
We requested to have the old recipe made but to our shock sushi chef said no it can't be done. I thought wow! Since when does Sushi Roku NOT accommodate their customers even if they have all the ingredients?? Any sushi place I've been to would have done this. 
It was explained to us that it's a corporate thing and they want to keep the menu the same across all locations.  IMHO this dilutes the wow factor of Sushi Roku as a top notch sushi destination.  Very disappointing as this was a signature dish that is no longer available because of a corporate strategy. This is not putting your customers first.  
Service was great though.  But sadly we will not be returning to our once favorite sushi destination here in Vegas because they refuse to accommodate their customers. This place has lost its lustre.

Gotta say, I was definitely disappointed in this place. You are paying for the strip view and nice atmosphere at this restaurant. The sushi was average at best. The sake we got a bottle of was good - though it was $35 for a 330ml bottle (barely bigger than a beer bottle). And that was one of the cheapest there. Would not recommend it to my friends.

I first ate here two years ago and thought it was very good.  I love the Sushi Roku's in Santa Monica, Hollywood and Pasadena.  My recent lunch there surpassed all of these and any expectations from my first visit in 2010.  

Here's what I ate, all prepared by a young sushi chef named Moon, who is in my book a rising sushi star:

Uni sushi - this was two pieces of uni of the highest quality, sweet and unctuous, simply perfect

Spicy scallop hand roll - sweet and fresh scallops, so fresh they were almost a bit crunchy when bitten into, and the sauce was subtly spicy, but not overly hot.  The nori they use here is of the best quality - it crackles when you bite into it, but does not shatter.

Eel and avocado hand roll - Über-rich, sweet and addictive.  The avocado was at its peak of ripeness, the eel sweet and almost melting, and the sauce, which Moon told me was cooked down from sea eel, lent a sweet and an umami flavor to this wonderful roll.

Baked crab hand roll - My favorite dish of the day.  Beautiful crab (it tasted like Alaskan king, but not sure), baked with garlic butter and wrapped in soy paper.  If you love crab, you MUST order this.  I need to have it again.  So good.

Service was great, I  enjoyed speaking with Moon about all kinds of food topics, and the sushi bar is a pleasant place to while away a midday hour.  I went on a slow Sunday afternoon and am so glad that I did.  It can be quite a scene on weekend evenings (lots of pretty blonde women in tiny black dresses), but come for the food, too!

Highly recommended.

Trendy interesting looking place with friendly staff.  Food was pretty good but just not worth the expense and super small portions.  Great for people watching and burning a hole in your pocket but that's about it.

In las Vegas as well as other big restaurant/entertainment towns, good food is expected but in Las Vegas it sometimes does not fully compare to Chicago and NY.

However, the one place I finally went to was Samba Sushi and what a great surprise.  I tend to avoid sushi in several places when traveling unless in Hawaii and some parts of CA and Japan.  Sushi Samba had some of the best dishes I have had and the quality was great.  They have a variety of menu items with small plates and full entrees.  They do some traditional sushi but mostly more interesting variations as well as the S American dishes.  Some of the items were:
Rock fish
Wagyu Gyoza
Rock shrimp tempura
Green bean tempura
Pork belly
Moqueca Mista. Seafood coconut milk and rice with green onion
Yamato sushi roll(maguro, Fois gras, Osetra caviar)
Uni shushi outstanding 
Great sake list

All the fish and shellfish were fresh and well prepared.

It gets busy so we ate at the bar and the service was excellent there.  Luna and Maria can help with picking some great dishes at the bar.

It is on the higher price side but worth it compared to a lot of other places where the food doesn't always live up to the expectations in Vegas.  Looking forward to next trip back there.

We decided to create our own sushi tour while visiting Las Vegas. We researched the sushi restaurants and picked 5 to try. We went in with the thought that we would ask for a recommendation from the staff and that is what we would order. GREAT EXPERIENCE!!!! recommendation was Excellent!

This is a small California based chain. The atmosphere at the sushi bar is OK but needs work. For example, when you first arrive, you are greeted loudly (good). However, after that most of the sushi chefs are silent. Only one chef (left most, perhaps the most senior) was a little talkative. On the positive side, the patrons were very friendly; I don't know if this is normal, or was just a coincidence.

In my two meals at the sushi bar, I've tried:
* ankimo (steamed monkfish liver). Five medium slices; firm, with a very rich texture. Excellent.
* uni (sea urchin). Pretty good, but wasn't as firm or tasty as it could be.
* ama-ebi (raw shrimp). Good overall. The heads were served tempura style, but were not as juicy or as crispy as they should be.
* awabi (abalone). Good
* unagi (barbecued eel). Pretty standard. It should have been hotter and a little crisp.
* hamachi (yellowtail). Good.
* Smoked salmon wrapped ankimo topped with toro tartar, uni and caviar. It also included a layer of spinach, and gold leaf was placed on top. There were three pieces, each piece too big to eat in one bite, so eating it was tricky. Other than that, it was very tasty. 
* Bincho maguro (albacore). Seared, topped with onion and a vinegary sauce. Good to very good.
* Kohada (shad) served with shiso leaf. Moderately strong flavor, but milder than other similar fish (like saba/mackeral). Very good.


The sushi was generally very good, but not quite up to the standards of Hyakumi or Okada. It was cheaper than Hyakumi but no cheaper than Okada. Keep in mind that I'm comparing Sushi Roku to my two favorite sushi bars in all of Las Vegas.

My boyfriend and I decided to come here last minute, it was very empty during lunch time. This place did have a nice view of the strip but other than that it was just ok. We don't mind spending money on great food and good service but the food was just average. We both ordered miso soup, shared edamame, ordered one roll each and also each got the lunch combination. The food was just average but not worth $120.00. I would skip it next time.

Food was ok. Drinks took half an hour to be served after we had ordered. Service was ok. Average restaurant. Way too pricey for the "ok" experience we had. There are better japanese restaurants in town.

Some of the best sushi hands down since I moved out here from Cali!! I've been here twice already and both times I left smiling. Great fish variety and super fresh! They also had a few fishes I've never had before so it was a great experience. I strictly eat sashimi and/or sushi only and can say this is seriously some of the tastiest and freshest fish I've tried in the valley. The chefs are super friendly and funny. Great customer service all around. I am definitely going to become a regular!
The sushi is ok but the eye candy is ridiculous.  People in scottsdale don't wear clothes.  Its amazing

It was just okay. I didn't order anything extravagant just a couple rolls. The service was good,not exceptional and the rolls tasted okay. My disappointment comes from the prep time of my rolls. They took maybe 3 or 4 minutes to arrive at my table after I ordered them. This tells me they were made ahead and sitting in a cooler.  I expected more from a restaurant on the strip.

Best Sushi in Phoenix by far, and great service to boot. Even just basics, yellow tail, etc, are phenomenal and there saki menu is comprehensive. The baked hand crab roll is amazing, especially with the dipping sauce.

It took awhile to find the place, but had I read the directions on the website first, that could have been avoided! At first glance the restaurant seemed very dead.  All of the seats in the front were empty, but as soon as the hostess took us to our reserved seat around the corner, we saw a whole other part of the restaurant where all of the tables were full.  Great service by the wait staff, excellent sushi and non sushi items.  The truffle sushi roll was AMAZING!  The restaurant has a great view of the strip and was exactly what I wanted for my birthday dinner in Vegas.  The waiter brought out a dessert and a candle/sparkler to help my group celebrate my birthday.  The prices not out of control either.
Great service and the food was very tasty, although the fish wasn't as fresh as I expected. You must try the octopus sashimi. Very pricey but it is worth it because of their unique and tasty dishes.

PRICE         1   stars    (Too Pricey)
FOOD         3.75 starts (Good quality)     
SERVICE    4.5 stars    (Good host and great staff)
QUANTITY  2.5 stars   (Really small portions)

Hence I gave it a total of 3 stars

Items we got

- $5 Miso Soup
- $18 Tuna sashami Caprico (Cold Appetizer)
- $22 Katana Roll (Special Roll)
- $11 Spicy Shrimp with Asparagus (Regular Hand Cut roll)
- $10 Wine for the wife (Argentinian, she really liked it) 

Total $71 with tax. Total bill $82. Still left hungry and only got 1 drink.

Would I go there again ? Yes only if I win money while I gamble.

My friend had a gift card for Sushi Roku and asked me to help him spend it and I was glad I could help! We were a little early so we sat in the bar with Regis who was super cool and outgoing. We had a couple of mojitos that were too sweet for us but still pretty good. We ate the spicy yellowtail, kobe potstickers and tempura shrimp. The yellowtail was amazing! We then got seated by a nice hostess (tall blond) and were put in Justins station. Needless to say, he was awesome! The happy hour on sundays is phenomenal. Half priced bottles of wine. So, we imbibed. My friend asked Justin a ton of questions and was borderline annoying but Justin kept his cool and treated us well. The manager, Stephen came by and was also very professional and courteous. We had the filet wrapped asparagus and the short ribs  were delicious. Overall, we had a fantastic time and would definitely return.

Of course everyone comes here because of their great ratings, but from my experience this place deserves 3 stars!

Ambience: This is probably what gets this place such great ratings. No lie it's really nice and high up with great views. The lighting is dim, creating a nice romantic evening vibe! Everything is nicely decorated too. Ps. I hope you guys find this place easily if you're still planning on coming after this review because it took me 30 mins haha it's in the mall!!!! 3rd floor!

Food: the food is really really bland and mediocre unless you came with the notion that you are going to spend 300$. I got two sushi rolls (shrimp tempura and spicy tuna) and they were both not appealing at all. If this place had Mikuni quality sushi I would have been okay with paying such high prices, but literally the food was so plain and definitely not worth what we paid. 

Drinks: We got a sake bottle that was like flavored sweet sake which was good, it was 40$ and is around 8 shots worth of sake

Service: the service wasn't bad, our lady frequented our table around 3-4 times total when we were there! The weird part is that they already add the tip to your bill, and she added 21%. I usually understand when there's 8+ people that they do that but there was only 4 of us! A little strange... 

Also heads up for if you are planning on coming during a special holiday; because on New Years to cancel your reservation they charge 50$ a person

Awesome! We got a nice cozy booth...had an awesome server-The guy with two names! Haha :) anyway..spicy tuna roll, the edamame, and the kimchee cucumber sunomono were premier! Went two nights..valet was a breeze :) but def a place to dress highline style as patrons are seemingly there to be seen. Haha :) had a blast each night because of how friendly EVERYONE was to us..hostess, mgr., and def our server. Will be back for sure!

Not the BEST SUSHI EVER, but not bad. Slightly over priced, but to be expected in Scottsdale. Our waiter was really adorbs. He went through basically the entire menu with us after we said we hadn't been there before, giving suggestions and letting us know what was his favorite. Started with shishito peppers (ok, would have been better without the sauce) and green beans (sister enjoyed, I was meh, just didn't care the sauce). We went with the chefs special which included 12 pieces of his choice, a California roll, and a spicy tuna roll. I think it was about $40? Not awful and the pieces were tasty. The best of the meal for me was the sake sampler. 3 almost-double shots of different sakes for $12. YUM.
I ordered the crispy spicy tuna ($16) with chicken fried rice ($15), both were filling and well prepared. Service was great, ambiance was excellent. Well priced considering you're in Vegas.

Sushi Roku is hands down my favorite sushi restaurants from all around the country. I have been to multiple sushi places in Vegas and all over the east coast. As a super sushi lover, it is extremely rare that I am impressed with the quality of sushi the way I was with Sushi Roku. Growing up my parents owned their own sushi restaurant and I am confident when I say.. I know my fish. I don't know or understand how they manage to always have the freshest quality of fish despite the fact that LV is in the middle of a desert but I hope they keep it up.. forever. 

Servers are helpful, kind, and knowledgeable of the menu. If you don't know where to start, ask them for their thoughts and they'd definitely help you. I highly recommend the Shima Roll but to be really honest, it seems that you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The price range tends to be on the higher end but hey, you're in vegas--the city of excess/riches and you're in a desert yet you are being served fresh fish.. what did you expect? And as I've said, the quality and taste is as good as it gets. 

If you are a sushi lover, I recommend that you give this place a go!

Ehh...the sushi ain't soo good! The servers were not soo nice, the ambiance is great, but the server-no not soo great! You problably could get better sushi somewhere else, we tried this place because we were staying at Caesers! I won't be returning!

Hands down the best spicy tuna roll everrrr.

Fun atmosphere, great waitstaff, awesome lighting.  :)

Will definitely go back.

A++++++++

Great service, vibe, sushi is great! Perfect spot to grab a drink or for a date night. Highly recommend.

We came here for Happy Hour on a Sunday night.  We ordered off the HH menu, a bunch of cheap rolls.  Needless to say that we were super disappointed.  The rice on the rolls were Way overcooked so we were left with mushy rolls.  For such a nice location this sushi restaurant is a disappointment!

The service was great. The atmosphere was great. The price was a bit high. The real problem was in the blandness of the food. Maybe I am a bit spoiled out here on the coast but everything was bland. Maybe they aim the flavor at a mid-west palate? Spicy'less tuna?

Delicious. We were craving sushi something fierce on our Vegas trip and this place hit the spot. Friendly and prompt service and delicious food. Get the roll with the curry paste (balls it's good!). We also enjoyed the crab dynamite roll, shima roll, and spicy scallop roll. The chicken skewers were awesome too.

Fantastic food,  awesome ambiance and terrific service!  We were celebrating our 23rd anniversary and we loved it. Try the foie gras, absolutely love it. Salmon dinner was terrific. Yes, we'll worth the price.

This place is expensive and the portions are soooo small. The view is nice and decor is beautiful but that's about it. We spent $150 (including tip) for three people and left feeling hungry. Would not recommend this place.

This is a great place for groups. It's loctaed in the W Hotel. Good location. Every time a group walks in the chefs make lots of noise. They gave shots on the house and made the meal quite enjoyable!

The sushi was good, not spectacular but very good!

Stopped in here for lunch after shopping in caesars..i was able to get a seat at sushi bar right away...i ordered a drink as recommended by server called the far east mule..it was refreshing n good...i ordered the 8 piece roku signature style sushi..it was absolutely delicious! The sushi chef described each one n explained that no soy sauce was needed..i enjoyed each one i cant wait to go back n order it again! Great food n service!

Omg yellow tail wrapped foie. Need I say more? Yummmmn. Uni, crudo, chefs pick. Holy moly everything was amazing. I think this is one of the best sushi places that I have ever had. I want some now as I'm writing this. Come and you won't be disappointed. Good luck and good eats!!
Placed an order on uber eats, an hour later I'm informed it's canceled. If you're not able to fulfill an order, at least inform the customer in a timely manner

This restaurant was absolutely at the top of our most memorable experiences at Vegas, along with a few others. This was certainly my best sushi experience ever. My partner and I shared a few rolls and dessert together.. and I must say it is not an exaggeration that I had a culinary experience similar to that of exploding fireworks! We were thrilled (and disappointed at the same time) to pay the bill at the end. 

I was particularly intrigued by the ability of the masters behind this food to capture these amazing smokey flavors in sushi that I had otherwise never experienced before. 

I highly recommend going here for either a romantic experience for two, or for taking out your team for an amazing meal! You could certainly see that the patrons all fell between these two categories judging by the Expo name tags and dressed up couples.

We will definitely be back.

Awesome atmosphere, spectacular views of the strip, picturesque sushi, very attentive and accommodating waitstaff. 

Think of Miyake's in Palo Alto fun atmosphere and Miyagi's in LA scene blended and done right Caesar's style.

Food was decent- nothing that blew us away. Rice on the sushi seemed soggy.  Service was so-so. We felt rushed, timing of food was bad, and staff wasn't as knowledgable on the menu as I would expect for a place that has a lot of hype in this area.

I try to check out Sushi Roku when ever I'm in Vegas and down at the Forum Shops.  Sushi Roku always has excellent sushi and wagyu beef.  The sake selection is also top shelf and they have one heck of a happy hour.

You should take the time to check them out!!

This place is amazing.

My friend and I started off ordering appetizers. I ordered the kimchee cucumber salad. When it arrived it was cucumbers in vinegar dressing but no kimchee. Another woman, who wasn't our waitress delivered it, and she saw I was confused so she asked me if everything was okay. I asked her where the kimchee was and she said the kimchee is mixed with the vinegar. I was slightly disappointed. She asked if I wanted to send it back and I said no it's fine, I'd give it a try. I took a bite and wow! It was so delicious. Tons of flavor. Seconds later our waitress arrived as she was notified I wasn't 100% pleased with the cucumber salad. I was super impressed they were so attentive to my needs. Our waitress also offered to swap it out for something else and while I told her it was different than what I had expected that it was totally delicious. They really wanted to make sure I was happy with what I had ordered.

Following my appetizer I ordered the baked lobster roll and some albacore sashimi. It was out of this world! The baked lobster roll is drizzled with hollandaise sauce. So delicious! And the albacore was so fresh and served with an amazing garlic ponzu sauce.

Our waitress checked on us several times. She was so sweet and really wanted to make sure we had a good experience. I will definitely come back here next time I'm in Vegas. Next time I will try to leave room to try some dessert.

Great service. Drinks and waiters were delightful. Food was fantastic. The spicy tuna was fantastic, the best item to me was the hanabi for anyone wanting to go. The popcorn shrimp was the only thing that wasn't very good, a little to doughy but otherwise a fantastic experience every time I go.

5 stars for ambiance, two stars for both food and service. 

Great decor and view looking over the street. Service was slow, poorly timed, and not very helpful. Food was mediocre - my boyfriend and I got the edamame hummus (pita was great, hummus was bland), spicy tuna roll (eh) an avacado roll, and pork belly fried rice (incredibly bland). Definitely over priced.

Won't be returning, except perhaps for drinks to enjoy the view.

Let me be clear that we may have gone on the wrong day as it was Valentine's Day. The place was noisy, very crowded & the tables near each other. The food is great but we felt rushed perhaps because they wanted to turn the tables. The lady who waited on us was knowledgeable and elegant. It's a bit pricey to not be able to relax but then again it was Valentine's Day.

Great location in the W and the food was good but I would not exceptional.  In addition made reservations but they were not able to seat us for almost 40 minutes - made the reservation more or less pointless.  

Overall the crunchy tuna roll was my favorite.  Nothing was bad but that definitely stuck out from the 10 dishes we ordered.

I know-Sushi, Vegas? What? um...

I have to say the West Hollywood location is way better. 

I had the Hamachi and scallion roll, crunchy spicy tuna (fried, over cooked the tuna) and the Hamachi jalapeno sashimi. 

Over all is was an "ok". I wouldn't go back based on this experience. But next time i'm down in the west area, I'll go there.

We went to this place on NYE. It was a classy place. We ordered tofu 3ways and salmon sashimi carpaccio for appetizers. The tofu dish is decent. The sashimi carpaccio is very flavorful. We also got matsu sushi selection and Japanese style ribeye steak and they both taste great.

Sushi Roku is kind of hidden since its on the third floor of the Forum Shops. Few people have told me that this place was pretty good, so I knew it existed. However, we never actually dined here until recently. Came here on a Saturday night, but the restaurant was empty. There were a few people sitting at the sushi bar and maybe 3 other tables that were occupied. 

We started off with three of their Signature Rolls - the Crunchy Spicy Tuna, Crab Dynamite and the Baked Lobster. My husband and I liked the Baked Lobster one the best. They put a creamy Miso sauce on top of the roll which was good, but if it had a stronger Miso flavor, it would have been perfect! There was nothing special about the other two that we ordered. They were basically your standard Spicy Tuna and California Rolls that can be found at any sushi restaurant. We also ordered the Popcorn Shrimp Tempura. Kind of hard to screw up Shrimp Tempura, but it was tasty with the sauce. My only complaint is that maybe they should consider having the spicy creamy sauce on the side because after a while, the shrimp seemed sort of soggy.  

Service was excellent. Our server was friendly and checked on us often. Our drinks were always being refilled and empty plates were taken away quickly. 

I'm glad I tried Sushi Roku, but there was nothing special about this place that makes me want to come back. I think they need more selections for their signature rolls. I'm a snob when it comes to sushi, so I already have my favorite sushi spot! But for a $100 bill for 2 people, there are definitely better places to eat sushi.

Ambiance: 4 stars

I would not come here for the food ever again! I remembered biting into a tempura veggie mix and it had the undercooked taste.  Sushi was very mediocre.  

Awesome, eye candy scene (Cougars galore) but the quality of the food just was not up to par with the rest of the sushi/Japanese community.  And of course, way over priced!

At Sushi Roko the Sushi was ok, albeit extra small portions, but what can you expect on the strip, probably never outstanding food quality and service.

The interior looks tired and needs some updating, especially most of the black wooden chairs that all need some serious attention.

Sushi Roku is an excellent sushi restaurant, my favorite in LV, and one of my favorites in the USA.  You can fall into the trap that I always fall into- which is ordering a ton of the most expensive sushi- but you can also take a more reasonable path and eat lunch specials, omakase plates, etc, and you will save your wallet.  The quality has always been consistently excellent.  They generally have excellent, juicy / fatty toro, and the nigiri slices are generously cut and well executed.  Although I seldom eat rolls, they have a creative selection.  

**LV residents should note that they give a 20% off locals discount- huge score!

I will always return to Sushi Roku when in LV- absolutely love it!  Highly recommended for all levels of 'sushi expertise', and the non-sushi menu (which I don't venture into) is extensive enough to satisfy non-sushi eaters as well.  Enjoy!

My experience with this place was quite mixed, but overall I had to give them 4 stars. Here's why:
At first the experience was NOT good:
-We were seated next to a huge party that was so loud I couldn't even hear my friends. The place was full so we weren't able to switch tables and it really ruined the whole dining experience because we couldn't even talk to each other!
-Food took foooorever to come out and, when it did, some of it was missing and some of it was wrong. The tempura veggies weren't even cooked!
But they did a LOT to try to make it better:
-They comped our veggies and brought us complimentary tempura shrimp and shots for the table
-The manager came over and personally apologized for the loudness and the mishaps we'd had with our food
And overall, the service was great considering how busy the place was. The food did take a long time to come out, but we weren't in a rush so it was fine.
In terms of quality food - the tempura shrimp were amazing! The specialty sushi rolls were great, but the regular rolls were nothing special (literally nothing to them - could make them at home yourself). I'd say don't waste money on the "regular" rolls - get the specialty ones! They're pricier, but you get more (8 pieces instead of 5 or 6) and with many more flavor combinations, sauces, etc.
So overall I'd say to give the place a chance. It has good food, good service, and good drinks.

Sushi Roku, good reputation in LA. Sushi Roku in Las Vegas should be called Sushi Fooku, because that's what they're going to do to your wallet and your palate.

A group of 5 of us came here around 9:30PM on Saturday night, in need of pre-late night nourishment. Yelping before leaping, this place had a decent review on Yelp. This is one of the only times I have  been steered wrong...but it was oh so wrong.

The problems started when we began to select rolls to order. Usually I'm a sashimi girl, and I shy away from rolls. But I knew I wanted something to fill us all up. So I started everyone off with the Spicy Tuna on Crispy Rice, and the first roll Spicy Canadian Rock Shrimp with Asparagus. The Tuna w/ Crispy Rice was great, but this is a standard for any sushi restaurant. The roll, on the other hand, was so tiny, 6 small pieces with even smaller ingredients - 11 dollars down.

I asked our waiter what he suggested in terms of rolls, and wouldn't you know it, the rolls he told us about were both the MOST expensive rolls on the menu, 26 dollars a piece. A-hole.

We ordered three more rolls, all small and average tasting and then were told that the kitchen was closing - WTF, 11, this is Vegas? But whatever, that's fine, we're done anyway. One round of drinks for 4 people, 2 edamames and four of the CHEAPEST rolls was $150 dollars. I'd happily shell out twice this if I didn't think I was merely paying for the overhead of the restaurant, because I know the food didn't cost 1/4 of that.

If you do go here, don't expect anything great from the rolls.  It's an expensive tourist joint, plain and simple. The worst part is that it's now highly unlikely I go to this place in Los Angeles. I was so sad to have this experience because of Roku's great name out in LA, but I have to say, this location is the King of Meh.

eh, we went on a tuesday night and the place was pretty dead.  It is a very cool space and after eating at the Vegas location i was excited to try it. it was Ok, nothing spectacular and the service was really spotty (even though they were pretty dead). Our sushi came out before our apps, which was not what we would have preferred and was very strange.  I am sure there are better places for sushi in Scottsdale.

Came here for lunch May 2015 and had the spicy tuna roll with avocado. 
I am the person who gave NO tip because of the following bad service:
- my server was basically not existent.  
-I asked for brown rice instead of white rice and they said it's impossible to do brown rice because of the it ALL the time.

-I got no avocado on it at all when asked. 

-No condiments on table or offered. 
-my food took forever to come and when it did it was luke warm/cold (it's deep fried) so it must of been sitting around for ages. The place was very quiet and after the lunch rush time. 2.30
- the serving size was not worth the price
- after I was finished, I was still hungry but there was no one around to get a menu off. Frustrated at waiting, I went to the front desk and checked out

I've been here a handful of times and I'm never disappointed with my meal. Making a reservation is always a breeze, all the employees are very professional and friendly. 
I love all the dishes, and have yet to try something that I didn't enjoy. Service is always great. It's always nice to come here for special occasions since they are very accommodating. Definitely put this on your list of sushi spots to try!

Totally killed my feet while treking through the Forum Shops at Caesars to get to this place, but hey I had to look flyyyy and wear my oh so unomfortable heels =\

Anyhoo, on yelp it says this place is located though Caesars Palace, and maybe that is the easiest way to get there, but damn it is far!  And in heels the walk seems so much further.

My SO and I came here for our anniversary dinner.  We were seated by the window, and had an amazing view of the strip.  

We ordered:  

Starters

-Chinese Green Beans with Garlic  - super delish.  I could eat these all day.
-Tuna Sashimi Carpaccio - reallly fresh, and tasty.

Mains

-Baked Lobster Roll - this roll was so dissapointing.  The lobster was chewy, had an unusual taste to it.  I couldnt stomach more than 1 bite. 
-Spicy Tuna Roll - so delish!  It was fresh, and melt in your mouth good.
-Panko Double Shrimp Roll - My favorite!  So good!

I've been to the Sushi Roku in Arizona, and that location was so superb...I was hoping this location would be just as good, but turned out to be just okay.

Located at The W Hotel in Scottsdale, AZ, Sushi Roku is a hip, lounge-y, fun Japanese restaurant.  

I had the pleasure of staying at The W for a training seminar I was attending and my coworker and I were addicted to Sushi Roku as soon as we got there.  We ate at this restaurant on 3 different occasions and were never bored with their food or atmosphere.  

We tried a few appetizers; spicy edamame and a shrimp dumpling soup which was to die for!  So flavorful, I could have eaten just that...but ofcourse it didn't stop there.  We also had a few of their speciality rolls *don't remember which ones...sorry, as well as some sashimi and the Miso glazed Sea Bass with mash potatoes...yummy!  All were very good and I would have again, but I have to compliment the waitstaff, bartenders and manager who made a lasting impression.  We dined at the bar our last night and everyone was SUPER friendly and made us feel like apart of their 'Sushi Roku Family'....you guys rock!

Till next time...Irrishai-mase!!

We went for lunch and had a really good time.  The tempura was so fresh as was the eel and avocado roll and the spicy tuna roll.  The beer was so fresh and the atmosphere was perfect for lunch. The seating is super cozy and it made us want to stay all day and eat sushi and drink beer! :)

Amazing service and the best food!  Pricey but worth it.  Take your time and enjoy everything.  Careful not to order too much because it is filling but so delicious.  The wait staff was super friendly and the atmosphere was great and the seats comfortable.  I don't think I've been to a better sushi place yet.

One of the best sushi place I've been to in the USA! The sushi chefs are actually Japanese.  Our bill pre tax pre tip was $250, and the two of us only ate sushi, it's not an expensive place, that tells you how good the sushi is here, so we ate so much of them!

Awful service. Stated couldn't split a 6 person check because he couldn't remember what each of us ordered.. When we labeled them for him still got it wrong. Manager was no help stated that he just wanted us in and out and he didn't even apologize for the issue plus HE was wearing diamond earrings with a tux. If I want to go to a nice restaurant and have a $300 bill I shouldn't have to deal with bad service and will take my business elsewhere.

Amazing fish to be savored here. 

Quiet mid week lunch I joined 3 others at the sushi bar and scanned the menu.  Sashimi combo- 2 cuts of 4 fish but mouthwatering delicious. 
Monkfish Liver sushi was a nice change. Never had it before and actually I don't recall seeing it on other menus. Not bad. I'd order it again. 
Tako roll was small. A let down compared to the amazing presentation of fish.

The takeaway here is high quality in an upscale location with warm charm and great service. You do pay for what you get but it's worth it. I'll be back for dinner with friends.

My favorite sushi place in all of Las Vegas. When I visit the city, I make sure to make a stop here. The sashimi is really fresh, I even remembered the sushi chef saying that some of it comes from Japan. Toro has to be my favorite sashami there. Tastes like butter and melts in your mouth. I think I've tried just about everything there and all of it really stands out and makes me dream about coming back.

Such a great happy hour! And they do it 7 days a week.....
Only gripe is that it's at the bar only and sometimes it's a little tight seating......
Best thing we had was the cauliflower/date dish. Amazing!!! And their signature martini cocktail! Must try if you like sweeter cocktails.

Son of a b*tch this place is good. We had the Japanese Yellowtail Sashimi, the Popcorn Rock Shrimp, the Spicy Jumbo Shrimp with Spicy Potato Chips and the grilled eggplant. OMG....wow, just...wow! There wasn't one thing I didn't like but any of these dishes. The food was fresh, the flavors were divine...I was in heaven.

I also got the Teriyaki Salmon lunchbox which was also very good. The only thing I can say that wasn't top notch was the miso soup...just a tad bit too smokey but all in all this place is a definite on a return trip to Vegas.
This is the greatest place in Scottsdale for sushi and drinks. Logan is an awesome server and can't thank Dan the man enough for being such a great manager!!!!!
